analyzed: chu bo zhes bya ba ni skad cig gcig nas gcig tu brgyud pas rgyud mi 'chad pa'i phyir te /
translated: The ‚Äústream‚Äù is the uninterrupted continuity of moments.

original: chu'i chu bo bzhin no //
analyzed: chu'i chu bo bzhin no //
translated: It is like a stream of water.

original: ji srid 'khor gyi bar du rnam pa gzhan du 'gyur ba med pas 'di la bdag tu yongs su sems par gyur na mi rung zhes byis pa bdag tu lta ba de dag la ma bstan to //
analyzed: ji srid 'khor gyi bar du rnam pa gzhan du 'gyur ba med pas 'di la bdag tu yongs su sems par gyur na mi rung zhes byis pa bdag tu lta ba de dag la ma bstan to //
translated: It is not explained to those childish beings who have the view of self, thinking, ‚ÄúIt is not suitable for them to think of this as a self, since it changes in different ways as long as it continues.‚Äù

original: dbang po gzugs can thams cad kyi rgyu yin pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni sgra 'jug pa'i rgyur ston to //
analyzed: dbang po gzugs can thams cad kyi rgyu yin pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni sgra 'jug pa'i rgyur ston to //
translated: The cause of all physical faculties, etc. shows the reason for using the term ‚Äúappropriating consciousness.‚Äù

original: 'dis tshe ji srid par rjes su 'jug gi bar du grub pa dang bde ba gcig pas dbang po gzugs can thams cad len pas len pa'i rnam par shes pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'dis tshe ji srid par rjes su 'jug gi bar du grub pa dang bde ba gcig pas dbang po gzugs can thams cad len pas len pa'i rnam par shes pa zhes bya'o //
translated: It is called the ‚Äúappropriating consciousness‚Äù because it appropriates all physical faculties, since it is the cause of their existence and pleasure as long as it continues.

original: gzhan du na ni shi ba'i ro bzhin du 'jig par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan du na ni shi ba'i ro bzhin du 'jig par 'gyur ro //
translated: Otherwise, it would perish like a dead body.

original: lus kun te /
analyzed: lus kun te /
translated: The entire body

original: lus te / lus thams cad nye bar len pa'i gnas su 'gyur ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni dbang po gzugs can rnams ma byung ba dang / gzugs med par yang lus mngon par 'grub pa ste /üîΩnyid mtshams sbyor ba'o //üîΩde sprel ba ni yongs su 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: lus te / lus thams cad nye bar len pa'i gnas su 'gyur ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni dbang po gzugs can rnams ma byung ba dang / gzugs med par yang lus mngon par 'grub pa ste / nyid mtshams sbyor ba'o // de sprel ba ni yongs su 'dzin pa'o //
translated: The body is formed in the formless realm without the presence of material organs.üîΩThe body is formed in the formless realm without the presence of material organs.üîΩThe body is formed in the formless realm without the presence of material organs.üîΩThe body is formed in the formless realm without the presence of material organs.üîΩThe body is formed in the formless realm without the presence of material organs.

original: de mngon par 'grub pa nye bar 'dzin pa'i phyir khu chu dang khrag gi nang du brgyal ba na kun gzhi rnam par shes pas lus mtha' dag bzung ba yin te /
analyzed: de mngon par 'grub pa nye bar 'dzin pa'i phyir khu chu dang khrag gi nang du brgyal ba na kun gzhi rnam par shes pas lus mtha' dag bzung ba yin te /
translated: The body is formed in the formless realm without the presence of material organs.üîΩThe body is formed in the formless realm without the presence of material organs.üîΩThe body is formed in the formless realm without the presence of material organs.üîΩThe body is formed in the formless realm without the presence of material organs.üîΩThe body is formed in the formless realm without the presence of material organs.üîΩThe body is formed in the formless realm without the presence of material organs.üîΩThe body is formed in the formless realm without the presence of material organs.üîΩThe body is formed in the formless realm without the presence of material organs.üîΩThe body is formed in the formless realm without the presence of material organs.üîΩThe body is formed in the formless realm without the presence of material organs.üîΩThe body is formed in the formless realm without the presence of material organs.üîΩThe body is formed in the formless realm without the presence of material organs.üîΩThe body is formed in the formless realm without the presence of material organs.üîΩThe body is formed in the formless realm without the presence of material organs.üîΩThe body is formed in the formless realm without the presence of material organs.üîΩThe body is formed in the formless realm without the presence of material organs.

original: lus mtha' dag gi bag chags bsgos pa'i phyir yongs su bzung ba yin no //üîΩde ni sems zhes kyang bya ste /
analyzed: lus mtha' dag gi bag chags bsgos pa'i phyir yongs su bzung ba yin no // de ni sems zhes kyang bya ste /
translated: The body is formed in the formless realm without the presence of material organs.

original: zhes bya ba ni rnam grangs rnam par gzhag pa nyid du lung gzhan gyis ston par byed do //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni rnam grangs rnam par gzhag pa nyid du lung gzhan gyis ston par byed do //
translated: The body is formed in the formless realm without the presence of material organs.üîΩThe body is formed in the formless realm without the presence of material organs.

original: gnyis pa nyon mongs pa can gyi yid ces bya ba ni 'jig tshogs la lta ba la sogs pa nyon mongs pa bzhi po dag dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnyis pa nyon mongs pa can gyi yid ces bya ba ni 'jig tshogs la lta ba la sogs pa nyon mongs pa bzhi po dag dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The second is called the afflicted mind because it is associated with the four afflictions such as the view of the transitory aggregates.

original: de la 'jig tshogs la lta ba ni bdag dang bdag gis mngon par zhen pa'o //
analyzed: de la 'jig tshogs la lta ba ni bdag dang bdag gis mngon par zhen pa'o //
translated: Among them, the view of the transitory aggregates is the adherence to a self and what is possessed by a self.

original: de'i dbang gis nga'o snyam pa'i nga rgyal te /
analyzed: de'i dbang gis nga'o snyam pa'i nga rgyal te /
translated: Due to its power, there is the pride that thinks ‚ÄúI am.‚Äù

original: nga'o bdag go snyam du khengs so //
analyzed: nga'o bdag go snyam du khengs so //
translated: It is inflated, thinking ‚ÄúI am,‚Äù ‚ÄúI exist.‚Äù

original: de gnyis yod na bdag la chags pa 'byung ste /
analyzed: de gnyis yod na bdag la chags pa 'byung ste /
translated: When those two exist, attachment to the self arises.

original: bdag la dga'o //
analyzed: bdag la dga'o //
translated: One delights in the self.

original: de gsum gyi rgyu ni ma rig pa ste /
analyzed: de gsum gyi rgyu ni ma rig pa ste /
translated: The cause of those three is ignorance,

original: mi shes pa rig pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs so //
analyzed: mi shes pa rig pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs so //
translated: which is the opposite of the knowledge of the knowable.

original: de ni rnam par shes @196b pa kun nas nyon mongs pa'i gnas yin te /üîΩmnyam par gzhag pa dang / mnyam par ma bzhag pa dang / dge ba la sogs pa'i gnas skabs su'am /
analyzed: de ni rnam par shes @196b pa kun nas nyon mongs pa'i gnas yin te / mnyam par gzhag pa dang / mnyam par ma bzhag pa dang / dge ba la sogs pa'i gnas skabs su'am /
translated: That is the basis of the affliction of consciousness,üîΩbecause it occurs in all situations, whether in equipoise or not, whether virtuous and so on,

original: 'gal ba med par kun du 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'gal ba med par kun du 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: or whether it is not contradictory.

original: gzhan du na ni dge ba'i sems la nga'o snyam du ji ltar 'gyur /
analyzed: gzhan du na ni dge ba'i sems la nga'o snyam du ji ltar 'gyur /
translated: Otherwise, how could there be the thought ‚ÄúI am‚Äù in a virtuous mind?

original: gnas gcig pos ni skyed ces bya ba ni 'gags ma thag pa'i yid kyis so //
analyzed: gnas gcig pos ni skyed ces bya ba ni 'gags ma thag pa'i yid kyis so //
translated: The first, by means of one basis, is the mind that has just ceased.

original: gnyis pas ni nyon mongs pa can du byas pa ste zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gnyis pas ni nyon mongs pa can du byas pa ste zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The second, by means of two, is the defiled mind.

original: nyon mongs pa bzhi dang mtshungs par ldan pa ste /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa bzhi dang mtshungs par ldan pa ste /
translated: It is associated with the four defilements,

original: ngar 'dzin pa la sogs pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa ni des byas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ngar 'dzin pa la sogs pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa ni des byas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the defilements of self-delusion, etc., are produced by it.

original: yul la rnam par rig pa'i phyir //
analyzed: yul la rnam par rig pa'i phyir //
translated: Because it is the awareness of the object,

original: zhes bya ba ni yul 'dzin par snang ba'i phyir rnam par shes pa'i sgrar grub bo //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni yul 'dzin par snang ba'i phyir rnam par shes pa'i sgrar grub bo //
translated: it is established as the word consciousness, because it appears as the apprehension of the object.

original: de ma thag pa dang ngar sems pa'i phyir yid ni rnam par gnyis so zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de ma thag pa dang ngar sems pa'i phyir yid ni rnam par gnyis so zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The mind is twofold, because of immediate succession and the thought of ‚ÄúI.‚Äù

original: nges pa'i tshig gi tshul gyis te /
analyzed: nges pa'i tshig gi tshul gyis te /
translated: This is according to the method of etymology,

original: yid ge mi mngon par byas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yid ge mi mngon par byas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the mind is hidden.

original: rnam par sgrub pa dang / nges pa'i tshig gnyis kyis sgra'i don shes pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par sgrub pa dang / nges pa'i tshig gnyis kyis sgra'i don shes pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because of the two, establishment and etymology, the meaning of the word is known.

original: 'thad pa med par gzhan la bstan par mi nus pas nyon mongs pa can gyi yid sgrub pa la rigs pa tshigs su bcad pa rnams kyis 'jog go //
analyzed: 'thad pa med par gzhan la bstan par mi nus pas nyon mongs pa can gyi yid sgrub pa la rigs pa tshigs su bcad pa rnams kyis 'jog go //
translated: Since it is impossible to teach others without reason, the rational proofs of the existence of afflicted mentality are presented in the verses.

original: ma 'dres pa'i ma rig pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa la gal te nyon mongs pa can gyi yid med du zin na de med na ma rig pa ma 'dres pa yang med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ma 'dres pa'i ma rig pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa la gal te nyon mongs pa can gyi yid med du zin na de med na ma rig pa ma 'dres pa yang med par 'gyur ro //
translated: If afflicted mentality did not exist, unmixed ignorance would not exist.

original: ma rig pa ma 'dres pa ni de kho na la shes pa skye pa'i gags byed pa gti mug go zhes 'og nas 'chad do //
analyzed: ma rig pa ma 'dres pa ni de kho na la shes pa skye pa'i gags byed pa gti mug go zhes 'og nas 'chad do //
translated: Unmixed ignorance is delusion that obstructs the arising of knowledge of reality.

original: de ni rnam par shes pa lnga po dag la mi 'byung ste /
analyzed: de ni rnam par shes pa lnga po dag la mi 'byung ste /
translated: It does not occur in the five consciousnesses.

original: de la gnas pa la gnyen po med pa'i phyir ro /
analyzed: de la gnas pa la gnyen po med pa'i phyir ro /
translated: Because there is no antidote to it in those states.

original: gang na mi mthun pa'i phyogs yod pa de na gnyen po yod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang na mi mthun pa'i phyogs yod pa de na gnyen po yod par 'gyur ro //
translated: Where there is an opposing factor, there is an antidote.

original: rnam par shes pa lnga ni de'i gnyen po ma yin te de dag la mthong ba'i lam mi skye ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa lnga ni de'i gnyen po ma yin te de dag la mthong ba'i lam mi skye ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The five consciousnesses are not antidotes to it because the path of seeing does not arise in them.

original: nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa la yang ma yin te /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa la yang ma yin te /
translated: It is not in the non-defiled mental consciousness,

original: nyon mongs pa'i ngo bo nyid de nyid kyis de nyon mongs pa can du 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i ngo bo nyid de nyid kyis de nyon mongs pa can du 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it would be defiled by the very nature of the defilements.

original: nyon mongs pa can la yang ma yin te /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa can la yang ma yin te /
translated: It is not in the defiled,

original: de las gzhan pa'i nyon mongs pa dang mtshungs par ldan pas ma 'dres par mi 'grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de las gzhan pa'i nyon mongs pa dang mtshungs par ldan pas ma 'dres par mi 'grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not established as unmixed with other defilements that are associated with it.

original: nyon mongs pa des yid kyi rnam par shes pa nyon mongs pa can du dam bca' na ni gtan du nyon mongs pa can du 'gyur te /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa des yid kyi rnam par shes pa nyon mongs pa can du dam bca' na ni gtan du nyon mongs pa can du 'gyur te /
translated: If you assert that the mental consciousness is defiled by that defilement, it would be defiled forever,

original: nyon mongs pa'i mtshan nyid de dang mtshungs par ldan @197a * //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i mtshan nyid de dang mtshungs par ldan @197a * //
translated: because it would be associated with the characteristic of the defilement.

original: pa'i phyir sbyin pa la sogs pa'i sems dge bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: pa'i phyir sbyin pa la sogs pa'i sems dge bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: And the mind of generosity, etc., would not be virtuous,

original: gang gi ltar na dge ba'i sems dang lhan cig 'byung ba'i nyon mongs pa can gyi yid yod pa de'i ltar na ni de nyid dang mtshungs par ldan par 'gyur gyi gzhan dang ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gang gi ltar na dge ba'i sems dang lhan cig 'byung ba'i nyon mongs pa can gyi yid yod pa de'i ltar na ni de nyid dang mtshungs par ldan par 'gyur gyi gzhan dang ni ma yin no //
translated: According to those who believe that afflicted mind occurs simultaneously with a virtuous mind, it is concomitant with that afflicted mind, not with the other.

original: nyon mongs pa can gyi yid kyi rnam par shes pas ni de'i gnyen po mngon sum du byed par yang mi rung ste /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa can gyi yid kyi rnam par shes pas ni de'i gnyen po mngon sum du byed par yang mi rung ste /
translated: It is not tenable that afflicted mind consciousness is the direct antidote of that afflicted mind,

original: gang gi ltar na nyon mongs pa can gyi yid dang lhan cig 'byung ba'i dge ba'i sems yod pa de'i ltar na ni des drangs pa'i gnyen po skye ba'i phyir mi mthun pa'i phyogs 'gags te rigs so //
analyzed: gang gi ltar na nyon mongs pa can gyi yid dang lhan cig 'byung ba'i dge ba'i sems yod pa de'i ltar na ni des drangs pa'i gnyen po skye ba'i phyir mi mthun pa'i phyogs 'gags te rigs so //
translated: because according to those who believe that a virtuous mind that occurs simultaneously with afflicted mind exists, it is logical that the antidote that it induces arises and that the opposing factor is stopped.

original: de ltar na'ang 'di las gzhan pa 'jig tshogs la lta ba la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i phyir ma 'dres par mi 'grub pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: de ltar na'ang 'di las gzhan pa 'jig tshogs la lta ba la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i phyir ma 'dres par mi 'grub pa ma yin nam /
translated: But in that case, because it is concomitant with other afflictions such as the afflicted view of the self, it is not established as unmixed.

original: mi mthun par bzhag pa ste /
analyzed: mi mthun par bzhag pa ste /
translated: This is a contradictory assertion.

original: nga ni nyon mongs pa gzhan dang mtshungs par ldan pa ma yin pa'i phyir ma 'dres pa nyid du 'dod pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: nga ni nyon mongs pa gzhan dang mtshungs par ldan pa ma yin pa'i phyir ma 'dres pa nyid du 'dod pa ma yin gyi /
translated: I do not maintain that it is unmixed because it is not associated with other defilements.

original: 'o na ji zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ji zhe na /
translated: What then?

original: gzhan la med pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: gzhan la med pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because it does not exist in others.

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad bzhin no //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad bzhin no //
translated: It is like the eighteen special qualities of the Buddha.

original: ma 'dres par mi 'grub pa'i phyir ro zhes gang smras pa de ni gzhan gyis rnam par gzhag pa la ltos nas nyes pa brjod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma 'dres par mi 'grub pa'i phyir ro zhes gang smras pa de ni gzhan gyis rnam par gzhag pa la ltos nas nyes pa brjod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: You have stated that it is not established as unmixed, but this is a fault that is stated in relation to the system of others.

original: lnga po dag dang 'dra ba zhes bya ba 'di ni sgrub pa ma yin no //
analyzed: lnga po dag dang 'dra ba zhes bya ba 'di ni sgrub pa ma yin no //
translated: The statement that it is similar to the five is not a proof.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: What then?

original: sun 'byin pa de /
analyzed: sun 'byin pa de /
translated: This refutation

original: su rnam par shes pa gang zhe na /üîΩrnam par shes pa'i tshogs drug go zhes bya ba 'di khas len pa des ni mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa lnga dang / yid kyi rnam par shes pa mthun par khas blangs pa de 'gal te /
analyzed: su rnam par shes pa gang zhe na / rnam par shes pa'i tshogs drug go zhes bya ba 'di khas len pa des ni mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa lnga dang / yid kyi rnam par shes pa mthun par khas blangs pa de 'gal te /
translated: What is consciousness?üîΩThe six collections of consciousness.

original: lhan cig skyes pa'i gnas med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lhan cig skyes pa'i gnas med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: One who accepts this contradicts the five consciousnesses of eye, etc., and the mental consciousness, because there is no basis for their simultaneous arising.

original: gzhan gyi gzhung la ni gang lhan cig skye ba'i ngas med pa'i rnam par shes pa ci yang med do zhes so //
analyzed: gzhan gyi gzhung la ni gang lhan cig skye ba'i ngas med pa'i rnam par shes pa ci yang med do zhes so //
translated: In other scriptures, it is said that there is no consciousness at all that is not born with a self-nature.

original: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa'i lhan cig skye ba'i gnas ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa'i lhan cig skye ba'i gnas ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: Is not the store-consciousness the support of the consciousness born with it?

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: No, it is not.

original: bdag po'i rkyen du brjod pas 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag po'i rkyen du brjod pas 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because we accept the dominant condition.

original: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa ni yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i rgyu'i rkyen yin no //
analyzed: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa ni yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i rgyu'i rkyen yin no //
translated: The store-consciousness is the causal condition of the thinking consciousness.

original: 'dir ni nyon mongs pa can gyi yid bdag po'i rkyen du brjod par 'dod do //
analyzed: 'dir ni nyon mongs pa can gyi yid bdag po'i rkyen du brjod par 'dod do //
translated: But here we want to speak of the defiled mind as the dominant condition.

original: gang dag snying la gnas pa'i gzugs ci yang rung ba zhig yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i lhan cig skye ba'i gnas so zhes smras pa /
analyzed: gang dag snying la gnas pa'i gzugs ci yang rung ba zhig yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i lhan cig skye ba'i gnas so zhes smras pa /
translated: Those who say that some form existing in the heart is the support of the thinking consciousness born with it,

original: de dag gi de @197b yang rnam par rtog pa tsam du zad do //
analyzed: de dag gi de @197b yang rnam par rtog pa tsam du zad do //
translated: their opinion is mere conjecture.

original: yid kyi rnam par shes pa thams cad ni thams cad du nges par rtogs pa dang / rjes su dran pa'i rnam par rtog pa gnyis kyis rnam par mi rtog pa nyid du 'gyur te /
analyzed: yid kyi rnam par shes pa thams cad ni thams cad du nges par rtogs pa dang / rjes su dran pa'i rnam par rtog pa gnyis kyis rnam par mi rtog pa nyid du 'gyur te /
translated: All mental consciousnesses are nonconceptual, because they are definitely determined to be of two kinds: conceptual and memory.

original: dbang po gzugs can la brten pa mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dbang po gzugs can la brten pa mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa bzhin no //
translated: They are like the consciousnesses of the eye, etc., which are based on material organs.

original: snyoms par 'jug pa'i bye brag dang // zhes bya ba ni 'du shes med pa dang / 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa'o //üîΩgang la nyon mongs pa can gyi yid yod pa de la ni 'du shes med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa la de yod pa dang / 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa la ni med pa'i phyir khyad par du 'thad do //
analyzed: snyoms par 'jug pa'i bye brag dang // zhes bya ba ni 'du shes med pa dang / 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa'o // gang la nyon mongs pa can gyi yid yod pa de la ni 'du shes med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa la de yod pa dang / 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa la ni med pa'i phyir khyad par du 'thad do //
translated: The distinction of meditative development refers to the attainment of non-perception and the attainment of cessation.üîΩThe distinction is tenable in regard to these two because the one exists in the attainment of non-perception and the other does not exist in the attainment of cessation.

original: gzhan du na ni gnyi gar yang 'du shes dang tshor ba 'gog pa dang / nyon mongs pa can gyi yid kyi rnam par shes pa kun tu 'byung ba med pa'i phyir bye brag med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan du na ni gnyi gar yang 'du shes dang tshor ba 'gog pa dang / nyon mongs pa can gyi yid kyi rnam par shes pa kun tu 'byung ba med pa'i phyir bye brag med par 'gyur ro //
translated: Otherwise, there would be no distinction in regard to both of them, because the cessation of the formative forces that are dissociated from mind would be the same in both, and because the cessation of the formative forces that are associated with mind would be the same in both, and because the non-manifestation of afflicted consciousness would be the same in both.

original: bsam gtan pa bzhi pa dang / srid pa'i rtse mo'i sa tha dad pa dang / nges par 'byung ba dang / zhi bar gnas par 'dod pa tha dad pa'i phyir yang tha dad par mi 'gyur ram zhe na /üîΩma yin te /
analyzed: bsam gtan pa bzhi pa dang / srid pa'i rtse mo'i sa tha dad pa dang / nges par 'byung ba dang / zhi bar gnas par 'dod pa tha dad pa'i phyir yang tha dad par mi 'gyur ram zhe na / ma yin te /
translated: Would they not be different because they are different levels of meditative attainment, different levels of the summit of existence, and different levels of renunciation and peaceful abiding?

original: rang gi ngo bo tha dad pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo tha dad pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: They would not be different because they do not have different natures.

original: gnyi gar yang sems dang sems las byung ba 'gog par bye brag ci yod /
analyzed: gnyi gar yang sems dang sems las byung ba 'gog par bye brag ci yod /
translated: What is the difference between the two in terms of the cessation of mind and mental factors?

original: 'di ni mdo sde pa dang gtan la dbab pa ste /
analyzed: 'di ni mdo sde pa dang gtan la dbab pa ste /
translated: This is the Sautrantika and the Vini≈õcayasa·πÉgraha

original: de dang nye ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dang nye ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are similar to it.

original: de ni mi ldan pa rnams rdzas su yod par mi 'dod na snyoms par 'jug pa rdzas tha dad par ga la 'gyur /
analyzed: de ni mi ldan pa rnams rdzas su yod par mi 'dod na snyoms par 'jug pa rdzas tha dad par ga la 'gyur /
translated: If they do not assert that nonpossession exists as a substance, how could meditative attainment be a different substance?

original: nges tshig med pa'i skyon du 'gyur //
analyzed: nges tshig med pa'i skyon du 'gyur //
translated: The fault of having no etymological definition would ensue.

original: zhes bya ba la nges pa'i tshig ni nges pa'i tshig ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la nges pa'i tshig ni nges pa'i tshig ste /
translated: The term ‚Äúetymological definition‚Äù means the definition of a term.

original: ngar sems pa'i phyir yid do zhes bya ba'i nges pa'i tshig gang yin pa 'di nyon mongs pa can gyi yid med na ji la gnas par 'gyur /
analyzed: ngar sems pa'i phyir yid do zhes bya ba'i nges pa'i tshig gang yin pa 'di nyon mongs pa can gyi yid med na ji la gnas par 'gyur /
translated: If afflicted mind did not exist, then what would the mind be that is called ‚Äúmind‚Äù because it thinks of itself?

original: rnam par shes pa drug po dag ni ngar sems pa'i phyir yid do zhes bya ba de ltar 'thad pa ma yin te 'gags zin pa'i phyir ro //üîΩ'du shes med par skye ba'i rgyun //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa drug po dag ni ngar sems pa'i phyir yid do zhes bya ba de ltar 'thad pa ma yin te 'gags zin pa'i phyir ro // 'du shes med par skye ba'i rgyun //
translated: It is not tenable to say that the six consciousnesses are the mental faculty because they are already established as the six consciousnesses, and because it is illogical to say that the six consciousnesses are the mental faculty that thinks ‚ÄúI.‚ÄùüîΩThe fault of the absence of the conception of ‚ÄúI‚Äù

original: ngar 'dzin med pa'i skyon du 'gyur //
analyzed: ngar 'dzin med pa'i skyon du 'gyur //
translated: would apply to the continuum of one born in the state of nondiscernment.

original: zhes bya ba la 'du shes med pa zhes bya ba ni 'du shes med pa'i lha rnams kyi nang du sems dang sems las byung ba 'gags pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la 'du shes med pa zhes bya ba ni 'du shes med pa'i lha rnams kyi nang du sems dang sems las byung ba 'gags pa'o //
translated: The state of nondiscernment is the cessation of mind and mental factors among the gods who are devoid of discernment.

original: der skye ba ni nyid mtshams sbyor zhing sprel ba'o //
analyzed: der skye ba ni nyid mtshams sbyor zhing sprel ba'o //
translated: To be born there is to be reborn there and to be connected with that state.

original: de'i rgyun ni de phan chad rgyun du 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: de'i rgyun ni de phan chad rgyun du 'byung ba'o //
translated: The continuum of that state is the occurrence of that state in a continuous manner.

original: gal te des nyon mongs pa can gyi yid mi 'dod na ngar 'dzin pa med pa nyid du @198a * //
analyzed: gal te des nyon mongs pa can gyi yid mi 'dod na ngar 'dzin pa med pa nyid du @198a * //
translated: If you do not accept that the afflicted mind exists in that state, then the fault of the absence of the conception of ‚ÄúI‚Äù would apply to the continuum of birth in that state.

original: 'gyur te / nyon mongs pa mtha' dag dang ldan pa'i skye ba'i rgyun ni ngar 'dzin pa med par ma mthong ngo //
analyzed: 'gyur te / nyon mongs pa mtha' dag dang ldan pa'i skye ba'i rgyun ni ngar 'dzin pa med par ma mthong ngo //
translated: We do not see a continuum of birth that is devoid of the conception of ‚ÄúI‚Äù and that is endowed with all the afflictions.

original: de nyid kyi phyir de ni 'phags pas smras pa'i 'os yin no //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir de ni 'phags pas smras pa'i 'os yin no //
translated: For that very reason, it is appropriate for the noble ones to speak of the afflicted mind.

original: skye ba'i skad cig la mngon du 'gyur ba'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i rten can ngar 'dzin pa'i 'phen pas ngar 'dzin pa dang bcas pa nyid do //
analyzed: skye ba'i skad cig la mngon du 'gyur ba'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i rten can ngar 'dzin pa'i 'phen pas ngar 'dzin pa dang bcas pa nyid do //
translated: The support of the mental consciousness that manifests in the moment of birth is projected by the apprehension of the self and is accompanied by the apprehension of the self.

original: ngar 'dzin pa ma spangs pa'i phyir rjod byed dang bcas pa la sogs pa lta bu'o zhes byar yang mi rung ste /
analyzed: ngar 'dzin pa ma spangs pa'i phyir rjod byed dang bcas pa la sogs pa lta bu'o zhes byar yang mi rung ste /
translated: It is not proper to say that it is accompanied by verbal expression, etc., because the apprehension of the self has not been abandoned.

original: ngar 'dzin pa dang bcas te 'gags pa dang / rjod byed la sogs pa yang sems las gzhan du mi 'grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ngar 'dzin pa dang bcas te 'gags pa dang / rjod byed la sogs pa yang sems las gzhan du mi 'grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because the apprehension of the self and verbal expression, etc., are not established as being different from the mind.

original: ngar 'dzin pa'i bag chags ni lus kyi rgyud la mi rigs te /
analyzed: ngar 'dzin pa'i bag chags ni lus kyi rgyud la mi rigs te /
translated: The latent impressions of the apprehension of the self are not logical in the body-continuum,

original: gzugs kyi phung po la de med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzugs kyi phung po la de med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they do not exist in the aggregate of form.

original: de lta bas na skad cig phan chad so so'i skye bo'i skye ba'i rgyun ngar 'dzin pa med pas ji skad bshad pa de rigs so //
analyzed: de lta bas na skad cig phan chad so so'i skye bo'i skye ba'i rgyun ngar 'dzin pa med pas ji skad bshad pa de rigs so //
translated: Therefore, it is logical to explain that the continuum of birth of the ordinary person, from one moment to the next, is without the apprehension of the self.

original: gang la de dang lhan cig 'byung ba'i sems ngar 'dzin pa'i gnas yod pa de la ni nyes pa med do //
analyzed: gang la de dang lhan cig 'byung ba'i sems ngar 'dzin pa'i gnas yod pa de la ni nyes pa med do //
translated: There is no fault in the case where there is a mind that arises together with it and is the basis of the apprehension of the self.

original: ngar 'dzin pa dang ldan par ni //
analyzed: ngar 'dzin pa dang ldan par ni //
translated: One who is endowed with the apprehension of ‚ÄúI‚ÄùüîΩ

original: rnam pa kun du mi 'thad do //
analyzed: rnam pa kun du mi 'thad do //
translated: It is not tenable in any wayüîΩfor one who possesses the view of the transitory composite.

original: zhes bya ba ni rnam pa thams cad du mi rung zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni rnam pa thams cad du mi rung zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This means that it is not tenable in any way.

original: dge ba'i gnas skabs ni sbyin pa la sogs pa la ngar 'dzin pa dang ldan te /
analyzed: dge ba'i gnas skabs ni sbyin pa la sogs pa la ngar 'dzin pa dang ldan te /
translated: In the context of the wholesome, one who possesses the view of the transitory composite is one who gives gifts, etc.

original: ngar sbyin pa byed do snyam du ngar sems pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ngar sbyin pa byed do snyam du ngar sems pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because he thinks, ‚ÄúI give gifts,‚Äù he is one who thinks in terms of ‚ÄúI.‚Äù

original: ngar 'dzin pa dang ldan pa ni ma rig pa med na mi 'byung ngo //
analyzed: ngar 'dzin pa dang ldan pa ni ma rig pa med na mi 'byung ngo //
translated: One who possesses the view of the transitory composite does not occur without ignorance.

original: ma rig pa yang sems las byung ba yin pas gnas med par mi 'byung ste /
analyzed: ma rig pa yang sems las byung ba yin pas gnas med par mi 'byung ste /
translated: And ignorance does not occur without a basis, since it is a mental factor.

original: nyon mongs pa can gyis yid ma gtogs par gnas gzhan med do //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa can gyis yid ma gtogs par gnas gzhan med do //
translated: There is no other basis except the afflicted mind.

original: dge ba'i sems ni ma rig pa'i gnas su mi rung ngo //
analyzed: dge ba'i sems ni ma rig pa'i gnas su mi rung ngo //
translated: It is not tenable that the wholesome mind is the basis of ignorance.

original: nyon mongs pa can gyi yid med na gnyis med ces bya ba ni ma rig pa ma 'dres pa dang / lnga po dag dang 'dra ba'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa can gyi yid med na gnyis med ces bya ba ni ma rig pa ma 'dres pa dang / lnga po dag dang 'dra ba'o //
translated: Without the afflicted mind, there is no duality, that is, no ignorance unmixed with the five.

original: gsum po 'gal bar 'gyur zhes bya ba ni snyoms par 'jug pa'i bye brag dang / nges pa'i tshig dang / ngar 'dzin pa med pa'i skye ba gsum mo //
analyzed: gsum po 'gal bar 'gyur zhes bya ba ni snyoms par 'jug pa'i bye brag dang / nges pa'i tshig dang / ngar 'dzin pa med pa'i skye ba gsum mo //
translated: The three are mutually exclusive, that is, the three kinds of meditative attainment, the etymological definition, and the birth of one who is without the conceit of ‚ÄúI.

original: ma rig pa ma 'dres pa sngar bstan pa de bshad de //
analyzed: ma rig pa ma 'dres pa sngar bstan pa de bshad de //
translated: The above-mentioned non-mixture of ignorance is explained:üîΩIt is always an obstruction to the mind

original: yang dag don la 'jug pa yi //üîΩsems kyi gegs su rtag gyur dang // zhes bya ba ni yang dag pa'i don mthong ba'i gags byed pa ste /
analyzed: yang dag don la 'jug pa yi // sems kyi gegs su rtag gyur dang // zhes bya ba ni yang dag pa'i don mthong ba'i gags byed pa ste /
translated: that is engaged in the true object.

original: de yod na de mi 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de yod na de mi 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It is always an obstruction to the mind that is engaged in the true object, because when it exists, the latter does not occur.

original: dus rnams kun tu 'byung ba de /
analyzed: dus rnams kun tu 'byung ba de /
translated: It occurs in all the stages,

original: zhes bya ba ni dge ba dang / mi dge ba dang @198b lung du ma bstan pa'i gnas skabs su yang rjes su 'brel zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni dge ba dang / mi dge ba dang @198b lung du ma bstan pa'i gnas skabs su yang rjes su 'brel zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: that is, it is related to the wholesome, unwholesome, and undefined stages.

original: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa ma gtogs par sems kyi lus gsum pa mi dmigs te zhes bya ba ni ji ltar yid ces bya ba'i sgra'i lus ni 'gags ma thag pa'i rnam par shes pa yin la rnam par shes pa'i sgra'i ni rnam par shes pa drug
analyzed: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa ma gtogs par sems kyi lus gsum pa mi dmigs te zhes bya ba ni ji ltar yid ces bya ba'i sgra'i lus ni 'gags ma thag pa'i rnam par shes pa yin la rnam par shes pa'i sgra'i ni rnam par shes pa drug
translated: Apart from the foundation consciousness, a third mental body is not perceived,üîΩjust as the body of the word mind is the immediately past consciousness, and the body of the word consciousness is the six consciousnesses.

original: po dag yin pa ltar sems zhes bya'i sgra'i lus gzhan ni de ltar mi dmigs so //üîΩbrjod pa 'di'i lus med pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: po dag yin pa ltar sems zhes bya'i sgra'i lus gzhan ni de ltar mi dmigs so // brjod pa 'di'i lus med pa ni ma yin no //
translated: A third body of the word mind is not perceived in the same way.üîΩBut this does not mean that the body of this word does not exist.

original: 'di rnam grangs su gtogs pa'ang ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di rnam grangs su gtogs pa'ang ma yin te /
translated: It is not a synonym,

original: yid dang rnam par shes pa'i sgra gnyis kyi brjod par bya ba tha dad pa'i phyir ro /
analyzed: yid dang rnam par shes pa'i sgra gnyis kyi brjod par bya ba tha dad pa'i phyir ro /
translated: because the referents of the words mind and consciousness are different.

original: 'dir sgra'i lus su 'dod pa ni brjod par bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'dir sgra'i lus su 'dod pa ni brjod par bya ba'o //
translated: Here the referent of the word body is the referent of the word mind.

original: de lta bas na kun gzhi rnam par shes pa ni sems zhes bya ba'i sgra'i brjod par bya ba'o //
analyzed: de lta bas na kun gzhi rnam par shes pa ni sems zhes bya ba'i sgra'i brjod par bya ba'o //
translated: Therefore the foundation consciousness is the referent of the word mind.

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How so?

original: 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pas bsdus pa'i chos kyi sa bon nus pa'i khyad par can sna tshogs rnam par tha dad pa rnams kyis kun du bsags shing gang bar byas pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni de sgor byas shing bsten nas zhes bya ba'i tha tshig
analyzed: 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pas bsdus pa'i chos kyi sa bon nus pa'i khyad par can sna tshogs rnam par tha dad pa rnams kyis kun du bsags shing gang bar byas pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni de sgor byas shing bsten nas zhes bya ba'i tha tshig
translated: This is what is meant by ‚Äúhaving that as its basis and support.‚Äù

original: ste / sems kyi sgra de la 'jug pa'i rgyur ston to //
analyzed: ste / sems kyi sgra de la 'jug pa'i rgyur ston to //
translated: The word ‚Äúmind‚Äù shows that it is the cause of the active consciousnesses.

original: shes bya phra mo bsdus pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bas ni shes bya phra mo nye bar bzung ba khas blangs nas nyan thos rnams la ma bshad de /
analyzed: shes bya phra mo bsdus pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bas ni shes bya phra mo nye bar bzung ba khas blangs nas nyan thos rnams la ma bshad de /
translated: ‚ÄúBecause it collects subtle objects of knowledge‚Äù means that the Subduer did not teach it to the ≈õrƒÅvakas, having accepted that subtle objects of knowledge are to be apprehended.

original: de dag ni shes bya rags pa bsdu bas gdul ba yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de dag ni shes bya rags pa bsdu bas gdul ba yin pa'i phyir /
translated: This is because they are to be disciplined by collecting gross objects of knowledge.

original: shes bya phra mo shes pa la gtogs pa med pa nyid do //
analyzed: shes bya phra mo shes pa la gtogs pa med pa nyid do //
translated: They do not have the ability to know subtle objects of knowledge.

original: nyan thos rnams ni shes bya thams cad shas pa la gtogs pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni nus pa dang / don du gnyer ba dang / gtogs pa'i mtshan nyid med par ston to //
analyzed: nyan thos rnams ni shes bya thams cad shas pa la gtogs pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni nus pa dang / don du gnyer ba dang / gtogs pa'i mtshan nyid med par ston to //
translated: ‚ÄúThe ≈õrƒÅvakas do not have the ability to know all objects of knowledge‚Äù shows that they do not have the characteristics of ability, interest, and inclusion.

original: de dag ni de bstan pa med par yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni nyan thos rnams la kun gzhi rnam par shes pa ma bstan kyang shes bya gzugs la sogs pa rags pa /
analyzed: de dag ni de bstan pa med par yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni nyan thos rnams la kun gzhi rnam par shes pa ma bstan kyang shes bya gzugs la sogs pa rags pa /
translated: Those who are not taught that, i.e., the disciples, even though the foundation consciousness is not taught to them, abandon the afflictions by discriminating the gross objects of knowledge, such as form, in terms of impermanence, etc.,

original: sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung ba'i bdag nyid la mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i rnam par so sor rtog pa dag nyon mongs pa rnams spangs te /
analyzed: sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung ba'i bdag nyid la mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i rnam par so sor rtog pa dag nyon mongs pa rnams spangs te /
translated: which have the nature of suffering and origin.

original: de'i don du de dag bcom ldan 'das kyi drung na tshangs par spyod par gnas so //
analyzed: de'i don du de dag bcom ldan 'das kyi drung na tshangs par spyod par gnas so //
translated: For that purpose, they abide in pure action in the presence of the BhagavƒÅn.

original: rags pa nyid ni gzugs ni lus can yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rags pa nyid ni gzugs ni lus can yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Grossness is due to form having a body.

original: tshor ba la sogs pa ni dmigs pa dang rnam pa yongs su chad pa dang / rgyu rags pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshor ba la sogs pa ni dmigs pa dang rnam pa yongs su chad pa dang / rgyu rags pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Feeling, etc., are gross due to the object, aspect, and cause being cut off.

original: de las bzlog pa @199a * //
analyzed: de las bzlog pa @199a * //
translated: The opposite of that

original: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa ni phra ba'o //
analyzed: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa ni phra ba'o //
translated: is the foundation consciousness, which is subtle.

original: chos gcig mngon par ma shes shing yongs su ma shes na yang sdug bsngal mthar 'byin par ngas ma bshad do zhes gang gsungs pa de ni nyon mongs pa rnams las dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: chos gcig mngon par ma shes shing yongs su ma shes na yang sdug bsngal mthar 'byin par ngas ma bshad do zhes gang gsungs pa de ni nyon mongs pa rnams las dgongs pa'o //
translated: I do not say that suffering will be brought to an end without directly knowing and fully understanding one thing, and that is the afflictions.

original: ma spangs na zhes bya ba'i bye brag gi sgra dang gzhi mthun pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: ma spangs na zhes bya ba'i bye brag gi sgra dang gzhi mthun pa'i phyir te /
translated: The word ‚Äúwithout‚Äù is used because of the common locus of the word ‚Äúwithout‚Äù and ‚Äúwithout abandoning.‚Äù

original: nyon mongs pa la ma gtogs pa spang bar bya ba gzhan med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa la ma gtogs pa spang bar bya ba gzhan med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because there is nothing to be abandoned apart from the afflictions.

original: yang na mi rtag pa la sogs pa spyi'i rnam par snyegs kyi /
analyzed: yang na mi rtag pa la sogs pa spyi'i rnam par snyegs kyi /
translated: Or else, the word ‚Äúwithout‚Äù is used because of the general aspect of impermanence, etc.

original: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa nyid ces ma bzung bas nyes pa med do //üîΩbyang chub sems dpa' rnams ni shes bya thams cad shes pa la gtogs pa yin no zhes bya ba ni rigs kyi mthus nus pa dang / don du gnyer ba dang / gtogs pa'i mtshan nyid dang ldan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa nyid ces ma bzung bas nyes pa med do // byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni shes bya thams cad shes pa la gtogs pa yin no zhes bya ba ni rigs kyi mthus nus pa dang / don du gnyer ba dang / gtogs pa'i mtshan nyid dang ldan pa'i phyir /
translated: But since the word ‚Äúwithout‚Äù is not used in the sense of ‚Äúwithout the store consciousness,‚Äù there is no fault.üîΩThe bodhisattvas are included in the knowledge of all knowables means that they are included in the knowledge of all knowables because they have the characteristics of ability, aspiration, and inclusion.

original: thams cad shes par bya bar gtogs so //
analyzed: thams cad shes par bya bar gtogs so //
translated: The word ‚Äúincluded‚Äù means that they are included in the knowledge of all knowables.

original: gzhan du na ni gzhan gyi don byed mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan du na ni gzhan gyi don byed mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Otherwise, it would be impossible to benefit others.

original: gzhan dag gi bsam pa dang / bag la nyal dang / khams dang / dbang po mchog dang / mchog ma yin pa dang / skal pa yod pa dang / skal ba med pa dang / dus dang dus ma yin pa mi shes pa thams cad mkhyen pa ma yin pas gzhan gyis don mtha' dag byed mi nus pa'i phyir de don du gnyer ba'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams la kun gzhi rnam par shes pa bshad do //
analyzed: gzhan dag gi bsam pa dang / bag la nyal dang / khams dang / dbang po mchog dang / mchog ma yin pa dang / skal pa yod pa dang / skal ba med pa dang / dus dang dus ma yin pa mi shes pa thams cad mkhyen pa ma yin pas gzhan gyis don mtha' dag byed mi nus pa'i phyir de don du gnyer ba'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams la kun gzhi rnam par shes pa bshad do //
translated: Because those who do not know all the inclinations, dormant tendencies, temperaments, superior and inferior faculties, possibilities and impossibilities, and proper and improper times of others are not omniscient and therefore cannot benefit others in every way, the foundation consciousness is taught to those bodhisattvas who seek omniscience.üîΩWithout knowing that, it is not easy to attain the gnosis of omniscience.

original: de shes pa med par ni thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes thob par sla ba ma yin no zhes bya ba ni kun gzhi rnam par shes pa yongs su shes pa med par don du yongs su rtogs pa spong bar mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: de shes pa med par ni thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes thob par sla ba ma yin no zhes bya ba ni kun gzhi rnam par shes pa yongs su shes pa med par don du yongs su rtogs pa spong bar mi 'gyur te /
translated: Without knowing the foundation consciousness, the elimination of the conception of objects as real is not possible.

original: de ma spangs na yongs su brtag par ma bya ba'i don yod pa'i phyir rna par mi rtog pa'i ye shes med do //
analyzed: de ma spangs na yongs su brtag par ma bya ba'i don yod pa'i phyir rna par mi rtog pa'i ye shes med do //
translated: If that is not eliminated, nonconceptual gnosis does not exist because there is an object that should not be analyzed.

original: de'i phyir shes bya thams cad kyi spyi'i mtshan nyid mngon sum du ma byas pas thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes thob par sla ba ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir shes bya thams cad kyi spyi'i mtshan nyid mngon sum du ma byas pas thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes thob par sla ba ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, since the universal characteristics of all objects of knowledge are not directly perceived, it is not easy to attain the exalted wisdom of omniscience.

original: rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa'i shes pas yongs su brtag par bya ba'i don gcig las gcig bzlog pa'i rang gi mtshan nyid ma rtogs na ni mtha' yas pa'i phyir thams cad rtogs par mi nus so //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa'i shes pas yongs su brtag par bya ba'i don gcig las gcig bzlog pa'i rang gi mtshan nyid ma rtogs na ni mtha' yas pa'i phyir thams cad rtogs par mi nus so //
translated: If the specific characteristics of one object of conceptual cognition are not understood, then all are not understood because they are infinite.

original: gal te 'di dag kun gzhi rnam par shes pa 'di nyid brjod pa'i bag chags yongs su 'gyur ba'i dbang gis don dang / sems can dang / bdag @199b dang ; rnam par rig par snang bar 'byung bar shes na de'i tshe gzung ba'i don med par rtogs nas 'dzin pa yang med par rigs pas khong du chud nas rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes 'thob bo //
analyzed: gal te 'di dag kun gzhi rnam par shes pa 'di nyid brjod pa'i bag chags yongs su 'gyur ba'i dbang gis don dang / sems can dang / bdag @199b dang ; rnam par rig par snang bar 'byung bar shes na de'i tshe gzung ba'i don med par rtogs nas 'dzin pa yang med par rigs pas khong du chud nas rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes 'thob bo //
translated: If it is understood that all these are the appearance of the object, sentient beings, self, and representations of this very foundation consciousness through the power of the transformation of the propensities for verbalization, then at that time, having understood that the object of apprehension does not exist, one realizes that the apprehender also does not exist through reasoning, and one attains nonconceptual exalted wisdom.

original: de'i rjes la thams cad kyi spyi'i mtshan nyid de bzhin nyid goms par byed cing de dang chos thams cad ro gcig par shes te /
analyzed: de'i rjes la thams cad kyi spyi'i mtshan nyid de bzhin nyid goms par byed cing de dang chos thams cad ro gcig par shes te /
translated: After that, one cultivates the suchness which is the general characteristic of all things, and one knows that it is of one taste with all things.

original: mtha' yas pa med pa'i phyir thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes thob par sla ba yin no //
analyzed: mtha' yas pa med pa'i phyir thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes thob par sla ba yin no //
translated: Because of the absence of the infinite, it is easy to attain the knowledge of an omniscient one.

original: dmigs pa dag pa la ma gtogs par shes pa dag pa'i thabs gzhan med do //
analyzed: dmigs pa dag pa la ma gtogs par shes pa dag pa'i thabs gzhan med do //
translated: There is no means of purifying the cognition except by purifying the object.

original: de ltar na skad cig gcig dang ldan pa'i shes rab kyis chos thams cad shes so zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de ltar na skad cig gcig dang ldan pa'i shes rab kyis chos thams cad shes so zhes gsungs so //
translated: Thus, it is said that one knows all things by means of the cognition of the single moment.

original: yang smras pa /
analyzed: yang smras pa /
translated: Again, it is said:

original: brtags pa'i chos la rnam rtog pa //
analyzed: brtags pa'i chos la rnam rtog pa //
translated: The conceptualization of imagined things

original: shes bya kun la ma spangs na //
analyzed: shes bya kun la ma spangs na //
translated: is not abandoned with respect to all objects of cognition.

original: thams cad mkhyen pa nyid med de //
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa nyid med de //
translated: Therefore, omniscience does not exist,

original: de phyir chos la bdag med bstan //
analyzed: de phyir chos la bdag med bstan //
translated: and so the selflessness of things is taught.

original: zhe'o // lung gi tshul 'di mi mngon par mi shes pa dag ni /üîΩdper na rgyun gyis nus pa'i phyir //
analyzed: zhe'o // lung gi tshul 'di mi mngon par mi shes pa dag ni / dper na rgyun gyis nus pa'i phyir //
translated: Those who do not understand this method of scriptureüîΩsay, for example:üîΩJust as fire is thought to burn everything

original: mes ni thams cad sreg 'dod ltar //
analyzed: mes ni thams cad sreg 'dod ltar //
translated: through the power of its continuum,

original: de bzhin thams cad mkhyen 'dod kyi //
analyzed: de bzhin thams cad mkhyen 'dod kyi //
translated: so too it is thought to know everythingüîΩthrough the power of its omniscience.

original: cig car thams cad rig phyir min //
analyzed: cig car thams cad rig phyir min //
translated: because of simultaneous knowledge of all things.

original: zhes smra'o // de lta bas na kun gzhi rnam par shes pa dang / ma shes pas thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes 'thob par bslab dang dka' bar 'gyur ro zhes gtso bo kho nar brjod do //
analyzed: zhes smra'o // de lta bas na kun gzhi rnam par shes pa dang / ma shes pas thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes 'thob par bslab dang dka' bar 'gyur ro zhes gtso bo kho nar brjod do //
translated: Therefore, because of the non-existence of the store-consciousness, the attainment of the knowledge of an Omniscient One is difficult.

original: chos thams cad bdag med pa'o zhes bya ba thams cad mkhyen pa ma yin nam zhe na /üîΩthams cad mkhyen pa ni yin mod kyi /
analyzed: chos thams cad bdag med pa'o zhes bya ba thams cad mkhyen pa ma yin nam zhe na / thams cad mkhyen pa ni yin mod kyi /
translated: But is it not said that all things are selfless?üîΩIt is said, but not by the Omniscient One.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa ni ma yin no //
translated: It is said by the Disciples, but not by the Omniscient One.

original: yang rnam grangs kyis kun gzhi rnam par shes pa nyan thos kyi theg par yang bstan te zhes bya ba ni sde pa gzhan la grags par nye bar 'god pas kun gzhi rnam par shes pa'i lam po che btod pa nyid du mjug sdud par skabs sbyor ba'o
analyzed: yang rnam grangs kyis kun gzhi rnam par shes pa nyan thos kyi theg par yang bstan te zhes bya ba ni sde pa gzhan la grags par nye bar 'god pas kun gzhi rnam par shes pa'i lam po che btod pa nyid du mjug sdud par skabs sbyor ba'o
translated: The store-consciousness is also taught in the Vehicle of the Disciples, by way of synonyms.

original: // de bzhin gshegs pa byung na phan yon bzhi yod do zhes mdo gang las gsungs pa de ni /
analyzed: // de bzhin gshegs pa byung na phan yon bzhi yod do zhes mdo gang las gsungs pa de ni /
translated: The four benefits that occur when a Tathagata appears are stated in a Sutra:

original: de bzhin gshegs pa byung ba'i phan yon rnam pa bzhi'i mdo de las 'di gsungs so //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa byung ba'i phan yon rnam pa bzhi'i mdo de las 'di gsungs so //
translated: This is stated in the S≈´tra on the Four Benefits of the Appearance of the TathƒÅgatas.

original: skye dgu kun gzhi la kun tu dga' ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: skye dgu kun gzhi la kun tu dga' ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: In the line ‚Äúall beings are delighted with the foundation,‚Äù

original: kun gzhi la brten nas dga' bas de ltar gyi dus na kun gzhi la kun du dga'o //
analyzed: kun gzhi la brten nas dga' bas de ltar gyi dus na kun gzhi la kun du dga'o //
translated: because of delight in the foundation, they are delighted with the foundation at that time.

original: ji lta zhe na /üîΩ'di ltar kun gzhi las yang dag par byung ba zhes bya ba ni 'das pa'i dus te de las byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ji lta zhe na / 'di ltar kun gzhi las yang dag par byung ba zhes bya ba ni 'das pa'i dus te de las byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: How is that?üîΩ‚ÄúIn this way, they arise from the foundation‚Äù refers to the past.

original: @200a * // 'di ltar yang 'di ni ma 'ongs pa na mngon par dga' ba'i ngang tshul can te /
analyzed: @200a * // 'di ltar yang 'di ni ma 'ongs pa na mngon par dga' ba'i ngang tshul can te /
translated: ‚ÄúIn this way, they are inclined toward the future‚Äù means that they are inclined toward the future.

original: de 'dod pa la gzhol ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de 'dod pa la gzhol ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they are devoted to desire.

original: de lta bas na kun gzhi la mngon par dga' bas can zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de lta bas na kun gzhi la mngon par dga' bas can zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Therefore, they are called ‚Äúthose who are delighted with the foundation.‚Äù

original: kun gzhi spangs pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni legs par gzhom pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: kun gzhi spangs pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni legs par gzhom pa'i phyir ro //
translated: ‚ÄúBecause they abandon the foundation‚Äù means because they conquer it well.

original: nyan 'dod ces bya ba ni nyan par 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: nyan 'dod ces bya ba ni nyan par 'dod pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThey are inclined to listen‚Äù means they are inclined to listen.

original: rnam par gtod ces bya ba ni smon lam btab nas thos pa las byung ba'i shes pas nyan pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par gtod ces bya ba ni smon lam btab nas thos pa las byung ba'i shes pas nyan pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIt is directed‚Äù means that it is listening with the knowledge that arises from hearing, after having made a prayer.

original: kun shes par byed par sems nye bar 'jog ces bya ba ni bsams pa las byung ba'i shes pas don gtan la 'bebs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: kun shes par byed par sems nye bar 'jog ces bya ba ni bsams pa las byung ba'i shes pas don gtan la 'bebs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: ‚ÄúIt is placed in the mind that is to be fully understood‚Äù means that it is ascertaining the meaning with the knowledge that arises from reflection.

original: chos kyi rjes su mthun pa'i chos sgrub ces bya ba ni bsgoms pa las byung ba 'jig rten las 'das pas so //
analyzed: chos kyi rjes su mthun pa'i chos sgrub ces bya ba ni bsgoms pa las byung ba 'jig rten las 'das pas so //
translated: ‚ÄúIt is the practice of the teaching that accords with the teaching‚Äù means that it is supramundane, which arises from meditation.

original: lam gyi bden pa ni bstan pa'i chos kyi rjes su mthun pa'i chos te nan tan du bya ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lam gyi bden pa ni bstan pa'i chos kyi rjes su mthun pa'i chos te nan tan du bya ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The truth of the path is the teaching that accords with the teaching that is to be known, because it is the practice.

original: de sgrub pa ni rang gi sems kyi rgyud la 'jog pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de sgrub pa ni rang gi sems kyi rgyud la 'jog pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Its practice is the placement of it in one‚Äôs own mental continuum.

original: dge 'dun phal chen sde'i lung las kyang zhes byas ba 'dis kyang lam po che btod par sgrub bo //
analyzed: dge 'dun phal chen sde'i lung las kyang zhes byas ba 'dis kyang lam po che btod par sgrub bo //
translated: ‚ÄúAlso in the scriptures of the MahƒÅsƒÅ·πÉghika school‚Äù establishes that the path is the clearing away of the great road.

original: rtsa ba'i rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba ni rnam par shes pa gzhan dag gi rgyu yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: rtsa ba'i rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba ni rnam par shes pa gzhan dag gi rgyu yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: ‚ÄúThe fundamental consciousness‚Äù is the cause of the other consciousnesses.

original: dper na shing gi rtsa ba ni sdong bu la sogs pa'i rgyu yin pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na shing gi rtsa ba ni sdong bu la sogs pa'i rgyu yin pa lta bu'o //
translated: For example, the root of a tree is the cause of the trunk and so on.üîΩAlso, in the scriptures of the Mahƒ´≈õƒÅsakas, it says:

original: sa ston sde'i lung las kyang zhes bya ba ni de dag gi lung gi phung po rnam pa gsum la skad cig pa ni gang dag skad cig re re la skye ba dang 'gag pa'o //
analyzed: sa ston sde'i lung las kyang zhes bya ba ni de dag gi lung gi phung po rnam pa gsum la skad cig pa ni gang dag skad cig re re la skye ba dang 'gag pa'o //
translated: The momentary are those that arise and cease every moment.

original: de'i tshe rabs pa ni gang dag 'chi ba la thug gi par du rjes su 'brang ba'o //
analyzed: de'i tshe rabs pa ni gang dag 'chi ba la thug gi par du rjes su 'brang ba'o //
translated: The life-continuum is that which continues until death.

original: 'khor ba ji srid pa ni gang dag rdo rjes lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin ma thob kyi bar du rjes su 'brang ba'o //
analyzed: 'khor ba ji srid pa ni gang dag rdo rjes lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin ma thob kyi bar du rjes su 'brang ba'o //
translated: The samsaric is that which continues until the vajra-like concentration is attained.

original: de dag kyang kun gzhi rnam par shes pa las gzhan mi srid pas kun gzhi rnam par shes pa de nyid ming gzhan gyis bstan pa ste /
analyzed: de dag kyang kun gzhi rnam par shes pa las gzhan mi srid pas kun gzhi rnam par shes pa de nyid ming gzhan gyis bstan pa ste /
translated: Since those are not possible apart from the foundation consciousness, that foundation consciousness is taught by another name.

original: ji skad bstan pa'i phung po rnams ni ji srid 'khor bar yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ji skad bstan pa'i phung po rnams ni ji srid 'khor bar yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the aggregates taught in that way do not exist as long as samsara exists.

original: ji lta zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta zhe na /
translated: How is that?

original: la lar res 'ga' zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: la lar res 'ga' zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: It is said: ‚ÄúSometimes, somewhere, etc.‚Äù

original: gzhi dang dus bstan to //
analyzed: gzhi dang dus bstan to //
translated: The basis and time have been explained.

original: de la gzugs med par ni gzungs rgyun chad do //
analyzed: de la gzugs med par ni gzungs rgyun chad do //
translated: In the formless realm, the stream of form is interrupted.

original: 'du shes med pa dang / de'i snyoms par 'jug pa la ni sems kyi rgyun chad do //
analyzed: 'du shes med pa dang / de'i snyoms par 'jug pa la ni sems kyi rgyun chad do //
translated: In the meditative attainment of nonperception, the stream of mind is interrupted.

original: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa la ni gnyen po skyes kyi bar du gzugs dang sems kyi sa bon gyi rgyun mi 'chad do //üîΩ'phags pa gnas brtan pa rnams kyi lung las ni srid pa'i yan lag gi sgrar gsungs te /
analyzed: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa la ni gnyen po skyes kyi bar du gzugs dang sems kyi sa bon gyi rgyun mi 'chad do // 'phags pa gnas brtan pa rnams kyi lung las ni srid pa'i yan lag gi sgrar gsungs te /
translated: But in the foundation consciousness, the stream of seeds of form and mind is not interrupted until the antidote arises.

original: srid @200b pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: srid @200b pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: In the scriptures of the elders, these are called members of existence because they are the cause of existence.

original: rnam par phye ste smra ba'i lung las kyang de skad du 'byung ngo //üîΩlta ba la sogs pa drug ni mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa nas /
analyzed: rnam par phye ste smra ba'i lung las kyang de skad du 'byung ngo // lta ba la sogs pa drug ni mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa nas /
translated: In the scriptures of the Vaibhasikas, they are called members of dependent origination.

original: yid la sogs pa'i bar du ci rigs su sbyar ro //
analyzed: yid la sogs pa'i bar du ci rigs su sbyar ro //
translated: The scriptures of the Vaibhasikas also state that the six beginning with view are eye consciousness and so on up to mind consciousness.

original: gang zhig kun gzhi rnam par shes pa la zhes dang ba ni rnam par shes pa'i cha bdun dang ldan pa'i phreng ba lta bar byed pa nas dngos po yongs su gcod pa'i bar ro zhes smra ba de'i lan rigs pa thigs pa'i nang du blta bar bya'o
analyzed: gang zhig kun gzhi rnam par shes pa la zhes dang ba ni rnam par shes pa'i cha bdun dang ldan pa'i phreng ba lta bar byed pa nas dngos po yongs su gcod pa'i bar ro zhes smra ba de'i lan rigs pa thigs pa'i nang du blta bar bya'o
translated: The response to the assertion that the mind is the continuum of the seven consciousnesses, from the eye consciousness to the entity-realizer, should be sought in the Drop of Logic.

original: // lam bo che btod pa yin no zhes bya ba ni sde pa gzhan gyi lung du ma las grags pas kun gzhi rnam par shes pa'i lam du dong ba dang rjes su dong ba nyid ston to //
analyzed: // lam bo che btod pa yin no zhes bya ba ni sde pa gzhan gyi lung du ma las grags pas kun gzhi rnam par shes pa'i lam du dong ba dang rjes su dong ba nyid ston to //
translated: The statement that the mind is the path of the world means that it is the path of the consciousness that is the foundation of all of samsara and nirvana.

original: kha cig 'di snyam du zhes bya ba ni log par rtogs pa ston te /
analyzed: kha cig 'di snyam du zhes bya ba ni log par rtogs pa ston te /
translated: The statement ‚Äúsome think‚Äù presents a false view.

original: sems dang yid dang rnam par shes pa ni don gcig ces bya ba la sogs pa ji skad bshad pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: sems dang yid dang rnam par shes pa ni don gcig ces bya ba la sogs pa ji skad bshad pa lta bu'o //
translated: The mind, mentality, and consciousness are synonyms.

original: de yang mi 'thad de zhes bya ba ni rigs pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de yang mi 'thad de zhes bya ba ni rigs pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This is not tenable means this is not logical.

original: yid rnam par shes pa gnyis don tha dad par dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yid rnam par shes pa gnyis don tha dad par dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the two, the mental consciousness and the consciousnesses, are observed to be different.

original: zhes bya ba ni rjod pa dang brjod par bya ba'i rang bzhin can gyi sgra gnyis dang don gnyis tha dang ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni rjod pa dang brjod par bya ba'i rang bzhin can gyi sgra gnyis dang don gnyis tha dang ba'i phyir te /
translated: Because the two sounds and the two objects that have the nature of the expressed and the expressor are different.

original: rnam par shes pa drug po 'das ma thag pa ni yid do //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa drug po 'das ma thag pa ni yid do //
translated: The immediately past six consciousnesses are the mental faculty.üîΩThe awareness of individual objects is consciousness.

original: yul so sor rna par rig pa ni rnam par shes pa'o zhes 'byung bas yid dang rnam par shes pa gnyis don tha dad do //
analyzed: yul so sor rna par rig pa ni rnam par shes pa'o zhes 'byung bas yid dang rnam par shes pa gnyis don tha dad do //
translated: Thus, the mental faculty and consciousness are different.

original: de bzhin du sems kyi don gyis kyang tha dad du dbye bar bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du sems kyi don gyis kyang tha dad du dbye bar bya'o //
translated: In the same way, the meaning of mind should be distinguished.

original: yang kha cig ni zhes bya ba ni kun gzhi la kun du dga' ba la sogs pa don gzhan du rtogs te /
analyzed: yang kha cig ni zhes bya ba ni kun gzhi la kun du dga' ba la sogs pa don gzhan du rtogs te /
translated: Some say that the meaning of the foundation consciousness is different from the meaning of mind.

original: de smras pa /
analyzed: de smras pa /
translated: They say:

original: nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga po dag ni kun gzhi zhes bya'o zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga po dag ni kun gzhi zhes bya'o zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The five appropriated aggregates are called the foundation consciousness.

original: de dag la bdag nyid du 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag la bdag nyid du 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they are grasped as a self.üîΩThe view of the transitory collection is the foundation consciousness.

original: 'jig tshogs la lta ba kun gzhi'o zhes bya bas ni des de dag la bdag nyid du 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'jig tshogs la lta ba kun gzhi'o zhes bya bas ni des de dag la bdag nyid du 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it grasps those aggregates as a self.

original: bde ba'i tshor ba 'dod chags dag bcas pa ni kun gzhi'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: bde ba'i tshor ba 'dod chags dag bcas pa ni kun gzhi'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The statement, ‚ÄúThe feeling of pleasure and the attachment that is to be abandoned are the store consciousness,‚Äù

original: 'dod chags dang tshor ba lhan cig spyod pa'i spyi ni kun gzhi nyid de ;
analyzed: 'dod chags dang tshor ba lhan cig spyod pa'i spyi ni kun gzhi nyid de ;
translated: refers to the store consciousness as the common locus of the feeling of pleasure and attachment.

original: 'dod chags rgyas par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dod chags rgyas par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because attachment increases in the store consciousness.

original: yang na so so la bya ste /
analyzed: yang na so so la bya ste /
translated: Alternatively, the statement refers to each of the two terms.

original: chags pa dang de'i gnas yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chags pa dang de'i gnas yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because the feeling of pleasure is the basis of attachment.

original: de dag ni kun gzhi rnam par shes pa la rmongs pa rnams so //
analyzed: de dag ni kun gzhi rnam par shes pa la rmongs pa rnams so //
translated: These people are confused about the store consciousness.

original: ji lta zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta zhe na /
translated: How so?

original: lung dang rtogs pas de snyam du sems so zhes bya ba smos pa ste /üîΩnye bar bstan pa @201a * //
analyzed: lung dang rtogs pas de snyam du sems so zhes bya ba smos pa ste / nye bar bstan pa @201a * //
translated: The text states, ‚ÄúThey think in this way because of scripture and reasoning.‚Äù

original: dang ; nyes par khong du chud pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dang ; nyes par khong du chud pa'i phyir ro //
translated: They think in this way because of the teaching of the sutras and because of their understanding of the meaning of the sutras.üîΩThey think in this way because of the teaching of the sutras and because of their understanding of the meaning of the sutras.

original: yang na yid ches pa'i lung med pa dang / rang gis kyang khong du ma chud pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yang na yid ches pa'i lung med pa dang / rang gis kyang khong du ma chud pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Or, they think in this way because they have no authoritative scriptures and because they do not understand the meaning of the scriptures.

original: nyan thos kyi theg pa rnam par gzhag pa'i tshul du na yang de dag gi rnam par gzhag pa de mi rung ba med mod kyi zhes bya ba ni smad pa ste /
analyzed: nyan thos kyi theg pa rnam par gzhag pa'i tshul du na yang de dag gi rnam par gzhag pa de mi rung ba med mod kyi zhes bya ba ni smad pa ste /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúeven though there is nothing unreasonable in their formulation from the point of view of the system of the ≈õrƒÅvaka vehicle‚Äù is a criticism.

original: rang gi lo rgyus kyi lugs kyis na de thams cad kyi thams cad du rung bar bstan to //
analyzed: rang gi lo rgyus kyi lugs kyis na de thams cad kyi thams cad du rung bar bstan to //
translated: According to our own historical tradition, all of that is taught as being suitable.

original: de la ma rmongs pa rnams kyi kun gzhi rnam par gzhag pa de kun gzhi rnam par shes pa yin par yongs su bzung nas rnam par 'jog pa ni ches bzang ngo zhes bya ba ni smad par rnam par 'grel te /
analyzed: de la ma rmongs pa rnams kyi kun gzhi rnam par gzhag pa de kun gzhi rnam par shes pa yin par yongs su bzung nas rnam par 'jog pa ni ches bzang ngo zhes bya ba ni smad par rnam par 'grel te /
translated: There, the presentation of the foundation consciousness for those who are not confused is very good, it is said, if it is taken as the foundation consciousness and presented as such.

original: de'i bshad pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i nyes pa brjod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i bshad pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i nyes pa brjod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is a condemnation, because it expresses the fault of conceptualization in its explanation.

original: 'di ltar nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga po dag ni shin tu sdug bsngal ba'i ngan 'gro rnams su skyes pa dag dang mi mthun pa ma yin no zhes bya ba la ngan 'gro ni sems can dmyal ba dang / dud 'gro dang / yi dags rnams so //
analyzed: 'di ltar nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga po dag ni shin tu sdug bsngal ba'i ngan 'gro rnams su skyes pa dag dang mi mthun pa ma yin no zhes bya ba la ngan 'gro ni sems can dmyal ba dang / dud 'gro dang / yi dags rnams so //
translated: Thus, the five appropriated aggregates are not incompatible with those born in the extremely painful miserable realms. The miserable realms are the hells, animals, and ghosts.

original: de dag ni rtag par shin tu sdug bsngal ba nyid du bye brag med de /
analyzed: de dag ni rtag par shin tu sdug bsngal ba nyid du bye brag med de /
translated: They are not distinguished as being always extremely painful.

original: de dag la res 'ga' yang bde ba med do //
analyzed: de dag la res 'ga' yang bde ba med do //
translated: There is never any happiness for them.

original: mi mthun pa zhes bya ba ni mi 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: mi mthun pa zhes bya ba ni mi 'dod pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúDisagreeable‚Äù means undesirable.

original: 'dod pa med pa'i don la ni su yang mi sbyor te /
analyzed: 'dod pa med pa'i don la ni su yang mi sbyor te /
translated: No one is connected to the meaning of the absence of desire.

original: sbyor ba'i don dang mi ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sbyor ba'i don dang mi ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is not the meaning of connection.

original: de dag ni de dang 'bral ba nyid du 'dod do zhes bya bas ni de ston te /
analyzed: de dag ni de dang 'bral ba nyid du 'dod do zhes bya bas ni de ston te /
translated: ‚ÄúThey are said to desire freedom from them‚Äù shows that.

original: sdug bsngal gyi phung po 'di dag med kyang ci ma rung snyam du sdug bsngal gyi phung po dang bral bar 'dod ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi phung po 'di dag med kyang ci ma rung snyam du sdug bsngal gyi phung po dang bral bar 'dod ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning is that they desire freedom from the mass of suffering, thinking, ‚ÄúHow good it would be if this mass of suffering did not exist!‚Äù

original: gang dag dang 'bral bar 'dod pa de dag la sbyor bar mi rung ste /
analyzed: gang dag dang 'bral bar 'dod pa de dag la sbyor bar mi rung ste /
translated: It is not reasonable to connect those from whom one desires freedom.

original: 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because that is contradictory.

original: bde ba'i tshor ba 'dod chags dang bcas pa yang bsam gtan bzhi pa yan chad gong ma gzugs med pa rnams dang mi mthun pa yin te /
analyzed: bde ba'i tshor ba 'dod chags dang bcas pa yang bsam gtan bzhi pa yan chad gong ma gzugs med pa rnams dang mi mthun pa yin te /
translated: Pleasant feeling accompanied by attachment is disagreeable to those above the fourth meditation, to those in the formless realms.

original: yid 'byung ba'i rgyu yin pas rnam par sun 'byin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yid 'byung ba'i rgyu yin pas rnam par sun 'byin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is the cause of disgust, it is a cause of remorse.

original: de dang ldan pa'i sems can rnams //
analyzed: de dang ldan pa'i sems can rnams //
translated: Beings who possess it

original: zhes bya ba ni bsam gtan bzhi pa thob pa rnams so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni bsam gtan bzhi pa thob pa rnams so //
translated: This refers to those who have attained the fourth meditation.

original: de lta bas na der yang de la de dag sbyor bar mi rigs te med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de lta bas na der yang de la de dag sbyor bar mi rigs te med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Therefore, it is not reasonable to apply those to it, because they do not exist there.

original: 'jigs tshogs la lta ba yang chos 'di la bdag med pa la mos pa dag dang mi mthun pa yin te zhes bya ba ni spang par bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'jigs tshogs la lta ba yang chos 'di la bdag med pa la mos pa dag dang mi mthun pa yin te zhes bya ba ni spang par bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The view of the transitory collection is incompatible with those who are devoted to the selflessness of this teaching, because it is to be abandoned.

original: mos pa smos pa ni bdag med pa mthong ba rnams la de med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mos pa smos pa ni bdag med pa mthong ba rnams la de med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The mention of devotion is because those who have seen selflessness do not have that.

original: de la yang de dag sbyor ba mi rigs so zhes bya ba ni spong bar 'dod pa dang / spong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la yang de dag sbyor ba mi rigs so zhes bya ba ni spong bar 'dod pa dang / spong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not reasonable to apply those to it, because it is to be abandoned and because it is the cause of abandonment.

original: de ltar @201b gzhan gyi lugs rnams la skyon brjod nas de rang gi phyogs la gsal zhing yon tan phul du phyin pa brjod par 'dod nas kun gzhi rnam par shes pa la nang gi bdag gi dngos po khas blangs pa ni zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de ltar @201b gzhan gyi lugs rnams la skyon brjod nas de rang gi phyogs la gsal zhing yon tan phul du phyin pa brjod par 'dod nas kun gzhi rnam par shes pa la nang gi bdag gi dngos po khas blangs pa ni zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Having thus stated the faults of other systems, wishing to state his own position, which is clear and has the highest qualities, he says, ‚ÄúWe accept the internal self-entity to be the foundation consciousness.‚Äù

original: ni zhes bya ba'i sgra ni gzhan gyis smras pa'i khyad par bzlog pa'i don te /
analyzed: ni zhes bya ba'i sgra ni gzhan gyis smras pa'i khyad par bzlog pa'i don te /
translated: The word ‚Äúbut‚Äù has the sense of refuting the distinction spoken of by others.

original: nang du bdag gi dngos por khas blangs pa ni nang gi bdag gi dngos por khas blangs pa'o //
analyzed: nang du bdag gi dngos por khas blangs pa ni nang gi bdag gi dngos por khas blangs pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúAccepting it as one‚Äôs own inner self‚Äù means accepting it as one‚Äôs own inner self.

original: de bas na shin tu sdug bsngal ba sems can dmyal ba la sogs pa'i 'gro ba rnams su skyes pa sdug bsngal gyi phung po rnam par zhig par 'dod pa la gzhol yang kun gzhi rnam par shes pa de la bdag tu chags pa'i zhags pas bcings pa
analyzed: de bas na shin tu sdug bsngal ba sems can dmyal ba la sogs pa'i 'gro ba rnams su skyes pa sdug bsngal gyi phung po rnam par zhig par 'dod pa la gzhol yang kun gzhi rnam par shes pa de la bdag tu chags pa'i zhags pas bcings pa
translated: Therefore, even though one is born in the extremely painful destinies of hell beings, etc., and is intent on destroying the mass of suffering, those who are bound by the fetters of attachment to the self in the store consciousness

original: rnams de rnam par zhig par 'dod par ni nam yang mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: rnams de rnam par zhig par 'dod par ni nam yang mi 'gyur te /
translated: will never desire the destruction of that store consciousness.

original: tshor ba btang snyoms dang mtshungs par ldan pas mi mthun pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshor ba btang snyoms dang mtshungs par ldan pas mi mthun pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is associated with the feeling of indifference, there is no aversion to it.

original: 'di ltar de dag ni rtag tu sdug bsngal ba'i phung po 'di dag med kyang ci ma rung snyam du smon gyi bdag med kyang ci ma rung snyam du ni ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar de dag ni rtag tu sdug bsngal ba'i phung po 'di dag med kyang ci ma rung snyam du smon gyi bdag med kyang ci ma rung snyam du ni ma yin te /
translated: Thus, they always wish, ‚ÄúIf only these aggregates of suffering did not exist!‚Äù but not, ‚ÄúIf only the self did not exist!‚Äù

original: bdag tu lta ba'i gnyen po med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag tu lta ba'i gnyen po med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there is no antidote to the view of self.

original: 'gro ba gzhan la brten pa'i phung po rnams la de dag gi 'dod pa gang yin pa de'ang kun gzhi rnam par shes pa'i dbang gis 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: 'gro ba gzhan la brten pa'i phung po rnams la de dag gi 'dod pa gang yin pa de'ang kun gzhi rnam par shes pa'i dbang gis 'gyur gyi /
translated: Whatever desire there is for the aggregates of other reincarnating beings is due to the power of the store consciousness.

original: yid kyi rnam par shes pa la de ltar bdag tu chags par ni mi rung ste /
analyzed: yid kyi rnam par shes pa la de ltar bdag tu chags par ni mi rung ste /
translated: It is not proper to say that desire is due to the mental consciousness,

original: de ni ngan 'gror sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni ngan 'gror sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because that consciousness is associated with the feeling of pain in the miserable realms.

original: de nyid kyi phyir 'gro ba gzhan du yang de la 'dod par ni mi rung ngo //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir 'gro ba gzhan du yang de la 'dod par ni mi rung ngo //
translated: Therefore, it is not proper to say that desire is for other reincarnating beings.üîΩEven though those who are born in the formless realm, which is beyond the fourth meditation, are not in accord with the pleasure of those who are attached, they are bound by attachment to a self.

original: bsam gtan bzhi pa yan chad gzugs med par skyes pa rnams 'dod chags dang bcas pa'i bde ba dang mi mthun du zin kyang bdag tu chags pas bcings pa ni bdag tu chags pas gzhan gyi dbang gis kun gzhi rnam par shes pa kho na la 'jug gi
