analyzed: bsam gtan bzhi pa yan chad gzugs med par skyes pa rnams 'dod chags dang bcas pa'i bde ba dang mi mthun du zin kyang bdag tu chags pas bcings pa ni bdag tu chags pas gzhan gyi dbang gis kun gzhi rnam par shes pa kho na la 'jug gi
translated: They enter only the store consciousness, which is under the control of attachment to a self,

original: yid kyi rnam par shes pa la ni ma yin te /
analyzed: yid kyi rnam par shes pa la ni ma yin te /
translated: not the mental consciousness.

original: 'di ltar gnyen po ma byung gi bar du kun gzhi rnam par shes pa ni 'gyur ba med par 'jug gi / yid kyi rnam par shes pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar gnyen po ma byung gi bar du kun gzhi rnam par shes pa ni 'gyur ba med par 'jug gi / yid kyi rnam par shes pa ni ma yin te /
translated: Thus, until the antidote arises, the store consciousness proceeds without change, but not the mental consciousness.

original: 'du shes med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / 'du shes med pa dang / 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams su rgyun chad med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'du shes med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / 'du shes med pa dang / 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams su rgyun chad med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the mental consciousness is interrupted in the attainments of non-perception and cessation.

original: yid kyi rnam par shes pa tshor ba med pa ni gnyi ga la yang grub pa med do //üîΩde bzhin du chos 'di pa kun brtags pa'i bdag tu lta ba dang mi mthun du @202a * //
analyzed: yid kyi rnam par shes pa tshor ba med pa ni gnyi ga la yang grub pa med do // de bzhin du chos 'di pa kun brtags pa'i bdag tu lta ba dang mi mthun du @202a * //
translated: The mental consciousness without feeling is not established in either case.

original: zin kyang kun gzhi rnam par shes pa la bdag tu chags pa dang rjes su 'brel ba lhan cig tu skyes pa ni yod pa nyid de /
analyzed: zin kyang kun gzhi rnam par shes pa la bdag tu chags pa dang rjes su 'brel ba lhan cig tu skyes pa ni yod pa nyid de /
translated: In the same way, even though the view of a self is incompatible with the imagined self of this teaching, attachment to a self in the store consciousness is still present, because it is innate and related to that.

original: glo bur du sgra chen po thos nas skrag pa skye ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: glo bur du sgra chen po thos nas skrag pa skye ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because fear arises suddenly when one hears a loud noise.

original: chags pa de phung po dag nyid la ci'i phyir mi 'dod ce na /
analyzed: chags pa de phung po dag nyid la ci'i phyir mi 'dod ce na /
translated: Why is that attachment not accepted as being to the aggregates themselves?

original: 'di ltar de dag la de 'byung ba yang kun gzhi rnam par shes pa nyid las 'byung ngo //
analyzed: 'di ltar de dag la de 'byung ba yang kun gzhi rnam par shes pa nyid las 'byung ngo //
translated: Thus, the arising of these from that is the arising of the store consciousness.

original: phung po bzhi po de dmigs pa dang rnam par yongs su chad pa dag ni 'du shes med pa dang / 'du shes med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa la brten pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phung po bzhi po de dmigs pa dang rnam par yongs su chad pa dag ni 'du shes med pa dang / 'du shes med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa la brten pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The four aggregates are not included in the formless realm because they are not included in the meditative development of the perception-sphere of infinite space, etc.

original: gal te de ltar na dgra bcom pa la yang 'byung ngo zhe na /
analyzed: gal te de ltar na dgra bcom pa la yang 'byung ngo zhe na /
translated: If this is so, then it also occurs in the arhat.

original: bdag tu lta ba dang mi mthun du zin kyang zhes brjod kyi /
analyzed: bdag tu lta ba dang mi mthun du zin kyang zhes brjod kyi /
translated: Although it is not in accord with the view of self,

original: de spangs su zin kyang zhes brjod pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de spangs su zin kyang zhes brjod pa ni ma yin te /
translated: it is not said that it is abandoned.

original: dgra bcom pas ni de spangs pas nyes pa med do //
analyzed: dgra bcom pas ni de spangs pas nyes pa med do //
translated: There is no fault in this because the arhat has abandoned it.

original: yang na dgra bcom pa la ni de log pas kun gzhi rnam par shes pa la de chags pa med do //
analyzed: yang na dgra bcom pa la ni de log pas kun gzhi rnam par shes pa la de chags pa med do //
translated: Or else, it does not exist in the store consciousness of the arhat because it has been eliminated.

original: de lta bas na kun gzhi rnam par shes pa kun gzhi nyid du ches legs par rnam par gzhag pa grub po zhes bya ba ni gtan la phab nas mjug sdud pa'o //
analyzed: de lta bas na kun gzhi rnam par shes pa kun gzhi nyid du ches legs par rnam par gzhag pa grub po zhes bya ba ni gtan la phab nas mjug sdud pa'o //
translated: Thus, the establishment of the store consciousness as the store itself is well established. This is the conclusion.

original: chos legs par zhes bya ba ni nyes pa med pa dang yon tan phul du byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos legs par zhes bya ba ni nyes pa med pa dang yon tan phul du byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: ‚ÄúThe Dharma is excellent‚Äù means that it is without fault and has the highest virtues.

original: de ltar rnam grangs rnam par bzhag nas ming tsam gyis rang bzhin yongs su rtogs pa'i phyir mtshan nyid rnam par 'jog ste /
analyzed: de ltar rnam grangs rnam par bzhag nas ming tsam gyis rang bzhin yongs su rtogs pa'i phyir mtshan nyid rnam par 'jog ste /
translated: Having thus presented the synonyms, the characteristics are presented in order to fully understand the nature through mere names.

original: rang dang 'brel pa can gyi mtshan nyid kyis rtogs par byed do //
analyzed: rang dang 'brel pa can gyi mtshan nyid kyis rtogs par byed do //
translated: It is understood through the characteristic of being related to itself.

original: de ni mdor bsdu na rnam pa gsum ste zhes bya ba ni rgyu dang 'bras bu tha dad pa'i phyir 'brel pa can gyi mtshan nyid phye bas so //
analyzed: de ni mdor bsdu na rnam pa gsum ste zhes bya ba ni rgyu dang 'bras bu tha dad pa'i phyir 'brel pa can gyi mtshan nyid phye bas so //
translated: That is summarized as threefold, because the characteristic of being related is distinguished due to the difference between cause and effect.

original: rang gi mtshan nyid kyi dbang du byas te /
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid kyi dbang du byas te /
translated: From the perspective of its own characteristic,

original: gang kun nas nyon mongs pa'i chos thams cad kyi bag chags la brten nas sa bon yongs su 'dzin pa dang ldan pas de skye ba'i rgyu mtshan nyid do zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: gang kun nas nyon mongs pa'i chos thams cad kyi bag chags la brten nas sa bon yongs su 'dzin pa dang ldan pas de skye ba'i rgyu mtshan nyid do zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: it is said that it is the cause for the arising of all defiled phenomena, because it possesses the complete retention of the seeds based on the habitual tendencies.

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa kun nas nyon mongs pa'i chos thams cad dang lhan cig 'byung ba dang / 'gag pa yang dang yang myong nas skye bar 'dod pa de dag gi skye ba la rgyu'i dngos po yin no //
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa kun nas nyon mongs pa'i chos thams cad dang lhan cig 'byung ba dang / 'gag pa yang dang yang myong nas skye bar 'dod pa de dag gi skye ba la rgyu'i dngos po yin no //
translated: The cause of the arising of those who assert that all dharmas that are defiled by passion, etc., arise and cease together with the experience of arising and cessation again and again is the possession of the seed.

original: sa bon yongs su 'dzin pa dang ldan pas zhes bya ba ni sa bon yongs su 'dzin pa dang ldan pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: sa bon yongs su 'dzin pa dang ldan pas zhes bya ba ni sa bon yongs su 'dzin pa dang ldan pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The possession of the seed is the possession of the seed.

original: de la sa bon yongs su 'dzin pa dang ldan pa 'di ni gang skye ba can rnams dang lhan cig byung @202b ba dang 'gag pa myong ba ste /
analyzed: de la sa bon yongs su 'dzin pa dang ldan pa 'di ni gang skye ba can rnams dang lhan cig byung @202b ba dang 'gag pa myong ba ste /
translated: The possession of the seed is the experience of arising and cessation together with those that have arising.

original: de lta bur gyur pa ni bag chags zhes bya ba sa bon yongs su 'dzin par rung ngo //
analyzed: de lta bur gyur pa ni bag chags zhes bya ba sa bon yongs su 'dzin par rung ngo //
translated: That which is of this kind is suitable to be called a latent impression, or the possession of the seed.

original: de dang ldan pa'i phyir yang de dag gi rgyur 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dang ldan pa'i phyir yang de dag gi rgyur 'gyur ro //
translated: Because of the possession of that, it is also the cause of those.

original: gtso bo la sogs pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: gtso bo la sogs pa ni ma yin te /
translated: But it is not the primal nature, etc.,

original: ji skad du bshad pa'i sa bon yongs su 'dzin pa dang mi ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ji skad du bshad pa'i sa bon yongs su 'dzin pa dang mi ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it does not possess the possession of the seed as explained.

original: de ma thag pa la sogs pa'i rkyen rnams kyang ma yin te /üîΩde dag ni phan 'dogs pa yin gyi rgyu ma yin te /
analyzed: de ma thag pa la sogs pa'i rkyen rnams kyang ma yin te / de dag ni phan 'dogs pa yin gyi rgyu ma yin te /
translated: Nor are they conditions such as the immediately preceding condition, etc.üîΩbecause these are helpful, but not causes.

original: gtso bo'i rgyu'i sa bon yongs su 'dzin pa dang mi ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gtso bo'i rgyu'i sa bon yongs su 'dzin pa dang mi ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: They do not possess the seed of the primary cause.

original: gtso bo'i rgyu ni sa bon te /
analyzed: gtso bo'i rgyu ni sa bon te /
translated: The primary cause is the seed.

original: de yongs su 'dzin par byed pas kun gzhi rnam par shes pa ni rgyu mtshan yin gyi ;
analyzed: de yongs su 'dzin par byed pas kun gzhi rnam par shes pa ni rgyu mtshan yin gyi ;
translated: The alaya consciousness is the causal condition because it holds the seed.

original: phan 'dogs par byed pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: phan 'dogs par byed pa ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not the helpful condition.

original: rgyu'i mtshan nyid smos pas de skye ba'i rgyu mtshan nyid 'brel ba can gyi mtshan nyid ma yin nam zhe na ma yin te /
analyzed: rgyu'i mtshan nyid smos pas de skye ba'i rgyu mtshan nyid 'brel ba can gyi mtshan nyid ma yin nam zhe na ma yin te /
translated: If you say that the characteristic of cause is mentioned, and that it is the related characteristic of the condition as cause, that is not so.

original: dngos po'i rkyen gyis byed pa'i nus pa ma byung ba rgyu mtshan tsam du brjod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dngos po'i rkyen gyis byed pa'i nus pa ma byung ba rgyu mtshan tsam du brjod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the power of the condition of a thing that has not yet arisen is merely called a condition.

original: rgyu nyid ni byed pa'i nus pa nyid byung ba yin gyi /
analyzed: rgyu nyid ni byed pa'i nus pa nyid byung ba yin gyi /
translated: The characteristic of cause is the arising of the power of action.

original: rgyu mtshan tsam nyid ni ma yin te /
analyzed: rgyu mtshan tsam nyid ni ma yin te /
translated: It is not merely a condition.

original: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa sa bon thams cad pa de kun nas nyon mongs pa'i chos de dag nyid kyi rgyu nyid du dus thams cad du nye bar gnas pa yin no zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa sa bon thams cad pa de kun nas nyon mongs pa'i chos de dag nyid kyi rgyu nyid du dus thams cad du nye bar gnas pa yin no zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: That all-seeds consciousness-store is the cause of those very defiled dharmas, and it always abides.

original: 'bras bu nyid kyi mtshan nyid ni de nyid kyi las kyi nus pa nyid du byung ba ste /
analyzed: 'bras bu nyid kyi mtshan nyid ni de nyid kyi las kyi nus pa nyid du byung ba ste /
translated: The characteristic of result is that it arises from the power of karma.

original: gang 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pas bsdus pa'i 'dod chags la sogs pa kun nas nyon mongs pa'i chos kun du 'byung ba de dag gis bag chags skyed par byed pa de ni kun gzhi rnam par shes pa 'bras bu'i mtshan nyid de /
analyzed: gang 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pas bsdus pa'i 'dod chags la sogs pa kun nas nyon mongs pa'i chos kun du 'byung ba de dag gis bag chags skyed par byed pa de ni kun gzhi rnam par shes pa 'bras bu'i mtshan nyid de /
translated: The alaya consciousness is the result of the power of karma, because the arising of the defiled dharmas such as attachment, which are included in the active consciousnesses, generates the perfuming that is the alaya consciousness.

original: phan tshun rgyu dang 'bras bur byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phan tshun rgyu dang 'bras bur byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they are mutually cause and result.

original: 'og nas kyang /
analyzed: 'og nas kyang /
translated: And later it says:

original: chos rnams brjod pa'i bag chags las //üîΩbyung ste de dag nyid las de //
analyzed: chos rnams brjod pa'i bag chags las // byung ste de dag nyid las de //
translated: From the perfuming of the expression of dharmasüîΩarises that which is expressed, and from that, perfuming.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'byung ngo //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'byung ngo //
translated: And so on.üîΩThe characteristic of the cause is that it is the seed of the active consciousnesses.

original: bag chags zhes bya ba 'di ci zhig ces bya ba ni bag chags kyi rang bzhin gtan la dbab pa'i phyir 'dri bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: bag chags zhes bya ba 'di ci zhig ces bya ba ni bag chags kyi rang bzhin gtan la dbab pa'i phyir 'dri bar byed pa'o //
translated: The question is asked in order to determine the nature of the residual impression.üîΩThe reason for its arising is said to be the simultaneous arising and cessation of those entities.

original: chos de dag lhan cig 'byung ba dang 'gags pa la brten nas de 'byung ba'i rgyu mtshan nyid gang yin pa de ni brjod par bya ba ste zhes bya ba ni bag chags sgo bar byed pa de dag dang lhan cig dus gcig tu skye ba dang 'gag
analyzed: chos de dag lhan cig 'byung ba dang 'gags pa la brten nas de 'byung ba'i rgyu mtshan nyid gang yin pa de ni brjod par bya ba ste zhes bya ba ni bag chags sgo bar byed pa de dag dang lhan cig dus gcig tu skye ba dang 'gag
translated: The reason for its arising is said to be the simultaneous arising and cessation of those entities that are the basis for the imprints.

original: pa yun ring du rnyed nas bag chags sgo bar byed pa de dag nye bar ma gyur kyang skye bar 'gyur ba'i rgyu mtshan nyid ni @203a * //üîΩbag chags bsgo bar bya ba yin te /
analyzed: pa yun ring du rnyed nas bag chags sgo bar byed pa de dag nye bar ma gyur kyang skye bar 'gyur ba'i rgyu mtshan nyid ni @203a * // bag chags bsgo bar bya ba yin te /
translated: Even when those entities that are the basis for the imprints are not present, the residual impression that is produced by them arises for a long time.üîΩThe reason for its arising is said to be the simultaneous arising and cessation of those entities that are the basis for the imprints.

original: nyid ces bya ba ni bag chags bsgo bar bya ba dang sgo bar byed pa las bag chags logs shig tu phyung ba lta bur dngos po'i rkyen gyis ston to //
analyzed: nyid ces bya ba ni bag chags bsgo bar bya ba dang sgo bar byed pa las bag chags logs shig tu phyung ba lta bur dngos po'i rkyen gyis ston to //
translated: The word ‚Äúitself‚Äù indicates that the residual impression is a condition that is a real entity, not something that is separate from the entity that is the basis for the imprints and the imprints themselves.

original: dper na til dag la me tog gis bsgos na til dang me tog lhan cig 'byung zhing 'gags kyang til rnams de'i dri gzhan 'byung ba'i rgyu mtshan nyid du 'byung ba zhes bya ba ni grags pa'i dpe dper brjod pa'o //
analyzed: dper na til dag la me tog gis bsgos na til dang me tog lhan cig 'byung zhing 'gags kyang til rnams de'i dri gzhan 'byung ba'i rgyu mtshan nyid du 'byung ba zhes bya ba ni grags pa'i dpe dper brjod pa'o //
translated: For example, when sesame seeds are perfumed by flowers, the sesame seeds and flowers arise and cease together, but the sesame seeds are the cause of the arising of the fragrance of the flowers. This is a well-known example.üîΩFor example, sesame seeds are obtained after a long time of arising and ceasing together with jasmine flowers, etc., and even after the flowers are removed, they are the cause of the arising of their fragrance.

original: dper na til rnams sna ma'i me tog la sogs pa dang lhan cig tu yun ring du skye ba dang 'gag pa rnyed par gyur nas me tog bsal kyang de'i dri 'byung ba'i rgyu mtshan nyid yin pa dang / dper na 'dod chags la sogs pa la spyod pa rnams kyi 'dod chags la sogs pa'i bag chags lhan cig 'byung ba rnams dang 'gag pa'i rgyu las byung ba rnams dang /
analyzed: dper na til rnams sna ma'i me tog la sogs pa dang lhan cig tu yun ring du skye ba dang 'gag pa rnyed par gyur nas me tog bsal kyang de'i dri 'byung ba'i rgyu mtshan nyid yin pa dang / dper na 'dod chags la sogs pa la spyod pa rnams kyi 'dod chags la sogs pa'i bag chags lhan cig 'byung ba rnams dang 'gag pa'i rgyu las byung ba rnams dang /
translated: And for example, the latent tendencies of desire, etc., arise from the cause of the arising and ceasing together with the practice of desire, etc.,

original: mang du thos pa rnams kyi mang du thos pa'i bag chags kyang thos pa dang lhan cig 'byung ba dang 'gag pa las 'byung ste /
analyzed: mang du thos pa rnams kyi mang du thos pa'i bag chags kyang thos pa dang lhan cig 'byung ba dang 'gag pa las 'byung ste /
translated: and the latent tendencies of much learning arise from the cause of learning together with much learning.

original: des chos 'dzin pa'i blo dang sgra dag byas pa ltar kun gzhi rnam par shes pa la yang tshul de bzhin du blta bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: des chos 'dzin pa'i blo dang sgra dag byas pa ltar kun gzhi rnam par shes pa la yang tshul de bzhin du blta bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Just as the mind that apprehends a sound and the sound itself are so, the foundation consciousness and the seeds should be viewed in the same way.

original: gzhan la grags pa la ltos nas kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa nyid kyis kun gzhi rnam par shes pa nyid ston to //
analyzed: gzhan la grags pa la ltos nas kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa nyid kyis kun gzhi rnam par shes pa nyid ston to //
translated: This shows that the foundation consciousness itself is the foundation consciousness in dependence on what is renowned to others.

original: dper brjod pa mang po 'jig rten dang bstan bcos la ltos pa dang / phyi dang nang tha dad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dper brjod pa mang po 'jig rten dang bstan bcos la ltos pa dang / phyi dang nang tha dad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Many examples are given in dependence on the world and treatises, because the internal and external are different.

original: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa dang sa bon de dag gi rdzas de dag tha dad dam /üîΩ'on te tha dad pa med par gnas zhes bya ba ni nyis 'geg  tu gzhug par rtogs pa snying la bzhag ste /
analyzed: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa dang sa bon de dag gi rdzas de dag tha dad dam / 'on te tha dad pa med par gnas zhes bya ba ni nyis 'geg  tu gzhug par rtogs pa snying la bzhag ste /
translated: Are the foundation consciousness and those seeds different substantial entities or are they not different?üîΩThis is a question that should be understood to be a double bind,

original: gnyi ga la skyon gdags par 'dod nas dri ba'o //
analyzed: gnyi ga la skyon gdags par 'dod nas dri ba'o //
translated: because it is asked with the desire to impute faults to both alternatives.

original: gal te so so na ni des na dge ba dang / mi dge ba dang / lung dum bstan pa bag chags sgo bar byed pa'i chos de dag ji lta ba de bzhin du de dag gi bag chags kyang tha dad pa'i phyogs su 'gyur ba'i skyon du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te so so na ni des na dge ba dang / mi dge ba dang / lung dum bstan pa bag chags sgo bar byed pa'i chos de dag ji lta ba de bzhin du de dag gi bag chags kyang tha dad pa'i phyogs su 'gyur ba'i skyon du 'gyur ro //
translated: If they are different, then just as those phenomena that are virtuous, nonvirtuous, and neutral are the seeds of the latent afflictions, in the same way, the latent afflictions would also be different.

original: ji ste tha dad pa ma yin na ni de dag tha dad pa ma yin pa de nyid mi 'thad de /
analyzed: ji ste tha dad pa ma yin na ni de dag tha dad pa ma yin pa de nyid mi 'thad de /
translated: If they are not different, then their nondifference is untenable,

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu tha dad pa'i phyir ro //üîΩde dag dang rdzas su na tha dad pa yang ma yin tha mi dad pa yang ma yin mod kyi zhes bya ba ni tha dad pa dang tha dad pa ma yin pa las yang dag par 'das pa'i tshul gyis kun gzhi rnam par shes pa la bag
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu tha dad pa'i phyir ro // de dag dang rdzas su na tha dad pa yang ma yin tha mi dad pa yang ma yin mod kyi zhes bya ba ni tha dad pa dang tha dad pa ma yin pa las yang dag par 'das pa'i tshul gyis kun gzhi rnam par shes pa la bag
translated: because cause and effect are different.üîΩAlthough they are neither different nor the same in substance,

original: chags rnams gnas @203b par brjod de /
analyzed: chags rnams gnas @203b par brjod de /
translated: the latent afflictions are said to exist in the store consciousness in the manner of a nondifference that transcends difference and nondifference.

original: nus pa'i khyad par gyi rang bzhin gyi phyir ro //
analyzed: nus pa'i khyad par gyi rang bzhin gyi phyir ro //
translated: Because they are a special capacity.

original: bag chags zhes bya ba ni nus pa'i khyad par te /
analyzed: bag chags zhes bya ba ni nus pa'i khyad par te /
translated: The term ‚Äúlatent afflictions‚Äù refers to a special capacity.

original: nus pa yang nus pa can dang de nyid dam gzhan zhes brjod par bya ba ma yin no //
analyzed: nus pa yang nus pa can dang de nyid dam gzhan zhes brjod par bya ba ma yin no //
translated: and the potency is not to be described as either the same as or different from that which possesses the potency.

original: de dag dang phan tshun tha dad dam tha dad pa ma yin zhes 'dri ba ni tshul bzhin ma yin pa ste ;
analyzed: de dag dang phan tshun tha dad dam tha dad pa ma yin zhes 'dri ba ni tshul bzhin ma yin pa ste ;
translated: To ask whether they are mutually different or not different is not proper,

original: nus pa can rgyur byas nas btags pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nus pa can rgyur byas nas btags pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the potency is designated as dependent on the possessor of the potency.

original: mdo sde pa'i ltar na don gyi rnam par 'dzin pa'i blo 'byung ba dang / rnam par rnams phan tshun tha dad pa dang tha dad pa ma yin par bsam pa'i skabs mi rnyed de /
analyzed: mdo sde pa'i ltar na don gyi rnam par 'dzin pa'i blo 'byung ba dang / rnam par rnams phan tshun tha dad pa dang tha dad pa ma yin par bsam pa'i skabs mi rnyed de /
translated: According to the Sautrantikas, the cognition that apprehends the aspects of the object and the aspects themselves do not provide an occasion for thinking that they are either different or not different,

original: de gnyi ga yang nyes par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de gnyi ga yang nyes par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because both of those are faulty.

original: ji lta zhe na shing rnams zhes bya ba'i blo de ni gcig yin la rnam pa ni mang ste /
analyzed: ji lta zhe na shing rnams zhes bya ba'i blo de ni gcig yin la rnam pa ni mang ste /
translated: How so? The cognition called ‚Äútrees‚Äù is one, but the aspects are many.

original: rnam par rnams re zhig gcig pa nyid ni ma yin te /
analyzed: rnam par rnams re zhig gcig pa nyid ni ma yin te /
translated: The aspects are not, first, identical,

original: mang po nyid du rang rang gis rig pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mang po nyid du rang rang gis rig pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are individually cognized as many.

original: du ma nyid kyang ma yin te /
analyzed: du ma nyid kyang ma yin te /
translated: Nor are they many,üîΩbecause they are not cognized as separate.

original: cig car shes ba du ma mi 'byung ba dang / rnam par shes pa'i de kho na gcig las mi 'da' ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: cig car shes ba du ma mi 'byung ba dang / rnam par shes pa'i de kho na gcig las mi 'da' ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because many simultaneous cognitions do not occur, and because the reality of consciousness does not exceed one.

original: de bzhin du kun gzhi rnam par shes pa la gnas pa'i bag chags rnams kyang tha dad pa dang / tha dad pa ma yin pa las yang dag par 'das par khong du chud par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du kun gzhi rnam par shes pa la gnas pa'i bag chags rnams kyang tha dad pa dang / tha dad pa ma yin pa las yang dag par 'das par khong du chud par bya'o //
translated: In the same way, one should understand that the residual impressions that are in the store consciousness are beyond being different or not different.

original: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa dang kun nas nyon mongs pa'i chos de dang dus mnyam du gcig gi rgyu nyid du gcig 'gyur bas ji ltar lta zhe na zhes bya ba ni gcig la gcig rgyu dang ldan par mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa dang kun nas nyon mongs pa'i chos de dang dus mnyam du gcig gi rgyu nyid du gcig 'gyur bas ji ltar lta zhe na zhes bya ba ni gcig la gcig rgyu dang ldan par mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: How can the store consciousness and those dharmas that are the results of affliction be the causes of each other, since they occur simultaneously?

original: dper na mar me 'bar ba zhes bya ba ni rigs pas shes par byed do //
analyzed: dper na mar me 'bar ba zhes bya ba ni rigs pas shes par byed do //
translated: The example of the burning lamp is understood through reasoning.

original: shing tshig na me lce 'byung ste de'i yan lag tshig pa med par med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shing tshig na me lce 'byung ste de'i yan lag tshig pa med par med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: When the wood is burning, the flame occurs, and it does not occur without the burning wood.

original: des na ji ltar snying po tshig pa dang me lce 'byung ba dus gcig pa lta bu ste dus tha dad pa med pa'i phyir ro //üîΩgal te sngar tshig la phyis me lce 'byung na ni rgyu med pa las 'byung ba'i tshig pa de lta bu me lce yang gang las 'byung bar 'gyur /
analyzed: des na ji ltar snying po tshig pa dang me lce 'byung ba dus gcig pa lta bu ste dus tha dad pa med pa'i phyir ro // gal te sngar tshig la phyis me lce 'byung na ni rgyu med pa las 'byung ba'i tshig pa de lta bu me lce yang gang las 'byung bar 'gyur /
translated: Therefore, just as the burning of the wick and the arising of the flame are simultaneous, they are not different in time.üîΩIf the burning of the wick were prior and the flame arose later, then the burning of the wick would arise without a cause.

original: ji ste sngar me lce 'byung ba phyis tshig na rgyu med pa las byung ba'i me lce ji lta bu tshig pa yang ji lta bu ste gnyi ga med par 'gyur ro //üîΩde lta bas na ji ltar mar me'i me lce 'byung ba dang / snying po tshig pa dag dus gcig pa de bzhin du kun gzhi rnam par shes pa dang 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa yang dus gcig kho nar phan tshun gcig @204a * //
analyzed: ji ste sngar me lce 'byung ba phyis tshig na rgyu med pa las byung ba'i me lce ji lta bu tshig pa yang ji lta bu ste gnyi ga med par 'gyur ro // de lta bas na ji ltar mar me'i me lce 'byung ba dang / snying po tshig pa dag dus gcig pa de bzhin du kun gzhi rnam par shes pa dang 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa yang dus gcig kho nar phan tshun gcig @204a * //
translated: If the flame arose prior and the burning of the wick later, then the flame would arise without a cause and how could the burning of the wick be? Both would be nonexistent.

original: la gcig rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos por 'gyur ro //
analyzed: la gcig rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos por 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, just as the arising of the flame of a lamp and the burning of the wick are simultaneous, so too the foundation consciousness and the active consciousnesses are simultaneous, and they are mutually cause and effect.

original: mdung khyim gcig la gcig brten pa yang de bzhin no //
analyzed: mdung khyim gcig la gcig brten pa yang de bzhin no //
translated: They are like a pair of sheaves of reeds supporting each other.

original: de ltar rgyu'i rkyen du rnam par gzhag sde zhes bya ba ni sa bon yongs su 'dzin pa dang ldan pa ji skad bshad pa ltar de gzhan du ma yin no ;
analyzed: de ltar rgyu'i rkyen du rnam par gzhag sde zhes bya ba ni sa bon yongs su 'dzin pa dang ldan pa ji skad bshad pa ltar de gzhan du ma yin no ;
translated: Thus, it is established as the causal condition.

original: / rgyu'i rkyen gzhan mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni 'di skad du bstan par 'gyur te /
analyzed: / rgyu'i rkyen gzhan mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni 'di skad du bstan par 'gyur te /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúbecause another causal condition is not perceived‚Äù means that it is taught as follows:

original: gang dag gis rgyu lnga ni rgyu'i rkyen to zhes smra ba de dag kyang rnam grangs kyis kun gzhi rnam par shes pa nyid du smra'o //
analyzed: gang dag gis rgyu lnga ni rgyu'i rkyen to zhes smra ba de dag kyang rnam grangs kyis kun gzhi rnam par shes pa nyid du smra'o //
translated: Those who say that the five causes are the causal condition also say that the storehouse consciousness is a synonym for the causal condition.

original: bag chags bskyed pa med par ni skal ba mnyam pa dang / kun du 'gro ba dang rnam par smin pa'i rgyu 'das pa rnams rgyu nyid du mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bag chags bskyed pa med par ni skal ba mnyam pa dang / kun du 'gro ba dang rnam par smin pa'i rgyu 'das pa rnams rgyu nyid du mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because without the generation of the latent impressions, the homogeneous cause, the pervasive cause, and the ripening cause, which are past, would not be tenable as causes.

original: bag chags rnams kyang kun gzhi rnam par shes pa las gzhan na med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bag chags rnams kyang kun gzhi rnam par shes pa las gzhan na med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: And the latent impressions do not exist apart from the storehouse consciousness.

original: 'dron  po'i dpes ni mtshungs par ldan pa'i rgyu la yang sems dang sems las byung ba phan tshun ltos nas yul la spyod pa rnams kyi rang gi nus pa yod do //
analyzed: 'dron  po'i dpes ni mtshungs par ldan pa'i rgyu la yang sems dang sems las byung ba phan tshun ltos nas yul la spyod pa rnams kyi rang gi nus pa yod do //
translated: The example of travelers shows that the cause of association is the power of mind and mental functions to engage objects in mutual dependence.

original: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa la brten pa'i sa bon med par ni nus pa mi 'thad do //
analyzed: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa la brten pa'i sa bon med par ni nus pa mi 'thad do //
translated: Without the seeds in the store consciousness, power is impossible.

original: lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu nyid ni btags pa pa ste /
analyzed: lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu nyid ni btags pa pa ste /
translated: The cause of simultaneous arising is a nominal cause,

original: dus gcig tu 'byung ba rnams la rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dus gcig tu 'byung ba rnams la rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because the relation of cause and effect is impossible for things that arise at the same time.

original: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa phyi dang nang gi sa bon thams cad pa yin pa'i yang phyir te /
analyzed: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa phyi dang nang gi sa bon thams cad pa yin pa'i yang phyir te /
translated: Also, because the store consciousness is the universal seed,

original: de la ma gtogs par rgyu'i rkyen gzhan mi dmigs so //
analyzed: de la ma gtogs par rgyu'i rkyen gzhan mi dmigs so //
translated: because apart from it, no other cause for the universal seed can be found.

original: bag chags tha dad pa ma yin zhig sna tshogs ma yin pa chos tha dad pa sna tshogs dag gi rgyur ji ltar rung zhe na zhes bya ba ni rigs pa med par rgol ba'o //
analyzed: bag chags tha dad pa ma yin zhig sna tshogs ma yin pa chos tha dad pa sna tshogs dag gi rgyur ji ltar rung zhe na zhes bya ba ni rigs pa med par rgol ba'o //
translated: How can a nondifferentiated, nondiverse residual impression be the cause of diverse, differentiated things? This is an objection based on reason.

original: dper na tshi gu'i rtsi sna tshogs kyis bsgyur ba zhes bya ba ni 'thad par smras pa'o //
analyzed: dper na tshi gu'i rtsi sna tshogs kyis bsgyur ba zhes bya ba ni 'thad par smras pa'o //
translated: For example, ‚Äúthe various dyes are the transformation‚Äù is a correct statement.

original: tshi gu'i rtsi ni tshon gyi bye brag ste /
analyzed: tshi gu'i rtsi ni tshon gyi bye brag ste /
translated: The various dyes are a particular type of color.

original: sna tshogs su mi snang ba dag go //
analyzed: sna tshogs su mi snang ba dag go //
translated: They do not appear as various.

original: 'bras bu mngon par 'grub pa nyid tshon gyi snod yin pas 'bras bu mngon par 'grub pa'i tshon gyi snod do //
analyzed: 'bras bu mngon par 'grub pa nyid tshon gyi snod yin pas 'bras bu mngon par 'grub pa'i tshon gyi snod do //
translated: The manifestation of the effect is the container of the dye, so it is the container of the dye of the manifestation of the effect.

original: der bcug pa ni rkyen gyis yongs su zin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: der bcug pa ni rkyen gyis yongs su zin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The cloth is placed in it because it is completely taken hold of by conditions.

original: ras lta bu ni kun gzhi rnam par shes pa ste /
analyzed: ras lta bu ni kun gzhi rnam par shes pa ste /
translated: The cloth is the fundamental consciousness,

original: tshon lta bu'i chos sna tshogs kun du ston pa'i phyir ro //üîΩtheg pa chen po la phra ba zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten pa rnams kyis shes par dka' ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshon lta bu'i chos sna tshogs kun du ston pa'i phyir ro // theg pa chen po la phra ba zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten pa rnams kyis shes par dka' ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it manifests the various dharmas which are like the dye.üîΩThe Mahayana is called ‚Äúsubtle‚Äù because it is difficult for the worldly to understand.

original: mchog tu zab pa zhes bya ba ni @204b nyan thos la sogs pas gting dpag dka' ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mchog tu zab pa zhes bya ba ni @204b nyan thos la sogs pas gting dpag dka' ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It is called ‚Äúextremely profound‚Äù because it is difficult for the Sravakas, etc., to fathom.

original: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba zhes bya ba ni rgyu las rgyu dang ldan pa 'byung zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba zhes bya ba ni rgyu las rgyu dang ldan pa 'byung zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Dependent origination means that an effect arises endowed with a cause.

original: ngo bo nyid rnam par 'byed pa can zhes bya ba la rang gi ngo bo nyid ni ngo bo nyid do //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid rnam par 'byed pa can zhes bya ba la rang gi ngo bo nyid ni ngo bo nyid do //
translated: It is called the ‚Äúdifferentiator‚Äù because it differentiates the intrinsic reality.

original: rnam par 'byed par byed pa ni rnam par 'byed pa'o //üîΩrnam par 'byed par nus pa'am /
analyzed: rnam par 'byed par byed pa ni rnam par 'byed pa'o // rnam par 'byed par nus pa'am /
translated: Differentiation is the act of differentiating.üîΩIt is the differentiator because it is able to differentiate,

original: rnam par 'byed par dgos pa ni rnam par 'byed pa can te /
analyzed: rnam par 'byed par dgos pa ni rnam par 'byed pa can te /
translated: or because it is the purpose of differentiation.

original: kun gzhi rnam par shes pas kun nas nyon mongs pa'i chos kyi rang bzhin skye ba can thams cad rnam par 'byed par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: kun gzhi rnam par shes pas kun nas nyon mongs pa'i chos kyi rang bzhin skye ba can thams cad rnam par 'byed par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is the differentiator because the store consciousness differentiates all phenomena that are born with the nature of affliction.

original: sdug pa dang mi sdug pa rnam par 'byed pa can zhes bya ba ni bde 'gro dang ngan 'gro dang / 'dod pa dang / mi 'dod pa'i lus sna tshogs 'grub pa la gtso bo'i rkyen gyis rab tu phye ba'i ma rig pa la sogs pa'i yan lag bcu gnyis dang /
analyzed: sdug pa dang mi sdug pa rnam par 'byed pa can zhes bya ba ni bde 'gro dang ngan 'gro dang / 'dod pa dang / mi 'dod pa'i lus sna tshogs 'grub pa la gtso bo'i rkyen gyis rab tu phye ba'i ma rig pa la sogs pa'i yan lag bcu gnyis dang /
translated: The ‚Äúdiscriminating‚Äù is the discrimination of the pleasant and unpleasant, which is the discrimination of the principal condition for the establishment of the various bodies of good and bad destinies, of the desired and undesired, and of the twelve members of dependent origination beginning with ignorance.

original: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa las 'du byed la sogs pa 'byung ba na ma rig pa la sogs pa'i dbang gis bsod nams dang / bsod nams ma yin pa dang / mi g-yo ba tha dad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa las 'du byed la sogs pa 'byung ba na ma rig pa la sogs pa'i dbang gis bsod nams dang / bsod nams ma yin pa dang / mi g-yo ba tha dad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: When the formations, etc., arise from the store consciousness, they are distinguished as meritorious, nonmeritorious, and unshakable because of the power of ignorance, etc.

original: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba 'di nyid la rmongs pa dag kha cig ni sngon byas pa'i rgyu las byung ba nyid rtog ces bya ba ni skyes bu'i byed pa la skur pa'i phyir ro ;
analyzed: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba 'di nyid la rmongs pa dag kha cig ni sngon byas pa'i rgyu las byung ba nyid rtog ces bya ba ni skyes bu'i byed pa la skur pa'i phyir ro ;
translated: Some, confused about this very dependent origination, imagine that it arises from a previously created cause. This is because they deny the activity of a person.

original: / de dag ni ma rig pas ldongs pas dmus long dper byas so //
analyzed: / de dag ni ma rig pas ldongs pas dmus long dper byas so //
translated: They are like the blind because they are blinded by ignorance.

original: sna la reg ces bya ba ni sna la reg ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: sna la reg ces bya ba ni sna la reg ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: ‚ÄúTouching the nose‚Äù means ‚Äútouching the nose‚Äù in the sense of ‚Äútouching the nose.‚Äù

original: mdor bsdu na kun gzhi rnam par shes pa'i ngo bo nyid ni rnam par smin pa'i rnam par shes pa sa bon thams cad pa ste zhes bya ba la mdor bsdu na sngon gyi dge ba dang mi dge ba'i las kyi bag chags dang / gzung ba dang 'dzin par rnam par rtog pa la mngon par zhen pa rnams kyis rnam par smin pa'i bdag nyid sems can gyi rdzas kyi dngos gzhi kun gzhi rnam par shes pa bsgrub pa ni rang gi mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: mdor bsdu na kun gzhi rnam par shes pa'i ngo bo nyid ni rnam par smin pa'i rnam par shes pa sa bon thams cad pa ste zhes bya ba la mdor bsdu na sngon gyi dge ba dang mi dge ba'i las kyi bag chags dang / gzung ba dang 'dzin par rnam par rtog pa la mngon par zhen pa rnams kyis rnam par smin pa'i bdag nyid sems can gyi rdzas kyi dngos gzhi kun gzhi rnam par shes pa bsgrub pa ni rang gi mtshan nyid do //
translated: The essence of the store consciousness is the essence of its own nature.üîΩIt includes all bodies in the three realms and all destinies of sentient beings.

original: des khams gsum pa'i lus thams cad dang / 'gro ba thams cad bsdus so zhes bya ba la 'dod pa dang gzugs dang / gzugs med pa na spyod pa'i lus thams cad dang / sems can gyi rgyud 'gro ba thams cad de /
analyzed: des khams gsum pa'i lus thams cad dang / 'gro ba thams cad bsdus so zhes bya ba la 'dod pa dang gzugs dang / gzugs med pa na spyod pa'i lus thams cad dang / sems can gyi rgyud 'gro ba thams cad de /
translated: It includes all bodies in the realm of desire, the realm of form, and the formless realm, and all the life-streams of sentient beings in all destinies.

original: lha la sogs pa bsdus pa ni 'brel pa can gyi @205a * //üîΩmtshan nyid do //
analyzed: lha la sogs pa bsdus pa ni 'brel pa can gyi @205a * //üîΩmtshan nyid do //
translated: The inclusion of gods, etc., is its related characteristic.

original: ji ltar gzugs dang 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa yul kha cig dang / res 'ga'i dus su rgyun chad pa de ltar kun gzhi rnam par shes pa ni gnyen po ma byung gi bar du ma yin te /
analyzed: ji ltar gzugs dang 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa yul kha cig dang / res 'ga'i dus su rgyun chad pa de ltar kun gzhi rnam par shes pa ni gnyen po ma byung gi bar du ma yin te /
translated: Just as form and the engaging consciousnesses are sometimes interrupted in regard to some objects, the foundation consciousness is not interrupted until the antidote arises.

original: khyab pa'i phyir thams cad 'dzin par byed pa'o //
analyzed: khyab pa'i phyir thams cad 'dzin par byed pa'o //
translated: Because it is pervasive, it holds all seeds.

original: sa bon thams cad pa zhes bya ba ni 'dir sa bon zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sa bon thams cad pa zhes bya ba ni 'dir sa bon zhes bya'o //
translated: The term ‚Äúseeds‚Äù is used here.

original: phyi dang nang dang mi gsal ba //
analyzed: phyi dang nang dang mi gsal ba //
translated: External, internal, and indeterminate.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshigs su bcad pa lngas ni de rab tu dbye ba dang bcas pa ston te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshigs su bcad pa lngas ni de rab tu dbye ba dang bcas pa ston te /
translated: The next five verses present the classification of the foundation consciousness.

original: phyi rol gyi sa bon ni nas la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: phyi rol gyi sa bon ni nas la sogs pa'o //
translated: External seeds are barley, etc.

original: nang gi sa bon ni kun gzhi rnam par shes pa'o //
analyzed: nang gi sa bon ni kun gzhi rnam par shes pa'o //
translated: Internal seeds are the foundation consciousness.

original: mi gsal ba ni lung du ma bstan pa'o //
analyzed: mi gsal ba ni lung du ma bstan pa'o //
translated: Indeterminate seeds are neutral.

original: gnyis ni phyi dang nang gi'o //
analyzed: gnyis ni phyi dang nang gi'o //
translated: The other two are external and internal.

original: yang na 'bras bu dang rgyu ste /
analyzed: yang na 'bras bu dang rgyu ste /
translated: Alternatively, they are effect and cause.

original: de gnyis kyi rgyu mtshan kun gzhi rnam par shes pa yang gnyis so //
analyzed: de gnyis kyi rgyu mtshan kun gzhi rnam par shes pa yang gnyis so //
translated: The foundation consciousness is the sign of both of those.

original: de las rgyu dang gzhi'i dngos pos kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba'i chos 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de las rgyu dang gzhi'i dngos pos kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba'i chos 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the phenomena of defilement and purification arise from that, by means of the cause and the basic reality.

original: gang dag gnyis dag ces 'don pa de dag gi ltar na rgyu dang 'bras bu dag ces bshad do //
analyzed: gang dag gnyis dag ces 'don pa de dag gi ltar na rgyu dang 'bras bu dag ces bshad do //
translated: Those who read ‚Äúthe two‚Äù should explain it as ‚Äúcause and effect.

original: kun rdzob ces bya ba ni phyi rol gyi nas la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: kun rdzob ces bya ba ni phyi rol gyi nas la sogs pa ste /
translated: ‚Äù The conventional is external, such as barley, etc.

original: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa gyur pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa gyur pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is the transformation of the store consciousness.

original: dam pa'i don ces bya ba la don dam pa'i sa bon ni kun gzhi rnam par shes pa ste /
analyzed: dam pa'i don ces bya ba la don dam pa'i sa bon ni kun gzhi rnam par shes pa ste /
translated: The ultimate is the seed of the ultimate, i.e., the store consciousness,

original: sa bon thams cad kyi rkyen yin pa dang de'i bdag nyid yan lag yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sa bon thams cad kyi rkyen yin pa dang de'i bdag nyid yan lag yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is the condition of all seeds and is the part that is their nature.

original: sa bon de gnyis ni chos tha dad pa'i phyir rnam pa drug tu dbye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sa bon de gnyis ni chos tha dad pa'i phyir rnam pa drug tu dbye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: These two seeds are divided into six kinds because of the difference in their natures.

original: skad cig pa zhes bya ba ni byung ma thag tu rnam par 'jig pa'i phyir te bye brag med pa'i phyir sa bon rtag pa med do //
analyzed: skad cig pa zhes bya ba ni byung ma thag tu rnam par 'jig pa'i phyir te bye brag med pa'i phyir sa bon rtag pa med do //
translated: Momentary means that they perish as soon as they arise, because there is no permanent seed without distinction.

original: skad cig pa yang 'gags zin pa ni ma yin te bya shi ba'i skad bzhin du 'gags nas 'bras bu mi rung ba'i phyir lhan cig 'byung ba'i //
analyzed: skad cig pa yang 'gags zin pa ni ma yin te bya shi ba'i skad bzhin du 'gags nas 'bras bu mi rung ba'i phyir lhan cig 'byung ba'i //
translated: Nor is the moment that has already ceased, like the sound of a dead gong, because it is not suitable to be a cause.

original: de lta bas na 'bras bu'i dus dang 'gal ba med pa'i phyir bon ni 'bras bu dang lhan cig gnas par 'dod de autpala'i rtsa ba la sogs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: de lta bas na 'bras bu'i dus dang 'gal ba med pa'i phyir bon ni 'bras bu dang lhan cig gnas par 'dod de autpala'i rtsa ba la sogs pa bzhin no //
translated: Therefore, since it is not contradictory for the seed to exist at the time of the effect, we assert that the seed exists simultaneously with the effect, like the root of an utpala flower and so on.

original: lhan cig 'byung ba yang glog bzhin du skad cig gcig dang gnyis dang gsum du gnas pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: lhan cig 'byung ba yang glog bzhin du skad cig gcig dang gnyis dang gsum du gnas pa ma yin gyi /
translated: Also, the simultaneous arising of the seed and effect is not like lightning, which endures for one, two, or three moments.

original: skad cig gcig nas gcig tu brgyud pas yun ring du rgyun chags su 'byung ba'i phyir rgyun chags @205b su 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: skad cig gcig nas gcig tu brgyud pas yun ring du rgyun chags su 'byung ba'i phyir rgyun chags @205b su 'byung ba'o //
translated: Rather, it is a continuous arising, because it occurs for a long time through a succession of moments.

original: de ci mngon zhe na /
analyzed: de ci mngon zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: rtsa ba la phan pa dang gnod pa ni yal ga la sogs pa la yang phan gnod du 'gyur te de dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rtsa ba la phan pa dang gnod pa ni yal ga la sogs pa la yang phan gnod du 'gyur te de dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because benefit and harm to the root is benefit and harm to the branches and so on, since they possess the root.

original: gal te rgyun chags su 'byung ba na btags pa'i phyogs kyang sa bon du khas blangs pa'i phyir thams cad las thams cad cig car ci'i phyir mi 'byung zhe na lan btab pa /
analyzed: gal te rgyun chags su 'byung ba na btags pa'i phyogs kyang sa bon du khas blangs pa'i phyir thams cad las thams cad cig car ci'i phyir mi 'byung zhe na lan btab pa /
translated: If it is a continuum that arises, then even the position of the designation is accepted as a seed, so why do not all things arise simultaneously from all things?üîΩThe reply:

original: nges pa zhes bya ste nus pa nges pa'i phyir rgyun chags su 'byung du zin kyang thams cad las thams cad cig car mi 'byung ngo //
analyzed: nges pa zhes bya ste nus pa nges pa'i phyir rgyun chags su 'byung du zin kyang thams cad las thams cad cig car mi 'byung ngo //
translated: Because of the certainty of the potentiality, even though it is a continuum that arises, not all things arise simultaneously from all things.

original: de lta na yang dus thams cad du ci'i phyir 'bras bu mi 'byin zhe na lan btab pa /
analyzed: de lta na yang dus thams cad du ci'i phyir 'bras bu mi 'byin zhe na lan btab pa /
translated: Even so, why does the effect not always arise? The reply:

original: rkyen la ltos pa zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: rkyen la ltos pa zhes bya ba ste /
translated: Because of the dependence on conditions.

original: rtag tu rkyen nye bar gnas pa ma yin pa'i phyir nyes pa med do //
analyzed: rtag tu rkyen nye bar gnas pa ma yin pa'i phyir nyes pa med do //
translated: There is no fault, because the conditions do not always remain present.

original: sa bon de'i sa bon gang zhe na /
analyzed: sa bon de'i sa bon gang zhe na /
translated: What is the seed of that seed?

original: de'i phyir rang gi 'bras bus bsgrubs pa'o zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir rang gi 'bras bus bsgrubs pa'o zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Therefore, it is said, ‚ÄúIt is established by its own effect.‚Äù

original: sa bon dang sa bon can thog ma med pa'i phyir de'i 'bras bu gang yin pa de nyid sa bon yin no //
analyzed: sa bon dang sa bon can thog ma med pa'i phyir de'i 'bras bu gang yin pa de nyid sa bon yin no //
translated: Because the seed and the seed-possessor are without beginning, that which is its effect is just the seed.

original: des na ji skad smos pa'i sa bon gyi chos dang mi ldan pa'i phyir gtso bo la sogs pa'i sa bon nyid sel to //
analyzed: des na ji skad smos pa'i sa bon gyi chos dang mi ldan pa'i phyir gtso bo la sogs pa'i sa bon nyid sel to //
translated: Therefore, since the primal substance, etc., do not have the qualities of a seed as described, they are excluded from being seeds.

original: sa bon dang sa bon gyi dngos po ni bag chags bsgo bar bya ba dang sgo bar byed pa'i 'brel pa la ltos pas bsgo bar bya ba dpyod do //
analyzed: sa bon dang sa bon gyi dngos po ni bag chags bsgo bar bya ba dang sgo bar byed pa'i 'brel pa la ltos pas bsgo bar bya ba dpyod do //
translated: The seed and the state of being a seed depend on the relation of being that which is infused and that which infuses.

original: brtan zhes bya ba ni til la sogs pa bzhin du rgyud rgyun chags su 'byung ba ste /
analyzed: brtan zhes bya ba ni til la sogs pa bzhin du rgyud rgyun chags su 'byung ba ste /
translated: The seed is stable, i.e., it occurs in a continuous series, like sesame, etc.

original: rlung bzhin du g-yo ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rlung bzhin du g-yo ba ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not mobile, like the wind.

original: rlung yang me tog la sogs pas bsgo bar bya ba ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: rlung yang me tog la sogs pas bsgo bar bya ba ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: But isn‚Äôt the wind infused with the scent of flowers, etc.?

original: gal te bsgo bar bya ba yin na ni bsgos pa'i til dang 'brel pa can gyi rdzas gzhan gyi dri bzhin du de dang 'brel pa can gyi rdzas kyi dri yang dmigs par 'gyur ro ;
analyzed: gal te bsgo bar bya ba yin na ni bsgos pa'i til dang 'brel pa can gyi rdzas gzhan gyi dri bzhin du de dang 'brel pa can gyi rdzas kyi dri yang dmigs par 'gyur ro ;
translated: If it were infused, then the scent of the substance related to the infused sesame would be perceived, just as the scent of the substance related to the sesame is perceived.

original: / brtan du zin kyang gang lung du ma bstan pa dri mnyam pa de la bsgo bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: / brtan du zin kyang gang lung du ma bstan pa dri mnyam pa de la bsgo bar 'gyur ro //
translated: But even if it is stable, it is infused with the scent of the neutral, i.e., morally undefined, scent.

original: dri zhim po la ni ma yin te /
analyzed: dri zhim po la ni ma yin te /
translated: It is not a pleasant smell,

original: gla rtsi bzhin no //
analyzed: gla rtsi bzhin no //
translated: like sandalwood.

original: dri nga ba la yang ma yin te /
analyzed: dri nga ba la yang ma yin te /
translated: It is not an unpleasant smell,

original: sgog pa bzhin no //
analyzed: sgog pa bzhin no //
translated: like garlic.

original: bsgo bya ba zhes bya ba ni gang bsgo bar nus pa'am bsgo bar bya ba ste /
analyzed: bsgo bya ba zhes bya ba ni gang bsgo bar nus pa'am bsgo bar bya ba ste /
translated: That which is to be ordered is that which can be ordered or is to be ordered.

original: phan tshun gyi cha shes 'dre pa'i phyir de ni bsgo bar bya'o //
analyzed: phan tshun gyi cha shes 'dre pa'i phyir de ni bsgo bar bya'o //
translated: It is to be ordered because the parts of the two are mixed.

original: sngo ba la sogs pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: sngo ba la sogs pa ni ma yin te /
translated: It is not blue, etc.,

original: phan tshun 'dre pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phan tshun 'dre pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there is no mixing of the two.

original: bsgo bar bya ba yang sgo bar byed pa dang 'brel pa gang yin pa de la sgo bar byed de so sor gnas shing 'brel pa med pa la ni ma yin no //
analyzed: bsgo bar bya ba yang sgo bar byed pa dang 'brel pa gang yin pa de la sgo bar byed de so sor gnas shing 'brel pa med pa la ni ma yin no //
translated: That which is to be ordered is ordered in relation to that which orders, but not in relation to that which is not related to the one who orders.

original: de las gzhan ni min zhes bya ba la ni @206a * //
analyzed: de las gzhan ni min zhes bya ba la ni @206a * //
translated: It is not other than that.

original: zhes bya ba'i sgra ni 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa rnams bsgo bar bya ba nyid las bzlog pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i sgra ni 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa rnams bsgo bar bya ba nyid las bzlog pa'i phyir te /
translated: The word ‚Äúnot‚Äù is for the purpose of excluding the engaged consciousnesses,

original: ji skad bshad pa dang mi mthun pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ji skad bshad pa dang mi mthun pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are not in accordance with what has been explained.

original: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa ni gnyen por ma byung gi bar du rgyun chags su 'byung bas rtag pa'o //
analyzed: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa ni gnyen por ma byung gi bar du rgyun chags su 'byung bas rtag pa'o //
translated: The store-consciousness is permanent because it occurs in a continuous series until the antidote arises.

original: gzhan ni res 'ga' rgyun chad pas ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan ni res 'ga' rgyun chad pas ma yin no //
translated: The other consciousnesses are not, because they are sometimes interrupted.

original: de nyid gcig tu lung du ma bstan pa yin gyi gzhan ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de nyid gcig tu lung du ma bstan pa yin gyi gzhan ni ma yin te /
translated: Only that is always indeterminate, not the others,

original: dge ba dang mi dge ba yang yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dge ba dang mi dge ba yang yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are also virtuous or nonvirtuous.

original: de nyid bag chags bsgo bar 'os pa dang bsgo bar nus pa yin te /
analyzed: de nyid bag chags bsgo bar 'os pa dang bsgo bar nus pa yin te /
translated: Only that is capable of being perfumed and can be perfumed,

original: rtag la lung du ma bstan pa dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rtag la lung du ma bstan pa dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is always indeterminate.

original: 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa rnams ni ma yin te /
analyzed: 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa rnams ni ma yin te /
translated: The active forms of consciousness are not,

original: 'di ltar drug po dag la 'brel med de /
analyzed: 'di ltar drug po dag la 'brel med de /
translated: because the six are unrelated.

original: ji lta zhe na /üîΩtha dad gsum dang 'gal ba'i phyir /
analyzed: ji lta zhe na / tha dad gsum dang 'gal ba'i phyir /
translated: How so?

original: zhes bya ba smos pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba smos pa'o //
translated: Because they are different, because of the three, and because of contradiction.

original: gal te 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa drug po dag lhan cig 'byung bar 'gyur na gnas dang / dmigs pa dang ; yid la byed pa gsum sa so so rang gi tha dad par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa drug po dag lhan cig 'byung bar 'gyur na gnas dang / dmigs pa dang ; yid la byed pa gsum sa so so rang gi tha dad par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If the six active forms of consciousness occurred simultaneously, there would be no difference in their three simultaneous supports, objects, and mental activities.

original: gang gi phyir gsum tha dad par 'gal bar med de tha dad pa nyid yin pa de'i phyir drug po dag cig car 'byung ba med do //
analyzed: gang gi phyir gsum tha dad par 'gal bar med de tha dad pa nyid yin pa de'i phyir drug po dag cig car 'byung ba med do //
translated: Because the three are not mutually exclusive, they are different. Therefore, the six do not occur simultaneously.

original: cig car me 'byung na phan tshun 'brel ba med do //
analyzed: cig car me 'byung na phan tshun 'brel ba med do //
translated: If fire were to occur simultaneously, there would be no mutual relationship.

original: 'brel ba med na bsgo bar bya ba dang sgo bar byed pa'i dngos por ga la 'gyur /
analyzed: 'brel ba med na bsgo bar bya ba dang sgo bar byed pa'i dngos por ga la 'gyur /
translated: If there is no relationship, how could there be the state of the one who is enjoined and the one who enjoins?

original: ji ste skad cig snga mas phyi ma la bsgo bar 'dod na yang mi rung ste /
analyzed: ji ste skad cig snga mas phyi ma la bsgo bar 'dod na yang mi rung ste /
translated: If it is asserted that the former moment enjoins the latter, that is also not reasonable.

original: skad cig lhan cig med pa'i phyir de gnyis cig car du med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skad cig lhan cig med pa'i phyir de gnyis cig car du med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the moment does not exist simultaneously, those two do not exist simultaneously.

original: 'brel ba med na bsgo bar bya ba dang sgo bar byed pa med do zhes ston to //
analyzed: 'brel ba med na bsgo bar bya ba dang sgo bar byed pa med do zhes ston to //
translated: It is taught that if there is no relationship, there is no injunction and no enjoiner.

original: ji ste rigs kyi dngos po la brten nas rnam par shes pa drug car yang brjod par 'dod pa bye brag med pas rnam par shes pa rigs gcig go //
analyzed: ji ste rigs kyi dngos po la brten nas rnam par shes pa drug car yang brjod par 'dod pa bye brag med pas rnam par shes pa rigs gcig go //
translated: If it is asserted that the six consciousnesses are of the same type, based on the fact that they are all consciousnesses, without any distinction,

original: de'i phyir rnam par shes pa 'ga' zhig gam skad cig 'ga' zhig la bsgos na /
analyzed: de'i phyir rnam par shes pa 'ga' zhig gam skad cig 'ga' zhig la bsgos na /
translated: then if one consciousness or one moment is enjoined,üîΩall consciousnesses or all moments would be enjoined.

original: thams cad la yang bsgos par 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: thams cad la yang bsgos par 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: and it would also be infused in all other minds.

original: de'ang mi rung ste /
analyzed: de'ang mi rung ste /
translated: This is not correct.

original: rigs la bya na gzhan du thal /
analyzed: rigs la bya na gzhan du thal /
translated: If it is said that it is infused in the class of mind, then it would be infused in other minds.

original: dgra bcom pa rnams kyi sems kyang rnam par shes pa'i rigs las ma 'das te /
analyzed: dgra bcom pa rnams kyi sems kyang rnam par shes pa'i rigs las ma 'das te /
translated: The minds of arhats are not beyond the class of consciousness,

original: de la yang mi dge ba'i bag chags bsgos par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de la yang mi dge ba'i bag chags bsgos par 'gyur ro //
translated: and it would be infused in them.

original: yang na gzhan du yang thal bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: yang na gzhan du yang thal bar 'gyur te /
translated: Or else, it would be infused in other minds,

original: rigs gzhan la yang zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: rigs gzhan la yang zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: that is, in the class of other minds.

original: ji lta zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta zhe na /
translated: How is this?

original: mig la @206b sogs pa'i dbang po dbang po'i rigs dang ldan pa rnams ni gzugs dang ba'i bdag nyid can yin pas dbang po nyid thun mong pa'i phyir yid kyi dbang po yang 'byung ba las gyur ba nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mig la @206b sogs pa'i dbang po dbang po'i rigs dang ldan pa rnams ni gzugs dang ba'i bdag nyid can yin pas dbang po nyid thun mong pa'i phyir yid kyi dbang po yang 'byung ba las gyur ba nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: The eye and other sense faculties that are of the nature of the elements would be the sense faculty of mind, because the nature of the sense faculty is common to all.

original: bsgo bar bya na yang bsgo ba ni 'dir zad de /
analyzed: bsgo bar bya na yang bsgo ba ni 'dir zad de /
translated: If it is said that it is infused in the mind, then this is the end of infusion.

original: yang na phan tshun du'am skad cig snga mas skad cig phyi ma la'am /
analyzed: yang na phan tshun du'am skad cig snga mas skad cig phyi ma la'am /
translated: Or else, it would be infused in other minds, that is, in the subsequent moment of the previous moment.

original: rnam par shes pa'i rigs la bsgo grang na /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i rigs la bsgo grang na /
translated: Or else, it would be infused in the class of consciousness.

original: rnam pa thams cad du mi rung bas kun gzhi rnam par shes pa las gzhan pa'i rnam par shes pa la sgo bar byed pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ni legs par bshad pa'o //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad du mi rung bas kun gzhi rnam par shes pa las gzhan pa'i rnam par shes pa la sgo bar byed pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ni legs par bshad pa'o //
translated: Therefore, it is well said that the consciousness that is the appropriator is not a consciousness other than the foundation consciousness.

original: phyi dang nang gi sa bon 'di gnyi ga yang skyed par byed pa dang 'phen par byed pa ste /
analyzed: phyi dang nang gi sa bon 'di gnyi ga yang skyed par byed pa dang 'phen par byed pa ste /
translated: Both of these seeds, external and internal, are projecting and producing.

original: phyir rol gyi sa bon ni myu gu mngon du skyed par byed pa'o //
analyzed: phyir rol gyi sa bon ni myu gu mngon du skyed par byed pa'o //
translated: An external seed is the producer of the sprout that is manifest.

original: brgyud nas sdong bu la sogs pa'i 'phen pa yang yin no //
analyzed: brgyud nas sdong bu la sogs pa'i 'phen pa yang yin no //
translated: It is also the projector of the stem and so on indirectly.

original: nang gi sa bon kun gzhi rnam par shes pa yang ming dang gzugs mngon du skyed par byed pa'o //
analyzed: nang gi sa bon kun gzhi rnam par shes pa yang ming dang gzugs mngon du skyed par byed pa'o //
translated: The internal seed, the foundation consciousness, is the producer of manifest name and form.

original: brgyud nas rga shi la thug pa'i bar du 'phen par byed pa yang yin no //
analyzed: brgyud nas rga shi la thug pa'i bar du 'phen par byed pa yang yin no //
translated: It is also the projector of birth up to old age and death indirectly.

original: skyed par byed pa ni yin grang na 'phen par byed par ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /üîΩma btab shi ba 'phen pa'i phyir //
analyzed: skyed par byed pa ni yin grang na 'phen par byed par ji ltar 'gyur zhe na / ma btab shi ba 'phen pa'i phyir //
translated: If it is a producer, how can it be a projector?

original: zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: Because it projects death before planting.

original: gal te sa bon ni skyed par byed pa yin la /
analyzed: gal te sa bon ni skyed par byed pa yin la /
translated: If the seed is the producer of the sprout,

original: 'phen par byed pa ma yin na sa bon du ma btab pa skyed pa la sogs pa'i nang du yod pa'i nas la sogs pa'i sa bon rnams kyi rgyun yun ring por rjes su 'phel bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'phen par byed pa ma yin na sa bon du ma btab pa skyed pa la sogs pa'i nang du yod pa'i nas la sogs pa'i sa bon rnams kyi rgyun yun ring por rjes su 'phel bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: but not its impeller, then the continuum of the seed, such as barley, etc., would not continue for a long time, since it would not be produced from the seed that has not been sown.

original: shi ba'i ro rnams kyang rnam par bsngos pa la sogs pa'i gnas skabs su rjes su 'jug par mi 'gyur gyi shi ma thag tu rnam par 'jug par 'gyur ba'i rigs so //
analyzed: shi ba'i ro rnams kyang rnam par bsngos pa la sogs pa'i gnas skabs su rjes su 'jug par mi 'gyur gyi shi ma thag tu rnam par 'jug par 'gyur ba'i rigs so //
translated: The continuum of the dead body would not continue in the state of being burned, etc., but it would be reasonable to say that it continues immediately after death.

original: ji lta zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta zhe na /
translated: How is that?

original: mda' ni bar du mi ltung bzhin /
analyzed: mda' ni bar du mi ltung bzhin /
translated: Like an arrow in flight.

original: dper na mnga' ni sngar bkang la 'phangs na 'gro ba de la 'gro ba de'i skyed par byed pa ni bkang ba ma yin te /üîΩde med pa'i phyir ro //üîΩmi 'gro ba yang ma yin te /
analyzed: dper na mnga' ni sngar bkang la 'phangs na 'gro ba de la 'gro ba de'i skyed par byed pa ni bkang ba ma yin te / de med pa'i phyir ro // mi 'gro ba yang ma yin te /
translated: For example, when an arrow is shot, the one who shoots it does not shoot it again, because it has already been shot.üîΩNor does he not shoot it, because it has already been shot.

original: tshu rol du ltung bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshu rol du ltung bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: If he shoots it, it will not go far, because it is already in flight.

original: ji srid du 'gro bar bya bar yang 'gro bas na de'i phyir bkang ba ni de la 'phen pa yin par mngon no //üîΩgang dag rang gi ngang gis mthar 'jig phyir //
analyzed: ji srid du 'gro bar bya bar yang 'gro bas na de'i phyir bkang ba ni de la 'phen pa yin par mngon no // gang dag rang gi ngang gis mthar 'jig phyir //
translated: Since it is that which goes to the end of going, it is clear that the end of going is the impelling of that which goes.

original: zhes 'don pa de dag gi ltar na 'di ni 'phen par byed pa nyid kyi gtan tshigs kyi don yin gyi dpe ma yin te /
analyzed: zhes 'don pa de dag gi ltar na 'di ni 'phen par byed pa nyid kyi gtan tshigs kyi don yin gyi dpe ma yin te /
translated: Those who recite the line ‚Äúbecause it would disintegrate by itself‚Äù take this to be the meaning of the reason that refutes the thesis that the end of going is the impelling of that which goes. It is not an example.

original: 'di ltar snying po dang ma zad pa'i mar me 'chi ba'i tshul du mtha' 'gyur ba'i rgyun 'chad pa'i bdag nyid phyir rol gyi rkyen la mi ltos par rang gi ngang @207a * //üîΩgis rnam par 'jig pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar snying po dang ma zad pa'i mar me 'chi ba'i tshul du mtha' 'gyur ba'i rgyun 'chad pa'i bdag nyid phyir rol gyi rkyen la mi ltos par rang gi ngang @207a * // gis rnam par 'jig pa yin te /
translated: This is because the self-disintegration of the continuum of the flame is like the way the flame goes out without depending on external conditions.

original: des na gang gis de ltar 'du byed rnams ji ltar sngon bzhin du rgyu na rgyas par mi byed pas nges par 'phen pas yongs su zad par rjes su dpag go /üîΩ// / bam po gnyis pa /
analyzed: des na gang gis de ltar 'du byed rnams ji ltar sngon bzhin du rgyu na rgyas par mi byed pas nges par 'phen pas yongs su zad par rjes su dpag go / // / bam po gnyis pa /
translated: Therefore, since it is not the case that the flame is extended by the cause of the flame as it was before, it is inferred that it is definitely impelled and then extinguished.

original: de ltar nang gi dang phyi'i sa bon gnyis mtshungs par bstan nas /
analyzed: de ltar nang gi dang phyi'i sa bon gnyis mtshungs par bstan nas /
translated: Having shown that the internal and external seeds are similar,üîΩthe internal and external fruits are shown to be similar.

original: phyi rol sa bon ma btab pa'am zhes bya ba la sogs pa mi mtshungs pa nyid brjod do //
analyzed: phyi rol sa bon ma btab pa'am zhes bya ba la sogs pa mi mtshungs pa nyid brjod do //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúexternal seeds that are not planted‚Äù and so on indicates that the two cases are not analogous.

original: 'am zhes bya ba ni nges pa med pa'i don to //
analyzed: 'am zhes bya ba ni nges pa med pa'i don to //
translated: The word ‚Äúor‚Äù indicates that the analogy is not certain.

original: phyi rol gyi sa bon ni btab kyang rung ste sa bon nyid du rnam par rtog ste dper na sol ba dang ba lang gi lci ba dang / lug gi bal la sogs pa ni til dang / autpala'i rtsa ba dang / rtsva d'ur pa la sogs pa la go rims bzhin te /
analyzed: phyi rol gyi sa bon ni btab kyang rung ste sa bon nyid du rnam par rtog ste dper na sol ba dang ba lang gi lci ba dang / lug gi bal la sogs pa ni til dang / autpala'i rtsa ba dang / rtsva d'ur pa la sogs pa la go rims bzhin te /
translated: External seeds are conceived to be seeds whether or not they are planted, just as charcoal, cow dung, wool, and so on are seeds of sesame, lotus roots, and durva grass, respectively.

original: til la sogs pa sol ba la sogs pa la ma btab mod kyi 'on kyang de dag las skye'o //
analyzed: til la sogs pa sol ba la sogs pa la ma btab mod kyi 'on kyang de dag las skye'o //
translated: Charcoal, etc., are not planted in sesame, etc., but they are still their seeds.

original: 'bras s'a lu la sogs pa'i sa bon btab pa ni s'a lu'i myu gu la sogs pa sa bon du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'bras s'a lu la sogs pa'i sa bon btab pa ni s'a lu'i myu gu la sogs pa sa bon du 'gyur ro //
translated: Seeds of rice, etc., that are planted become the seeds of rice sprouts, etc.

original: nges pa med pa'i sa bon nyid de ni nang gi kun gzhi rnam par shes pa la 'dod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: nges pa med pa'i sa bon nyid de ni nang gi kun gzhi rnam par shes pa la 'dod pa ma yin te /
translated: But internal seeds are not accepted to be seeds that are not planted in the store consciousness.

original: de la ni btab pa nyid sa bon du rung gi ma btab pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de la ni btab pa nyid sa bon du rung gi ma btab pa ni ma yin no //
translated: Only seeds that are planted in the store consciousness are seeds, not those that are not planted there.

original: de ci mngon zhe na /
analyzed: de ci mngon zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: thos pa la sogs pa'i bag chags bskyed pa med na de'i 'bras bu mang du thos pa la sogs pa mi snang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thos pa la sogs pa'i bag chags bskyed pa med na de'i 'bras bu mang du thos pa la sogs pa mi snang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because if the latent impressions of hearing and so on were not generated, the result of that, much hearing and so on, would not appear.

original: phyi rol gyi 'bras bu s'a lu la sogs pa'i sa bon gang yin pa de ni btab kyang res 'ga' chud zos la sred la sogs pa ni ma btab kyang rung ste skye ba de ltar nang gi sa bon ni ma yin te /
analyzed: phyi rol gyi 'bras bu s'a lu la sogs pa'i sa bon gang yin pa de ni btab kyang res 'ga' chud zos la sred la sogs pa ni ma btab kyang rung ste skye ba de ltar nang gi sa bon ni ma yin te /
translated: The external seed of rice and so on is planted and sometimes it fails, but craving and so on arise even if they are not planted. The internal seed is not like that.

original: byas pa dang ma byas pa chud za ba dang skye ba med pas phyi rol dang mi 'dra'o //
analyzed: byas pa dang ma byas pa chud za ba dang skye ba med pas phyi rol dang mi 'dra'o //
translated: Because what is done and what is not done do not fail and arise, it is not like the external.

original: gal te nang gi sa bon las phyi'i sa bon tha dad pa yin na kun gzhi rnam par shes pa sa bon thams cad pa nyid du snga bshad pa la gnod par ji ltar mi 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: gal te nang gi sa bon las phyi'i sa bon tha dad pa yin na kun gzhi rnam par shes pa sa bon thams cad pa nyid du snga bshad pa la gnod par ji ltar mi 'gyur zhe na /
translated: If the external seed is different from the internal seed, why does it not contradict the earlier explanation that the foundation consciousness is the seed of everything?

original: lan btab pa /üîΩnang ni phyir rol rkyen yin te //
analyzed: lan btab pa / nang ni phyir rol rkyen yin te //
translated: The answer is:üîΩThe internal is the external condition,

original: 'di ltar de ni bag chags rten //
analyzed: 'di ltar de ni bag chags rten //
translated: because it is the support of latent impressions.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste //
translated: And so on.

original: 'di ltar 'bras s'a lu la sogs pa'i sa bon ni de la za ba'i srog chags rnams kyi las kyi bag chags kyi sa bon kun gzhi rnam par shes pa la gnas pa rnams kyis der snang bar bsgrubs pa ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'bras s'a lu la sogs pa'i sa bon ni de la za ba'i srog chags rnams kyi las kyi bag chags kyi sa bon kun gzhi rnam par shes pa la gnas pa rnams kyis der snang bar bsgrubs pa ste /
translated: Thus, the seed of rice, etc. is established as appearing as it does due to the seeds of the habitual tendencies of the karma of the living beings who consume it, which are located in the storehouse consciousness.

original: de'i phyir de las gud na med do //
analyzed: de'i phyir de las gud na med do //
translated: Therefore, it does not exist apart from that.

original: yang smras pa /
analyzed: yang smras pa /
translated: Again, it is said:üîΩSpace, earth, wind, sun,

original: nam mkha' sa rlung nyi ma dang // phyogs dang rgya mtsho 'bab chu rnams //üîΩnang gi byed pa yang dag gi //
analyzed: nam mkha' sa rlung nyi ma dang // phyogs dang rgya mtsho 'bab chu rnams // nang gi byed pa yang dag gi //
translated: directions, oceans, and riversüîΩare the parts of the inner agent

original: cha yin phyi rol 'dra bar gnas //
analyzed: cha yin phyi rol 'dra bar gnas //
translated: and exist externally as well.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs @207b pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs @207b pa'o //
translated: And so on.

original: yang 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa gzhan gang yin pa de ni lus thams cad dang lha la sogs pa 'gro ba thams cad du nye bar spyod pa can du blta ste zhes bya ba ni nye bar spyod nus pa ste /
analyzed: yang 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa gzhan gang yin pa de ni lus thams cad dang lha la sogs pa 'gro ba thams cad du nye bar spyod pa can du blta ste zhes bya ba ni nye bar spyod nus pa ste /
translated: Again, any other engaging consciousness should be seen as having the entire body and all the worlds of gods, etc. as its domain.

original: dmigs pa dang rnam pa yongs su chad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dmigs pa dang rnam pa yongs su chad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is capable of experiencing them because it has a specific objective reference and aspect.

original: gcig ni rkyen gyi rnam par shes //
analyzed: gcig ni rkyen gyi rnam par shes //
translated: One is the condition of consciousness.

original: gnyis pa nye bar spyod pa can //
analyzed: gnyis pa nye bar spyod pa can //
translated: The second is the enjoyer.

original: nye bar spyod dang yongs spyod dang // de yi 'jug byed sems las byung //
analyzed: nye bar spyod dang yongs spyod dang // de yi 'jug byed sems las byung //
translated: Enjoyment, full enjoyment, and the mental factors that cause themüîΩto occur are the second transformation of consciousness.

original: zhes bya ba de la nye bar spyod pa ni tshor ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba de la nye bar spyod pa ni tshor ba'o //
translated: Enjoyment is feeling.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa dbus dang mtha' rnam par 'byed pa'i gzhung nye bar bkod pas ni yid ches pa dang ldan pa dang gzhung lugs gcig tu mthun par ston to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa dbus dang mtha' rnam par 'byed pa'i gzhung nye bar bkod pas ni yid ches pa dang ldan pa dang gzhung lugs gcig tu mthun par ston to //
translated: The passage from the Discussion of the Middle and the Extremes that is cited here shows that the teaching of the three natures is authoritative and that it is consistent with the scriptural tradition.

original: chos kun rnam par shes la sbyor //
analyzed: chos kun rnam par shes la sbyor //
translated: All phenomena are connected with consciousness.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni kun gzhi rnam par shes pa dang 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa gnyis gcig gi rkyen gcig yin par lung gis brtan por byed de /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni kun gzhi rnam par shes pa dang 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa gnyis gcig gi rkyen gcig yin par lung gis brtan por byed de /
translated: This passage shows that the foundation consciousness and the evolving consciousnesses are the conditions of each other, like a mother and her child.

original: ma la bu rnams bdag cag ni khyod kyi yin no zhes smra ba lta bu'o //üîΩde dag la yang de de bzhin //
analyzed: ma la bu rnams bdag cag ni khyod kyi yin no zhes smra ba lta bu'o // de dag la yang de de bzhin //
translated: The children say, ‚ÄúWe belong to you.‚Äù

original: zhes bya ba ni khyed nga'i yin no zhes smra ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni khyed nga'i yin no zhes smra ba lta bu'o //
translated: The mother says, ‚ÄúThey are mine.‚Äù

original: de lta bas na gcig la gcig 'byung bas kun gzhi dang 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa gnyis phan tshun du rgyu'i rkyen to //
analyzed: de lta bas na gcig la gcig 'byung bas kun gzhi dang 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa gnyis phan tshun du rgyu'i rkyen to //
translated: Thus, the store-consciousness and the actual consciousnesses are reciprocal conditions as cause, because they arise from each other.

original: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba dang po la //
analyzed: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba dang po la //
translated: The first of the members of dependent origination

original: zhes bya ba ni ngo bo nyid rnam par 'byed pa can la ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni ngo bo nyid rnam par 'byed pa can la ste /
translated: is the one that has the differentiation of essences.

original: ji skad bshad ma thag pa'o //
analyzed: ji skad bshad ma thag pa'o //
translated: It is as has just been explained.

original: gnyis pa la zhes bya ba ni sdug pa dang mi sdug pa rnam par 'byed pa can la'o //
analyzed: gnyis pa la zhes bya ba ni sdug pa dang mi sdug pa rnam par 'byed pa can la'o //
translated: The second is the one that has the differentiation of the pleasant and the unpleasant.

original: bdag po'i rkyen to zhes bya ba ni dngos su na ma rig pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: bdag po'i rkyen to zhes bya ba ni dngos su na ma rig pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: The dominant condition is ignorance, etc.

original: de dag gi mthus 'du byed la sogs pa bde 'gro dang ngan 'gror 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag gi mthus 'du byed la sogs pa bde 'gro dang ngan 'gror 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: , because the members of existence, such as the formative forces, arise in good and bad destinies through the power of those.

original: rnam par shes pa drug po dag rkyen gsum gyis skye zhes bya ba ni bdag po dang dmigs pa dang de ma thag pa zhes bya ba rnams so //
