analyzed: rnam par shes pa drug po dag rkyen gsum gyis skye zhes bya ba ni bdag po dang dmigs pa dang de ma thag pa zhes bya ba rnams so //
translated: The six consciousnesses arise from three conditions, namely, the dominant, the object, and the immediate antecedent.

original: de la mig ni mig gi rnam par shes pa'i bdag po'i rkyen to //
analyzed: de la mig ni mig gi rnam par shes pa'i bdag po'i rkyen to //
translated: The eye is the dominant condition of visual consciousness.

original: gzugs ni dmigs pa'i rkyen to //
analyzed: gzugs ni dmigs pa'i rkyen to //
translated: Form is the objective condition.

original: 'gags ma thag pa'i yid ni de ma thag pa'i rkyen te go skabs 'byed do //
analyzed: 'gags ma thag pa'i yid ni de ma thag pa'i rkyen te go skabs 'byed do //
translated: The immediately preceding mind is the immediately preceding condition, because it makes a place.

original: ji ltar 'di gsum gyis mig gi rnam par shes pa skyes pa ltar rna ba la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa rnams kyang de bzhin te snga ma dang don mthun par rang rang gi gsum gsum po dag gis 'byung bar mtshungs par bshad do //
analyzed: ji ltar 'di gsum gyis mig gi rnam par shes pa skyes pa ltar rna ba la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa rnams kyang de bzhin te snga ma dang don mthun par rang rang gi gsum gsum po dag gis 'byung bar mtshungs par bshad do //
translated: Just as the eye consciousness arises from these three, so too the ear consciousness and so on arise from their own three conditions, which are similar to the first three.

original: 'khor ba pa zhes bya ba ni ngo bo nyid rnam par 'byed pa can yin te /üîΩde las gzhan pa'i rkyen gsum med pa'i phyir rgyu'i @208a * //
analyzed: 'khor ba pa zhes bya ba ni ngo bo nyid rnam par 'byed pa can yin te / de las gzhan pa'i rkyen gsum med pa'i phyir rgyu'i @208a * //
translated: The term ‚Äúof cyclic existence‚Äù indicates that the three conditions are distinguished by their intrinsic reality.

original: rkyen las 'byung ba nyid du nges so //
analyzed: rkyen las 'byung ba nyid du nges so //
translated: Since the other three conditions do not exist apart from that, they are definitely derived from the causal condition.

original: de ltar rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba gsum po dag gi rkyen ni bzhi ste /
analyzed: de ltar rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba gsum po dag gi rkyen ni bzhi ste /
translated: Thus the three types of dependent origination have four conditions.

original: ci rigs su sbyar gyi sems dang sems las byung ba gcig la yang bzhi char ni ma yin par khong du chud par byed do //
analyzed: ci rigs su sbyar gyi sems dang sems las byung ba gcig la yang bzhi char ni ma yin par khong du chud par byed do //
translated: One should understand that the four conditions are applied as appropriate, but not all four to a single mind or mental factor.

original: rang dang gzhan gyi lung dag gis kun gzhi rnam par shes pa bsgrubs nas ldan pa'i rigs las grub par bsgrubs te /
analyzed: rang dang gzhan gyi lung dag gis kun gzhi rnam par shes pa bsgrubs nas ldan pa'i rigs las grub par bsgrubs te /
translated: Having established the foundation consciousness through scripture of ourselves and others, he establishes its existence through reasoning.

original: rigs pa dang lung so sos mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rigs pa dang lung so sos mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because reasoning and scripture individually are not able to do that.

original: ji skad du dad pas ni nga'i phyir ma 'gro shig ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: ji skad du dad pas ni nga'i phyir ma 'gro shig ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: As it is said, ‚ÄúDo not go for my sake, etc.‚Äù

original: 'di ltar kun gzhi rnam par shes pa las gzhan na kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba med kyi de dag de la yod de nga'i phyir de yod do //
analyzed: 'di ltar kun gzhi rnam par shes pa las gzhan na kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba med kyi de dag de la yod de nga'i phyir de yod do //
translated: Thus, apart from the foundation consciousness, there is no defilement or purification, but they exist in it, and for that reason it exists.

original: de la kun nas nyon mongs pa yin pas kun nas nyon mongs pa ste /
analyzed: de la kun nas nyon mongs pa yin pas kun nas nyon mongs pa ste /
translated: Therein, it is defilement because it is defiled.

original: kun nas nyon mongs par gyur pa rnam par ma dag pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs par gyur pa rnam par ma dag pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It is said to be defiled, that is, impure.

original: rnam par byang ba yin pas rnam par byang ba ste dag pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par byang ba yin pas rnam par byang ba ste dag pa'o //
translated: It is purification because it is purified, that is, pure.

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa rnam pa gsum ni nyon mongs pas byas pa dang / las kyis byas pa dang skye bas byas pa'o //
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa rnam pa gsum ni nyon mongs pas byas pa dang / las kyis byas pa dang skye bas byas pa'o //
translated: The three kinds of defilement are: defilement by the passions, defilement by action, and defilement by birth.üîΩThe two kinds of purification are: mundane and supramundane.

original: rnam par byang ba rnam pa gnyis pa 'jig rten pa rnams ni re zhig pa ste /üîΩnyon mongs pa rnam par gnon pa tsam du zad do //üîΩ'jig rten las 'das pa ni gtan du ba ste /
analyzed: rnam par byang ba rnam pa gnyis pa 'jig rten pa rnams ni re zhig pa ste / nyon mongs pa rnam par gnon pa tsam du zad do // 'jig rten las 'das pa ni gtan du ba ste /
translated: The mundane is temporary, for it is merely the suppression of the passions.

original: lam gyi bden pas bag la nyal legs par bcom pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lam gyi bden pas bag la nyal legs par bcom pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The supramundane is permanent, for it is the destruction of the latent tendencies by the truth of the path.üîΩWith reference to the impossibility of the defilement of the passions in the evolving consciousnesses, he says, ‚ÄúThe consciousness that is born from the eye and form, etc.‚ÄùüîΩThe consciousness that is born from the eye and form, etc., is the visual consciousness, etc.üîΩThe consciousness that is born from the eye and form, etc., is the visual consciousness, etc.üîΩThe consciousness that is born from the eye and form, etc., is the visual consciousness, etc.

original: 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa rnams la nyon mongs pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa mi srid pa'i dbang du byas nas 'di ltar mig gi rnam par shes pa gang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras so //
analyzed: 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa rnams la nyon mongs pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa mi srid pa'i dbang du byas nas 'di ltar mig gi rnam par shes pa gang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras so //
translated: The consciousness that is born from the eye and form, etc., is the visual consciousness, etc.üîΩThe consciousness that is born from the eye and form, etc., is the visual consciousness, etc.üîΩThe consciousness that is born from the eye and form, etc., is the visual consciousness, etc.üîΩThe consciousness that is born from the eye and form, etc., is the visual consciousness, etc.üîΩThe consciousness that is born from the eye and form, etc., is the visual consciousness, etc.üîΩThe consciousness that is born from the eye and form, etc., is the visual consciousness, etc.üîΩThe consciousness that is born from the eye and form, etc., is the visual consciousness, etc.üîΩThe consciousness that is born from the eye and form, etc., is the visual consciousness, etc.üîΩThe consciousness that is born from the eye and form, etc., is the visual consciousness, etc.üîΩThe consciousness that is born from the eye and form, etc., is the visual consciousness, etc.üîΩThe consciousness that is born from the eye and form, etc., is the visual consciousness, etc.üîΩThe consciousness that is born from the eye and form, etc., is the visual consciousness, etc.üîΩThe consciousness that is born from the eye and form, etc., is the visual consciousness, etc.üîΩThe consciousness that is born from the eye and form, etc., is the visual consciousness, etc.

original: mig gi rnam par shes pa 'gags pa rnam par shes pa gzhan gyis bar du chod pa de la zhes bya ba ni rna ba la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pas bar du chod pa la bya ste /
analyzed: mig gi rnam par shes pa 'gags pa rnam par shes pa gzhan gyis bar du chod pa de la zhes bya ba ni rna ba la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pas bar du chod pa la bya ste /
translated: The consciousness that is born from the eye and form, etc., is the visual consciousness, etc.üîΩThe consciousness that is born from the eye and form, etc., is the visual

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa'i bag chags gnas pa dang bcas pa 'gags pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa'i bag chags gnas pa dang bcas pa 'gags pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the latent states of attachment and so on along with their basis have ceased.

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa dang bcas pa 'byung du mi rung ste zhes bya ba ni yang mig gi rnam par shes pa la 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dang / gti mug dang ldan pa 'byung du mi rung ste /
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa dang bcas pa 'byung du mi rung ste zhes bya ba ni yang mig gi rnam par shes pa la 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dang / gti mug dang ldan pa 'byung du mi rung ste /
translated: It is not tenable that eye consciousness arises together with attachment and so on,

original: rgyu med pa'i phyir ro /
analyzed: rgyu med pa'i phyir ro /
translated: because it would be causeless.

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa dang bcas pa'i mig gi rnam par shes pa 'das pa de ni de'i rgyur mi rung ste /
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa dang bcas pa'i mig gi rnam par shes pa 'das pa de ni de'i rgyur mi rung ste /
translated: It is not tenable that past eye consciousness together with attachment and so on is the cause of that,

original: 'das pa'i las las rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu 'byung ba bzhin @208b no ;
analyzed: 'das pa'i las las rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu 'byung ba bzhin @208b no ;
translated: because it is like the arising of the ripened result from past karma.üîΩJust as Vaibhasikas assert that the ripened result arises from past karma,

original: / ji ltar bye brag tu smra ba rnams 'das pa'i las las rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu 'byung zhes bya ba la bag chags kyi bya ba med pas mdo sde pa dag mi 'dod pa de ltar de dag la yang 'das pa med pas de las 'dod
analyzed: / ji ltar bye brag tu smra ba rnams 'das pa'i las las rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu 'byung zhes bya ba la bag chags kyi bya ba med pas mdo sde pa dag mi 'dod pa de ltar de dag la yang 'das pa med pas de las 'dod
translated: because they do not assert that past karma exists, they do not assert that the result arises from past karma.

original: chags la sogs pa dang bcas pa'i sems 'byung du mi rung ngo //
analyzed: chags la sogs pa dang bcas pa'i sems 'byung du mi rung ngo //
translated: It is not tenable that the mind is accompanied by attachment, etc.

original: 'di ni re zhig 'dod chags la sogs pa dang lhan cig byung ba'i mig gi rnam par shes pa la 'dod chags la sogs pa'i bag chags khas blangs te /
analyzed: 'di ni re zhig 'dod chags la sogs pa dang lhan cig byung ba'i mig gi rnam par shes pa la 'dod chags la sogs pa'i bag chags khas blangs te /
translated: For now, it is accepted that the eye consciousness that occurs together with attachment, etc. has the latent impressions of attachment, etc.

original: de las gzhan 'byung ba gang yin ba de 'dod chags la sogs pa dang ldan par 'byung du mi rung bar bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de las gzhan 'byung ba gang yin ba de 'dod chags la sogs pa dang ldan par 'byung du mi rung bar bstan pa yin no //
translated: But it is shown that it is not tenable that what occurs later, which is different from that, occurs accompanied by attachment, etc.

original: da ni 'dod chags la sogs pa dang lhan cig 'byung ba'i rnam par shes pa de nyid la yang bag chags mi 'thad par dpyod de /
analyzed: da ni 'dod chags la sogs pa dang lhan cig 'byung ba'i rnam par shes pa de nyid la yang bag chags mi 'thad par dpyod de /
translated: Now, it is analyzed that the latent impressions are not tenable even in that consciousness that occurs together with attachment, etc.

original: mig gi rnam par shes pa 'dod chags la sogs pa dang lhan cig byung ba de la yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: mig gi rnam par shes pa 'dod chags la sogs pa dang lhan cig byung ba de la yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúEven in that eye consciousness that occurs together with attachment, etc.‚Äù

original: re zhig 'dod chags la ni ma yin te /
analyzed: re zhig 'dod chags la ni ma yin te /
translated: It is not tenable that attachment is the latent impression of attachment.üîΩ‚ÄúAttachment is not in it‚Äù means that attachment is not in the eye consciousness that occurs together with attachment, etc. ‚ÄúIt‚Äù refers to the eye consciousness that occurs together with attachment, etc. ‚ÄúAttachment‚Äù refers to the attachment that exists in the continuum of that person. ‚ÄúAttachment is not in it‚Äù means that attachment is not in the eye consciousness that occurs together with attachment, etc.üîΩ‚ÄúAttachment is not in it‚Äù means that attachment is not in the eye consciousness that occurs together with attachment, etc. ‚ÄúIt‚Äù refers to the eye consciousness that occurs together with attachment, etc. ‚ÄúAttachment‚Äù refers to the attachment that exists in the continuum of that person. ‚ÄúAttachment is not in it‚Äù means that attachment is not in the eye consciousness that occurs together with attachment, etc.üîΩ‚ÄúAttachment is not in it‚Äù means that attachment is not in the eye consciousness that occurs together with attachment, etc. ‚ÄúIt‚Äù refers to the eye consciousness that occurs together with attachment, etc. ‚ÄúAttachment‚Äù refers to the attachment that exists in the continuum of that person. ‚ÄúAttachment is not in it‚Äù means that attachment is not in the eye consciousness that occurs together with attachment, etc.üîΩ‚ÄúAttachment is not in it‚Äù means that attachment is not in the eye consciousness that occurs together with attachment, etc. ‚ÄúIt‚Äù refers to the eye consciousness that occurs together with attachment, etc. ‚ÄúAttachment‚Äù refers to the attachment that exists in the continuum of that person. ‚ÄúAttachment is not in it‚Äù means that attachment is not in the eye consciousness that occurs together with attachment, etc.

original: 'dod chags ni de la brten pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la re zhig sgra ni rim gyi don ta //
analyzed: 'dod chags ni de la brten pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la re zhig sgra ni rim gyi don ta //
translated: ‚ÄúAttachment is not in it‚Äù means that attachment is not in the eye consciousness that occurs together with attachment, etc. ‚ÄúIt‚Äù refers to the eye consciousness that occurs together with attachment, etc. ‚ÄúAttachment‚Äù refers to the attachment that exists in the continuum of that person. ‚ÄúAttachment is

original: 'dod chags ni sems las byung ba yin pas rnam par shes pa la brten pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod chags ni sems las byung ba yin pas rnam par shes pa la brten pa'o //
translated: Attachment is a mental factor, thus it is based on consciousness.

original: gnas pas gnas la bsgo ba ni rigs pa'i tshul yin gyi gnas nyid kyis gnas pa la bsgo pa ni mi rung ste /
analyzed: gnas pas gnas la bsgo ba ni rigs pa'i tshul yin gyi gnas nyid kyis gnas pa la bsgo pa ni mi rung ste /
translated: It is proper for a ruler to order a subject, but it is not proper for a subject to order a ruler.

original: bdag nyid la byed pa 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag nyid la byed pa 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It is contradictory for something to act upon itself.

original: mi brtan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi brtan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is unstable.

original: zhes bya ba ni kha cig mi 'don te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni kha cig mi 'don te /
translated: Some do not recite this line.

original: rnam par shes pa yang mi brtan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa yang mi brtan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because consciousness is also unstable.

original: rnam par shes pa gzhan dag la yang ma yin te zhes bya ba ni rna ba la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa rnams la'o //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa gzhan dag la yang ma yin te zhes bya ba ni rna ba la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa rnams la'o //
translated: Nor in other consciousnesses means not in the ear consciousnesses and so on.

original: rnam par shes pa rnams kyi gnas tha dad pa'i phyir ro zhes bya la gnas ni rna ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa rnams kyi gnas tha dad pa'i phyir ro zhes bya la gnas ni rna ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: Because the bases of the consciousnesses are different. The bases are the ear and so on.

original: rnam par shes pa rnams kyi gnas te tha dad do //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa rnams kyi gnas te tha dad do //
translated: The bases of the consciousnesses are different.

original: des na mig gi rnam par shes pa nyid mig la brten te 'byung gi gzhan las ni ma yin te /
analyzed: des na mig gi rnam par shes pa nyid mig la brten te 'byung gi gzhan las ni ma yin te /
translated: Therefore eye consciousness arises in dependence on the eye, but not in dependence on the others.

original: ji ltar sngar tha dad gsum dang 'gal ba'i phyir zhes bshad pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: ji ltar sngar tha dad gsum dang 'gal ba'i phyir zhes bshad pa lta bu'o //
translated: As was previously explained, because it is contradictory for the three to be different.

original: lhan cig 'byung ba dang 'gag pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni lhan cig 'byung ba ma yin pa rnams la bag chags bsgo bar bya ba dang / sgo bar byed pa'i dngos po med pas bag chags kyi mtshan nyid med par ston to //
analyzed: lhan cig 'byung ba dang 'gag pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni lhan cig 'byung ba ma yin pa rnams la bag chags bsgo bar bya ba dang / sgo bar byed pa'i dngos po med pas bag chags kyi mtshan nyid med par ston to //
translated: Because there is no arising or ceasing together, it shows that there is no characteristic of a latent imprint because there is no entity that is the cause of impressing or that which is impressed, for those that do not arise together.

original: rang gi dngos po la yang ma yin te zhes bya ba ni mig gi rnam par shes pa de nyid kyis mig gi rnam par shes pa de nyid la bag chags mi bsgo ste /üîΩbsgo bar bya ba dang spo @209a * //
analyzed: rang gi dngos po la yang ma yin te zhes bya ba ni mig gi rnam par shes pa de nyid kyis mig gi rnam par shes pa de nyid la bag chags mi bsgo ste / bsgo bar bya ba dang spo @209a * //
translated: Nor is it in its own entity, because that eye consciousness does not impress a latent imprint on that eye consciousness itself.

original: par byed pa las dang byed pa dag 'chol ba'i skyon du 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: par byed pa las dang byed pa dag 'chol ba'i skyon du 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the error of the confusion of the object and agent of impressing would arise.

original: rnam par shes pa de la rnam par shes pas bsgos pa yang mi rung ngo //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa de la rnam par shes pas bsgos pa yang mi rung ngo //
translated: Nor is it tenable that consciousness is impressed by consciousness.

original: zhes bya ba ni mig gi rnam par shes pa la rna ba la sogs pa'i rnam pa shes pas gzhan de dang lhan cig skyes pa'i 'dod chags la sogs pas bag chags bsgor mi rung zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni mig gi rnam par shes pa la rna ba la sogs pa'i rnam pa shes pas gzhan de dang lhan cig skyes pa'i 'dod chags la sogs pas bag chags bsgor mi rung zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
translated: This means that the eye consciousness cannot be cultivated by the imprints of attachment and so on that are concomitant with other consciousnesses such as the ear consciousness.üîΩ

original: snga ma bzhin du gnas tha dad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: snga ma bzhin du gnas tha dad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This means that the eye consciousness cannot be perfumed by the ear consciousness, etc., nor by the attachment, etc., that are born with it, because they are in different locations, as before.

original: tshul ni 'di tsam dag tu zad de /
analyzed: tshul ni 'di tsam dag tu zad de /
translated: This is the extent of the method.

original: rnam pa thams cad du mi rung ngo //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad du mi rung ngo //
translated: It is not possible in any way.

original: mig gi rnam par shes pa la ji lta ba de bzhin du zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni snga ma dang don mtshungs par bshad do //
analyzed: mig gi rnam par shes pa la ji lta ba de bzhin du zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni snga ma dang don mtshungs par bshad do //
translated: As with the eye consciousness, so also with the ear, nose, tongue, and body consciousnesses.

original: gang yangs gong ma 'du shes med pa nas shi 'phos te 'dir skyes pa rnams kyi zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa'i khams su'o //
analyzed: gang yangs gong ma 'du shes med pa nas shi 'phos te 'dir skyes pa rnams kyi zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa'i khams su'o //
translated: Those who die in the above-mentioned two formless realms and are born here in the desire realm are not perfumed by the attachment, etc., of the desire realm, because they are born in the desire realm with a weak mind.

original: nyon mongs pa dang nye ba'i nyon mongs pa zhes bya ba ni 'dod chags la sogs pa dang khro ba la sogs pas so //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa dang nye ba'i nyon mongs pa zhes bya ba ni 'dod chags la sogs pa dang khro ba la sogs pas so //
translated: Afflictions and secondary afflictions refers to attachment, etc., and anger, etc.

original: thog ma nyid du zhes bya ba ni nyid mtshams sbyor ba'i dus na'o //
analyzed: thog ma nyid du zhes bya ba ni nyid mtshams sbyor ba'i dus na'o //
translated: At the very outset means at the time of rebirth.

original: gnas dang bcas pa zhes bya ba ni snga ma bzhin du bshad do //
analyzed: gnas dang bcas pa zhes bya ba ni snga ma bzhin du bshad do //
translated: Endowed with a basis is explained as before.

original: mdo sde pa dang gtan la dbab pa'i skabs ston te de'i gzhung ltar na 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dag dngos po med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mdo sde pa dang gtan la dbab pa'i skabs ston te de'i gzhung ltar na 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dag dngos po med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The Sautrantikas and the Praj√±aptivadins are mentioned because, according to their texts, the past and future do not exist as real entities.

original: nyon mongs pa'i gnyen po'i rnam par shes pa byung na zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni gal te kun gzhi rnam par shes pa med na gang gi tshe thog ma nyid du rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu la 'jug pa la mthong bas spang par bya ba'i
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i gnyen po'i rnam par shes pa byung na zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni gal te kun gzhi rnam par shes pa med na gang gi tshe thog ma nyid du rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu la 'jug pa la mthong bas spang par bya ba'i
translated: If the foundation consciousness did not exist, when one first enters the path and becomes a stream enterer, then the antidote to the afflictions of the path of seeing has not yet arisen.

original: nyon mongs pa'i gnyen po la ma skyes pa de'i tshe 'jig rten pa'i shes pa thams cad ni 'gags na bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa'i bag la nyal gang du gnas par 'gyur /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i gnyen po la ma skyes pa de'i tshe 'jig rten pa'i shes pa thams cad ni 'gags na bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa'i bag la nyal gang du gnas par 'gyur /
translated: At that time, if all mundane consciousnesses have ceased, where would the latent afflictions to be abandoned by the path of meditation be located?

original: gnyen po nyid mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi sa bon dang 'brel par ni mi rung ngo //
analyzed: gnyen po nyid mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi sa bon dang 'brel par ni mi rung ngo //
translated: It is not tenable that the antidote itself is related to the seed of the counteragent.

original: ngo bo nyid kyis rnam par grol ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyis rnam par byang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid kyis rnam par grol ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyis rnam par byang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is liberated by its very nature means because it is naturally purified.

original: zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This is the meaning.

original: lhan cig 'byung ba dang 'gag pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs dang gnyen po phan tshun mi mthun pa'i phyir snang ba dang mun pa bzhin te /
analyzed: lhan cig 'byung ba dang 'gag pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs dang gnyen po phan tshun mi mthun pa'i phyir snang ba dang mun pa bzhin te /
translated: Because it does not arise or cease simultaneously means that the counteragent and the counteracted are mutually incompatible, like light and darkness.

original: sa bon gyi mtshan nyid du mi rung bar ston to //
analyzed: sa bon gyi mtshan nyid du mi rung bar ston to //
translated: This shows that it is not tenable that the antidote has the characteristic of a seed.

original: de'i 'og tu zhes bya ba ni mthong ba'i lam gyi 'og tu bsgom pa'i lam la'o //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu zhes bya ba ni mthong ba'i lam gyi 'og tu bsgom pa'i lam la'o //
translated: Subsequently means on the path of cultivation that follows the path of seeing.

original: 'das nas yun ring ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni brda phrad par zad do //
analyzed: 'das nas yun ring ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni brda phrad par zad do //
translated: After a long time means that it is easy to understand.

original: bye brag @209b tu smra ba'i thob pa'i phyogs ni mdo sde ba nyid kyis bsal zin te de ni skyabs su mi rung ngo //
analyzed: bye brag @209b tu smra ba'i thob pa'i phyogs ni mdo sde ba nyid kyis bsal zin te de ni skyabs su mi rung ngo //
translated: The VaibhƒÅ·π£ika position on obtainment has already been refuted by SautrƒÅntikas, so that is not a suitable refuge.

original: nye bar gyur ba'i phyir mdo sde pa dang dpyad pa'i dbang du byas pa ste /
analyzed: nye bar gyur ba'i phyir mdo sde pa dang dpyad pa'i dbang du byas pa ste /
translated: The Sautrantikas, on the other hand, are concerned with analysis.

original: de la yang bag chags kyi gnas med pa'i skyon chags pa nyid do //
analyzed: de la yang bag chags kyi gnas med pa'i skyon chags pa nyid do //
translated: But they have the fault of having no basis for the residual impressions.

original: de lta bas na kun gzhi rnam par shes pa med na nyon mongs pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa mi rung ngo zhes bya ba ni gzhan du na mi srid pa'i tshul gyis nges par byas te mjug sdud pa'o //
analyzed: de lta bas na kun gzhi rnam par shes pa med na nyon mongs pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa mi rung ngo zhes bya ba ni gzhan du na mi srid pa'i tshul gyis nges par byas te mjug sdud pa'o //
translated: Thus, if there were no alaya consciousness, the defilement of the passions would be impossible. This is a summary of the argument that the alaya must exist because, otherwise, the defilement of the passions would be impossible.

original: 'du byed kyi rkyen gyis rnam par shes pa mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'du byed kyi rkyen gyis rnam par shes pa mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The defilement of action would be impossible because the condition of action would not be tenable.

original: zhes bya ba ni 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa rnams la las kyi kun nas nyon mongs pa mi srid par ston to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa rnams la las kyi kun nas nyon mongs pa mi srid par ston to //
translated: This shows that the defilement of action is impossible for the actual consciousnesses.

original: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa med na mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa 'dod chags la sogs pa dang lhan cig skyes pa 'du byed kyi rkyen las byung bar 'dod na de yang mi rung ste /
analyzed: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa med na mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa 'dod chags la sogs pa dang lhan cig skyes pa 'du byed kyi rkyen las byung bar 'dod na de yang mi rung ste /
translated: If there were no alaya consciousness, the simultaneous arising of the eye consciousness and so on with such things as attachment would be impossible, because it is maintained that they arise from the condition of action.

original: rnam par shes pa'i rkyen gyi ming dang gzugs zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i rkyen gyi ming dang gzugs zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is said that name-and-form have consciousness as their condition.

original: mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa ni skad cig gis 'jig pa'i tshul can yin pas 'gags nas yun ring ba'i phyir ming dang gzugs kyi rkyen du mi rung ste /
analyzed: mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa ni skad cig gis 'jig pa'i tshul can yin pas 'gags nas yun ring ba'i phyir ming dang gzugs kyi rkyen du mi rung ste /
translated: The eye consciousness, etc., are momentary, and therefore, since they have ceased for a long time, they cannot be the condition of name-and-form.

original: nyes pa mang du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nyes pa mang du 'gyur ro //
translated: Many faults would ensue.

original: nyes pa 'dis 'jigs nas nyid mtshams sbyor ba'i rnam par shes pa 'dod na de yang mi rung ste /
analyzed: nyes pa 'dis 'jigs nas nyid mtshams sbyor ba'i rnam par shes pa 'dod na de yang mi rung ste /
translated: Fearing these faults, you might assert that the consciousness at conception is the consciousness that has them as its condition.üîΩBut that is not reasonable, because at the time of conception, the formative forces of merit,

original: nying mtshams sbyor ba'i rnam par shes pa'i dus na bsod nams dang / bsod nams ma yin pa dang / mi g-yo ba'i 'du byed 'gags nas yun ring ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nying mtshams sbyor ba'i rnam par shes pa'i dus na bsod nams dang / bsod nams ma yin pa dang / mi g-yo ba'i 'du byed 'gags nas yun ring ba'i phyir ro //
translated: nonmerit, and immobility have ceased for a long time.

original: 'gags pa rnams las ni de 'byung bar yang mi rigs so //
analyzed: 'gags pa rnams las ni de 'byung bar yang mi rigs so //
translated: It is not reasonable that they arise from those that have ceased.

original: rjes su chags pa dang khong khro ba dang ldan pa'i phyir nying mtshams sbyor ba'i sems ni lung du ma bstan pa ma yin no //
analyzed: rjes su chags pa dang khong khro ba dang ldan pa'i phyir nying mtshams sbyor ba'i sems ni lung du ma bstan pa ma yin no //
translated: And the mind at conception is not neutral, because it is associated with attachment and aversion.

original: rnam par smin pa ni lung du ma bstan pa yin pas de 'du byed kyi rkyen can du mi rung ngo //
analyzed: rnam par smin pa ni lung du ma bstan pa yin pas de 'du byed kyi rkyen can du mi rung ngo //
translated: Since the karmic maturation is indeterminate, it is not suitable to be the condition of karmic formation.

original: 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa 'du byed dang mtshungs par ldan pa rnams kun gzhi rnam par shes pa la bag chags skyed na ni mi rung ngo //
analyzed: 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa 'du byed dang mtshungs par ldan pa rnams kun gzhi rnam par shes pa la bag chags skyed na ni mi rung ngo //
translated: If the karmic formations that are concomitant with the active forms of consciousness generate the latent ten dencies in the foundation consciousness, this is not suitable.

original: de med na len pa'i rkyen gyis srid pa yang mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de med na len pa'i rkyen gyis srid pa yang mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: If that is not so, then the condition of grasping would not be possible.

original: zhes bya bas ni bag chags kyi gnas skabs kyi las rnam par smin par mngon du phyogs par gyur ba'am /
analyzed: zhes bya bas ni bag chags kyi gnas skabs kyi las rnam par smin par mngon du phyogs par gyur ba'am /
translated: This means that karma in the state of latent tendencies that is about to actualize its karmic maturation

original: 'jug pa rnyed pa ni srid pa ste /
analyzed: 'jug pa rnyed pa ni srid pa ste /
translated: or that has obtained activity is existence.

original: nyid mtshams sbyor ba'i rnam par shes pa ni ma yin no //üîΩ'du byed kyis yongs su bsgos pa'i rnam par shes pa mi 'thad na skye ba'i 'bras @210a * //
analyzed: nyid mtshams sbyor ba'i rnam par shes pa ni ma yin no // 'du byed kyis yongs su bsgos pa'i rnam par shes pa mi 'thad na skye ba'i 'bras @210a * //
translated: It is not the linking consciousness.

original: bu 'byin par mngon du phyogs par gyur pa na las de gang du gnas te srid par 'gyur /
analyzed: bu 'byin par mngon du phyogs par gyur pa na las de gang du gnas te srid par 'gyur /
translated: If the consciousness that is completely suffused by karmic formation is not tenable, then when the result of birth is about to be produced, where does that karma exist and become existence?

original: de ltar bas na kun gzhi rnam par shes pa med na las kyi kun nas nyon mongs pa yang mi rung ngo //
analyzed: de ltar bas na kun gzhi rnam par shes pa med na las kyi kun nas nyon mongs pa yang mi rung ngo //
translated: Thus, if the store-consciousness does not exist, the defilement of action is not possible.

original: da ni nyid mtshams sbyor ba sbrel ba mi rung ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la sogs pas rnam par shes pa gzhan dag la skye ba'i kun nas nyon mongs pa mi srid par ston to //
analyzed: da ni nyid mtshams sbyor ba sbrel ba mi rung ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la sogs pas rnam par shes pa gzhan dag la skye ba'i kun nas nyon mongs pa mi srid par ston to //
translated: Now, in order to demonstrate that the defilement of birth is not possible for the other consciousnesses, he says: because the linking of rebirth is not possible, etc.

original: mnyam par ma bzhag pa'i sa nas zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa'i khams nas so //
analyzed: mnyam par ma bzhag pa'i sa nas zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa'i khams nas so //
translated: From the stage of the non-concentrated, i.e. from the realm of desire.

original: shi 'phos pa'i zhes bya ba ni shi ba'o //
analyzed: shi 'phos pa'i zhes bya ba ni shi ba'o //
translated: At the time of death, i.e. at the time of dying.

original: yid bar mdo'i srid pa na gnas pa zhes bya ba ni shi ba dang skye ba'i srid pa gnyis kyi bar gyi srid pa la gnas pa'i sems so //
analyzed: yid bar mdo'i srid pa na gnas pa zhes bya ba ni shi ba dang skye ba'i srid pa gnyis kyi bar gyi srid pa la gnas pa'i sems so //
translated: The mind that is situated in the intermediate existence between death and birth is the mind that is situated in the intermediate existence between death and birth.

original: yid kyi rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba ni de las gzhan pa'i rnam par shes pa rnams de'i tshe 'gags nas yun ring ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yid kyi rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba ni de las gzhan pa'i rnam par shes pa rnams de'i tshe 'gags nas yun ring ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The mental consciousness, i.e. because the other consciousnesses have long since ceased at that time.

original: nyon mongs pa can zhes bya ba ni rjes su chags pa dang khong khro ba dang ldan pa'i phyir phyin ci log gis so //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa can zhes bya ba ni rjes su chags pa dang khong khro ba dang ldan pa'i phyir phyin ci log gis so //
translated: ‚ÄúAfflicted‚Äù means that it is associated with attachment and hostility, because it is distorted.

original: nying mtshams sbyor ba zhes bya ni nyid mtshams sbyor bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: nying mtshams sbyor ba zhes bya ni nyid mtshams sbyor bar byed pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúLinking‚Äù means that it links one to rebirth.

original: de 'brel pa ni skye ba ste lus yongs su 'dzin pa zhes bya ba'i dang bde ba gcig pas 'dres par gyur nas nur nur por 'gyur te /
analyzed: de 'brel pa ni skye ba ste lus yongs su 'dzin pa zhes bya ba'i dang bde ba gcig pas 'dres par gyur nas nur nur por 'gyur te /
translated: ‚ÄúIts connection‚Äù is birth, which is the full assumption of a body.

original: zhes bya ba ni skye ba'i srid pa la dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni skye ba'i srid pa la dmigs pa'o //
translated: This refers to the observation of the birth existence.

original: bar ma do'i srid par 'gag la zhes bya ba na de ma 'gags na skye ba'i srid pa mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bar ma do'i srid par 'gag la zhes bya ba na de ma 'gags na skye ba'i srid pa mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: ‚ÄúIt ceases in the intermediate existence‚Äù because if it does not cease, the birth existence is not possible.

original: rnam par shes pa yang ma'i mngal du nur nur po nyid brgyal po zhes bya ba ni da 'gag pa dang dus mnyam du khu chu dang khrag dang lhan cig grub pa dang bde ba gcig pas 'dres par gyur nas nur nur por 'gyur te /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa yang ma'i mngal du nur nur po nyid brgyal po zhes bya ba ni da 'gag pa dang dus mnyam du khu chu dang khrag dang lhan cig grub pa dang bde ba gcig pas 'dres par gyur nas nur nur por 'gyur te /
translated: ‚ÄúConsciousness also enters the mother‚Äôs womb as the state of kalala, which is the beginning of the body.‚Äù This means that at the very moment of its cessation, it is mixed with semen and blood, and becomes the state of kalala.

original: ji skad du bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa ;
analyzed: ji skad du bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa ;
translated: As the Lord has said:üîΩ‚ÄúAnanda, if consciousness does not enter the mother‚Äôs womb,

original: kun dga' po gal te rnam par shes pa ma'i mngal du ma zhugs na nur nur po yang nur nur po nyid du chags par mi 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: kun dga' po gal te rnam par shes pa ma'i mngal du ma zhugs na nur nur po yang nur nur po nyid du chags par mi 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: the kalala does not come into existence.‚ÄùüîΩIf that mental consciousness itself were to faint,üîΩthat is, if the store consciousness were to be absent,üîΩthen the mental consciousness would be absent, and the body would be like a piece of wood.üîΩTherefore, the store consciousness is the support of the mental consciousness.

original: gal te yid kyi rnam par shes pa de nyid brgyal na ni zhes bya ba ni kun gzhi rnam par shes pa ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: gal te yid kyi rnam par shes pa de nyid brgyal na ni zhes bya ba ni kun gzhi rnam par shes pa ma yin pa'o //
translated: The mental consciousness is the support of the six consciousnesses of the eye, etc.

original: brgyal bzhes bya ba skyes pa rnam par smin par gyur pa ste /
analyzed: brgyal bzhes bya ba skyes pa rnam par smin par gyur pa ste /
translated: The six consciousnesses are the support of the store consciousness.üîΩThe six consciousnesses are the support of the mental consciousness.üîΩThe six consciousnesses are the support of the mental consciousness.üîΩThe six consciousnesses are the support of the mental consciousness.üîΩThe six consciousnesses are the support of the mental consciousness.

analyzed: de la brten nas gzhan dad pa dang chags pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i dge ba dang mi dge ba dang bde ba dang sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba myong ba dang ldan pa rnam par rtog pa can gyi yid kyi rnam par shes pa phyi ma phyi ma'i
translated: The six consciousnesses are the support of the mental consciousness.üîΩThe six consciousnesses are the support of the mental consciousness.üîΩThe six consciousnesses are the support of the mental consciousness.üîΩThe six consciousnesses are the support of the mental consciousness.üîΩThe six consciousnesses are the support of the mental consciousness.üîΩThe six consciousnesses are the support of the mental consciousness.üîΩThe six consciousnesses are the support of the mental consciousness.üîΩThe six consciousnesses are the support of the mental consciousness.üîΩThe six consciousnesses are the support of the mental consciousness.üîΩThe six consciousnesses are the support of the mental consciousness.üîΩThe six consciousnesses are the support of the mental consciousness.üîΩThe six consciousnesses are the support of the mental consciousness.üîΩThe six consciousnesses are the support of the mental consciousness.üîΩThe six consciousnesses are the support of the mental consciousness.üîΩThe six consciousnesses are the support of the mental consciousness.üîΩThe six consciousnesses are the support of the mental consciousness.üîΩThe six consciousnesses are the support of the mental consciousness.üîΩThe six consciousnesses are the support of the mental consciousness.üîΩThe six consciousnesses are the support of the mental consciousness.üîΩThe six consciousnesses are the support of the mental consciousness.üîΩThe six consciousnesses are the support of the mental consciousness.üîΩThe six consciousnesses are the support of the mental consciousness.üîΩThe six consciousnesses are the support of the mental consciousness.üîΩThe six consciousnesses are the support of the mental consciousness.üîΩThe six consciousnesses are the support of the mental consciousness.

original: gnas skabs rnams su 'byung ngo //
analyzed: gnas skabs rnams su 'byung ngo //
translated: The six consciousnesses are the support of the mental consciousness.üîΩThe

original: des na yid kyi rnam @210b par shes pa gnyis dus gcig tu ma'i mngal du 'jug par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni gang rtsa bar gyur pa ste /
analyzed: des na yid kyi rnam @210b par shes pa gnyis dus gcig tu ma'i mngal du 'jug par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni gang rtsa bar gyur pa ste /
translated: That is the root.

original: sems can gyi rdzas de'i tshe mngon par 'du byed pa la mi ltos pa rnam par smin pa'i bdag nyid can lung du ma bstan pa dmigs pa dang rnam pa yongs su ma chad pa /üîΩbtang snyoms dang mtshungs par ldan pa brgyal ba de dang gang de la brten nas gzhan mngon par 'du byed pa can rnam par smin pa'i rang bzhin ma yin pa dmigs pa dang rnam pa yongs su chad pa bde ba dang sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba dang mtshungs
analyzed: sems can gyi rdzas de'i tshe mngon par 'du byed pa la mi ltos pa rnam par smin pa'i bdag nyid can lung du ma bstan pa dmigs pa dang rnam pa yongs su ma chad pa / btang snyoms dang mtshungs par ldan pa brgyal ba de dang gang de la brten nas gzhan mngon par 'du byed pa can rnam par smin pa'i rang bzhin ma yin pa dmigs pa dang rnam pa yongs su chad pa bde ba dang sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba dang mtshungs
translated: That sentient being‚Äôs substance is independent of formation, is the nature of karmic maturation, is neutral, and is not fully determined in terms of its focal object and aspect.üîΩIt is concomitant with equanimity and is unconscious.

original: par ldan pa'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa ste /
analyzed: par ldan pa'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa ste /
translated: That is the basis for the other mental consciousness that is concomitant with the feeling of either pleasure or pain, is not the nature of karmic maturation, and is fully determined in terms of its focal object and aspect.

original: de ni mdo dang 'gal ba'i phyir mi 'dod do //
analyzed: de ni mdo dang 'gal ba'i phyir mi 'dod do //
translated: That is not asserted because it contradicts the s≈´tras.

original: khyed ni 'di skad 'don te rnam par shes pa gnyis snga phyi med par 'byung ba ni gnas ma yin zhes go skabs med do zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: khyed ni 'di skad 'don te rnam par shes pa gnyis snga phyi med par 'byung ba ni gnas ma yin zhes go skabs med do zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: You say this: ‚ÄúIt is not possible for two consciousnesses to occur without a prior and a subsequent. There is no opportunity for that.‚Äù

original: de gnyis ni gcig pa nyid du yang mi 'thad de rang bzhin tha dad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de gnyis ni gcig pa nyid du yang mi 'thad de rang bzhin tha dad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not tenable that those two are identical because their natures are different.

original: rnam par smin pa rgyun chad na ni srog gi rgyun chad par 'gyur ro ;
analyzed: rnam par smin pa rgyun chad na ni srog gi rgyun chad par 'gyur ro ;
translated: If the maturation were interrupted, the continuum of life would be interrupted.

original: / rnam par smin pa med na 'gro ba yang med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: / rnam par smin pa med na 'gro ba yang med par 'gyur ro //
translated: If there were no maturation, there would be no transmigration.

original: yid kyi rnam par shes pa brgyal ba de ni yid kyi rnam par shes pa nyid du mi rigs te /
analyzed: yid kyi rnam par shes pa brgyal ba de ni yid kyi rnam par shes pa nyid du mi rigs te /
translated: It is not logical that the unconsciousness of fainting is mental consciousness itself.

original: dus rtag tu nyon mongs pa can nyid gnas yin pa zhes bya ba ni dam bca' ba'i don gyi skyon chos can gyi rang gi ngo bo nyid las bzlog pa ston to //
analyzed: dus rtag tu nyon mongs pa can nyid gnas yin pa zhes bya ba ni dam bca' ba'i don gyi skyon chos can gyi rang gi ngo bo nyid las bzlog pa ston to //
translated: The fault in the meaning of the thesis is shown by the reversal of the intrinsic reality of the subject: ‚ÄúIt is not the case that it is always afflicted.‚Äù

original: gang yid kyi rnam par shes pa nyid du gnyi ga la nges pa de ni rtag tu nyon mongs pa can gnas ma yin te /
analyzed: gang yid kyi rnam par shes pa nyid du gnyi ga la nges pa de ni rtag tu nyon mongs pa can gnas ma yin te /
translated: That which is ascertained as both mental consciousness and always afflicted is not the case.

original: dper na dus phyi ma la 'byung ba'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa bzhin no //üîΩnyid mtshams sbyor ba'i sems thams cad ni thams cad nas thams cad du nyon mongs pa gnas yin te /
analyzed: dper na dus phyi ma la 'byung ba'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa bzhin no // nyid mtshams sbyor ba'i sems thams cad ni thams cad nas thams cad du nyon mongs pa gnas yin te /
translated: For example, it is like the mental consciousness that will occur in the future.

original: bar ma do'i srid pas bsdus pa'i gnas skye ba'i srid pa la dmigs pa ni thams cad na rtag par nyon mongs pa can yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bar ma do'i srid pas bsdus pa'i gnas skye ba'i srid pa la dmigs pa ni thams cad na rtag par nyon mongs pa can yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: All minds of rebirth are defiled, because the mind of rebirth that is included in the intermediate existence always focuses on the existence at birth, which is always defiled.

original: de ltar na yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i chos las 'das pa'i phyir de yid kyi rnam par shes par mi rung ngo //
analyzed: de ltar na yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i chos las 'das pa'i phyir de yid kyi rnam par shes par mi rung ngo //
translated: Thus, because it is beyond the realm of mental consciousness, it is not suitable as mental consciousness.

original: yang na nyon mongs pa bzhi dang mtshungs par ldan pa nyon mongs pa can gnas yin pa'i phyir nyid mtshams sbyor ba'i sems nyon mongs pa can du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yang na nyon mongs pa bzhi dang mtshungs par ldan pa nyon mongs pa can gnas yin pa'i phyir nyid mtshams sbyor ba'i sems nyon mongs pa can du 'gyur ro //
translated: Or else, the mind of rebirth would be defiled because it is defiled and it is concomitant with the four defilements.

original: rnam par smin pa yin pa'i phyir de ni lung du ma bstan par yang 'dod do //
analyzed: rnam par smin pa yin pa'i phyir de ni lung du ma bstan par yang 'dod do //
translated: It is also asserted to be neutral because it is karmic maturation.

original: nyon mongs pa can gyi yid ni bsgrubs zin to snyam du bsams pa'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa can gyi yid ni bsgrubs zin to snyam du bsams pa'o //
translated: The defiled mind has already been established.

original: rnam par smin pa nyid kyang bkag ste /üîΩyid kyi rnam @211a * //
analyzed: rnam par smin pa nyid kyang bkag ste / yid kyi rnam @211a * //
translated: The ripening itself is also refuted.

original: par shes pa 'ba' zhig bkag pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: par shes pa 'ba' zhig bkag pa ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not that only the mental consciousness is refuted.üîΩBecause the object of the mental consciousness is not an object.

original: yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i dmigs pa la mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni de'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa ma yin zhes bya ba de nyid kyi gtan tshigs kyis gnon no //
analyzed: yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i dmigs pa la mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni de'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa ma yin zhes bya ba de nyid kyi gtan tshigs kyis gnon no //
translated: This is the same argument as ‚Äúit is not the mental consciousness of that.‚Äù

original: gang bdag cag gnyi ga la yid kyi rnam par shes par nges pa de ni rang gi dmigs pa la dmigs shing yongs su gcod de /
analyzed: gang bdag cag gnyi ga la yid kyi rnam par shes par nges pa de ni rang gi dmigs pa la dmigs shing yongs su gcod de /
translated: That which is ascertained as the mental consciousness for both of us definitely has an object and determines it.

original: dper na phyi ma'i gnas skabs gzhan na 'byung ba'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa bzhin te /
analyzed: dper na phyi ma'i gnas skabs gzhan na 'byung ba'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa bzhin te /
translated: For example, like the mental consciousness that occurs in another state later.

original: 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa rnams yul so sor rnam par rig pa'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa rnams yul so sor rnam par rig pa'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the active consciousnesses are characterized by the awareness of individual objects.

original: nyid mtshams sbyor ba'i sems ni de ltar dmigs pa yongs su mi gcod pa ma yin pas de yid kyi rnam par shes pa ma yin no //
analyzed: nyid mtshams sbyor ba'i sems ni de ltar dmigs pa yongs su mi gcod pa ma yin pas de yid kyi rnam par shes pa ma yin no //
translated: The consciousness at conception is not like that, since it does not determine its object. Therefore it is not the mental consciousness.

original: 'dir 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa'i sems dang mtshungs par phyir brgal du yang mi rung ste /
analyzed: 'dir 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa'i sems dang mtshungs par phyir brgal du yang mi rung ste /
translated: It is also not suitable to be the mind of entry into the meditative attainment of cessation because

original: de ni yid kyi rnam par shes pa nyid du khas mi len pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni yid kyi rnam par shes pa nyid du khas mi len pa'i phyir ro //
translated: that is not accepted as a mental consciousness.

original: de lta bas na 'dir ni dmigs pa la mi dmigs pa yongs su mi gcod pa yin gyi med pa nyid ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de lta bas na 'dir ni dmigs pa la mi dmigs pa yongs su mi gcod pa yin gyi med pa nyid ni ma yin te /
translated: Therefore, here the nonapprehension of an object is not the nonapprehension of something that exists but the nonapprehension of something that does not exist.

original: 'di ltar de'i tshe chos med pa ni ma yin gyi /
analyzed: 'di ltar de'i tshe chos med pa ni ma yin gyi /
translated: Because at that time phenomena do not not exist.

original: yod bzhin du yongs su mi gcod do //
analyzed: yod bzhin du yongs su mi gcod do //
translated: They exist but are not apprehended.

original: yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i gnas mig la sogs pa yongs su ma rdzogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i gnas mig la sogs pa yongs su ma rdzogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the eyes and so on that are the basis of the mental consciousness are incomplete.

original: yid kyi rnam par shes pa de brgyal ba yin du chug na yang zhes bya ba nas bzung ste /
analyzed: yid kyi rnam par shes pa de brgyal ba yin du chug na yang zhes bya ba nas bzung ste /
translated: Even if that mental consciousness is unconscious,

original: de'i rnam par smin pa'i rnam par shes pa sa bon thams cad pa'o //üîΩzhes bya ba der grub po zhes bya ba'i bar de ni mjug sdud pa ste /
analyzed: de'i rnam par smin pa'i rnam par shes pa sa bon thams cad pa'o // zhes bya ba der grub po zhes bya ba'i bar de ni mjug sdud pa ste /
translated: the consciousness that is its result is the all-seeds resultant consciousness.üîΩThis is the conclusion.

original: go sla bas ma bshad do //
analyzed: go sla bas ma bshad do //
translated: Because it is easy to understand, it is not explained.

original: nyid mtshams sbyor ba sprel zin pa rnams kyi zhes bya ba ni lus thob pa rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: nyid mtshams sbyor ba sprel zin pa rnams kyi zhes bya ba ni lus thob pa rnams kyi'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThose who have already taken rebirth‚Äù means those who have obtained a body.

original: dbang po gzugs can zhes bya ba ni yid ma gtogs pa'o //
analyzed: dbang po gzugs can zhes bya ba ni yid ma gtogs pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúHaving material faculties‚Äù means excluding the mental faculty.

original: 'dzin par byed pa zhes bya ba ni yongs su 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: 'dzin par byed pa zhes bya ba ni yongs su 'dzin pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúSeizing‚Äù means grasping.

original: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa la ma gtogs pa de las gzhan zhes bya ba ni 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa'o //
analyzed: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa la ma gtogs pa de las gzhan zhes bya ba ni 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúOther than that‚Äù means excluding the storehouse consciousness, the active forms of consciousness.

original: ji lta zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta zhe na /
translated: How is that?

original: gnas so sor nges pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: gnas so sor nges pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ste /
translated: ‚ÄúBecause of the restriction of the location.‚Äù

original: de mig la sogs pa drug po dag go //
analyzed: de mig la sogs pa drug po dag go //
translated: That is, the six beginning with the eye.

original: 'dis ni 'dzin par byed pa gcig pu med par ston to //
analyzed: 'dis ni 'dzin par byed pa gcig pu med par ston to //
translated: This shows that there is no single appropriator.

original: mig gi rnam par shes pa'i gnas ni mig nyid yin no //
analyzed: mig gi rnam par shes pa'i gnas ni mig nyid yin no //
translated: The location of the eye consciousness is the eye itself.

original: de bzhin du rna ba la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa rnams kya gnas kyang rna ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du rna ba la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa rnams kya gnas kyang rna ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: In the same way, the location of the ear consciousness is the ear, etc.

original: gang gi gnas gang @211b yin pa de nyid kyis de 'dzin par mi rung ngo //
analyzed: gang gi gnas gang @211b yin pa de nyid kyis de 'dzin par mi rung ngo //
translated: It is not possible for that which is the location of something to be that which appropriates it.

original: mi brtan pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni g-yo ba'i phyir zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
analyzed: mi brtan pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni g-yo ba'i phyir zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
translated: Because it is unstable means because it is unsteady.

original: yud tsam yud tsam la bar chad dang bcas par 'tshol bar 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yud tsam yud tsam la bar chad dang bcas par 'tshol bar 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it arises as a search that is interrupted from moment to moment.

original: 'du shes med pa la sogs par yang rgyun chad pas mig la sogs pa zin pa rnams kyang rgyun chad par 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'du shes med pa la sogs par yang rgyun chad pas mig la sogs pa zin pa rnams kyang rgyun chad par 'gyur te /
translated: Also, the eyes, etc., that are appropriated would be interrupted, because the stream is interrupted in the state of nonperception, etc.

original: dper na shi ba'i lus kun gzhi rnam par shes pas btang ba rnams bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na shi ba'i lus kun gzhi rnam par shes pas btang ba rnams bzhin no //
translated: For example, like the body of a dead person that is abandoned by the foundation consciousness.

original: gal te lus kyi dbang pos khog pa zin te khyab pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: gal te lus kyi dbang pos khog pa zin te khyab pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: If you say that the eyes, etc., are not interrupted because the body faculty appropriates and pervades the body,

original: de yang mi rung ste /
analyzed: de yang mi rung ste /
translated: that is not correct.

original: lus kyi dbang po yang gzung bar bya ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lus kyi dbang po yang gzung bar bya ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the body faculty is also an object to be appropriated.

original: gal te de 'dzin par byed pa yin na ni ma zin par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gal te de 'dzin par byed pa yin na ni ma zin par 'gyur te /
translated: If it is the appropriator, it would not be appropriated,

original: 'dzin pa gzhan med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dzin pa gzhan med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there would be no other appropriator.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang lus kyi dbang po yongs su btang bas 'chi bar 'gyur gyi rnam par shes pa yongs su btang bas ni ma yin no zhes gsungs pa'i rigs na /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang lus kyi dbang po yongs su btang bas 'chi bar 'gyur gyi rnam par shes pa yongs su btang bas ni ma yin no zhes gsungs pa'i rigs na /
translated: The BhagavƒÅn also said, ‚ÄúDeath occurs through the complete cessation of the body faculty, not through the complete cessation of consciousness.‚Äù

original: tshe dang drod dang rnam par shes //üîΩ'di dag gang tshe lus 'dor zhing //
analyzed: tshe dang drod dang rnam par shes // 'di dag gang tshe lus 'dor zhing //
translated: Life, heat, and consciousnessüîΩWhen these leave the body,

original: bor nas de tshe 'dug pa ni //
analyzed: bor nas de tshe 'dug pa ni //
translated: then the body lies discarded,

original: dper na shing la sems med bzhin //üîΩzhes kyang gsungs so //
analyzed: dper na shing la sems med bzhin // zhes kyang gsungs so //
translated: like a piece of wood devoid of feeling.

original: de lta bas na lus kye dbang po ni 'dzin par byed par mi rigs so //
analyzed: de lta bas na lus kye dbang po ni 'dzin par byed par mi rigs so //
translated: Therefore it is not reasonable that the body faculty is the appropriator.

original: rnam par shes pa dang ming dang gzugs mdung kham ltar gcig la gcig brten pa'i tshul gyis 'jug pa gang yin pa de yang rnam par smin pa'i rnam par shes pa med na ni mi rung ngo zhes bya ba ni bcom ldan 'das kyis rnam par shes pa'i
analyzed: rnam par shes pa dang ming dang gzugs mdung kham ltar gcig la gcig brten pa'i tshul gyis 'jug pa gang yin pa de yang rnam par smin pa'i rnam par shes pa med na ni mi rung ngo zhes bya ba ni bcom ldan 'das kyis rnam par shes pa'i
translated: Also, the engagement of consciousness and name-and-form in the manner of mutual support, like a pair of oxen yoked to a single harness, is not tenable if there is no consciousness that is the result of karmic maturation.

original: rkyen gyis ming dang gzugs zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: rkyen gyis ming dang gzugs zhes gsungs te /
translated: The BhagavƒÅn said, ‚ÄúConditioned by consciousness is name-and-form.‚Äù

original: de la ming ni gzugs can ma yin pa'i phung po bzhi'o //
analyzed: de la ming ni gzugs can ma yin pa'i phung po bzhi'o //
translated: Name is the four aggregates that are not form.

original: gzugs ni nur nur po'o //
analyzed: gzugs ni nur nur po'o //
translated: Form is the embryo.

original: 'di gnyis kyi rkyen rnam par shes pa gang yin pa skad cig gcig nas gcig tu brgyud de gnas nyid du gyur pa de yang kun gzhi rnam par shes pa las gzhan ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di gnyis kyi rkyen rnam par shes pa gang yin pa skad cig gcig nas gcig tu brgyud de gnas nyid du gyur pa de yang kun gzhi rnam par shes pa las gzhan ma yin no //
translated: The consciousness that is the condition of these two is the transformation of the life-stream, and that is not other than the store-consciousness.

original: ming smos pas ni 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa bzung na rnam par shes pa smos pas ci zhig gtso bor bstan par 'gyur /
analyzed: ming smos pas ni 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa bzung na rnam par shes pa smos pas ci zhig gtso bor bstan par 'gyur /
translated: If the consciousness that is mentioned in the verse is taken as the operative consciousness, what is the point of mentioning the store-consciousness?

original: rnam par shes pa las ni bdag gi yid bzlog na rnam par shes pa las 'das pa ni ma yin no zhes gang gsungs pa de yang kun gzhi rnam par shes pa yod na 'thad de /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa las ni bdag gi yid bzlog na rnam par shes pa las 'das pa ni ma yin no zhes gang gsungs pa de yang kun gzhi rnam par shes pa yod na 'thad de /
translated: The statement, ‚ÄúThe self is turned away from consciousness, but not from the transcendence of consciousness,‚Äù is tenable only if the store-consciousness exists.

original: 'di ltar de ni lus kyi gnas nyid du rgyun mi 'chad par 'jug go //
analyzed: 'di ltar de ni lus kyi gnas nyid du rgyun mi 'chad par 'jug go //
translated: Thus, it is the basis of the body and it functions without interruption.

original: de nyid kyi phyir de ming dang gzugs kyi rkyen du gsungs te /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir de ming dang gzugs kyi rkyen du gsungs te /
translated: Therefore, it is said to be the condition of name-and-form,

original: des lus la khyab pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: des lus la khyab pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it pervades the body.

original: kun dga' bo gzhon nu'am @212a * //
analyzed: kun dga' bo gzhon nu'am @212a * //
translated: Ananda, the consciousness of a young boy or girl

original: gzhon nu ma'i rnam par shes pa gal te rgyun chad cing 'gags kyang ming dang gzugs de 'phel zhing rgyas pa dang yangs par 'gyur ram /
analyzed: gzhon nu ma'i rnam par shes pa gal te rgyun chad cing 'gags kyang ming dang gzugs de 'phel zhing rgyas pa dang yangs par 'gyur ram /
translated: if it were to be cut off and cease, would the name and form increase, grow, and expand?üîΩThe Bhagavat said, ‚ÄúNo, it would not.‚Äù

original: bcom ldan 'das de ni mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa gang gsungs pa de yang kun gzhi rnam par shes pa med na mi 'thad do //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das de ni mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa gang gsungs pa de yang kun gzhi rnam par shes pa med na mi 'thad do //
translated: That is not tenable if there is no foundation consciousness.

original: rnam par shes pa gzhan ni sems can 'byung po rnams kyi zas su yang mi rung ste /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa gzhan ni sems can 'byung po rnams kyi zas su yang mi rung ste /
translated: Other consciousnesses are not suitable as food for sentient beings.

original: zhes bya ba ni 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa ste /
translated: This refers to the active consciousnesses.

original: snyoms par 'jug pa gnyis dang 'du shes pa na med pas ma khyab pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: snyoms par 'jug pa gnyis dang 'du shes pa na med pas ma khyab pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the two meditative states of composure and the state of nondiscernment are not pervaded by it.

original: zas med par ni khams gsum na spyod pa'i gnas pa med do //üîΩsnyoms par 'jug pa'i sems dang sems las byung ba 'gog pa ni zas su mdo las ma gsungs te /
analyzed: zas med par ni khams gsum na spyod pa'i gnas pa med do // snyoms par 'jug pa'i sems dang sems las byung ba 'gog pa ni zas su mdo las ma gsungs te /
translated: Without food, there is no abiding in the three realms.

original: kham gyi zas la sogs pa grangs nges pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: kham gyi zas la sogs pa grangs nges pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The sutras do not mention the cessation of mind and mental factors in the meditative states of composure as food because the number of foods such as oral food is fixed.

original: de ltar re zhig kun gzhi rnam par shes pa med na 'dod pa'i khams su nyid mtshams sbyor ba sprel ba mi rung ba'i 'thad pa bstan nas //
analyzed: de ltar re zhig kun gzhi rnam par shes pa med na 'dod pa'i khams su nyid mtshams sbyor ba sprel ba mi rung ba'i 'thad pa bstan nas //
translated: Thus, having demonstrated the untenability of linking in the desire realm if there is no foundation consciousness,

original: 'di nas shi 'phos te mnyam par gzhag pa'i sar skye ba na zhes bya ba la sogs pas gzugs dang gzugs med pa rnams su yang de mi rigs pa'i 'thad pa ston te /
analyzed: 'di nas shi 'phos te mnyam par gzhag pa'i sar skye ba na zhes bya ba la sogs pas gzugs dang gzugs med pa rnams su yang de mi rigs pa'i 'thad pa ston te /
translated: from here on, when one dies and is born in the stage of meditative equipoise, etc., he demonstrates the untenability of that in the form and formless realms.

original: 'dod pa'i khams su shi nas gong du skye ba na zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams su shi nas gong du skye ba na zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Dying in the desire realm and being born above is what is meant by ‚Äúwhen one dies and is born in the stage of meditative equipoise.‚Äù

original: yid kyi rnam par shes pa nyon mongs pa can zhes bya ba ni de'i sa pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa'i ro myang ba'i nyon mongs pa dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: yid kyi rnam par shes pa nyon mongs pa can zhes bya ba ni de'i sa pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa'i ro myang ba'i nyon mongs pa dang ldan pa'o //
translated: Afflicted mental consciousness means that it is associated with the affliction of relishing the taste of meditative equipoise of that stage.

original: sa bon dang ldan pa gzhan mi 'thad do zhes bya ba la 'dod pa na spyod pa'i sems ni sa bon dang ldan pa ma yin te /
analyzed: sa bon dang ldan pa gzhan mi 'thad do zhes bya ba la 'dod pa na spyod pa'i sems ni sa bon dang ldan pa ma yin te /
translated: It is untenable that another possesses the seeds means that a mind operating in the desire realm does not possess the seeds.

original: lhan cig 'byung ba dang 'gag pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lhan cig 'byung ba dang 'gag pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it does not arise or cease simultaneously.

original: mnyam par gzhag pa'i sems kyang sa bon dang ldan pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: mnyam par gzhag pa'i sems kyang sa bon dang ldan pa yang ma yin te /
translated: The mind in meditative equipoise also does not possess the seed,

original: gcig nyid sa bon dang sa bon can gyi dngos por mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gcig nyid sa bon dang sa bon can gyi dngos por mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not possible for one thing to be both a seed and that which possesses the seed.

original: gzugs na spyod pa'i sems tshe rabs gzhan na thob pa yang sa bon du mi rung ste /
analyzed: gzugs na spyod pa'i sems tshe rabs gzhan na thob pa yang sa bon du mi rung ste /
translated: The mind that occurs in the form realm and is obtained in other lives is also not suitable as a seed,

original: bag chags kyi kun gzhi rnam par shes pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bag chags kyi kun gzhi rnam par shes pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there is no store consciousness that is the permeation.

original: gzugs kyi rgyud kyang sa bon can ma yin te /
analyzed: gzugs kyi rgyud kyang sa bon can ma yin te /
translated: The stream of form also does not possess the seed,

original: gzugs khas mi len pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzugs khas mi len pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because form is not accepted.

original: de lta bas na thog ma med pa'i dus can de'i sa pa'i sems gang la bag chags gnas pa'i kun gzhi rnam par shes pa la nges par gnas bca' par bya'o //
analyzed: de lta bas na thog ma med pa'i dus can de'i sa pa'i sems gang la bag chags gnas pa'i kun gzhi rnam par shes pa la nges par gnas bca' par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, the store consciousness must definitely be established as the consciousness in which the permeations of the seeds of the minds of that stage exist from beginningless time.

original: yang gzugs med pa'i khams su skyes pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: yang gzugs med pa'i khams su skyes pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúborn in the formless realm‚Äù and so on means that

original: nyon mongs pa can gyi dge ba'i @212b sems yod pa rnams kyi zhes bya ba ni snyoms par 'jug pa'i ro myang ba rnams kyi nyon mongs pa can gyi dge ba'i sems kyang gzhi med par 'gyur te /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa can gyi dge ba'i @212b sems yod pa rnams kyi zhes bya ba ni snyoms par 'jug pa'i ro myang ba rnams kyi nyon mongs pa can gyi dge ba'i sems kyang gzhi med par 'gyur te /
translated: Their afflicted virtuous minds would be without a basis,

original: rnam par smin pa med ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: rnam par smin pa med ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: because they would be without karmic maturation.

original: de'i tshe na sems dang sems las byung ba thams cad ni de'i dngos por 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i tshe na sems dang sems las byung ba thams cad ni de'i dngos por 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because at that time all minds and mental factors would be its entity.

original: de lta bas na de'i gzhi rnam par smin pa'i rnam par shes pa nges par khas blang bar bya'o //
analyzed: de lta bas na de'i gzhi rnam par smin pa'i rnam par shes pa nges par khas blang bar bya'o //
translated: Therefore, you definitely must accept that the basis of those minds is the karmic maturation of consciousness.üîΩIn the formless realm, the phrase ‚Äúin that state‚Äù refers to the state of manifesting the transcendent, uncontaminated mind.

original: de nyid na zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gzugs med pa rnams su 'jig rten las 'das pa'i sems zag pa med pa de mngon du byed de de skyes pa na gang zag pa med pa de las gzhan pa'i sems 'jig rten pa 'byung ba ni medüîΩpar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de nyid na zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gzugs med pa rnams su 'jig rten las 'das pa'i sems zag pa med pa de mngon du byed de de skyes pa na gang zag pa med pa de las gzhan pa'i sems 'jig rten pa 'byung ba ni medüîΩpar 'gyur te /
translated: When that mind arises, there is no other worldly mind that is different from that uncontaminated mind.

original: 'gags pa na 'gro bas bsdus pa'i rnam par smin pa med pas 'gro ba de ldog pa nyid du 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'gags pa na 'gro bas bsdus pa'i rnam par smin pa med pas 'gro ba de ldog pa nyid du 'gyur te /
translated: Since it is stopped, since it is not included in going, it would be stopped, since it does not have the karmic maturation that is included in going.

original: gnyen po mngon sum du gyur na mi mthun pa'i phyogs thams cad spangs pa'i phyir bsgrim mi dgos par phung po lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa thob par 'gyur ro //üîΩ'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched du skyes pa rnams kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gang gi tshe srid pa'i rtse mor skyes pa dag nyon mongs pa rnams par spang du zhen pa'i phyir rang gi sa pa'i lam med pas ci yang med
analyzed: gnyen po mngon sum du gyur na mi mthun pa'i phyogs thams cad spangs pa'i phyir bsgrim mi dgos par phung po lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa thob par 'gyur ro // 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched du skyes pa rnams kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gang gi tshe srid pa'i rtse mor skyes pa dag nyon mongs pa rnams par spang du zhen pa'i phyir rang gi sa pa'i lam med pas ci yang med
translated: When the antidote is manifest, all opposing factors are abandoned, so without needing to make an effort, one attains nirvana without remainder of the aggregates.

original: pa'i skye mched kyi sa pa'i zag pa med pa'i sems gsal ba mngon du byed do //
analyzed: pa'i skye mched kyi sa pa'i zag pa med pa'i sems gsal ba mngon du byed do //
translated: Also those born in the base of neither discernment nor nondiscernment and so on means that when those born in the summit of existence manifest the clear uncontaminated mind of the base of nothingness, since they are attached to the abandonment of afflictions, they do not manifest the path of their own level.

original: de'i tshe de rnams kyi 'gro ba gnyi ga ldog par 'gyur zhes bya ba ni srid pa'i rtse mo dang / ci yang med pa'i skye mched kyi 'gro ba gnyi ga las ldog par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de'i tshe de rnams kyi 'gro ba gnyi ga ldog par 'gyur zhes bya ba ni srid pa'i rtse mo dang / ci yang med pa'i skye mched kyi 'gro ba gnyi ga las ldog par 'gyur te /
translated: Both destinies of the peak of existence and the base of nothingness would cease,

original: de gnyis kyi gnas med par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de gnyis kyi gnas med par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because there would be no basis for those two.

original: zag pa med pa'i chos ni 'gro bar gtogs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: zag pa med pa'i chos ni 'gro bar gtogs pa ma yin te /
translated: Uncontaminated states do not belong to a destiny,

original: ldan pa ma yin pa dang 'gro ba'i gnyen por 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ldan pa ma yin pa dang 'gro ba'i gnyen por 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are not concomitant with the mind and they are the antidote to destinies.üîΩAlso, nirvana is not a suitable basis for a destiny,

original: mya ngan las 'das pa'i 'gro ba yang gnas su mi rung ngo zhes bya ba ni phung po'i lhag ma dang bcas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings kyi gnas skabs yin pa dang / 'gro ba thams cad log pa'i phyir mya ngan las 'das pa ni 'gro ba ma yin te /
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa'i 'gro ba yang gnas su mi rung ngo zhes bya ba ni phung po'i lhag ma dang bcas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings kyi gnas skabs yin pa dang / 'gro ba thams cad log pa'i phyir mya ngan las 'das pa ni 'gro ba ma yin te /
translated: because nirvana is not a destiny since it is the state of the sphere of nirvana that has the remainder of the aggregates and because all destinies cease.

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i rnam par shes pa gnas mya ngan las 'das pa'i 'gro ba'i lus rnam par smin par gyur pa ni gang yang med do //
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i rnam par shes pa gnas mya ngan las 'das pa'i 'gro ba'i lus rnam par smin par gyur pa ni gang yang med do //
translated: There is no other consciousness that transcends the world, that is the body of those who go to the destination of nirvana.üîΩThe destination of the arhats is nirvana.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa ni dgra bcom pa rnams kyi 'gro ba'o zhes gang gsungs pa ni brten pa la der 'gro ba'i sgrar brjod do //üîΩlegs par byed pa'am nyes par @213a * //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa ni dgra bcom pa rnams kyi 'gro ba'o zhes gang gsungs pa ni brten pa la der 'gro ba'i sgrar brjod do // legs par byed pa'am nyes par @213a * //
translated: The word ‚Äúgo‚Äù is used figuratively for the support.üîΩWhen they die and transmigrate, those who have done good deeds

original: byed pa 'chi 'pho ba na zhes bya ba la sogs pa la legs par byed pa rnams ni lus kyi smad nas rim gyis drod yal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: byed pa 'chi 'pho ba na zhes bya ba la sogs pa la legs par byed pa rnams ni lus kyi smad nas rim gyis drod yal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: and those who have done bad deeds, the heat in their lower bodies

original: nyes par byed pa rnams ni lus kyi stod nas drod yal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nyes par byed pa rnams ni lus kyi stod nas drod yal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: and the heat in their upper bodies gradually disappears.

original: de lta bas na de yang kun gzhi rnam par shes pa med na mi 'thad de /
analyzed: de lta bas na de yang kun gzhi rnam par shes pa med na mi 'thad de /
translated: Therefore, that also is not tenable without the store consciousness.

original: de'i tshe gang na yang yid kyi rnam par shes pa med pas ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i tshe gang na yang yid kyi rnam par shes pa med pas ni ma yin no //
translated: At that time, it is not because the mental consciousness does not exist anywhere.

original: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa ni med par mi rigs so //
analyzed: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa ni med par mi rigs so //
translated: It is not reasonable that the store consciousness does not exist.

original: de ltar kun nas nyon mongs pa rnam par gsum mi srid par bstan nas 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa rnams la 'jig rten pa'i rnam par byang ba mi srid par ston te /
analyzed: de ltar kun nas nyon mongs pa rnam par gsum mi srid par bstan nas 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa rnams la 'jig rten pa'i rnam par byang ba mi srid par ston te /
translated: Thus, having taught that the three kinds of thorough affliction are impossible, he teaches that mundane purification is impossible for the engaging consciousnesses.

original: 'di ltar 'dod pa rnams las 'dod chags dang ma bral ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa nas gzugs na spyod pa'i sems 'das pa tshe rabs du mar sems gzhan gyis bar du bcad pa de yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar 'dod pa rnams las 'dod chags dang ma bral ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa nas gzugs na spyod pa'i sems 'das pa tshe rabs du mar sems gzhan gyis bar du bcad pa de yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: Thus, ‚Äúone who is not free from attachment to the desire realm‚Äù and so on, and ‚Äúthe past mind of the form realm that is interrupted by other minds over many lifetimes‚Äù and so on.

original: thog ma med pa'i 'khor ba na tshe rabs gzhan na thob pa'i gzugs na spyod pa'i sems gang yin pa de ni sa bon ma yin te /
analyzed: thog ma med pa'i 'khor ba na tshe rabs gzhan na thob pa'i gzugs na spyod pa'i sems gang yin pa de ni sa bon ma yin te /
translated: The mind of the form realm obtained in other lifetimes in beginningless cyclic existence is not a seed.

original: 'di ltar de ni tshe rabs du mar 'dod pa na spyod pa'i sems du mas bar du chod pas mdo sde pa'i gzhung ltar na med de 'das pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar de ni tshe rabs du mar 'dod pa na spyod pa'i sems du mas bar du chod pas mdo sde pa'i gzhung ltar na med de 'das pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Thus, since it is interrupted by many minds of the desire realm over many lifetimes, it does not exist according to the SautrƒÅntika system because it is past.

original: med pa ni gzugs na spyod pa'i sems kyi sa bon du yang mi rung ngo //
analyzed: med pa ni gzugs na spyod pa'i sems kyi sa bon du yang mi rung ngo //
translated: And that which does not exist is not suitable as a seed of the mind of the form realm.

original: de bzhin du 'dod chags dang bral ba nyid kyis thams cad la yang ci rigs su sbyar bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni snga ma dang mthun par sbyar ba'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du 'dod chags dang bral ba nyid kyis thams cad la yang ci rigs su sbyar bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni snga ma dang mthun par sbyar ba'o //
translated: This is the application in accordance with the former.

original: ci rigs par zhes bya ba ni gang la gang rigs pa'o //
analyzed: ci rigs par zhes bya ba ni gang la gang rigs pa'o //
translated: The appropriate manner means whatever is appropriate.üîΩTherefore, etc.

original: de lta bas na zhes bya ba la sogs pa nas gang sa bon thams cad pa rnam par smin pa'i rnam par shes pa gcig nas gcig tu brgyud de 'ongs pa de ni gzugs na spyod pa'i mnyam par gzhag pa'i sems de'i rgyu'i rkyen yin la /
analyzed: de lta bas na zhes bya ba la sogs pa nas gang sa bon thams cad pa rnam par smin pa'i rnam par shes pa gcig nas gcig tu brgyud de 'ongs pa de ni gzugs na spyod pa'i mnyam par gzhag pa'i sems de'i rgyu'i rkyen yin la /
translated: The cause condition of that form realm mind of meditative equipoise is that consciousness that is the ripening of all seeds that has come from the past through a continuous series.üîΩThe dominant condition of that virtuous mind derived from preparation is established.

original: sbyor ba las byung ba'i dge ba'i sems de ni bdag po'i rkyen yin par de grub bo zhes bya ba'i bar ni 'dir lus pa dag shugs kyis de ltar 'gyur bas kun gzhi rnam par shes pa yod par mjug bsdus bsngal nas de ni rgyu'i can yin la
analyzed: sbyor ba las byung ba'i dge ba'i sems de ni bdag po'i rkyen yin par de grub bo zhes bya ba'i bar ni 'dir lus pa dag shugs kyis de ltar 'gyur bas kun gzhi rnam par shes pa yod par mjug bsdus bsngal nas de ni rgyu'i can yin la
translated: Up to this point, since the remaining are implied, the existence of foundation consciousness is concluded.

original: / 'dod pa na spyod pa'i sbyor ba las byung ba'i dge ba'i sems ni bdag po'i rkyen yin par bstan te /
