analyzed: / 'dod pa na spyod pa'i sbyor ba las byung ba'i dge ba'i sems ni bdag po'i rkyen yin par bstan te /
translated: The virtuous mind of the desire realm that arises from preparation is the dominant condition.

original: thun mong ma yin pa'i rgyu yin pa dang mthu lhag ma'i phyir go rims bzhin no //
analyzed: thun mong ma yin pa'i rgyu yin pa dang mthu lhag ma'i phyir go rims bzhin no //
translated: It is the uncommon cause and the superior power, respectively.

original: da ni 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa rnams la 'jig rten las 'das pa'i rnam par byang ba mi srid par ston te /
analyzed: da ni 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa rnams la 'jig rten las 'das pa'i rnam par byang ba mi srid par ston te /
translated: Now, it is shown that supramundane purification is impossible for the active consciousnesses.

original: gzhan gyi sgra dang so @213b so rang gi tshul bzhin yid la byed pa la brten nas de'i rgyu las yang dag pa'i lta ba 'byung ngo zhes bya ba nas bzung ste /
analyzed: gzhan gyi sgra dang so @213b so rang gi tshul bzhin yid la byed pa la brten nas de'i rgyu las yang dag pa'i lta ba 'byung ngo zhes bya ba nas bzung ste /
translated: The correct view arises from its cause, which is based on the sound of another and one‚Äôs own proper mental attention.

original: tshig de nyid kyis bshad zin to //
analyzed: tshig de nyid kyis bshad zin to //
translated: This has already been explained by those words.

original: de la thos pa'i bag chags ni de'i sa bon yongs su 'dzin par mi rigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la thos pa'i bag chags ni de'i sa bon yongs su 'dzin par mi rigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: In that, the imprints of hearing are not suitable to hold its seed.

original: zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'i sa bon yongs su 'dzin par mi 'thad pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'i sa bon yongs su 'dzin par mi 'thad pa'i phyir te /
translated: This is because it is not tenable that the supramundane seed is held.

original: gong du ji skad smos pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: gong du ji skad smos pa lta bu'o //
translated: This is as explained above.

original: sa bon thams cad pa rnam par smin pa'i rnam par shes pa ni zhes bya ba nas sa bon du ji ltar rung zhes bya ba'i bar ni mi srid pa'i gnod par dri ba ste /
analyzed: sa bon thams cad pa rnam par smin pa'i rnam par shes pa ni zhes bya ba nas sa bon du ji ltar rung zhes bya ba'i bar ni mi srid pa'i gnod par dri ba ste /
translated: The passage from ‚ÄúThe fruitional consciousness that contains all the seeds‚Äù up to ‚ÄúHow can it be a seed?‚Äù is a question that refutes the possibility of the existence of the foundation consciousness.

original: nad las nad med pa ni nam yang ma mthong na nad lta bu'i kun gzhi rnam par shes pa las nad med pa lta bu'i 'jig rten las 'das pa'i sems ji ltar 'byung bar 'gyur /
analyzed: nad las nad med pa ni nam yang ma mthong na nad lta bu'i kun gzhi rnam par shes pa las nad med pa lta bu'i 'jig rten las 'das pa'i sems ji ltar 'byung bar 'gyur /
translated: Since we never see a healthy person arise from a sick person, how can the supramundane mind, which is like a healthy person, arise from the foundation consciousness, which is like a sick person?

original: chos kyi dbyings shin tu rnam par dag pa'i rgyu mthun pa thos pa'i bag chags sa bon pa las de 'byung ngo //
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings shin tu rnam par dag pa'i rgyu mthun pa thos pa'i bag chags sa bon pa las de 'byung ngo //
translated: It arises from the imprints of hearing that are concordant with the cause of the extremely pure dharmadhƒÅtu.

original: zhes bya bas ni rgyu gzhan ston te /
analyzed: zhes bya bas ni rgyu gzhan ston te /
translated: This teaches another cause.

original: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa ni de'i sa bon ma yin no //
analyzed: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa ni de'i sa bon ma yin no //
translated: The foundation consciousness is not the seed of that supramundane mind.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: What is it then?

original: sangs rgyas rnams kyis chos kyi dbyings shin tu rnam par dag pa glo bur gyi sgrib pa dang bral ba gang yin pa de'i rgyu mthun pa ni bstan pa'i chos te /
analyzed: sangs rgyas rnams kyis chos kyi dbyings shin tu rnam par dag pa glo bur gyi sgrib pa dang bral ba gang yin pa de'i rgyu mthun pa ni bstan pa'i chos te /
translated: The supramundane mind arises from the imprints of hearing that are concordant with the cause of the extremely pure dharmadhƒÅtu, which is the freedom from the adventitious afflictions of the buddhas.

original: de'i rgyu las byung bar gyur na 'dra ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i rgyu las byung bar gyur na 'dra ba'i phyir ro //
translated: If it were to arise from that cause, it would be similar.

original: de mnyan pa ni thos pa'o //
analyzed: de mnyan pa ni thos pa'o //
translated: Listening to that is hearing.

original: de'i bag chags gang yin pa de ni 'jig rten las 'das pa zag pa med pa'i sems kyi sa bon te kun gzhi rnam par shes pa ni mthun pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i bag chags gang yin pa de ni 'jig rten las 'das pa zag pa med pa'i sems kyi sa bon te kun gzhi rnam par shes pa ni mthun pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: That which is its latent impression is the seed of supramundane, uncontaminated mind, because the store consciousness is not compatible with it.

original: thos pa'i bag chags gang yin pa de yang zhes bya ba nas de'i gnas ci zhig yin par blta zhe na zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni gnas gzhan ston te /
analyzed: thos pa'i bag chags gang yin pa de yang zhes bya ba nas de'i gnas ci zhig yin par blta zhe na zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni gnas gzhan ston te /
translated: That which is the latent impression of hearing, up to what should be regarded as its basis? This shows another basis.

original: sangs rgyas rnams kyi byang chub la brten nas zhes bya ba ni ye shes dri ma med cing thogs pa med pa mdo la sogs pa bstan pa'i chos thos pa'i bag chags kyi gnas yin gyi /
analyzed: sangs rgyas rnams kyi byang chub la brten nas zhes bya ba ni ye shes dri ma med cing thogs pa med pa mdo la sogs pa bstan pa'i chos thos pa'i bag chags kyi gnas yin gyi /
translated: The basis of the latent impression of hearing is the uncontaminated, unobstructed knowledge of the buddhas, which is the Dharma of instruction such as the sutras.

original: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa ni gnas ma yin te /
analyzed: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa ni gnas ma yin te /
translated: The store consciousness is not the basis because it does not exist in the uncontaminated state.

original: de dang lhan cig 'jug go //
analyzed: de dang lhan cig 'jug go //
translated: It operates simultaneously with that.

original: de'i phyir gnas gang la zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir gnas gang la zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Therefore, it is said, ‚ÄúWhat should be regarded as its basis?‚Äù

original: rgyud gang la 'jug pa de lhan cig 'jug pa'i tshul gyis rnam par smin pa'i rnam par shes pa la 'jug te /
analyzed: rgyud gang la 'jug pa de lhan cig 'jug pa'i tshul gyis rnam par smin pa'i rnam par shes pa la 'jug te /
translated: It enters the mindstream in the manner of simultaneous engagement with the fruitional consciousness.

original: 'o ma dang chu bzhin no //
analyzed: 'o ma dang chu bzhin no //
translated: It is like milk and water.

original: zhes bya ba ni de rnam par smin pa'i rnam par shes pa dang lhan cig 'byung bar 'dod kyi /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni de rnam par smin pa'i rnam par shes pa dang lhan cig 'byung bar 'dod kyi /
translated: This means that it is asserted to occur simultaneously with the fruitional consciousness,

original: de sa bon nyid du ni mi 'dod do //
analyzed: de sa bon nyid du ni mi 'dod do //
translated: but it is not asserted to be the seed of that consciousness.

original: thos pa'i bag chags kyi sa bon de ni kun gzhi rnam par shes pa'i ngo bo nyid ma @214a * //
analyzed: thos pa'i bag chags kyi sa bon de ni kun gzhi rnam par shes pa'i ngo bo nyid ma @214a * //
translated: That seed of the imprints of hearing is not of the nature of the foundation consciousness

original: yin te / de'i gnyen po'i sa bon nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yin te / de'i gnyen po'i sa bon nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is the seed of the antidote to that.

original: zhes bya ba ni kun gzhi rnam par shes pa'i gnyen po rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes kyi rgyu yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni kun gzhi rnam par shes pa'i gnyen po rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes kyi rgyu yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This means that it is the cause of the nonconceptual wisdom that is the antidote to the foundation consciousness.

original: dper na khong du nad du ma zhugs sam dug sna tshogs 'thungs pas na yang rung /
analyzed: dper na khong du nad du ma zhugs sam dug sna tshogs 'thungs pas na yang rung /
translated: For example, it is like the antidote to poison that is ingested after poison has entered the body or various poisons have been drunk.

original: sman bcud kyis len dang dug sman 'thungs na nad dang lhan cig tu dus gzhan gyi bar du 'dug kyang dug gi sa bon can yang ma yin la /
analyzed: sman bcud kyis len dang dug sman 'thungs na nad dang lhan cig tu dus gzhan gyi bar du 'dug kyang dug gi sa bon can yang ma yin la /
translated: If one takes a medicinal elixir or an antidote, one stays for a while with the illness, but it is not that one has the seed of poison,

original: dug gi ngo bo nyid kyang ma yin pa ltar thos pa'i bag chags sa bon du gyur pa yang de bzhin no //
analyzed: dug gi ngo bo nyid kyang ma yin pa ltar thos pa'i bag chags sa bon du gyur pa yang de bzhin no //
translated: nor is it that one has the nature of poison. The latent tendency of hearing is like that.

original: de la bag chags chung ngu la brten nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni bshad pa nyid gsal bas brda phrad par sla'o //
analyzed: de la bag chags chung ngu la brten nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni bshad pa nyid gsal bas brda phrad par sla'o //
translated: The passage beginning ‚ÄúBased on the small latent tendency‚Äù is easy to understand because it clarifies what has been explained.

original: chos kyi sku'i sa bon du blta ste zhes bstan nas rnam par 'grel pa ste /
analyzed: chos kyi sku'i sa bon du blta ste zhes bstan nas rnam par 'grel pa ste /
translated: Having taught that it is the seed of the body of truth, he comments:

original: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa'i gnyen po yin pas kun gzhi rnam par shes pa'i ngo bo nyid ma yin pa dang / 'jig rten pa yin yang 'jig rten las 'das pa chos kyi dbyings shin tu rnam par dag pa'i rgyu mthun pa yin pas zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa'i gnyen po yin pas kun gzhi rnam par shes pa'i ngo bo nyid ma yin pa dang / 'jig rten pa yin yang 'jig rten las 'das pa chos kyi dbyings shin tu rnam par dag pa'i rgyu mthun pa yin pas zhes bya ba ste /
translated: Because it is the antidote to the consciousness of the ground of all, it is not of the nature of the consciousness of the ground of all. And because it is mundane but is the natural outflow of the supramundane utterly pure expanse of reality, it is the seed of the body of truth.

original: zag pa dang bcas pa yin yang 'jig rten las 'das pa zag pa med pa'i sems kyi sa bon yin te /
analyzed: zag pa dang bcas pa yin yang 'jig rten las 'das pa zag pa med pa'i sems kyi sa bon yin te /
translated: Although it is contaminated, it is the seed of the supramundane, uncontaminated mind,

original: de'i tshogs yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i tshogs yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because its collection exists.

original: 'dir ni rtogs pa'i mtshan nyid la chos kyi skur brjod par 'dod do //
analyzed: 'dir ni rtogs pa'i mtshan nyid la chos kyi skur brjod par 'dod do //
translated: Here, the realization is called the Dharma Body,

original: 'jig rten pa nyid ni 'jig rten pa la brten nas 'byung ba dang / kun gzhi rnam par shes pa dang lhan cig 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa nyid ni 'jig rten pa la brten nas 'byung ba dang / kun gzhi rnam par shes pa dang lhan cig 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is mundane, because it arises in dependence on the mundane, and because it functions simultaneously with the container consciousness.

original: gus pa bskyed pa'i phyir phan yon de ni 'jug rten las 'das pa'i sems ma byung du zin kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: gus pa bskyed pa'i phyir phan yon de ni 'jug rten las 'das pa'i sems ma byung du zin kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: In order to generate respect, it is said that ‚Äúeven though the supramundane mind has not yet arisen, etc.‚Äù

original: nyon mongs pas kun nas dkris pa'i gnyen po zhes bya ba ni yod na 'dod chags la sogs pa kun du mi 'byung ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: nyon mongs pas kun nas dkris pa'i gnyen po zhes bya ba ni yod na 'dod chags la sogs pa kun du mi 'byung ba'i phyir te /
translated: The antidote to the entanglements of the passions is called the antidote to the entanglements of the passions, because when it exists, attachment, etc., do not occur.

original: gnyen po yod na mi mthun pa'i phyogs mi skye'o //
analyzed: gnyen po yod na mi mthun pa'i phyogs mi skye'o //
translated: When there is an antidote, the opposing class does not arise.

original: de'i phyir rgyu med na 'bras bu med pas ngan song du 'gro ba'i gnyen po zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir rgyu med na 'bras bu med pas ngan song du 'gro ba'i gnyen po zhes bya ba ste /
translated: Therefore, when there is no cause, there is no effect. It is called the antidote to the going of sentient beings to miserable destinies,üîΩbecause when it exists, the going of sentient beings to miserable destinies does not occur.

original: 'jig rten pa yin yang dag lta //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa yin yang dag lta //
translated: Even though worldly, it is right view.

original: chen po su la yod gyur pa //üîΩde ni tsher rabs stong du yang //
analyzed: chen po su la yod gyur pa // de ni tsher rabs stong du yang //
translated: Whoever has the greatüîΩwill not go to the lower realms

original: ngan 'gror 'gro bar mi 'gyur ro //üîΩzhes ji skad gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: ngan 'gror 'gro bar mi 'gyur ro // zhes ji skad gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: even in a thousand rebirths.

original: 'o na / sngon byas pa'i nyes par spyang pa ngan song du 'gro bar mi 'gyur ram zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na / sngon byas pa'i nyes par spyang pa ngan song du 'gro bar mi 'gyur ram zhe na /
translated: But, if one has committed a transgression, will one not go to the lower realms?

original: de'i phyir nyes par byas pa thams cad dengs par byed pa'i gnyen po yin no zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir nyes par byas pa thams cad dengs par byed pa'i gnyen po yin no zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Therefore, it is said that it is the antidote that removes all transgressions.

original: thog pa med pa'i dus kyi nyes par byas pa dengs @214b par byed pa ni mthu 'joms par byed pa ste /
analyzed: thog pa med pa'i dus kyi nyes par byas pa dengs @214b par byed pa ni mthu 'joms par byed pa ste /
translated: It removes transgressions committed in beginningless time, and it overcomes their power.

original: de'i phyir gnyen po'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir gnyen po'o //
translated: Therefore, it is an antidote.

original: chos kyi skur bsdus pa ni chos kyi sku'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos kyi skur bsdus pa ni chos kyi sku'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is included in the Dharma body because it is the cause of the Dharma body.

original: rnam par grol ba'i lus su bsdus pa zhes bya ba yang de bzhin du brjed par bya'o //
analyzed: rnam par grol ba'i lus su bsdus pa zhes bya ba yang de bzhin du brjed par bya'o //
translated: It should be understood that it is included in the body of liberation in the same way.

original: de la chos kyi sku dang rnam par grol ba'i lus kyi khyad par ni 'di yin te rnam par grol ba ni nyon mongs pa'i bcings pa dang bral ba tsam du zad de /
analyzed: de la chos kyi sku dang rnam par grol ba'i lus kyi khyad par ni 'di yin te rnam par grol ba ni nyon mongs pa'i bcings pa dang bral ba tsam du zad de /
translated: The difference between the Dharma body and the liberated body is as follows: The liberated body is merely the freedom from the bondage of affliction.

original: dper na grong mi zhig lcags sgrog la sogs pa'i bcings pa dang bral na sdug bsngal de log pa'i 'bras bu tsam du zad kyi /
analyzed: dper na grong mi zhig lcags sgrog la sogs pa'i bcings pa dang bral na sdug bsngal de log pa'i 'bras bu tsam du zad kyi /
translated: For example, when a person in a village is freed from bondage by iron chains, etc., the result is merely the cessation of that suffering.

original: de las lhag pa'i dbang phyug gi khyad par dang ldan pa ma yin pa lta bu'o //üîΩchos kyi sku ni bag chags dang bcas pa'i nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa las rnam par grol ba dang stobs dang mi 'jigs pa la sogs pa ngo mtshar gyi yon tan du mas brgyan pa 'byor ba thams cad kyi gnas ji ltar 'dod pa bzhin
analyzed: de las lhag pa'i dbang phyug gi khyad par dang ldan pa ma yin pa lta bu'o // chos kyi sku ni bag chags dang bcas pa'i nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa las rnam par grol ba dang stobs dang mi 'jigs pa la sogs pa ngo mtshar gyi yon tan du mas brgyan pa 'byor ba thams cad kyi gnas ji ltar 'dod pa bzhin
translated: It is not endowed with the special power of the gods.

original: du spyod pas rang dbang mchog thob pa ste /
analyzed: du spyod pas rang dbang mchog thob pa ste /
translated: The Dharma body is liberated from the afflictions and the obscurations to omniscience together with their traces. It is adorned with many wondrous qualities such as the powers and fearlessnesses. It is the basis of all powers and obtains the supreme power of acting as one wishes.

original: dper na rgyal po'i bu bcings pa dang bral ma thag tu spyi bo nas dbang bskur ba dang / dbang phyug phun sum tshogs pa mchog dang ldan pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na rgyal po'i bu bcings pa dang bral ma thag tu spyi bo nas dbang bskur ba dang / dbang phyug phun sum tshogs pa mchog dang ldan pa lta bu'o //
translated: For example, as soon as the son of a king is freed from confinement, he is anointed on the head and becomes endowed with the most excellent and perfect sovereignty.

original: gnas kyang 'gyur ro zhes bya bas ni sman bcud kyis len btang nas rgyas par gyur na nad med par rgyas par 'gyur ba lta bu'i tshul gyis so //
analyzed: gnas kyang 'gyur ro zhes bya bas ni sman bcud kyis len btang nas rgyas par gyur na nad med par rgyas par 'gyur ba lta bu'i tshul gyis so //
translated: And the basis is transformed, as when a patient recovers from an illness after taking a medicinal elixir.

original: sa bon thams cad pa yang sa bon med par 'gyur /
analyzed: sa bon thams cad pa yang sa bon med par 'gyur /
translated: All seeds become seedless.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni sa bon gyi rnam pa thams cad spangs pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni sa bon gyi rnam pa thams cad spangs pa'i phyir te /
translated: And so on. Because all the aspects of seeds are abandoned.

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa'i sa bon thams cad med pa nyid 'di'i spangs par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa'i sa bon thams cad med pa nyid 'di'i spangs par rig par bya'o //
translated: The absence of all the seeds of the afflictions should be understood as the abandonment of this.

original: ngang pas chu la 'o ma 'thungs pa lta bu dang 'jig rten pa'i 'dod chags dang bral ba na mnyam par bzhag pa ma yin pa'i sa ba'i bag chags 'gribs te /
analyzed: ngang pas chu la 'o ma 'thungs pa lta bu dang 'jig rten pa'i 'dod chags dang bral ba na mnyam par bzhag pa ma yin pa'i sa ba'i bag chags 'gribs te /
translated: Like a swan diving into a lake and drinking up the milk, the mundane attachment and the latent tendencies of the non-concentrated levels diminish.

original: mnyam par bzhag pa'i sa pa'i bag chags 'phel nas gnas gyur pa bzhin no //
analyzed: mnyam par bzhag pa'i sa pa'i bag chags 'phel nas gnas gyur pa bzhin no //
translated: It is like the transformation of the ground of meditative equipoise through the development of habitual tendencies.

original: zhes bya ba ni tshig de nyid kyis bshad zin to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni tshig de nyid kyis bshad zin to //
translated: This is explained by the very words of the above passage.

original: de ltar kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba'i mi 'thad pas kun gzhi rnam par shes pa bsgrubs nas 'gog pa la snyoms par zhugs pa rnams kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa mi srid par sgrub po //
analyzed: de ltar kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba'i mi 'thad pas kun gzhi rnam par shes pa bsgrubs nas 'gog pa la snyoms par zhugs pa rnams kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa mi srid par sgrub po //
translated: Thus, having established the foundation consciousness through the untenability of affliction and purification, he proves the impossibility of the meditative attainment of cessation by saying, ‚ÄúIt is also impossible for those who have entered the meditative attainment of cessation,‚Äù and so on.

original: sangs rgyas dang / rang sangs rgyas dang / dgra bcom pa dang / phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams ma gtogs pa 'gog pa la snyoms par zhugs @215a * //üîΩpa gzhan rnams shi ba las bye brag ston pa na bcom ldan 'das kyis de'i rnam par shes pa lus dang bral ba ma yin no //
analyzed: sangs rgyas dang / rang sangs rgyas dang / dgra bcom pa dang / phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams ma gtogs pa 'gog pa la snyoms par zhugs @215a * // pa gzhan rnams shi ba las bye brag ston pa na bcom ldan 'das kyis de'i rnam par shes pa lus dang bral ba ma yin no //
translated: Except for buddhas, pratyekabuddhas, arhats, and irreversible bodhisattvas, the consciousness of others who have entered the meditative attainment of cessation is not separated from the body.

original: zhes bka' stsal te /
analyzed: zhes bka' stsal te /
translated: The Bhagavat has said, ‚ÄúTheir consciousness is not separated from the body.‚Äù

original: de ni kun gzhi rnam par shes pa las gzhan ma yin no //
analyzed: de ni kun gzhi rnam par shes pa las gzhan ma yin no //
translated: That is not other than the foundation consciousness.

original: de ltar ci mngon zhe na /
analyzed: de ltar ci mngon zhe na /
translated: Why is this so?

original: 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa ni de'i gnyen po ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa ni de'i gnyen po ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the meditative attainment of cessation is not the counteragent to that.

original: de'i gnyen por 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa skye ba ma yin te /
analyzed: de'i gnyen por 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa skye ba ma yin te /
translated: The meditative attainment of cessation does not arise as the counteragent to that,

original: dmigs pa dang rnam par yongs su ma chad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dmigs pa dang rnam par yongs su ma chad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it does not completely eliminate the objective mental support and aspect.

original: rnam par rig pa'i las mi gsal ba ni ma zhi ba nyid du yongs su mi gcod pas gnyen po mi byed pa'i phyir 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa ni kun gzhi rnam par shes pa'i gnyen po ma yin no //
analyzed: rnam par rig pa'i las mi gsal ba ni ma zhi ba nyid du yongs su mi gcod pas gnyen po mi byed pa'i phyir 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa ni kun gzhi rnam par shes pa'i gnyen po ma yin no //
translated: The activity of the non-clarity of the representation is not completely eliminated by the non-peacefulness, and therefore the meditative attainment of cessation is not the counteragent to the store-consciousness.

original: gang la gnyen po med pa de ni 'gog par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang la gnyen po med pa de ni 'gog par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: That which has no counteragent does not cease.

original: 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa gang dmigs pa dang rnam par yongs su chad pas ma zhi ba de'i gnyen por skye ste /
analyzed: 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa gang dmigs pa dang rnam par yongs su chad pas ma zhi ba de'i gnyen por skye ste /
translated: The counteragent to the active consciousnesses arises because they are not peaceful due to the complete elimination of the objective mental support and aspect.

original: de 'gag pa nyid do //
analyzed: de 'gag pa nyid do //
translated: That is their cessation.

original: ji ste 'gags kyang des blta ba'i phyir de dang ma bral ba zhes bya'o zhes bya bar 'dod na de'i phyir /
analyzed: ji ste 'gags kyang des blta ba'i phyir de dang ma bral ba zhes bya'o zhes bya bar 'dod na de'i phyir /
translated: If it is claimed that even though it has ceased, it is not separated from it because it is seen by that, then in response to that, it is said:

original: de las langs pa rnams kyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de las langs pa rnams kyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The passage beginning ‚ÄúThose who have arisen from that‚Äù explains this.

original: tshig de nyid kyis bshad zin to //
analyzed: tshig de nyid kyis bshad zin to //
translated: The meaning has already been explained by those words.

original: 'di'i phyir yang de ni yid kyi rnam par shes pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di'i phyir yang de ni yid kyi rnam par shes pa ma yin te /
translated: For this reason also, that is not mental consciousness,

original: snyoms par 'jug par mi rung ba'i phyir ro ;
analyzed: snyoms par 'jug par mi rung ba'i phyir ro ;
translated: because it is not suitable as meditative attainment.

original: /'du shes dang tshor ba 'gog pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: /'du shes dang tshor ba 'gog pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the cessation of discrimination and feeling is not tenable.

original: zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
translated: This is the meaning.

original: yid kyi rnam par shes pa ni sa mang po pa rnams dang mi ldan pa ma yin pas 'du shes dang tshor ba ma 'gags pa'i phyir snyoms par 'jug par mi rung ngo //
analyzed: yid kyi rnam par shes pa ni sa mang po pa rnams dang mi ldan pa ma yin pas 'du shes dang tshor ba ma 'gags pa'i phyir snyoms par 'jug par mi rung ngo //
translated: Mental consciousness is not unassociated with the universal mental factors, so it is not suitable as meditative attainment because discrimination and feeling would not cease.

original: 'di'i phyir yang de ni yid kyi rnam par shes pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di'i phyir yang de ni yid kyi rnam par shes pa ma yin te /
translated: For this reason also, that is not mental consciousness,üîΩbecause it is not tenable as the object of mental consciousness.

original: dmigs pa dang rnam par mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dmigs pa dang rnam par mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is not tenable as the object of mental consciousness.

original: yid kyi rnam par shes pa thams cad ni dmigs pa dang rnam par dmigs pa med par mi 'byung ngo //
analyzed: yid kyi rnam par shes pa thams cad ni dmigs pa dang rnam par dmigs pa med par mi 'byung ngo //
translated: Because all mental consciousness does not occur without an object and aspect.

original: de med pa'i phyir de yang mi 'grub bo //
analyzed: de med pa'i phyir de yang mi 'grub bo //
translated: Because that does not exist, it is not established.

original: 'di'i phyir yang de yid kyi rnam par shes pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di'i phyir yang de yid kyi rnam par shes pa ma yin te /
translated: Therefore, this is not mental consciousness,

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is associated with the root of virtue.

original: snyoms par 'jug pa'i sems de ni mi dge ba ma yin la /
analyzed: snyoms par 'jug pa'i sems de ni mi dge ba ma yin la /
translated: That mind that enters meditative attainment is not nonvirtuous,

original: lung du ma bstan pa yang ma yin gyi /
analyzed: lung du ma bstan pa yang ma yin gyi /
translated: nor is it neutral.

original: dge ba nyid de ma chags pa la sogs pa med par dge ba nyid kyi sems kyang med de /
analyzed: dge ba nyid de ma chags pa la sogs pa med par dge ba nyid kyi sems kyang med de /
translated: It is virtuous, because there is no virtuous mind without nonattachment and so on.üîΩThe treatise attainment of knowledge declares:

original: mtshungs par ldan pas de dang ldan no zhes grub pa'i mtha' las @215b 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mtshungs par ldan pas de dang ldan no zhes grub pa'i mtha' las @215b 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It is associated with those because it is concomitant with them.

original: ma chags pa la sogs pa yang reg pa la sogs pa med par mi 'byung ste /
analyzed: ma chags pa la sogs pa yang reg pa la sogs pa med par mi 'byung ste /
translated: Nonattachment and so on do not occur without contact and so forth.

original: reg pa ni ting nge 'dzin las byung ba'i shin tu sbyangs pa dang btang snyoms kyi tshor ba dang mthun par gyur te //
analyzed: reg pa ni ting nge 'dzin las byung ba'i shin tu sbyangs pa dang btang snyoms kyi tshor ba dang mthun par gyur te //
translated: Contact is compatible with pliancy and neutral feeling that arise from concentration.

original: tshor ba yang de dang lhan cig skyes par gyur pas snyoms par 'jug pa med do //
analyzed: tshor ba yang de dang lhan cig skyes par gyur pas snyoms par 'jug pa med do //
translated: Feeling arises simultaneously with it, so there is no meditative attainment.

original: de la 'di snyam du 'du shes dang tshor ba gnyis la 'bras dang zug rdu la sogs pa'i dngos par rnam par sun 'byin pas 'gog pa'i snyom par 'jug pa la 'gag par 'gyur ro snyam na /
analyzed: de la 'di snyam du 'du shes dang tshor ba gnyis la 'bras dang zug rdu la sogs pa'i dngos par rnam par sun 'byin pas 'gog pa'i snyom par 'jug pa la 'gag par 'gyur ro snyam na /
translated: If you think that the meditative attainment of cessation is an obstruction to the two, discernment and feeling, because they are objects of abandonment like a thorn,

original: de'i mthus mnyam par gzhag par 'gyur ba'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pas de'i lan 'debs so //
analyzed: de'i mthus mnyam par gzhag par 'gyur ba'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pas de'i lan 'debs so //
translated: then the response is that it is not because it is a meditative attainment that is attained by the power of those two.

original: rnam par sun 'byin pas ni mnyam par 'jog par nus kyi /
analyzed: rnam par sun 'byin pas ni mnyam par 'jog par nus kyi /
translated: Objection: One can attain meditative equipoise through the power of disgust.

original: de 'gog par ni mi nus te /
analyzed: de 'gog par ni mi nus te /
translated: Response: One cannot stop those two.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why?

original: mnyam par 'jog pa'i gzhan 'du shes med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa la 'du shes rgyun chad pa tsam du 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mnyam par 'jog pa'i gzhan 'du shes med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa la 'du shes rgyun chad pa tsam du 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the meditative attainment of nondiscernment is a meditative attainment of equipoise that is merely the cessation of discernment.

original: gal te gang rnam par sun phyung ba de 'gog par 'gyur na ni /
analyzed: gal te gang rnam par sun phyung ba de 'gog par 'gyur na ni /
translated: If that which is obstructed were to cease,

original: des na 'du shes med pa la snyoms par 'jug pa rnams kyis 'du shes rnam par sun phyung bas na 'du shes med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa la 'du shes tsam rgyun chad par 'gyur gyi gzhan ni ma yin no //üîΩyang ji ltar gnas 'gog pa med par gnas pa 'gog pa mi srid pa'i phyir der sems kyang 'gog par gyur ba de bzhin du 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa la sems kyang 'gag par 'gyur gyi gnas pa 'ba' zhig ni ma yin te /
analyzed: des na 'du shes med pa la snyoms par 'jug pa rnams kyis 'du shes rnam par sun phyung bas na 'du shes med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa la 'du shes tsam rgyun chad par 'gyur gyi gzhan ni ma yin no // yang ji ltar gnas 'gog pa med par gnas pa 'gog pa mi srid pa'i phyir der sems kyang 'gog par gyur ba de bzhin du 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa la sems kyang 'gag par 'gyur gyi gnas pa 'ba' zhig ni ma yin te /
translated: Therefore, since those who enter the meditative attainment of nondiscernment eradicate discernment, the continuum of mere discernment is severed in the meditative attainment of nondiscernment, but not the continuum of other minds.üîΩJust as it is impossible to stop abiding without stopping the basis, so too the mind is stopped in the meditative attainment of nondiscernment because the basis is stopped.

original: gnas yod pa la gnas pa bsal du mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnas yod pa la gnas pa bsal du mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The mind is stopped in the meditative attainment of cessation, but the basis is not stopped alone because it is impossible to eliminate abiding when the basis exists.üîΩBecause there is an example.

original: dpe yod pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la 'dir ni 'du shes med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dpe ste /
analyzed: dpe yod pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la 'dir ni 'du shes med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dpe ste /
translated: In this context, the meditative attainment of nondiscernment is the example.

original: de bzhin du dbyer mi rung ba'i phyir gnyi ga 'gag par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du dbyer mi rung ba'i phyir gnyi ga 'gag par 'gyur ro //
translated: Just as the mind and body are stopped in the meditative attainment of nondiscernment, so too both the mind and the basis are stopped in the meditative attainment of cessation because they are inseparable.

original: yang na 'byung ba dang 'byung ba las gyur pa yang dpe yin te /
analyzed: yang na 'byung ba dang 'byung ba las gyur pa yang dpe yin te /
translated: Or the elements and the derivative form are the example.

original: phan tshun med par mi 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phan tshun med par mi 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because they do not occur without each other.

original: dge ba la sogs pa'i sar nges te /
analyzed: dge ba la sogs pa'i sar nges te /
translated: They are determined to the stage of virtue, etc.

original: gang dag thams dad du 'gro ba ma yin pa de dag ni sems thams cad la mi 'byung bar rigs so //
analyzed: gang dag thams dad du 'gro ba ma yin pa de dag ni sems thams cad la mi 'byung bar rigs so //
translated: Those that do not go everywhere are reasonable as not occurring in all minds.

original: 'du shes dang tshor ba ni sa mang po pa yin pas thams cad du 'gro ba nyid du gnas pa'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: 'du shes dang tshor ba ni sa mang po pa yin pas thams cad du 'gro ba nyid du gnas pa'i rang bzhin no //
translated: Because ideation and sensation are universal mental activities, they are by nature omnipresent.

original: de'i phyir rnam par shes pa yod na 'di gnyis med du mi rung ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir rnam par shes pa yod na 'di gnyis med du mi rung ste /
translated: Therefore, when consciousness exists, these two are indispensable.

original: de'i phyir kun du 'gro ba nyid yin pa las /
analyzed: de'i phyir kun du 'gro ba nyid yin pa las /
translated: Therefore, they are omnipresent.

original: de bzhin du med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: de bzhin du med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: Because they do not exist in that way, he says,

original: 'di'i phyir yang @216a * //
analyzed: 'di'i phyir yang @216a * //
translated: For this reason also,

original: de yid kyi rnam par shes pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de yid kyi rnam par shes pa ma yin te /
translated: it is not mental consciousness.

original: dge ba dang mi dge ba dang lung du ma bstan par mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dge ba dang mi dge ba dang lung du ma bstan par mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is unreasonable that it be virtuous, nonvirtuous, or indeterminate.

original: yid kyi rnam par shes pa gang yin pa de ni dge ba'am /üîΩmi dge ba'am /
analyzed: yid kyi rnam par shes pa gang yin pa de ni dge ba'am / mi dge ba'am /
translated: Whatever is mental consciousness is either virtuous,üîΩnonvirtuous,

original: lung du ma bstan pa'am /
analyzed: lung du ma bstan pa'am /
translated: or indeterminate.

original: gcig tu 'gyur ba de ni dge ba ma yin te /
analyzed: gcig tu 'gyur ba de ni dge ba ma yin te /
translated: That which is one is not virtuous.

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba dang mtshungs par ldan par 'gyur ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba dang mtshungs par ldan par 'gyur ba'i phyir te /
translated: That is not virtuous because it would be concomitant with roots of virtue.

original: gong du ma chags pa la sogs pa med par dge bar ji ltar 'gyur /
analyzed: gong du ma chags pa la sogs pa med par dge bar ji ltar 'gyur /
translated: How could it be virtuous if nonattachment and so on did not exist?

original: de dag kyang reg pa med par ji ltar 'byung /
analyzed: de dag kyang reg pa med par ji ltar 'byung /
translated: How could they occur without contact?

original: de yang lhan cig skyes pa'i tshor ba la sogs pa med par ji ltar 'byung zhes ji skad bstan pa bzhin no ;
analyzed: de yang lhan cig skyes pa'i tshor ba la sogs pa med par ji ltar 'byung zhes ji skad bstan pa bzhin no ;
translated: How could that occur without the coemergent feeling and so on?

original: / su zhig sbyor ba las byung ba'i dge ba'i sems kyis 'phangs pas snyoms par 'jug pa'i sems dge ba yin gyi /
analyzed: / su zhig sbyor ba las byung ba'i dge ba'i sems kyis 'phangs pas snyoms par 'jug pa'i sems dge ba yin gyi /
translated: Some assert: The virtuous mind of meditative equipoxy is projected by the virtuous mind derived from preparation.üîΩIt is not virtuous because it is concomitant with roots of virtue.

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i phyir ni ma yin no snyam du de ltar rtogs pa de'i rtogs pa de ni bstan bcos dang mi mthun pa ste /
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i phyir ni ma yin no snyam du de ltar rtogs pa de'i rtogs pa de ni bstan bcos dang mi mthun pa ste /
translated: The assertion that it is virtuous because it is projected by the virtuous mind derived from preparation is illogical because it contradicts the treatise attainment of knowledge, which states:

original: mtshungs par ldan pas de dang ldan zhes rnam par gzhag pa dang 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mtshungs par ldan pas de dang ldan zhes rnam par gzhag pa dang 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It is posited as concomitant with that because it possesses that.

original: sbyor ba'i sems ni ma chags pa la sogs pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i phyir dge ba yin gyi /
analyzed: sbyor ba'i sems ni ma chags pa la sogs pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i phyir dge ba yin gyi /
translated: The preparatory mind is virtuous because it is concomitant with nonattachment and so on.

original: de'i rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu snyoms par 'jug pa'i sems ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i nges pa 'di sus byas /
analyzed: de'i rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu snyoms par 'jug pa'i sems ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i nges pa 'di sus byas /
translated: But who made this rule that the mind of meditative attainment is not the result of natural outflow of that mind?

original: de ni bdag nyid kyis dge ba yang ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni bdag nyid kyis dge ba yang ma yin te /
translated: It is not virtuous by itself,

original: bdag nyid kyis dge ba rnams ni dge ba'i rtsa ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: bdag nyid kyis dge ba rnams ni dge ba'i rtsa ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: because those that are virtuous by themselves are roots of virtue and so on.

original: grangs nges pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: grangs nges pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because their number is fixed.

original: don dam par dge ba yang ma yin te /
analyzed: don dam par dge ba yang ma yin te /
translated: It is not virtuous ultimately,

original: thar pa nyid nges par bya ba'i phyir ro //üîΩgal te mthu 'dus pa ni 'dus pa ste /
analyzed: thar pa nyid nges par bya ba'i phyir ro // gal te mthu 'dus pa ni 'dus pa ste /
translated: because liberation is ascertained.

original: reg pa zhes bya bar 'dod kyi /
analyzed: reg pa zhes bya bar 'dod kyi /
translated: If you say that the collection of powers is a collection and is asserted to be contact,

original: thams cad ni ma yin te /
analyzed: thams cad ni ma yin te /
translated: but not all are contact,

original: snyoms par 'jug pa la sbyor ba'i dus na tshor ba la sogs rnam par sun phung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: snyoms par 'jug pa la sbyor ba'i dus na tshor ba la sogs rnam par sun phung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because feeling and so on are rejected at the time of preparation for meditative attainment,

original: de'i tshe tshor ba skyed pa'i mthu med do zhe na /
analyzed: de'i tshe tshor ba skyed pa'i mthu med do zhe na /
translated: at that time they do not have the power to generate feeling.

original: de tsam rgyun chad par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba la sogs pas de'i lan btab zin to //
analyzed: de tsam rgyun chad par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba la sogs pas de'i lan btab zin to //
translated: We have already responded to this by saying that it would be interrupted in the same way.

original: de lta bas na der tshor ba med pa'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa mi rung ngo //
analyzed: de lta bas na der tshor ba med pa'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa mi rung ngo //
translated: Thus, mental consciousness without feeling is not possible there.

original: yang rtog pa dang dpyod pa dag gi 'du byed 'gags pas ngag 'byung bar mi 'gyur na yid kyi 'du byed 'gags kyang yid 'byung ba 'di la rgyu ci yod /
analyzed: yang rtog pa dang dpyod pa dag gi 'du byed 'gags pas ngag 'byung bar mi 'gyur na yid kyi 'du byed 'gags kyang yid 'byung ba 'di la rgyu ci yod /
translated: Moreover, if speech does not occur due to the cessation of the formations of investigation and analysis, what is the cause for the occurrence of mind, even though the formations of mind have ceased?

original: lus kyi 'du byed 'gags kyang lus gnas pa bzhin du yid kyi 'du byed 'gags kyang yid gnas so zhes slar gzhil du @216b mi rung ste /
analyzed: lus kyi 'du byed 'gags kyang lus gnas pa bzhin du yid kyi 'du byed 'gags kyang yid gnas so zhes slar gzhil du @216b mi rung ste /
translated: It is not appropriate to respond that mind persists even though the formations of mind have ceased, just as the body persists even though the formations of the body have ceased.

original: 'di ltar bcom ldan 'das kyis lus gnas pa'i rgyu gzhan dag kyang lus kyi 'du byed du gsungs te /
analyzed: 'di ltar bcom ldan 'das kyis lus gnas pa'i rgyu gzhan dag kyang lus kyi 'du byed du gsungs te /
translated: For the Blessed One has stated that there are other causes for the persistence of the body, which are also formations of the body.

original: 'di ltar kha zas dang srog gi dbang po dang rnam par shes pa ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar kha zas dang srog gi dbang po dang rnam par shes pa ste /
translated: They are food, the faculty of life force, and consciousness.

original: dbugs rgyu ba med par yang de dag gis lus gnas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dbugs rgyu ba med par yang de dag gis lus gnas par 'gyur ro //
translated: Even without the movement of breath, the body persists due to these.

original: sems pa dang 'du shes ma gtogs par yid kyi 'du byed gzhan dag ni gang du yang ma gsungs so //
analyzed: sems pa dang 'du shes ma gtogs par yid kyi 'du byed gzhan dag ni gang du yang ma gsungs so //
translated: Other mental formations, apart from intention and feeling, are not mentioned anywhere.

original: de lta bas na de gnyis med par de gnas par mi rung ste /
analyzed: de lta bas na de gnyis med par de gnas par mi rung ste /
translated: Thus, without these two, it is not tenable that it endures.

original: de'i phyir de yid kyi rnam par shes pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir de yid kyi rnam par shes pa ma yin te /
translated: Therefore, it is not mental consciousness.

original: zhar la byung ba de tsam gyis chog go //
analyzed: zhar la byung ba de tsam gyis chog go //
translated: This digression is sufficient.

original: mi dge ba yang ma yin te /
analyzed: mi dge ba yang ma yin te /
translated: It is not nonvirtuous,

original: snyoms par 'jug pa dge ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: snyoms par 'jug pa dge ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because the meditative attainment is virtuous.

original: 'du shes med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa yang mi dge bar mi 'dod na rnam par thar pa dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa'i nang du gtogs pa 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa lta smos kyang ci dgos /
analyzed: 'du shes med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa yang mi dge bar mi 'dod na rnam par thar pa dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa'i nang du gtogs pa 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa lta smos kyang ci dgos /
translated: If you do not assert that the meditative attainment of nondiscernment is nonvirtuous, then what need is there to mention the meditative attainment of cessation that is included in the liberations and the meditative attainments of successive abiding?

original: lung du ma bstan pa rnam pa gsum yang ma yin te /
analyzed: lung du ma bstan pa rnam pa gsum yang ma yin te /
translated: It is also not the three types of neutral states,

original: med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it does not exist.

original: de'i tshe bzo'i gnas la sogs pa mi 'byung ngo //
analyzed: de'i tshe bzo'i gnas la sogs pa mi 'byung ngo //
translated: At that time, the arts and so on do not occur.

original: rnam par smin pa las byung bar dam 'cha' na ni kun gzhi rnam par shes pa grub bo //üîΩgang rnam par smin pa yang ma yin la mngon par 'du byed par 'jug pa yang ma yin pa zhes bya ba lung du ma bstan pa lnga pa gzhan dag gis brtags pa de ni lung las mi 'byung ste /
analyzed: rnam par smin pa las byung bar dam 'cha' na ni kun gzhi rnam par shes pa grub bo // gang rnam par smin pa yang ma yin la mngon par 'du byed par 'jug pa yang ma yin pa zhes bya ba lung du ma bstan pa lnga pa gzhan dag gis brtags pa de ni lung las mi 'byung ste /
translated: If you maintain that it arises from the evolution of the store consciousness, then the store consciousness is established.üîΩThe fifth possibility, that which is neither evolution nor a motivating act, is not mentioned in the scriptures.

original: mdo dang chos mngon pa la med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mdo dang chos mngon pa la med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not mentioned in the scriptures because it does not exist in the sutras or in the Abhidharma.

original: de ltar gyur na 'gro ba de ldog pa nyid du 'gyur zhes bya bas kyang de'i lan btab zin to //
analyzed: de ltar gyur na 'gro ba de ldog pa nyid du 'gyur zhes bya bas kyang de'i lan btab zin to //
translated: We have already answered this by saying that if that were so, then the world would not be eternal.

original: gang yang gzugs dang sems kyi mjug thogs su 'byung ba 'dus byas kyi chos rnams kyi rgyu nyid du mdo sde pa rtog ste /
analyzed: gang yang gzugs dang sems kyi mjug thogs su 'byung ba 'dus byas kyi chos rnams kyi rgyu nyid du mdo sde pa rtog ste /
translated: The Sautrantikas imagine that conditioned dharmas arise immediately after form and mind, and that they are the cause of form and mind.

original: de 'di snyam du gzugs kyi skad cig snga ma'i mjug thogs su gzugs kyi skad cig phyi ma 'byung la /
analyzed: de 'di snyam du gzugs kyi skad cig snga ma'i mjug thogs su gzugs kyi skad cig phyi ma 'byung la /
translated: They think that the subsequent moment of form arises immediately after the prior moment of form.

original: sems kyi skad cig snga ma'i mjug thogs su yang sems kyi skad cig mtshungs par ldan pa dang bcas pa phyi ma 'byung ste /
analyzed: sems kyi skad cig snga ma'i mjug thogs su yang sems kyi skad cig mtshungs par ldan pa dang bcas pa phyi ma 'byung ste /
translated: The subsequent moment of mind and its associated factors arise from the final moment of the previous mind and its associated factors.üîΩHere, the opponent thinks that it is unnecessary to posit foundation consciousness as the cause of mind.

original: 'dir kun gzhi rnam par shes pa rgyur brtag ci dgos snyam du sems pa de gong ma bzhin du mi 'thad kyi steng du zhes bya bas sel to //
analyzed: 'dir kun gzhi rnam par shes pa rgyur brtag ci dgos snyam du sems pa de gong ma bzhin du mi 'thad kyi steng du zhes bya bas sel to //
translated: The response is that this is untenable, as explained above, and in addition, the word ‚Äúonly‚Äù refutes this.

original: gzugs dang sems ni 'ga' zhig tu res 'ga' rgyun chad par snang ba'i phyir ro zhes ji skad bstan pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: gzugs dang sems ni 'ga' zhig tu res 'ga' rgyun chad par snang ba'i phyir ro zhes ji skad bstan pa lta bu'o //
translated: This is because form and mind are sometimes seen to be interrupted.

original: gzhan yang de'i ltar na gzugs med pa nas shi ba'i gzugs ni gzugs kyi sa bon las mi 'byung @217a * //
analyzed: gzhan yang de'i ltar na gzugs med pa nas shi ba'i gzugs ni gzugs kyi sa bon las mi 'byung @217a * //
translated: Moreover, according to the opponent, form that arises from death in the formless realm does not arise from the seed of form,

original: ste ; 'gags nas yun ring ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ste ; 'gags nas yun ring ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because a long time has elapsed since it ceased.

original: 'du shes med pa shi ba dang 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa las langs pa'i sems kyang sems kyi sa bon las 'byung du mi rung ste /
analyzed: 'du shes med pa shi ba dang 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa las langs pa'i sems kyang sems kyi sa bon las 'byung du mi rung ste /
translated: Also, the mind of one who has died in the state of nondiscernment and the mind of one who has arisen from the meditative attainment of cessation are not suitable to arise from the seed of mind,

original: 'gags nas yun ring ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'gags nas yun ring ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because a long time has elapsed since it ceased.

original: yang gal te sems thams cad kun gzhi rnam par shes pa bzhin du sems gzhan gyi sa bon can du nges par 'gyur na ni /
analyzed: yang gal te sems thams cad kun gzhi rnam par shes pa bzhin du sems gzhan gyi sa bon can du nges par 'gyur na ni /
translated: Moreover, if all minds were definitely seeds of other minds, like the foundation consciousness,

original: des na phung po'i lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings su dgra bcom pa'i tha ma'i sems mi rung ste /
analyzed: des na phung po'i lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings su dgra bcom pa'i tha ma'i sems mi rung ste /
translated: then the final mind of an arhat in the realm of nirvana without remainder would be impossible.

original: de ma thag pa'i rkyen gyi dngos pos sems gzhan gyi sa bon gyi dngos po mi zad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ma thag pa'i rkyen gyi dngos pos sems gzhan gyi sa bon gyi dngos po mi zad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the condition as the equivalent and immediate antecedent would not cease, the condition of the seed of another mind would not cease.

original: de lta na yang phung po'i lhag ma med pa mya ngan las 'das pa med pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta na yang phung po'i lhag ma med pa mya ngan las 'das pa med pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: In that case, nirvana without remainder would not exist.

original: de ltar na sa bon thams cad pa rnam par smin pa'i rnam par shes pa med pa na nyes pa chen po mang por 'gyur ba'i phyir rang gi don lhur byed pas mi 'dod bzhin du yang rnam par smin pa'i rnam par shes pa nges par rtogs par
analyzed: de ltar na sa bon thams cad pa rnam par smin pa'i rnam par shes pa med pa na nyes pa chen po mang por 'gyur ba'i phyir rang gi don lhur byed pas mi 'dod bzhin du yang rnam par smin pa'i rnam par shes pa nges par rtogs par
translated: Thus, if the consciousness that is the maturation of all the seeds does not exist, many great errors would occur. Therefore, even if you do not want to, you must accept the existence of the consciousness that is the result of karma, because you are intent on your own welfare.

original: bya ste / 'di ni ldan pa'i rigs pa'o //
analyzed: bya ste / 'di ni ldan pa'i rigs pa'o //
translated: This is the reasoning of possession.

original: 'di la bral ba'i rigs pa yang yod de /üîΩ'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa rnams ni sems dang lhan cig 'byung ba ste /
analyzed: 'di la bral ba'i rigs pa yang yod de / 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa rnams ni sems dang lhan cig 'byung ba ste /
translated: There is also the reasoning of separation.

original: rnam par dang bcas pa'i phyir tshor ba la sogs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: rnam par dang bcas pa'i phyir tshor ba la sogs pa bzhin no //
translated: The active consciousnesses arise together with the mind because they have aspects like feeling and so on.

original: tshor ba la sogs pa dmigs pa dang rnam pa yongs su chad pa'i sems dang lhan cig 'byung ba'i phyir chos can gyi khyad par las bzlog pa'i rgyus sgrub pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: tshor ba la sogs pa dmigs pa dang rnam pa yongs su chad pa'i sems dang lhan cig 'byung ba'i phyir chos can gyi khyad par las bzlog pa'i rgyus sgrub pa yang ma yin te /
translated: They are not established by the reason of reversing the attributes of the subject because feeling and so on arise together with a mind that has a determined object and aspect.

original: nur nur po la sogs pa'i dus kyi sems las byung ba rnams kyang dmigs pa dang rnam pa yongs su ma chad pa'i sems dang lhan cig 'byung bas nges pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nur nur po la sogs pa'i dus kyi sems las byung ba rnams kyang dmigs pa dang rnam pa yongs su ma chad pa'i sems dang lhan cig 'byung bas nges pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is uncertain because even the minds and mental factors of the stages of kalala and so on arise together with a mind that has an undetermined object and aspect.

original: gzhan yang kun gzhi rnam par shes pa med du zin na ji ltar 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa la gnas par 'gyur ba mi srid pa de ltar tshigs su bcad pa rnams kyis 'dri ste tshigs su sbyar ba bsdebs nas brjod pa'i phyir tshigs su bcad pa'o
analyzed: gzhan yang kun gzhi rnam par shes pa med du zin na ji ltar 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa la gnas par 'gyur ba mi srid pa de ltar tshigs su bcad pa rnams kyis 'dri ste tshigs su sbyar ba bsdebs nas brjod pa'i phyir tshigs su bcad pa'o
translated: Moreover, if the foundation consciousness did not exist, it would be impossible for the active forms of consciousness to abide in it. The following verses ask how this could be so. They are verses because they are composed in verse, and they are a discussion because they are expressed.

original: // byang chub sems dpa' bzang po'i sems zhes bya ba la sogs pa la byang chub sems dpa' ni bshad zin to //
analyzed: // byang chub sems dpa' bzang po'i sems zhes bya ba la sogs pa la byang chub sems dpa' ni bshad zin to //
translated: The bodhisattva is called ‚Äúthe one with a good mind,‚Äù and so on. The bodhisattva has already been explained.

original: bzang po zhes bya ba ni dge ba'o //
analyzed: bzang po zhes bya ba ni dge ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúGood‚Äù means virtuous.

original: rnam par shes pa lnga spangs pa zhes bya ba ni yid kyi rnam par shes pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa lnga spangs pa zhes bya ba ni yid kyi rnam par shes pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúHaving abandoned the five consciousnesses‚Äù means the mental consciousness.

original: bstsal ba med pa las gzhan pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: bstsal ba med pa las gzhan pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: ‚ÄúOther than the unconditioned‚Äù means

original: bstsal @217b ba ni mi dge ba dang lung du ma bstan pa las grol ba zag pa med pa ste /
analyzed: bstsal @217b ba ni mi dge ba dang lung du ma bstan pa las grol ba zag pa med pa ste /
translated: the unconditioned is the uncontaminated, which is free from nonvirtue and neutral states.

original: zag pa med pa de las gzhan pa zag pa dang bcas pa ni bstsal ba de las gzhan pa'o //
analyzed: zag pa med pa de las gzhan pa zag pa dang bcas pa ni bstsal ba de las gzhan pa'o //
translated: Other than that unconditioned, the conditioned is contaminated.

original: gnyen po nyid la ni mthun pa'i phyogs kyi bag la nyal du mi rung ngo //
analyzed: gnyen po nyid la ni mthun pa'i phyogs kyi bag la nyal du mi rung ngo //
translated: It is not tenable that the antidote itself is the dormant tendency of the counteragent.

original: gal te gnyen po nyid 'gyur ba yin par 'dod na de'i phyir /
analyzed: gal te gnyen po nyid 'gyur ba yin par 'dod na de'i phyir /
translated: If you assert that the antidote itself is the counteragent, then:

original: spangs pa min phyir mi rung ngo //üîΩzhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: spangs pa min phyir mi rung ngo // zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: It is not tenable that it is abandoned,üîΩbecause it is not abandoned.

original: gnyen po ni spangs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gnyen po ni spangs pa ma yin no //
translated: The antidote is not abandoned.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: What is it then?

original: spangs pa'i rgyu yin no //
analyzed: spangs pa'i rgyu yin no //
translated: It is the cause of abandonment.

original: gyur pa ni spangs pa ste /
analyzed: gyur pa ni spangs pa ste /
translated: The counteragent is abandonment,

original: 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is the result.

original: gal te gnyen po nyid spangs pa yin par 'dod na /
analyzed: gal te gnyen po nyid spangs pa yin par 'dod na /
translated: If you assert that the antidote itself is abandonment,

original: rgyu 'bras tha dad med par 'gyur //
analyzed: rgyu 'bras tha dad med par 'gyur //
translated: then cause and effect would not be different.

original: spangs pa'i rgyu gnyen po 'bras bu nyid du khas len na gcig tu gyur pa'i phyir ro //üîΩgal te sa bon bral ba'am //
analyzed: spangs pa'i rgyu gnyen po 'bras bu nyid du khas len na gcig tu gyur pa'i phyir ro // gal te sa bon bral ba'am //
translated: If you accept that the antidote, the cause of abandonment, is itself the result of abandonment, they would be the same.üîΩIf you assert that the seed is separated

original: dngos po med par 'gyur 'dod na //
analyzed: dngos po med par 'gyur 'dod na //
translated: or becomes a non-entity,

original: zhes bya ba ni rnam par rtog pa ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni rnam par rtog pa ste /
translated: this is a conception.

original: 'gyur ba zhig yin na kun nas nyon mongs pa'i sa bon rnam pa mang po bsags pa'i sems kyi sa bon dang bral bar 'gyur ba'am /
analyzed: 'gyur ba zhig yin na kun nas nyon mongs pa'i sa bon rnam pa mang po bsags pa'i sems kyi sa bon dang bral bar 'gyur ba'am /
translated: If there were a transformation, then the mind would be separated from the seeds of the many kinds of afflictions.

original: yang na sa bon rnams med par 'gyur grang na /
analyzed: yang na sa bon rnams med par 'gyur grang na /
translated: Or else, the seeds would be destroyed.

original: de med par ni gnyis med de //üîΩzhes bya ba ni yod na sa bon dang bral ba'am /
analyzed: de med par ni gnyis med de // zhes bya ba ni yod na sa bon dang bral ba'am /
translated: But without them, there is no transformation.

original: dngos po med par 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: dngos po med par 'gyur gyi /
translated: If there were a transformation, then the mind would be separated from the seeds or else the seeds would be destroyed.

original: med na ni ma yin no //üîΩ'jig rten las 'das pa'i sems mngon du gyur pa de'i tshe ni de dag med na sa bon dang bral ba'am /
analyzed: med na ni ma yin no // 'jig rten las 'das pa'i sems mngon du gyur pa de'i tshe ni de dag med na sa bon dang bral ba'am /
translated: But without them, there is no transformation.

original: chad pa ji ltar 'gyur /
analyzed: chad pa ji ltar 'gyur /
translated: But when supramundane mind manifests, how could there be a separation from the seeds or a destruction of them?üîΩThe classification of this foundation consciousness.

original: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa 'di'i rab tu dbye ba gang zhe na zhes bya ba ni grub pa'i mtshan nyid kyi don rab tu dbye dgos pas rab tu dbye ba 'dri ba'o //
analyzed: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa 'di'i rab tu dbye ba gang zhe na zhes bya ba ni grub pa'i mtshan nyid kyi don rab tu dbye dgos pas rab tu dbye ba 'dri ba'o //
translated: The classification is asked about because the meaning of the characteristic of establishment must be classified.

original: rnam pa gsum dang rnam pa bzhir blta bar bya'o //üîΩzhes bya ba la /
analyzed: rnam pa gsum dang rnam pa bzhir blta bar bya'o //üîΩzhes bya ba la /
translated: It should be regarded as threefold and fourfold.

original: mngon par brjod pa'i bag chags kyi bye brag ces bya ba ni bdag dang chos dang / bya bar mngon par brjod par tha snyad btags pa rnams te /
analyzed: mngon par brjod pa'i bag chags kyi bye brag ces bya ba ni bdag dang chos dang / bya bar mngon par brjod par tha snyad btags pa rnams te /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthe various latent propensities for verbal expressions‚Äù refers to the verbal expressions of self, phenomena, and activities.

original: lha dang mi dang mig dang / gzugs dang / 'gro'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i bag chags sna tshogs yin te /
analyzed: lha dang mi dang mig dang / gzugs dang / 'gro'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i bag chags sna tshogs yin te /
translated: They are the various latent propensities for the expressions ‚Äúgod,‚Äù ‚Äúhuman,‚Äù ‚Äúeye,‚Äù ‚Äúform,‚Äù ‚Äúgoes,‚Äù and so on.

original: nus pa'i khyad par gang las bdag dang / chos dang / bya ba'i mngon par brjod par 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: nus pa'i khyad par gang las bdag dang / chos dang / bya ba'i mngon par brjod par 'byung ba'o //
translated: They are the special capacities from which the verbal expressions of self, phenomena, and activities arise.

original: bdag tu lta ba'i bag chags kyi bye brag ces bya ba ni nyon mongs pa bzhis nyon mongs par gyur pa'i yid 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i dbang gis kun gzhi rnam par shes pa la bdag go snyam pa'i bag chags kyi bye brag @218a * //
analyzed: bdag tu lta ba'i bag chags kyi bye brag ces bya ba ni nyon mongs pa bzhis nyon mongs par gyur pa'i yid 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i dbang gis kun gzhi rnam par shes pa la bdag go snyam pa'i bag chags kyi bye brag @218a * //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthe various latent propensities for the view of self‚Äù refers to the various latent propensities for the view of self that are generated in the store consciousness through the power of the view of the perishable composite.

original: go ; / srid pa'i yan lag gi bag chags kyi bye brag ces bya ba ni bsod nams dang bsod nams ma yin pa dang / mi g-yo ba'i 'du byed kyi dbang gis lha la sogs pa'i 'gro ba rnams su ma rig pa nas rga shi la thug pa rnams kyi bag chags kyi bye brag go rnam pa gsum bshad zin to //
analyzed: go ; / srid pa'i yan lag gi bag chags kyi bye brag ces bya ba ni bsod nams dang bsod nams ma yin pa dang / mi g-yo ba'i 'du byed kyi dbang gis lha la sogs pa'i 'gro ba rnams su ma rig pa nas rga shi la thug pa rnams kyi bag chags kyi bye brag go rnam pa gsum bshad zin to //
translated: The specific latent impressions of the members of cyclic existence are the specific latent impressions of the members of cyclic existence from ignorance to aging and death in the realms of gods and so on through the power of meritorious, nonmeritorious, and unshakable compositional activity.üîΩThe three types of latent impressions have been explained.

original: rnam pa bzhir brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: rnam pa bzhir brjod par bya ste /
translated: Now, four types should be mentioned.üîΩThe first is the specific latent impressions of the members of cyclic existence.üîΩThe second is the specific latent impressions of the three realms.üîΩThe third is the specific latent impressions of the three realms and the three times.üîΩThe fourth is the specific latent impressions of the three realms, the three times, and the three types of karma.

original: 'phen pas rab tu dbye ba zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: 'phen pas rab tu dbye ba zhes bya ba la /
translated: The first is the specific latent impressions of the members of cyclic existence.üîΩThe second is the specific latent impressions of the three realms.üîΩThe third is the specific latent impressions of the three realms and the three times.üîΩThe fourth is the specific latent impressions of the three realms, the three times, and the three types of karma.üîΩThe first is the specific latent impressions of the members of cyclic existence.üîΩThe second is the specific latent impressions of the three realms.

original: gang rnam par smin pa'i bag chags gsar du 'byung ba zhes bya ba ni bag chags 'byung ba brjod pas thog mar skye ba gang yin pa /
analyzed: gang rnam par smin pa'i bag chags gsar du 'byung ba zhes bya ba ni bag chags 'byung ba brjod pas thog mar skye ba gang yin pa /
translated: The third is the specific latent impressions of the three realms and the three times.üîΩThe fourth is the specific latent impressions of the three realms, the three times, and the three types of karma.üîΩThe first is the specific latent impressions of the members of cyclic existence.

original: de 'phen pas rab tu dbye ba ste /
analyzed: de 'phen pas rab tu dbye ba ste /
translated: The second is the specific latent impressions of the three realms.üîΩThe third is the specific latent impressions of the three realms and the three times.üîΩThe fourth is the specific latent impressions of the three realms, the three times, and the three types of karma.

original: des skye ba 'phen pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: des skye ba 'phen pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The first is the specific latent impressions of the members of cyclic existence.üîΩThe second is the specific latent impressions of the three realms.üîΩThe third is the specific latent impressions of the three realms and the three times.üîΩThe fourth is the specific latent impressions of the three realms, the three times, and the three types of karma.üîΩThe first is the specific latent impressions of the members of cyclic existence.üîΩThe second is the specific latent impressions of the three realms.üîΩThe third is the specific latent impressions of the three realms and the three times.

original: de med du zin na 'du byed kyi rkyen gyis rnam par shes pa dang / len pa'i rkyen gyis srid pa mi rung ngo //
analyzed: de med du zin na 'du byed kyi rkyen gyis rnam par shes pa dang / len pa'i rkyen gyis srid pa mi rung ngo //
translated: The fourth is the specific latent impressions of the three realms, the three times, and the three types of karma.üîΩThe first is the specific latent impressions of the members of cyclic existence.üîΩThe second is the specific latent impressions of the three realms

original: zhes bya ba ni 'di ltar kun gzhi rnam par shes pa nyon mongs pa'i bag la nyal la ltos pa skye ba la mngon du phyogs par gnas pa de nyid srid pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni 'di ltar kun gzhi rnam par shes pa nyon mongs pa'i bag la nyal la ltos pa skye ba la mngon du phyogs par gnas pa de nyid srid pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Thus, the foundation consciousness that is directed toward the arising of the propensities for affliction is called ‚Äúbecoming.‚Äù

original: rnam par smin pas rab tu dbye ba zhes bya ba ni gang 'du byed dang / srid pa'i rkyen gyis 'gro ba rnams su 'phangs pa rnam par smin pa ste /
analyzed: rnam par smin pas rab tu dbye ba zhes bya ba ni gang 'du byed dang / srid pa'i rkyen gyis 'gro ba rnams su 'phangs pa rnam par smin pa ste /
translated: The classification of karmic maturation is that which is projected into the destinies by the conditions of karmic formations and becoming.

original: de med du zin na rgyu med par gyur pas yang 'byung ba'i mig la sogs pa'i chos rnams skye bar mi rung ste /
analyzed: de med du zin na rgyu med par gyur pas yang 'byung ba'i mig la sogs pa'i chos rnams skye bar mi rung ste /
translated: If that did not exist, then without a cause, the arising of the phenomena of the eye and so on would be impossible.

original: rtsa ba med par yal ga la sogs pa mi 'byung ngo //
analyzed: rtsa ba med par yal ga la sogs pa mi 'byung ngo //
translated: Branches and so on do not arise without a root.

original: rgyu nyid du rab tu dbye ba zhes bya ba ni gang kun gzhi rnam par shes pa nyon mongs pa can gyi yid kyis 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i dbang gis bdag tu 'dzin pas dmigs pa de nyid ni bdag tu 'dzin pa'i rgyu nyid de /
analyzed: rgyu nyid du rab tu dbye ba zhes bya ba ni gang kun gzhi rnam par shes pa nyon mongs pa can gyi yid kyis 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i dbang gis bdag tu 'dzin pas dmigs pa de nyid ni bdag tu 'dzin pa'i rgyu nyid de /
translated: The classification of causes is that which is the cause of the apprehension of self, due to the power of the view of the transitory collection by the afflicted mind of the foundation consciousness.

original: de med du zin na nyon mongs pa can gyi yid dang 'brel ba can gyi ngar 'dzin pa'i dmigs pa med par 'gyur ro /
analyzed: de med du zin na nyon mongs pa can gyi yid dang 'brel ba can gyi ngar 'dzin pa'i dmigs pa med par 'gyur ro /
translated: If that were not so, then the object of the clinging to an ‚ÄúI‚Äù which is associated with the afflicted mind would not exist.

original: mtshan nyid kyis rab tu dbye ba ni thun mong pa la sogs pa'i bye brag gi rnam pa du ma'o //
analyzed: mtshan nyid kyis rab tu dbye ba ni thun mong pa la sogs pa'i bye brag gi rnam pa du ma'o //
translated: The classification by way of characteristics is the many aspects of the distinctions of the common, etc.

original: de la thun mong ni snod kyi 'jig rten gyi sa bon gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: de la thun mong ni snod kyi 'jig rten gyi sa bon gang yin pa'o //
translated: Among them, the common is the seed of the physical world.

original: zhes bya ba ni snod kyi 'jig rten du snang ba'i rnam par rig pa rnams kyi byed rgyu'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni snod kyi 'jig rten du snang ba'i rnam par rig pa rnams kyi byed rgyu'o //
translated: This is the active cause of the representations appearing as the physical world.

original: thun mong ba ni rang gi las dang mthun pa'i rnam par smin pa'i dbang gis de la spyod pa po thams cad la der snang ba'i rnam par rig pa skye ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thun mong ba ni rang gi las dang mthun pa'i rnam par smin pa'i dbang gis de la spyod pa po thams cad la der snang ba'i rnam par rig pa skye ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The common is because the representations appearing as that arise for all those who experience it by the power of the maturation of karma in accordance with their own.üîΩThe uncommon is the seed of the individual sense spheres.

original: thun mong ma yin pa ni so so rang gi skye mched kyi sa bon gang yin pa'o zhes bya ba la rang rang la yod pa ni so so rang rang gi @218b ste ;
analyzed: thun mong ma yin pa ni so so rang gi skye mched kyi sa bon gang yin pa'o zhes bya ba la rang rang la yod pa ni so so rang rang gi @218b ste ;
translated: Each one is individual, and each one is individual‚Äôs.

original: nang gi skye mched drug gi sa bon zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: nang gi skye mched drug gi sa bon zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning of the phrase ‚Äúseeds of the six sense bases‚Äù is the same as the meaning of the phrase ‚Äúseeds of the inner bases.‚Äù

original: thun mong ma yin pa de ni tshor ba med pa 'byung ba'i sa bon no zhes bya ba ni bde ba dang sdug bsngal gyi tshor bas phan 'dogs pa dang gnod par byed pa med pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: thun mong ma yin pa de ni tshor ba med pa 'byung ba'i sa bon no zhes bya ba ni bde ba dang sdug bsngal gyi tshor bas phan 'dogs pa dang gnod par byed pa med pa'i phyir te /
translated: The seeds of the arising of the non-common are the seeds of the arising of the inner bases that are devoid of feeling, because there is no benefit or harm from the feelings of pleasure and pain.

original: snod kyi 'jig rten la bde ba dang sdug bsngal ba med do ;
analyzed: snod kyi 'jig rten la bde ba dang sdug bsngal ba med do ;
translated: The world of the environment does not have pleasure and pain.üîΩWhen the antidote arises, that is, when the truth of the path arises, the seeds of the inner bases, which are the opposing factors, are stopped, because they are incompatible.üîΩThe seeds of the arising of the common are the seeds of the inner bases that are associated with feeling, because they are the seeds of the inner bases that are associated with feeling.üîΩThe seeds of the arising of the non-common are the seeds of the inner bases that are devoid of feeling, because they are the seeds of the inner bases that are devoid of feeling.

original: / gnyen po byung ste lam gyi bden pa skyes pa na mi mthun pa'i phyogs nang gi skye mched drug gi sa bon 'gags te mi mthun pa'i phyir ro //üîΩthun mong ba gzhan gyi rnam par rtog pas yongs su zin pa la ni mthong ba rnam par dag par 'gyur te /
analyzed: / gnyen po byung ste lam gyi bden pa skyes pa na mi mthun pa'i phyogs nang gi skye mched drug gi sa bon 'gags te mi mthun pa'i phyir ro //üîΩthun mong ba gzhan gyi rnam par rtog pas yongs su zin pa la ni mthong ba rnam par dag par 'gyur te /
translated: The seeds of the arising of the common are the seeds of the inner bases that are associated with feeling, because they are the seeds of the inner bases that are associated with feeling.üîΩThe seeds of the arising of the non-common are the seeds of the inner bases that are devoid of feeling, because they are the seeds of the inner bases that are devoid of feeling.üîΩThe seeds of the arising of the common are the seeds of the inner bases that are associated with feeling, because they are the seeds of the inner bases that are associated with feeling.üîΩThe seeds of the arising of the non-common are the seeds of the inner bases that are devoid of feeling, because they are the seeds of the inner bases that are devoid of feeling.üîΩThe seeds of the arising of the common are the seeds of the inner bases that are associated with feeling, because they are the seeds of the inner bases that are associated with feeling.üîΩThe seeds of the arising of the non-common are the seeds of the inner bases that are devoid of feeling, because they are the seeds of the inner bases that are devoid of feeling.üîΩThe seeds of the arising of the common are the seeds of the inner bases that are associated with feeling, because they are the seeds of the inner bases that are associated with feeling.üîΩThe seeds of the arising of the non-common are the seeds of the inner bases that are devoid of feeling, because they are the seeds of the inner bases that are devoid of feeling.üîΩThe seeds of the arising of the common are

original: zhes bya ba ni rnal 'byor pa nang gi skye mched kyi rnam par rtog pa 'gags pa rnams kyang thun mong ba snod kyi 'jig rten sems can gzhan gyi rnam par rtog pas zin pas gang yin pa de la mthong ba rnam par dag par 'gyur te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni rnal 'byor pa nang gi skye mched kyi rnam par rtog pa 'gags pa rnams kyang thun mong ba snod kyi 'jig rten sems can gzhan gyi rnam par rtog pas zin pas gang yin pa de la mthong ba rnam par dag par 'gyur te /
translated: This is because even the yogis who have stopped the conceptualization of the internal sense bases are still affected by the conceptualization of other sentient beings, who are ordinary, external world systems.

original: de dag gis de nam mkha' dang 'dra bar mthong bas chus kyang mi 'khru'o //
analyzed: de dag gis de nam mkha' dang 'dra bar mthong bas chus kyang mi 'khru'o //
translated: Since they see those as being like space, they are not carried away by water.

original: sas kyang mi 'dzin to //üîΩmes kyang mi tshig go //
analyzed: sas kyang mi 'dzin to // mes kyang mi tshig go //
translated: They are not held by earth.üîΩThey are not burned by fire.

original: rlung gis kyang mi bsgul to //
analyzed: rlung gis kyang mi bsgul to //
translated: They are not moved by wind.üîΩHow can the pure seeing of the existent be?

original: don yod pa la mthong ba rnam par dag par ji ltar 'gyur zhes gzhan gyi klan ka'i skabs rig nas /
analyzed: don yod pa la mthong ba rnam par dag par ji ltar 'gyur zhes gzhan gyi klan ka'i skabs rig nas /
translated: Knowing that this is an opportunity for others to criticize,

original: rnal 'byor pa rnams kyi mos pa tha dad pas zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: rnal 'byor pa rnams kyi mos pa tha dad pas zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: he says, ‚ÄúThe yogis have different aspirations,‚Äù and so on.

original: mos pa gang dang gang yin pa ji ltar mos pa bzhin du gser la sogs pa'i bye brag gis blta bar bya ba sna tshogs pa dmigs pa lta bu ste /
analyzed: mos pa gang dang gang yin pa ji ltar mos pa bzhin du gser la sogs pa'i bye brag gis blta bar bya ba sna tshogs pa dmigs pa lta bu ste /
translated: Whatever their aspiration is, they see the various objects of observation, such as the various distinctions of gold and so on, in accordance with their aspiration.

original: gser dang / dngul dang / rtsva dang shing la sogs pa'i bye brag gis dmigs pa sna tshogs so //üîΩthun mong 'ching ba spang dka' dang // yongs shes bya bar dka' bar 'dod //
analyzed: gser dang / dngul dang / rtsva dang shing la sogs pa'i bye brag gis dmigs pa sna tshogs so // thun mong 'ching ba spang dka' dang // yongs shes bya bar dka' bar 'dod //
translated: The object is various, because of the differences of gold, silver, grass, trees, etc.üîΩThe common one is difficult to abandon, the bond;

original: ces bya ba la /
analyzed: ces bya ba la /
translated: the one to be fully known is considered difficult to penetrate.

original: thun mong zhes bya ba ni thun mong gi rgyu las byung ba'i phyir de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: thun mong zhes bya ba ni thun mong gi rgyu las byung ba'i phyir de skad ces bya'o //
translated: The common one is so called because it arises from a common cause.

original: 'ching ba zhes bya ba ni chags pa'o //
analyzed: 'ching ba zhes bya ba ni chags pa'o //
translated: The bond is attachment.

original: spangs par dka' zhing yongs su zhes par bya ba dka' bas na spang dka' dang yongs shes bya bar dka' ba'o //
analyzed: spangs par dka' zhing yongs su zhes par bya ba dka' bas na spang dka' dang yongs shes bya bar dka' ba'o //
translated: It is difficult to abandon and difficult to penetrate, because it is difficult to fully know.

original: phyi rol mtshan ma chen po las //
analyzed: phyi rol mtshan ma chen po las //
translated: From the great external sign,

original: zhes bya ba ni gnas pa chen po snod kyi 'jig rten las zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni gnas pa chen po snod kyi 'jig rten las zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The great abode is the external world.

original: tha dad sems zhes bya ba ni mos pa sna tshogs rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: tha dad sems zhes bya ba ni mos pa sna tshogs rnams kyi'o //
translated: The various minds are those of the various aspirations.

original: de ni 'gags par ma gyur kyang //
analyzed: de ni 'gags par ma gyur kyang //
translated: It is not stopped,

original: zhes bya ba ni sems can gzhan gyi rnam par rtog pas yongs su zin pa'i phyir ma 'gags pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni sems can gzhan gyi rnam par rtog pas yongs su zin pa'i phyir ma 'gags pa'o //
translated: It is not stopped because it is taken hold of by the discriminations of other sentient beings.

original: @219a * // dag pa rnams kyi zhes bya ba ni gnas gyur pa rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: @219a * // dag pa rnams kyi zhes bya ba ni gnas gyur pa rnams kyi'o //
translated: Of the pure ones means of those who have a transmuted basis.

original: sangs rgyas gzigs pa rnam dag phyir //
analyzed: sangs rgyas gzigs pa rnam dag phyir //
translated: Because the vision of the buddhas is pure,
