original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gzugs la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa ma spangs pa'i so so'i skye bo rnams kyis zhing gang dag 'dam rdzab dang / rdo dang ba tsha can dang / mi mnyam pa dang / sdong dum dang / tsher ma dang /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gzugs la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa ma spangs pa'i so so'i skye bo rnams kyis zhing gang dag 'dam rdzab dang / rdo dang ba tsha can dang / mi mnyam pa dang / sdong dum dang / tsher ma dang /
translated: Those fields that are seen by ordinary beings who have not abandoned the discriminations of form, etc. as being filled with mire, stones, salt water, uneven terrain, stumps, thorns,

original: mi gtsang ba dang / ldan par mthong ba de dag nyid gzugs la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa spangs pa de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis gser la sogs pa'i rang bzhin du gzigs te /
analyzed: mi gtsang ba dang / ldan par mthong ba de dag nyid gzugs la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa spangs pa de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis gser la sogs pa'i rang bzhin du gzigs te /
translated: filth, and so on, are seen by the transcendent lords who have abandoned the discriminations of form, etc. as being composed of gold, etc.

original: mya ngan la shing du mthong ba bzhin no //
analyzed: mya ngan la shing du mthong ba bzhin no //
translated: like the vision of a pile of coals.

original: thun mong ma yin pa gang yin pa de ni tshor ba dang bcas pa 'byung ba'i sa bon te zhes bya ba ni bde ba dang sdug bsngal la sogs pa'i tshor ba'i gnas yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thun mong ma yin pa gang yin pa de ni tshor ba dang bcas pa 'byung ba'i sa bon te zhes bya ba ni bde ba dang sdug bsngal la sogs pa'i tshor ba'i gnas yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: That which is not common is the seed of the arising of feeling. This is because it is the basis of the feelings of pleasure, pain, etc.

original: de med du zin na zhes bya ba ni thun mong dang thun mong ma yin pa'i mtshan nyid kyi kun gzhi rnam par shes pa med du zin na 'di ni sems can gyi 'jig rten no //
analyzed: de med du zin na zhes bya ba ni thun mong dang thun mong ma yin pa'i mtshan nyid kyi kun gzhi rnam par shes pa med du zin na 'di ni sems can gyi 'jig rten no //
translated: If that did not exist, there would be no distinction between this sentient world and that inanimate world.

original: 'di ni snod kyi 'jig rten no //
analyzed: 'di ni snod kyi 'jig rten no //
translated: This is the world of sentient beings.üîΩThis is the world of the inanimate environment.

original: 'di ni bde bas can no //
analyzed: 'di ni bde bas can no //
translated: This is the happy world.üîΩThis is the unhappy world.

original: 'di ni sdug bsngal can no zhes bya ba'i bye brag med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di ni sdug bsngal can no zhes bya ba'i bye brag med par 'gyur ro //
translated: There would be no distinction if the alayavij√±ana, which has the common and uncommon characteristics, did not exist.

original: gnas ngan len gyi mtshan nyid ces bya ba la ngan pa ni sdig pa'o //
analyzed: gnas ngan len gyi mtshan nyid ces bya ba la ngan pa ni sdig pa'o //
translated: The characteristic of negative reflex action means: negative is sinful.

original: de len pa ni gnas ngan len no //
analyzed: de len pa ni gnas ngan len no //
translated: The taking of that is negative reflex action.

original: nyon mongs pa dang nye ba'i nyon mongs pa'i sa bon no //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa dang nye ba'i nyon mongs pa'i sa bon no //
translated: It is the seed of the afflictions and secondary afflictions.

original: gnas ngan len ni las su mi rung ba nyid do //
analyzed: gnas ngan len ni las su mi rung ba nyid do //
translated: Negative reflex action is the unserviceability of the mind.

original: shin tu sbyangs pa'i mtshan nyid ces bya ba la /
analyzed: shin tu sbyangs pa'i mtshan nyid ces bya ba la /
translated: The characteristic of pliancy.üîΩüîΩ

original: shin tu sbyangs pa ni ji skad smos pa las bzlog pa ste /
analyzed: shin tu sbyangs pa ni ji skad smos pa las bzlog pa ste /
translated: The characteristic of pliancy is the opposite of the above.

original: las su rung ba nyid dang yang ba dang / zo mdog bde ba zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: las su rung ba nyid dang yang ba dang / zo mdog bde ba zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Pliancy is the opposite of the above, i.e., it is the lightness, the ease of the body, and the ease of the mind.

original: spyad zin pa'i mtshan nyid ni gang dge ba dang mi dge ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni rnam par smin zin pa yang smin par mi nus te /
analyzed: spyad zin pa'i mtshan nyid ni gang dge ba dang mi dge ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni rnam par smin zin pa yang smin par mi nus te /
translated: The characteristic of the experienced is that which is either wholesome or unwholesome, etc. It is not possible for that which has already matured to mature again,

original: spyad zin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: spyad zin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it has already been experienced.

original: dper na sa bon gyis myu gu bskyed nas yang bskyed mi nus pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na sa bon gyis myu gu bskyed nas yang bskyed mi nus pa bzhin no //
translated: For example, a seed, having produced a sprout, is not able to produce it again.

original: ma spyad pa'i mtshan nyid ni gang mngon par brjod pa'i bag chags kyi sa bon te /
analyzed: ma spyad pa'i mtshan nyid ni gang mngon par brjod pa'i bag chags kyi sa bon te /
translated: The characteristic of the unexperienced is the seed of the latent impressions of verbalization.

original: zhes bya ba ni rkyen ji lta ba bzhin du sa bon rgyas par 'gyur ba la thog ma'i mtha' med pa'i spros pa rgyur gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni rkyen ji lta ba bzhin du sa bon rgyas par 'gyur ba la thog ma'i mtha' med pa'i spros pa rgyur gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The beginningless evolution of the seed of verbalization is the cause of the endless proliferation of verbalization, in accordance with the conditions.

original: de med du zin na zhes bya ba ni gnyi ga'i mtshan nyid kyi kun gzhi rnam par shes pa med na ste /
analyzed: de med du zin na zhes bya ba ni gnyi ga'i mtshan nyid kyi kun gzhi rnam par shes pa med na ste /
translated: if the ƒÅlaya consciousness that has the characteristics of both did not exist,

original: re zhig spyod zin pa'i mtshan nyid med na dge ba dang sdig pa zhes bya ba la @219b sogs pa ni 'bras bu byin pas spyad zin pa 'jig pa de med par 'gyur te /
analyzed: re zhig spyod zin pa'i mtshan nyid med na dge ba dang sdig pa zhes bya ba la @219b sogs pa ni 'bras bu byin pas spyad zin pa 'jig pa de med par 'gyur te /
translated: then first, if the characteristics of that which has been experienced did not exist, then that which has been experienced would not exist, because the results of virtue and nonvirtue and so on would be destroyed.

original: 'bras bu byin nas yang 'bras bur 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go /
analyzed: 'bras bu byin nas yang 'bras bur 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go /
translated: It would be meaningless to say that after giving a result, it would become a result again.

original: ma spyad pa'i kun gzhi rnam par shes pa med du zin na mngon par brjod pa'i bag chags gsar du 'byung bar yang mi rung ste /
analyzed: ma spyad pa'i kun gzhi rnam par shes pa med du zin na mngon par brjod pa'i bag chags gsar du 'byung bar yang mi rung ste /
translated: If the ƒÅlaya consciousness that has not yet been experienced did not exist, then the arising of new imprints of language would be illogical.

original: mngon par brjod pa sngon gyi rnying bar ma gyur pa sngon ma byung ba la da ltar gyur pa ni 'jig rten na gang med do //
analyzed: mngon par brjod pa sngon gyi rnying bar ma gyur pa sngon ma byung ba la da ltar gyur pa ni 'jig rten na gang med do //
translated: In the world there is nothing that is not old, that is not something that existed before but has become something new.

original: dpe mtshan nyid ces bya ba ni /
analyzed: dpe mtshan nyid ces bya ba ni /
translated: The characteristics of the example

original: dpe sgyu ma la sogs pa dang bstun par bya bar mtshon pa ste /
analyzed: dpe sgyu ma la sogs pa dang bstun par bya bar mtshon pa ste /
translated: are indicated as being consistent with the example of an illusion and so on.

original: dper na sgyu ma la sogs pa ni yang dag pa gang yin pa mthong ba'i rgyur gyur pa ji lta bar kun gzhi rnam par shes pa yang de bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na sgyu ma la sogs pa ni yang dag pa gang yin pa mthong ba'i rgyur gyur pa ji lta bar kun gzhi rnam par shes pa yang de bzhin no //
translated: For example, just as a magician, etc. are the cause for seeing what is real, so also is the store-consciousness.

original: de med du zin na zhes bya ba ni dpe sgyu ma la sogs pa dang bstun par bya ba med du zin na kun gzhi rnam par shes pa phyin ci log gi rgyur rtog par mi 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: de med du zin na zhes bya ba ni dpe sgyu ma la sogs pa dang bstun par bya ba med du zin na kun gzhi rnam par shes pa phyin ci log gi rgyur rtog par mi 'gyur gyi /
translated: If it did not exist, i.e., if the store-consciousness did not exist, then the cause for error would not exist, i.e., the store-consciousness would not be conceived as the cause for error.

original: yang dag pa ma mthong ba'i rgyu nyid du rtog par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yang dag pa ma mthong ba'i rgyu nyid du rtog par 'gyur ro //
translated: But the cause for not seeing what is real would exist, i.e., the store-consciousness would be conceived as the cause for not seeing what is real.

original: de ltar kun gzhi rnam par shes pa'i don rnam grangs dang / nges pa'i tshig dang / mtshan nyid dang / rab tu dbye bas bshad zin te //
analyzed: de ltar kun gzhi rnam par shes pa'i don rnam grangs dang / nges pa'i tshig dang / mtshan nyid dang / rab tu dbye bas bshad zin te //
translated: Thus, the meaning of the store-consciousness has been explained in terms of synonyms, verbal etymology, characteristics, and divisions.

original: so so yang dag par rig pa dang mthun pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: so so yang dag par rig pa dang mthun pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is in conformity with the analytical knowledges.

original: ci'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni dri ba brtsams nas brjod pa 'dod pa brjod de /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni dri ba brtsams nas brjod pa 'dod pa brjod de /
translated: Why? etc. Having begun the question, he states what he wants to say.

original: ma bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa can ma yin la lung du ma bstan pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: ma bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa can ma yin la lung du ma bstan pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Unobscured-indeterminate means that it is not afflicted and indeterminate.

original: 'di ltar zhes bya bas ni rgyu ston to //
analyzed: 'di ltar zhes bya bas ni rgyu ston to //
translated: Thus shows the cause.

original: 'di ltar ma bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa ni dge ba dang mi dge ba dang 'gal ba med do zhes bya ba ni rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos por ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar ma bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa ni dge ba dang mi dge ba dang 'gal ba med do zhes bya ba ni rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos por ro //
translated: Thus, an unobscured-indeterminate is not incompatible with virtue and nonvirtue.

original: phan tshun ma yin te /
analyzed: phan tshun ma yin te /
translated: It is not mutually,

original: mi mthun pa'i phyogs dang gnyen po yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi mthun pa'i phyogs dang gnyen po yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is the counteragent to the adverse side.

original: de lta bas na rnam par smin pa ni dge ba dang mi dge ba ma yin te /
analyzed: de lta bas na rnam par smin pa ni dge ba dang mi dge ba ma yin te /
translated: Therefore, the karmic maturation is neither virtuous nor nonvirtuous,

original: mi mthun pa gnyis lhan cig tu gnas par 'gyur du 'ong ngo //
analyzed: mi mthun pa gnyis lhan cig tu gnas par 'gyur du 'ong ngo //
translated: because it would follow that two incompatible things would coexist.

original: shes bya'i gnas bshad zin to //
analyzed: shes bya'i gnas bshad zin to //
translated: The topic of the knowable has been explained.

original: zhes bya ba ni yang bshad par bya ba ma yin pa'o /üîΩ// / bam po gsum pa /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni yang bshad par bya ba ma yin pa'o / // / bam po gsum pa /
translated: This means that it is not to be explained further.

original: shes bya'i mtshan nyid mdor bsdu na rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: shes bya'i mtshan nyid mdor bsdu na rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: The characteristics of the knowable are summarized as three:

original: zhes bya ba ni chos thams cad rnam pa gsum du yongs su chad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni chos thams cad rnam pa gsum du yongs su chad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because all phenomena are completely divided into three types.

original: gzhan gyi dbang gi mtshan nyid ces bya ba ni gzung ba dang 'dzin par yongs su rtog pa'i rjes su 'jug pa'i las dang nyon mongs pa gzhan dag gis dbang byas pa'i phyir te /üîΩshes @220a * //
analyzed: gzhan gyi dbang gi mtshan nyid ces bya ba ni gzung ba dang 'dzin par yongs su rtog pa'i rjes su 'jug pa'i las dang nyon mongs pa gzhan dag gis dbang byas pa'i phyir te / shes @220a * //
translated: The other-dependent characteristic is so called because it is controlled by other actions and afflictions that follow after the discrimination of grasped and grasper.

original: bya ci yang rung ste de ltar mtshan pa ni gzhan gyi dbang gi mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: bya ci yang rung ste de ltar mtshan pa ni gzhan gyi dbang gi mtshan nyid do //
translated: Any object of cognition that is characterized in this way is the other-dependent characteristic.

original: kun brtags pa'i mtshan nyid ces bya ba ni gtan med pa'i mtshan nyid de /
analyzed: kun brtags pa'i mtshan nyid ces bya ba ni gtan med pa'i mtshan nyid de /
translated: The imagined characteristic is so called because it is a completely non-existent characteristic.

original: kun brtags par bya ba gzung bas dang 'dzin pa dang / gang zag dang chos gang yin pa kun brtags par mtshon pa'i phyir mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: kun brtags par bya ba gzung bas dang 'dzin pa dang / gang zag dang chos gang yin pa kun brtags par mtshon pa'i phyir mtshan nyid do //
translated: It is a characteristic because it characterizes the imagined object, whether it be the imagined grasped or grasper, person or phenomena.

original: de ji ltar na mtshan nyid du 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: de ji ltar na mtshan nyid du 'gyur zhe na /
translated: How can it be a characteristic?

original: ji ltar na mi 'gyur /üîΩ'di ltar kun brtags pa shes pa med de /
analyzed: ji ltar na mi 'gyur / 'di ltar kun brtags pa shes pa med de /
translated: Why can‚Äôt it be?üîΩBecause the imagined is not a cognition.

original: yod par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yod par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: If it were, it would follow that it exists.

original: mi shes pa ni mtshan nyid du yang mi rung mtshan gzhir yang mi rung ngo zhe na /
analyzed: mi shes pa ni mtshan nyid du yang mi rung mtshan gzhir yang mi rung ngo zhe na /
translated: But it is not tenable that the non-cognized is a characteristic, nor is it tenable that it is a characterized basis.

original: ji ltar mi shes te /üîΩbcom ldan 'das kyis ji tsam du yod pa la yod par mi shes pa dang / ci tsam du med pa la med par mi shes pa zhes bya ba dang / de bzhin du yod pa la yang yod par shes par 'gyur /
analyzed: ji ltar mi shes te / bcom ldan 'das kyis ji tsam du yod pa la yod par mi shes pa dang / ci tsam du med pa la med par mi shes pa zhes bya ba dang / de bzhin du yod pa la yang yod par shes par 'gyur /
translated: How is it not cognized?üîΩHasn‚Äôt the Lord said, ‚ÄúTo the extent that one does not know existence as existence, and one does not know non-existence as non-existence,

original: med pa la yang med par shes par 'gyur zhes ma gsungs sam /üîΩkun brtags pa gzung ba'am /
analyzed: med pa la yang med par shes par 'gyur zhes ma gsungs sam / kun brtags pa gzung ba'am /
translated: to that extent one knows existence as existence, and one knows non-existence as non-existence‚Äù?üîΩThe non-existence of the imagined, whether as a perceived object or a perceiving subject, or as a self or as a dharma, is the characteristic of the perfected.

original: 'dzin pa'am / bdag gam chos kyi med pa yongs su grub pa'i mtshan nyid gang yin pa de tshad ma'i yul du gyur na rnam par shes so //
analyzed: 'dzin pa'am / bdag gam chos kyi med pa yongs su grub pa'i mtshan nyid gang yin pa de tshad ma'i yul du gyur na rnam par shes so //
translated: If it were the object of a validating cognition, it would be cognized.

original: de yongs su shes pas kun du brtags pa yod pa yin par yongs su gcod de mi mthun pa yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de yongs su shes pas kun du brtags pa yod pa yin par yongs su gcod de mi mthun pa yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: By fully understanding it, one determines the existence of the imagined, because there is a contradiction.

original: yul gyi dngos por khas blangs pas yongs su gcod pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: yul gyi dngos por khas blangs pas yongs su gcod pa ni ma yin no //
translated: But one does not determine it by accepting it as an objective entity.

original: lus dang lus can dang za ba po'i rnam par rig pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa de la lus kyi rnam par rig pa ni dbang po gzugs can du snang ba ste /
analyzed: lus dang lus can dang za ba po'i rnam par rig pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa de la lus kyi rnam par rig pa ni dbang po gzugs can du snang ba ste /
translated: The consciousness of the body, the embodied being, and the experiencer, etc. The consciousness of the body is the appearance of the material sense faculties.

original: de bzhin du 'og ma rnams la yang snang ba'i sgra sbyar bar bya'o //üîΩlus can gyi rnam par rig pa ni yid do ;
analyzed: de bzhin du 'og ma rnams la yang snang ba'i sgra sbyar bar bya'o // lus can gyi rnam par rig pa ni yid do ;
translated: The same should be applied to the following.üîΩThe consciousness of the embodied being is the mental faculty.

original: / za ba po'i rnam par rig pa ni yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i //
analyzed: / za ba po'i rnam par rig pa ni yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i //
translated: The consciousness of the experiencer is the mental consciousness.

original: des nye bar spyad par bya ba'i rnam par rig pa ni phyi'i skye mched rnams so //
analyzed: des nye bar spyad par bya ba'i rnam par rig pa ni phyi'i skye mched rnams so //
translated: The consciousness of the experienced is the external sense bases.

original: de la nye bar spyod pa'i rnam par rig pa ni rnam par shes pa lnga po dag go //
analyzed: de la nye bar spyod pa'i rnam par rig pa ni rnam par shes pa lnga po dag go //
translated: The consciousness of the experience is the five consciousnesses.

original: dus kyi rnam par rig pa ni dus gsum du snang ba'o //
analyzed: dus kyi rnam par rig pa ni dus gsum du snang ba'o //
translated: The consciousness of time is the appearance of the three times.

original: grangs kyi rnam par rig pa ni gcig la sogs par bgrang bar snang ba'o //
analyzed: grangs kyi rnam par rig pa ni gcig la sogs par bgrang bar snang ba'o //
translated: The consciousness of number is the appearance of counting one and so on.

original: yul gyi rnam par rig pa ni grong dang kun dga' ra ba la sogs par snang ba'o //
analyzed: yul gyi rnam par rig pa ni grong dang kun dga' ra ba la sogs par snang ba'o //
translated: The consciousness of place is the appearance of villages, parks, and so on.

original: tha snyad kyi rnam par rig pa ni mthong ba dang thos pa dang / bye brag phyed pa dang / rnam par shes pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: tha snyad kyi rnam par rig pa ni mthong ba dang thos pa dang / bye brag phyed pa dang / rnam par shes pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The conventional cognition is called seeing, hearing, distinguishing, and knowing.

original: bdag dang gzhan @220b gyi bye brag gi rnam par rig pa ni ngar 'dzin pa dang nga yir 'dzin par chad pa lus la sogs pa'i rnam par rig pa ste /
analyzed: bdag dang gzhan @220b gyi bye brag gi rnam par rig pa ni ngar 'dzin pa dang nga yir 'dzin par chad pa lus la sogs pa'i rnam par rig pa ste /
translated: The cognition of the distinction between self and other is the cognition of the body, etc., which is interrupted by the grasping of ‚ÄúI‚Äù and the grasping of ‚Äúmine.‚Äù

original: nga'o nga'i'o // 'di ni nga'i ma yin gyi 'di ni gzhan gyi'o //
analyzed: nga'o nga'i'o // 'di ni nga'i ma yin gyi 'di ni gzhan gyi'o //
translated: ‚ÄúI,‚Äù ‚Äúmine,‚Äù ‚Äúthis is not mine,‚Äù ‚Äúthis is another‚Äôs.‚Äù

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i bye brag tu 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i bye brag tu 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because of the grasping of distinctions such as these.

original: bde 'gro dang ngan 'gro dang / 'chi 'pho dang / skye ba'i rnam par rig pa ni lha dang / mi dang / sems can dmyal ba dang / dud 'gro dang / yi dags dang / skye ba dang / 'chi bar snang ba'o //
analyzed: bde 'gro dang ngan 'gro dang / 'chi 'pho dang / skye ba'i rnam par rig pa ni lha dang / mi dang / sems can dmyal ba dang / dud 'gro dang / yi dags dang / skye ba dang / 'chi bar snang ba'o //
translated: The cognition of good destiny and bad destiny, of death and rebirth, is the appearance of gods, humans, hell-beings, animals, hungry ghosts, birth, and death.

original: de la lus dang lus can dang / zhes bya ba nas tha snyad kyi rnam par rig pa gang yin pa de ni mngon par brjod pa'i bag chags kyi sa bon las byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la lus dang lus can dang / zhes bya ba nas tha snyad kyi rnam par rig pa gang yin pa de ni mngon par brjod pa'i bag chags kyi sa bon las byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The body, the embodied one, etc., up to the conventional cognition, arises from the seed which is the impression of expression.

original: zhes bya ba'i bar ni de'i rgyu las byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i bar ni de'i rgyu las byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The passage from ‚Äúthe body, the embodied, etc.‚Äù up to ‚Äúthe conventional cognition arises from the seed of the latent impressions of verbal expression‚Äù is the explanation of the cause of the arising of the cognition of the body, etc.

original: de bzhin du bdag dang gzhan gyi bye brag gi rnam par rig pa ni bdag tu lta ba'i bag chags kyi rgyu las byung ba ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du bdag dang gzhan gyi bye brag gi rnam par rig pa ni bdag tu lta ba'i bag chags kyi rgyu las byung ba ste /
translated: The cognition of the distinction between self and other arises from the cause of the latent impressions of the view of self.

original: nyon mongs pa can gyi yid sa bon yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa can gyi yid sa bon yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because the afflicted mind is the seed.

original: bde 'gro la sogs pa'i rnam par rig pa ni ma rig pa la sogs pa srid pa'i yan lag bcu gnyis kyi bag chags kyi rgya las byung ba'o //üîΩrnam par rig pa 'di rnams kyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i don ni brda phrad par zad do //
analyzed: bde 'gro la sogs pa'i rnam par rig pa ni ma rig pa la sogs pa srid pa'i yan lag bcu gnyis kyi bag chags kyi rgya las byung ba'o // rnam par rig pa 'di rnams kyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i don ni brda phrad par zad do //
translated: The cognition of good destinies, etc. arises from the cause of the latent impressions of the twelve members of existence, such as ignorance.üîΩThe meaning of the passage from ‚Äúthese various cognitions‚Äù is easy to understand.

original: rnam par rig pa 'di rnams kyi zhes bya ba ni ji skad smos pa rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: rnam par rig pa 'di rnams kyi zhes bya ba ni ji skad smos pa rnams kyi'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThese various cognitions‚Äù refers to those mentioned above.

original: rnam par rig pa tsam nyid ces bya ba ni log par yongs su rtog pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par rig pa tsam nyid ces bya ba ni log par yongs su rtog pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúMere representation‚Äù is the false imagination.

original: yang dag pa ma yin pa'i kun tu rtog pas bsdus pa zhes bya ba ni gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i dngos por rnam par 'jog pa'o //
analyzed: yang dag pa ma yin pa'i kun tu rtog pas bsdus pa zhes bya ba ni gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i dngos por rnam par 'jog pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúSubsumed by unreal imagination‚Äù is the establishment of the entities of the grasped and the grasper.

original: yod pa ma yin pa dang nor ba'i don snang ba'i gnas zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: yod pa ma yin pa dang nor ba'i don snang ba'i gnas zhes bya ba ni /
translated: ‚ÄúThe basis for the appearance of unreal and erroneous objects‚Äù

original: gzugs la sogs pa yod pa ma yin pa dang / der rnam par rtog pa nor bar snang ba rab tu gsal ba'i rgyu'o //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa yod pa ma yin pa dang / der rnam par rtog pa nor bar snang ba rab tu gsal ba'i rgyu'o //
translated: is the cause for the manifestation of the appearance of unreal form, etc. and the error of imagination in regard to them.

original: 'di ni gzhan gyi dbang gi mtshan nyid do zhes bya ba ni rtogs par bya ba zlos te ston pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni gzhan gyi dbang gi mtshan nyid do zhes bya ba ni rtogs par bya ba zlos te ston pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThis is the characteristic of the relative‚Äù is the reiteration and teaching of what is to be understood.

original: gang don med kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gzhan gyi dbang gi rang bzhin rnam par rig pa tsam nyid sems dang sems las byung ba 'khrul pa'i rang gi ngo bo nyid kyi don gyi rnam par rig pa'i cha la dngos por byed pa ni kun
analyzed: gang don med kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gzhan gyi dbang gi rang bzhin rnam par rig pa tsam nyid sems dang sems las byung ba 'khrul pa'i rang gi ngo bo nyid kyi don gyi rnam par rig pa'i cha la dngos por byed pa ni kun
translated: ‚ÄúAlthough it does not exist as a real object, etc. ‚Äù The nature of the relative is mere representation, mind and mental factors, the nature of error. The aspect of the representation of objects is taken as real by the imagination of the unreal.

original: brtags pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: brtags pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: It is the imagined reality.

original: de nyid kun brtags pa de dang gtan du bral ba ni yongs su grub pa'i mtshan nyid de /
analyzed: de nyid kun brtags pa de dang gtan du bral ba ni yongs su grub pa'i mtshan nyid de /
translated: The perfected reality is the complete absence of the imagined reality in the relative reality.

original: dper na smig rgyu la rang gi rgyud sngon du btang ste /üîΩchur gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i dngos por rnam par 'jog pa'i log par @221a * //
analyzed: dper na smig rgyu la rang gi rgyud sngon du btang ste / chur gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i dngos por rnam par 'jog pa'i log par @221a * //
translated: For example, a mirage is the imagined reality.

original: yongs su rtog pa ni gzhan gyi dbang ngo //
analyzed: yongs su rtog pa ni gzhan gyi dbang ngo //
translated: The misapprehension that is the antecedent of the perception of water is the relative reality.

original: chur snang ba la dngos por byed pa ni kun brtags pa'o //
analyzed: chur snang ba la dngos por byed pa ni kun brtags pa'o //
translated: The appearance of water is the imagined reality.

original: de dang gtan du bral ba ni yongs su grub pa lta bu'o //üîΩrnam par rtog pas brtags pa'i don //üîΩkun du brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid //
analyzed: de dang gtan du bral ba ni yongs su grub pa lta bu'o // rnam par rtog pas brtags pa'i don // kun du brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid //
translated: The complete absence of the appearance of water is the perfected reality.üîΩThe object imagined by conceptualizationüîΩis the imagined reality.

original: rnam par rtog pa gzhan gyi dbang //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa gzhan gyi dbang //
translated: Conceptualization is the relative reality.

original: de yi stong nyid yongs su grub //
analyzed: de yi stong nyid yongs su grub //
translated: The emptiness of that is the perfected reality.

original: rnam par rig pa 'di dag gi //üîΩzhes bya ba ni lus la sogs pa nas de la nye bar spyod pa la thug pa'i bar gyi rab tu dbye ba ste /
analyzed: rnam par rig pa 'di dag gi // zhes bya ba ni lus la sogs pa nas de la nye bar spyod pa la thug pa'i bar gyi rab tu dbye ba ste /
translated: These representationsüîΩare the differentiation of the body, etc.

original: de dag las byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag las byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: up to the enjoyment of those objects, because they arise from that.

original: rnam par rig pa rnam par don med pa'i dper rmi lam smos te grub pa'i phyir ro /
analyzed: rnam par rig pa rnam par don med pa'i dper rmi lam smos te grub pa'i phyir ro /
translated: The example of a dream is mentioned as an example of a cognition that is devoid of an object, because it is established.

original: dper na rmi lam zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni tshig de nyid kyis bshad zin to //
analyzed: dper na rmi lam zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni tshig de nyid kyis bshad zin to //
translated: The example of a dream, etc. is explained by the very words.

original: lung dang rigs pas zhes bya ba brjod pas ni lung las 'byung ba'i don rjes su dpag pa'i yul nyid du ston to //
analyzed: lung dang rigs pas zhes bya ba brjod pas ni lung las 'byung ba'i don rjes su dpag pa'i yul nyid du ston to //
translated: By the expression ‚Äúthrough scripture and reasoning,‚Äù he shows that the meaning that occurs in scripture is the very domain of inference.

original: sa bcu pa zhes bya ba ni mdo gang las byang chub sems dpa'i sa bcu bstan pa de sa bcu rnam par gzhag pa'i rnam pa ste /
analyzed: sa bcu pa zhes bya ba ni mdo gang las byang chub sems dpa'i sa bcu bstan pa de sa bcu rnam par gzhag pa'i rnam pa ste /
translated: The ten stages is the tenfold arrangement of the stages, in the sutra that teaches the ten bodhisattva stages.

original: ming dang / tshig dang / yi ge'i tshogs su snang ba'i rnam par rig pa 'dus pa 'phags pa rdo rje'i snying po'i dbang gis nyan pa po'i sems kyi rgyud la yod pa'i chos kyi rnam grangs te /
analyzed: ming dang / tshig dang / yi ge'i tshogs su snang ba'i rnam par rig pa 'dus pa 'phags pa rdo rje'i snying po'i dbang gis nyan pa po'i sems kyi rgyud la yod pa'i chos kyi rnam grangs te /
translated: The collection of the appearances of the groups of names, phrases, and letters is the cognition that is the Dharma discourse that exists in the mental continuum of the listener by the power of the noble Vajra Heart.

original: de brjod pa yid ches par rung ba nyid du ston to //
analyzed: de brjod pa yid ches par rung ba nyid du ston to //
translated: He shows that it is suitable to have confidence in that expression.

original: sems tsam zhes bya ba la sogs pa la sems ni rnam par rig pa dang don gcig go //
analyzed: sems tsam zhes bya ba la sogs pa la sems ni rnam par rig pa dang don gcig go //
translated: In ‚Äúmere mind,‚Äù etc., mind is synonymous with cognition.

original: tsam gyi sgras ni don sel bar byed de /
analyzed: tsam gyi sgras ni don sel bar byed de /
translated: The word ‚Äúonly‚Äù eliminates any other meaning.

original: de med pas 'dzin pa yang sel te /
analyzed: de med pas 'dzin pa yang sel te /
translated: Since that does not exist, the grasping is also eliminated,

original: brtags pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: brtags pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is imagined.

original: de sems las 'byung ba med par mi 'byung ba'i phyir sems las byung ba rnams ni mi dgag ste /
analyzed: de sems las 'byung ba med par mi 'byung ba'i phyir sems las byung ba rnams ni mi dgag ste /
translated: The mental factors are not negated, because they do not occur without the mind.

original: ji skad du sems las byung ba rnams med par sems nam yang mi 'byung ngo zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: ji skad du sems las byung ba rnams med par sems nam yang mi 'byung ngo zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: As it is said, ‚ÄúThe mind never occurs without the mental factors.‚Äù

original: 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa gang yin pa de'i sems ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa gang yin pa de'i sems ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: What is the mind in the meditative attainment of cessation?

original: 'di ni phyogs can la nyes par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di ni phyogs can la nyes par 'gyur ro //
translated: This is a fault for those who hold a position.

original: kho bo cag la ni de na sems gang yod pa de mtshungs par ldan pa dang bcas par yod do //
analyzed: kho bo cag la ni de na sems gang yod pa de mtshungs par ldan pa dang bcas par yod do //
translated: For us, whatever mind exists there exists along with the associated factors.

original: gang med pa de ni mtshungs par ldan pa dang bcas su med de /
analyzed: gang med pa de ni mtshungs par ldan pa dang bcas su med de /
translated: Whatever does not exist there does not exist along with the associated factors.

original: khams gsum pa ni khams gsum du snang ba'i rnam par rig pa rnams so //
analyzed: khams gsum pa ni khams gsum du snang ba'i rnam par rig pa rnams so //
translated: The three realms are the consciousnesses that appear as the three realms.

original: khams gsum pa smos pas ni 'dod pa la sogs pa'i sred pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa khams gsum par gtogs pa'i sems dang sems las byung ba rnams @221b rnam par rig pa tsam nyid du dam bca' ba ste //
analyzed: khams gsum pa smos pas ni 'dod pa la sogs pa'i sred pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa khams gsum par gtogs pa'i sems dang sems las byung ba rnams @221b rnam par rig pa tsam nyid du dam bca' ba ste //
translated: The statement ‚Äúin the three realms‚Äù means that the mind and mental factors belonging to the three realms, which are concomitant with craving for the desire realm, etc., are only consciousness.

original: de bzhin nyid la dmigs pa dang // gzhan gyi dbang la dmigs pa lam gyi bden pas bsdus pa rnams dang rjes las thob pa rnams ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de bzhin nyid la dmigs pa dang // gzhan gyi dbang la dmigs pa lam gyi bden pas bsdus pa rnams dang rjes las thob pa rnams ni ma yin te /
translated: The objective support of the reality of the path, which is the objective support of suchness and the objective support of the dependent nature, and the subsequent attainment are not included in the three realms,

original: khams gsum na spyod pa'i sred pa rnams kyis bdag gir ma byas pa dang / gnyen po yin pa dang / ma 'khrul pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: khams gsum na spyod pa'i sred pa rnams kyis bdag gir ma byas pa dang / gnyen po yin pa dang / ma 'khrul pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are not appropriated by the craving that operates in the three realms, because they are antidotes, and because they are nonerroneous.üîΩAccording to the SautrƒÅntika system, since the formless realm is merely mind and mental factors, it is not called a ‚Äútwo-realm‚Äù system.

original: mdo sde pa'i gzhung ltar na gzugs med pa'i khams ni sems dang sems las byung ba tsam du zad pas khams gnyis pa zhes mi bya'am zhe na ma yin te /
analyzed: mdo sde pa'i gzhung ltar na gzugs med pa'i khams ni sems dang sems las byung ba tsam du zad pas khams gnyis pa zhes mi bya'am zhe na ma yin te /
translated: This is not so,

original: nor bar bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nor bar bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is taught as an error.

original: gzugs 'ba' zhig med pas rnam par rig pa tsam ni ma yin gyi don thams cad med pas so //
analyzed: gzugs 'ba' zhig med pas rnam par rig pa tsam ni ma yin gyi don thams cad med pas so //
translated: It is not that mere representation does not exist because form does not exist, but rather because all objects do not exist.

original: mdo sde pa rnams ni gzugs med pa rnams kyi dmigs pa nor bar khas mi len to //üîΩdgongs pa nges par 'grel pa yang sa bcu pa bzhin du'am /
analyzed: mdo sde pa rnams ni gzugs med pa rnams kyi dmigs pa nor bar khas mi len to // dgongs pa nges par 'grel pa yang sa bcu pa bzhin du'am /
translated: The Sautrantikas do not accept that the objects of the formless are erroneous.

original: chos mngon pa'i mdor bsdus byas pa bzhin du bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: chos mngon pa'i mdor bsdus byas pa bzhin du bshad par bya'o //
translated: The Sandhinirmocana Sutra should be explained like the Dashabhumika Sutra or like the Abhidharma in brief.

original: ting nge 'dzin ni sems rtse gcig tu byed pa sems las byung ba'i chos so //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin ni sems rtse gcig tu byed pa sems las byung ba'i chos so //
translated: Samadhi is a mental factor that unifies the mind.

original: de'i spyod yul ni yul lo //
analyzed: de'i spyod yul ni yul lo //
translated: Its object is the object.

original: gzugs brnyan ni gzugs dngos ltar snang ba'o //
analyzed: gzugs brnyan ni gzugs dngos ltar snang ba'o //
translated: An image is the appearance of an object as if it were real.

original: dmigs pa rnam par rig pa tsam gyis rab tu phye ba can zhes bya ba ni phyi rol gyi dmigs pa med pa'o //
analyzed: dmigs pa rnam par rig pa tsam gyis rab tu phye ba can zhes bya ba ni phyi rol gyi dmigs pa med pa'o //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúdistinguished by the mere representation of the object of perception‚Äù means that external objects do not exist.

original: rnam par shes pa dmigs pa yin par ngas bshad do //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa dmigs pa yin par ngas bshad do //
translated: I have explained that consciousness is the object.

original: zhes bya ba ni 'di ltar dmigs pa de rnam par rig pa tsam gyis rab tu phye ba ni de'i ngo bo nyid ces bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni 'di ltar dmigs pa de rnam par rig pa tsam gyis rab tu phye ba ni de'i ngo bo nyid ces bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
translated: Thus, the object is distinguished by mere representation, which is to say, it is its intrinsic reality.

original: rnam par shes pa ni dmigs par snang ba tsam gyis rab tu phye ba yin par bshad do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa ni dmigs par snang ba tsam gyis rab tu phye ba yin par bshad do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Consciousness is distinguished by the mere appearance of the object, which is to say, it is its intrinsic reality.

original: sems de nyid kyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni bdag nyid la byed pa 'gal bar ston pa'o //
analyzed: sems de nyid kyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni bdag nyid la byed pa 'gal bar ston pa'o //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúby that very mind‚Äù and so on shows the contradiction of an action with respect to itself.

original: byams pa chos gang yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni lan 'debs pa ste /
analyzed: byams pa chos gang yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni lan 'debs pa ste /
translated: The response to this is stated in the passage beginning ‚ÄúMaitreya, no dharma whatsoever . . .‚Äù

original: chos thams cad ni byed pa med pas byed pa dang byed pa po mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos thams cad ni byed pa med pas byed pa dang byed pa po mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Since all dharmas are devoid of action, the agent and action are untenable.

original: de ltar skyes pa zhes bya ba ni rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i che ba nyid kyis ni gcig kho na rnam pa gnyis su snang ba'i tshul brjod pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar skyes pa zhes bya ba ni rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i che ba nyid kyis ni gcig kho na rnam pa gnyis su snang ba'i tshul brjod pa'o //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúarising in this way‚Äù refers to the greatness of dependent origination, which is to say, the mode of appearance of a single thing as two.

original: dper na gzugs kyi gzhi po rang gi bzhin nyid la brten nas me long la sogs pa'i nang du de nyid snang yang gzugs brnyan mthong ngo snyam du log par sems te /
analyzed: dper na gzugs kyi gzhi po rang gi bzhin nyid la brten nas me long la sogs pa'i nang du de nyid snang yang gzugs brnyan mthong ngo snyam du log par sems te /
translated: For example, on the basis of one‚Äôs own face, which is the basis of form, it appears in a mirror, etc. , but one thinks mistakenly, ‚ÄúI see a reflection.‚Äù

original: me long la sogs pa rgyu'i mthus don gzhan du med kyang snang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: me long la sogs pa rgyu'i mthus don gzhan du med kyang snang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because, by the power of the cause, the mirror, etc., it appears without being another entity.

original: de bzhin du @222a * //
analyzed: de bzhin du @222a * //
translated: In the same way,

original: dran pa dang kun du rtog pa la sogs pa'i rkyen gyis mthus gang tha dad pa ma yin yang tha dad par snang ba ting nge 'dzin gyi spyod yul gyi gzugs brnyan de de bzhin du skyes so //
analyzed: dran pa dang kun du rtog pa la sogs pa'i rkyen gyis mthus gang tha dad pa ma yin yang tha dad par snang ba ting nge 'dzin gyi spyod yul gyi gzugs brnyan de de bzhin du skyes so //
translated: although it is not different, it appears as different by the power of the condition, memory, imagination, etc.

original: lung de ni tshad ma dang bcas par bcom ldan 'das nyid kyis gtan la phab po //
analyzed: lung de ni tshad ma dang bcas par bcom ldan 'das nyid kyis gtan la phab po //
translated: The Lord himself has established that scriptural authority with a proof.üîΩThus, ‚Äúwhen the mind is concentrated,‚Äù etc.

original: 'di ltar sems mnyam par gzhag pa na zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni rigs pa gzhan nye bar 'god do //
analyzed: 'di ltar sems mnyam par gzhag pa na zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni rigs pa gzhan nye bar 'god do //
translated: He sets forth another reason.

original: ji ltar 'dod pa bzhin du snang ba'i phyir rnam par bsngos pa la sogs pa ni sems las gzhan ma yin te /
analyzed: ji ltar 'dod pa bzhin du snang ba'i phyir rnam par bsngos pa la sogs pa ni sems las gzhan ma yin te /
translated: Because they appear as desired, the blue-black color, etc. are not other than mind.

original: rnam 'byor pa'i rmi lam du rnam par bsngos pa la sogs pa rmis pa bzhin no //
analyzed: rnam 'byor pa'i rmi lam du rnam par bsngos pa la sogs pa rmis pa bzhin no //
translated: This is like the blue-black color, etc. that are dreamed by a yogin in a dream.

original: dran pa'i rnam par shes pa'ang mi rung ste zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi dogs pa bsal ba'i phyir smos pa ste /
analyzed: dran pa'i rnam par shes pa'ang mi rung ste zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi dogs pa bsal ba'i phyir smos pa ste /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúit is also not tenable that consciousness is a memory‚Äù is stated to dispel the doubts of others.

original: su 'di snyam du ting nge 'dzin gyi spyod yul gyi gzugs brnyan ni dur khrod la sogs pa na mthong ba'i keng rus mong po myong ba'i rgyu las byung bas dran no snyam du sems pa de la /
analyzed: su 'di snyam du ting nge 'dzin gyi spyod yul gyi gzugs brnyan ni dur khrod la sogs pa na mthong ba'i keng rus mong po myong ba'i rgyu las byung bas dran no snyam du sems pa de la /
translated: Someone might think this: ‚ÄúThe reflection that is the domain of samƒÅdhi is a memory that arises from the cause of experience, such as when a skeleton is seen in a charnel ground.‚Äù

original: 'di ni de lta ma yin no zhes sel to //
analyzed: 'di ni de lta ma yin no zhes sel to //
translated: The response to that is, ‚ÄúThis is not the case.‚Äù

original: dmigs pa de mdun du gzhag na snang ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni gal te de dran pa yin na ni ji ltar yul na mthong ba de'i yul nges par 'di ji ltar myong ba bzhin du dran pa'i rigs na de ni de lta yang ma yin
analyzed: dmigs pa de mdun du gzhag na snang ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni gal te de dran pa yin na ni ji ltar yul na mthong ba de'i yul nges par 'di ji ltar myong ba bzhin du dran pa'i rigs na de ni de lta yang ma yin
translated: If that is memory, then just as it sees the object in the present, it should remember the object in the past just as it was experienced, but it does not do so.

original: no // de'i phyir de ltar mngon sum du grub pa bsgoms pa las byung ba'i shes pa de ni dran pa ma yin no //
analyzed: no // de'i phyir de ltar mngon sum du grub pa bsgoms pa las byung ba'i shes pa de ni dran pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, that cognition arisen from meditation that is established as direct perception is not memory.

original: 'o na thos pa dang bsams pa las byung ba'i dngos po la rnam par shes pa gang 'byung ba de dran pa yin pas de'i spyod yul ni rnam par shes pa dang tha dad par 'grub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'o na thos pa dang bsams pa las byung ba'i dngos po la rnam par shes pa gang 'byung ba de dran pa yin pas de'i spyod yul ni rnam par shes pa dang tha dad par 'grub par 'gyur ro //
translated: But if the cognition that arises in regard to things that are heard or reflected upon is memory, then its object would be established as distinct from cognition.

original: zhe na / de yang de ltar ma yin te /
analyzed: zhe na / de yang de ltar ma yin te /
translated: But that is not so.

original: 'di ltar thos pa la sogs pa las byung ba la dran pa gang yin pa de ni 'das pa la dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar thos pa la sogs pa las byung ba la dran pa gang yin pa de ni 'das pa la dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because that memory which arises from hearing and so on focuses on the past.

original: 'das pa ni med pa'i phyir der snang ba ni rnam par rig pa tsam nyid du 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'das pa ni med pa'i phyir der snang ba ni rnam par rig pa tsam nyid du 'gyur te /
translated: Since the past does not exist, the appearance as that is just a mere representation.

original: dran par byas pas stong pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dran par byas pas stong pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is empty of what is remembered.

original: de lta bas na de ltar snang ba'i phyir 'di ni rnam par rig pa tsam ste /
analyzed: de lta bas na de ltar snang ba'i phyir 'di ni rnam par rig pa tsam ste /
translated: Therefore, because it appears in that way, this is mere representation.

original: rnal 'byor pas mdun du keng rus dmigs pa de'i gzugs brnyan bzhin no //
analyzed: rnal 'byor pas mdun du keng rus dmigs pa de'i gzugs brnyan bzhin no //
translated: Like the reflection of a skeleton that a yogin visualizes in front of him.

original: rjes su dpag pa 'dis zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gsal ba'i phyir rnam par dgrol bar mi 'bad do //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa 'dis zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gsal ba'i phyir rnam par dgrol bar mi 'bad do //
translated: With this inference, etc.

original: gang rmi lam lta bu'i rnam par rig pa sna tshogs zhes bya ba ni lus dang lus can la sogs pa'i rnam par rig pa rnams so //
analyzed: gang rmi lam lta bu'i rnam par rig pa sna tshogs zhes bya ba ni lus dang lus can la sogs pa'i rnam par rig pa rnams so //
translated: The various representations that are like a dream refers to the representations of the body, the embodied being, and so on.

original: de dag las @222b mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa'i rnam par rig pa rnams ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pas ni lus can dang za ba po'i rnam par rig pa bsdu'o //
analyzed: de dag las @222b mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa'i rnam par rig pa rnams ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pas ni lus can dang za ba po'i rnam par rig pa bsdu'o //
translated: Among them, the representations of eye consciousness and so on are included by the statement beginning with the words ‚Äúthe representations of the embodied being and the experiencer.‚Äù

original: de dag ni rnam par rig pa tsam nyid du rigs te rnam par shes pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag ni rnam par rig pa tsam nyid du rigs te rnam par shes pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: They are reasonable as mere representations, because they are of the nature of consciousness.

original: mig la sogs pa'i rnam par rig pa gzugs can rnams zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pas ni dpyad par bya ba'i rnam par rig pa bsdu'o //
analyzed: mig la sogs pa'i rnam par rig pa gzugs can rnams zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pas ni dpyad par bya ba'i rnam par rig pa bsdu'o //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthe representations of visible form, etc., which are material‚Äù includes the representations that are to be investigated.

original: ji ltar rnam par rig pa tsam nyid du zhes bya ba ni gzugs can yin pas mi srid pa 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: ji ltar rnam par rig pa tsam nyid du zhes bya ba ni gzugs can yin pas mi srid pa 'dzin pa'o //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúas mere representations‚Äù means that they are apprehended as impossible because they are material.üîΩThe phrase ‚Äúthese also‚Äù refers to the scriptures and reasonings.

original: de dag kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa la lung ni sa bcu pa dang / dgongs pa nges par 'grel pa las gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: de dag kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa la lung ni sa bcu pa dang / dgongs pa nges par 'grel pa las gsungs pa'o //
translated: The scriptures are those of the Sutra of the Ten Stages and the Sutra Unravelling the Intended Meaning.

original: rigs pa ni ting nge 'dzin gyi spyod yul gyi gzugs brnyan dang rmi lam la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: rigs pa ni ting nge 'dzin gyi spyod yul gyi gzugs brnyan dang rmi lam la sogs pa'o //
translated: The reasonings are those of the images that are the objects of concentration and dreams, etc.

original: snga ma bzhin no zhes bya ba ni mtshungs par sbyar ba'o //
analyzed: snga ma bzhin no zhes bya ba ni mtshungs par sbyar ba'o //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúas was done previously‚Äù is a reference to the above.

original: gal te de dag kyang zhes bya ba ni mtshungs pa la /
analyzed: gal te de dag kyang zhes bya ba ni mtshungs pa la /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúif these also‚Äù refers to the similarity.

original: brtan par rgyun gyis 'jug pa'i rgyu 'dri ba ste /
analyzed: brtan par rgyun gyis 'jug pa'i rgyu 'dri ba ste /
translated: The question is asked about the cause of the stable and continuous engagement.

original: de la mtshungs pa ni 'dra ba'o //
analyzed: de la mtshungs pa ni 'dra ba'o //
translated: Similarity means likeness.

original: brtan pa ni bar ma dor rgyun chad par mi mthong ba'o //
analyzed: brtan pa ni bar ma dor rgyun chad par mi mthong ba'o //
translated: Stability means not seeing an interruption in the middle.

original: de nyid rgyun te rgyun chags pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de nyid rgyun te rgyun chags pa'i phyir ro //
translated: That itself is a continuum because it is continuous.

original: phyin ci log la sogs pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa'i gzhi'i gnas yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phyin ci log la sogs pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa'i gzhi'i gnas yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is the basis for the afflicted states of error, etc.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pas ni nyon mongs pa dang las dang skye ba bsdu'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pas ni nyon mongs pa dang las dang skye ba bsdu'o //
translated: By mentioning ‚Äúetc.,‚Äù afflictions, karma, and birth are included.

original: mig la sogs pa'i rnam par reg pa rnams ni phyin ci log la sogs pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa'i gzhi'i gnas nyid yin te /
analyzed: mig la sogs pa'i rnam par reg pa rnams ni phyin ci log la sogs pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa'i gzhi'i gnas nyid yin te /
translated: The eye, etc., contacts are the basis for the afflicted states of error, etc.,

original: rgyu'i dngos por gnas pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu'i dngos por gnas pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they exist as the causal entity.

original: phyir ro zhes bya ba ni dgos pa 'dri ba la ltos nas lan btab pa ste /
analyzed: phyir ro zhes bya ba ni dgos pa 'dri ba la ltos nas lan btab pa ste /
translated: Because of that means that the answer is given in dependence on the question about the purpose.

original: gang gi phyir mig la sogs pa dang gzugs la sogs pa'i don med bzhin du de dag tu snang ba'i rnam par rig pa rnams mtshungs pa dang / brtan par rgyun gyis 'jug pa de kho na'i phyir phyin ci log rnams 'byung ngo //
analyzed: gang gi phyir mig la sogs pa dang gzugs la sogs pa'i don med bzhin du de dag tu snang ba'i rnam par rig pa rnams mtshungs pa dang / brtan par rgyun gyis 'jug pa de kho na'i phyir phyin ci log rnams 'byung ngo //
translated: Because the consciousnesses that appear as eyes, etc. and forms, etc. arise in the absence of eyes, etc. and forms, etc. , and because they occur in a continuous series, the errors occur.

original: gzhan du na zhes bya ba ni gal te ji ltar mi 'byung na don med pa la don du phyin ci log tu mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan du na zhes bya ba ni gal te ji ltar mi 'byung na don med pa la don du phyin ci log tu mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Otherwise, if they did not occur, the error of taking what is nonexistent as existent would not occur.

original: phyin ci log med na rgyu med pa'i phyir /üîΩnyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pas kun nas nyon mongs pa med par 'gyur ro //üîΩkun nas nyon mongs pa med du zin na /
analyzed: phyin ci log med na rgyu med pa'i phyir / nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pas kun nas nyon mongs pa med par 'gyur ro // kun nas nyon mongs pa med du zin na /
translated: If there were no error, there would be no affliction because there would be no cause.

original: rnam par byang ba yang med par 'gyur te /
analyzed: rnam par byang ba yang med par 'gyur te /
translated: If there were no affliction, there would be no purification.

original: de ldog pas rab tu phye ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ldog pas rab tu phye ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because purification is distinguished by the cessation of affliction.

original: de'i phyir @223a * //
analyzed: de'i phyir @223a * //
translated: Therefore,

original: de ltar 'di dag ces bya ba'i don ni brda phrad par zad do //
analyzed: de ltar 'di dag ces bya ba'i don ni brda phrad par zad do //
translated: the meaning of ‚Äúthus‚Äù is merely to indicate that the errors occur.

original: dgos pa'i dbang gis 'byung ba ni ma yin gyi /
analyzed: dgos pa'i dbang gis 'byung ba ni ma yin gyi /
translated: They do not occur by the power of a need.

original: rgyu'i dbang gis 'byung ba ma len nam zhe na ma yin te /
analyzed: rgyu'i dbang gis 'byung ba ma len nam zhe na ma yin te /
translated: If you ask, ‚ÄúIs it not the case that the elements arise due to a cause? ‚Äù the answer is no.

original: ji ltar dris ba bzhin lan btab pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: ji ltar dris ba bzhin lan btab pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because the question is answered in accordance with the way it was asked.

original: gzhan gyis ni dgos pa dris kyi /
analyzed: gzhan gyis ni dgos pa dris kyi /
translated: The questioner asked about the purpose,

original: sa bon zhes bya ba'i rgyu ni ma dris te /
analyzed: sa bon zhes bya ba'i rgyu ni ma dris te /
translated: but not about the cause called ‚Äúseed. ‚Äù

original: de ni kun gzhi rnam par shes pa la gnas pa thog ma med pa can yin par shes pas ma dris so //
analyzed: de ni kun gzhi rnam par shes pa la gnas pa thog ma med pa can yin par shes pas ma dris so //
translated: Since the cause is known to be the beginningless foundation consciousness, it was not asked about.

original: 'khrul pa'i rgyu ni gzugs su snang ba'i rnam par rig par 'dod do //
analyzed: 'khrul pa'i rgyu ni gzugs su snang ba'i rnam par rig par 'dod do //
translated: The cause of error is asserted to be the cognition that appears as form.

original: 'khrul pa ni gzugs can ma yin pa'i rnam par rig par 'dod do //
analyzed: 'khrul pa ni gzugs can ma yin pa'i rnam par rig par 'dod do //
translated: Error is asserted to be the cognition that is not physical.

original: de bas na gal te gzugs su snang ba gzugs can gyi rnam par rig pa med du zin na 'khrul pa gzugs can ma yin pa'i rnam par rig pa yang med par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de bas na gal te gzugs su snang ba gzugs can gyi rnam par rig pa med du zin na 'khrul pa gzugs can ma yin pa'i rnam par rig pa yang med par 'gyur te /
translated: Therefore, if the appearance as form does not exist as a physical cognition, then error, the cognition that is not physical, would not exist.

original: yul med pa'i yul can ni mi rung ngo //
analyzed: yul med pa'i yul can ni mi rung ngo //
translated: Because it is not possible for a subject to exist without an object.

original: ci'i phyir lus la sogs pa'i rnam par rig pa lhan cig 'byung zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni snga ma bzhin du 'dri bar byed do //
analyzed: ci'i phyir lus la sogs pa'i rnam par rig pa lhan cig 'byung zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni snga ma bzhin du 'dri bar byed do //
translated: Why is the perception of the body, etc. simultaneous?

original: skye ba dang nye bar spyod pa yongs su rdzogs par mngon pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni lan 'debs pa ste /
analyzed: skye ba dang nye bar spyod pa yongs su rdzogs par mngon pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni lan 'debs pa ste /
translated: The answer is: because the completion of birth and enjoyment is evident.

original: snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: snga ma bzhin no //
translated: The rest is as before.

original: 'di ltar rnam par rig pa lnga po 'di dag lus thams cad la zhugs na nye bar spyad pa dang bcas pa'i lus mtha' dag mngon te /
analyzed: 'di ltar rnam par rig pa lnga po 'di dag lus thams cad la zhugs na nye bar spyad pa dang bcas pa'i lus mtha' dag mngon te /
translated: Thus, when these five perceptions pervade the entire body, the entire body with its enjoyment is evident.

original: yan lag gang yang rung ba zhig mtshang na der mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yan lag gang yang rung ba zhig mtshang na der mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If any limb is injured, it is not so.

original: ci'i phyir dus kyi rnam par rig pa la sogs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni 'dri ba ste /
analyzed: ci'i phyir dus kyi rnam par rig pa la sogs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni 'dri ba ste /
translated: Why is the perception of time, etc.?

original: snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: snga ma bzhin no //
translated: The rest is as before.

original: sogs pa smos pa ni grangs dang / yul dang / tha snyad dang / bdag dang / gzhan dang / bde 'gro dang / ngan 'gro dang / 'chi 'pho dang / skye bar snang ba'i rnam par rig pa drug bsdu'o //üîΩthog ma med pa'i dus kyi 'khor ba'i rgyun mi 'chad pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa nas /üîΩskye ba dang rga shi myong ba'i rab tu dbye ba dpag tu med pa'i phyir ro //

original: zhes bya ba'i bar ni dgos pa drug po dag gis dus la sogs pa'i rnam par rig pa 'chi 'pho dang / skye ba'i rnam par rig pa la thug pa dag 'byung bar ston te go rims bzhin no //üîΩji ltar rnam par rig pa 'di dag ces bya ba la sogs pas rigs pa'i skabs kyis 'thad pa gzhan dang sgrub pa 'dri ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i bar ni dgos pa drug po dag gis dus la sogs pa'i rnam par rig pa 'chi 'pho dang / skye ba'i rnam par rig pa la thug pa dag 'byung bar ston te go rims bzhin no //üîΩji ltar rnam par rig pa 'di dag ces bya ba la sogs pas rigs pa'i skabs kyis 'thad pa gzhan dang sgrub pa 'dri ba'o //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúbecause of the infinite variety of the experiences of birth, old age, and death‚Äù indicates the six kinds of consciousness that appear as number, place, name, self, other, good destiny, bad destiny, death, and birth.üîΩThe phrase ‚Äúbecause of the infinite variety of the experiences of birth, old age, and death‚Äù indicates the six kinds of consciousness that appear as number, place, name, self, other, good destiny, bad destiny, death, and birth.üîΩThe phrase ‚Äúbecause of the infinite variety of the experiences of birth, old age, and death‚Äù indicates the six kinds of consciousness that appear as number, place, name, self, other, good destiny, bad destiny, death, and birth.üîΩThe phrase ‚Äúbecause of the infinite variety of the experiences of birth, old age, and death‚Äù indicates the six kinds of consciousness that appear as number, place, name, self, other, good destiny, bad destiny, death, and birth.üîΩThe phrase ‚Äúbecause of the infinite variety of the experiences of birth, old age, and death‚Äù indicates the six kinds of consciousness that appear as number, place, name, self, other, good destiny, bad destiny, death, and birth.üîΩThe phrase ‚Äúbecause of the infinite variety of the experiences of birth, old age, and death‚Äù indicates

original: de tsam du zad pas zhes @223b bya ba ni don med ces bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
analyzed: de tsam du zad pas zhes @223b bya ba ni don med ces bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
translated: ‚ÄúJust that‚Äù means ‚Äúmeaningless,‚Äù

original: don med pa'i phyir ro zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don med pa'i phyir ro zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is meaningless.

original: de ltar na tsam smos pas ni don dgag pa'i don bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na tsam smos pas ni don dgag pa'i don bshad pa yin no //
translated: Thus, the statement ‚Äújust that‚Äù explains the meaning of ‚Äúnegation of meaning.‚Äù

original: ji ltar don med pa de ltar lung gis kyang bstan to //
analyzed: ji ltar don med pa de ltar lung gis kyang bstan to //
translated: Just as it is meaningless, so it is taught by scripture.

original: rigs pa ni kha cig ni bshad zin kha cig ni 'chad par 'gyur ro /
analyzed: rigs pa ni kha cig ni bshad zin kha cig ni 'chad par 'gyur ro /
translated: Reasoning is either already explained or will be explained.

original: gnyis kyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni rgyu mtshan dang lta ba ni rgyu mtshan dang lta ba dag go //
analyzed: gnyis kyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni rgyu mtshan dang lta ba ni rgyu mtshan dang lta ba dag go //
translated: ‚ÄúBy two‚Äù and so on. The reason and the view are the reason and the view.

original: de gnyis dang lhan cig pa ni rnam par rig pa rgyu mtshan dang lta ba dang bcas pa ste /
analyzed: de gnyis dang lhan cig pa ni rnam par rig pa rgyu mtshan dang lta ba dang bcas pa ste /
translated: That which is together with those two is the representation together with the reason and the view.

original: mig la sogs pa zhes bya ba nas lus kyi rnam par rig pa la thug pa rnams so //
analyzed: mig la sogs pa zhes bya ba nas lus kyi rnam par rig pa la thug pa rnams so //
translated: The eye, and so on, up to the body representation.

original: bdag nyid ji lta ba bzhin du gzugs la sogs par snang ba'i rnam par rig pa'i rgyu mtshan gyis ni rgyu mtshan dang bcas pa'o //
analyzed: bdag nyid ji lta ba bzhin du gzugs la sogs par snang ba'i rnam par rig pa'i rgyu mtshan gyis ni rgyu mtshan dang bcas pa'o //
translated: The representation that appears as form, and so on, is together with the reason, because it is the reason for the representation.

original: mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa yul so sor rnam par rig pa snang ba'i lta bas ni lta ba dang bcas pa'o //üîΩyang na gzung ba'i cha ni rgyu mtshan /
analyzed: mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa yul so sor rnam par rig pa snang ba'i lta bas ni lta ba dang bcas pa'o // yang na gzung ba'i cha ni rgyu mtshan /
translated: The view of the eye consciousness, etc., is the appearance of the perception of individual objects.üîΩOr, the objective aspect is the sign, and the subjective aspect is the view.

original: 'dzin pa'i cha ni lta ba ste gnyis so //
analyzed: 'dzin pa'i cha ni lta ba ste gnyis so //
translated: There are two.

original: sna tshogs kyi rnam pa 'byung ba'i phyir te zhes bya ba ni ri mo'i gding ba la sogs pa la sna tshogs kyi rnam pa'i rnam par shes pa gcig kho na cha gcig ni gzung ba dang / cha gcig ni 'dzin par cig car 'byung ngo //
analyzed: sna tshogs kyi rnam pa 'byung ba'i phyir te zhes bya ba ni ri mo'i gding ba la sogs pa la sna tshogs kyi rnam pa'i rnam par shes pa gcig kho na cha gcig ni gzung ba dang / cha gcig ni 'dzin par cig car 'byung ngo //
translated: Because the various aspects arise, means that in a painted cloth, etc., only one consciousness of various aspects arises simultaneously, one part as the object, and one part as the subject.

original: gang dag de'i skye ba rim gyis 'byung bar 'dod pa de dag gi ltar na gzhi chen po la yang nyin gcig tu yang sna tshogs kyi blo 'byung bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang dag de'i skye ba rim gyis 'byung bar 'dod pa de dag gi ltar na gzhi chen po la yang nyin gcig tu yang sna tshogs kyi blo 'byung bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: But according to those who maintain that the arising of the various aspects is gradual, the various cognitions would not arise in a single day even in a great place.

original: yid kyi rnam par rig pa ni mig la sogs pa nas chos la thug pa'i rnam par rig pa thams cad kyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni don thams cad dmigs pa la yid kyi rnam par shes pa dbang byed pa mig la sogs pa'i rnam par
analyzed: yid kyi rnam par rig pa ni mig la sogs pa nas chos la thug pa'i rnam par rig pa thams cad kyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni don thams cad dmigs pa la yid kyi rnam par shes pa dbang byed pa mig la sogs pa'i rnam par
translated: The mental perceptual state is the mental perceptual state that is the dominant condition for all objects, from the perceptual state of the eye up to the perceptual state of the entity.üîΩThe mental perceptual state is the dominant condition for the perception of all objects, from the perceptual state of the eye up to the perceptual state of the entity.üîΩIt is the dominant condition for the perception of all objects, from the perceptual state of the eye up to the perceptual state of the entity.üîΩThe mental perceptual state is the dominant condition for the perception of all objects, from the perceptual state of the eye up to the perceptual state of the entity.üîΩThe mental perceptual state is the dominant condition for the perception of all objects, from the perceptual state of the eye up to the perceptual state of the entity.üîΩThe mental perceptual state is the dominant condition for the perception of all objects, from the perceptual state of the eye up to the perceptual state of the entity.

original: rig pa nas chos kyi rnam par rig pa la thug pa'i bar dag rgyu mtshan nyid du rnam par gnas te /üîΩde dag gis de rgyu mtshan dang bcas pa'o //üîΩyid kyi rnam par shes pa'i rnam par rig pas ni lta ba dang bcas pa ste /
analyzed: rig pa nas chos kyi rnam par rig pa la thug pa'i bar dag rgyu mtshan nyid du rnam par gnas te / de dag gis de rgyu mtshan dang bcas pa'o // yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i rnam par rig pas ni lta ba dang bcas pa ste /
translated: The mental perceptual state is the dominant condition for the perception of all objects, from the perceptual state of the eye up to the perceptual state of the entity.üîΩThe mental perceptual state is the dominant condition for the perception of all objects, from the perceptual state of the eye up to the perceptual state of the entity.üîΩThe mental perceptual state is the dominant condition for the perception of all objects, from the perceptual state of the eye up to the perceptual state of the entity.üîΩThe mental perceptual state is the dominant condition for the perception of all objects, from the perceptual state of the eye up to the perceptual state of the entity.

original: 'di ltar de dag thams cad la rnam par rtog par byed pa dang / rnam par rig pa thams cad kyi rnam par 'byung ba'i tshul can yang yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar de dag thams cad la rnam par rtog par byed pa dang / rnam par rig pa thams cad kyi rnam par 'byung ba'i tshul can yang yin te /
translated: The mental perceptual state is the dominant condition for the perception of all objects, from the perceptual state of the eye up to the perceptual state of the entity.

original: de lta bas na yid kyi rnam par shes pa de 'dir lta ba zhes bya'o //üîΩ'dir tshigs su bcad pa zhes @224a * //
analyzed: de lta bas na yid kyi rnam par shes pa de 'dir lta ba zhes bya'o //üîΩ'dir tshigs su bcad pa zhes @224a * //
translated: The mental perceptual state is the dominant condition for the perception of all objects, from the perceptual state of the eye up to the perceptual state of the entity.üîΩThe mental perceptual state is the dominant condition for the perception of all objects, from the perceptual state of the eye up to the perceptual state of the entity.üîΩThe mental perceptual state is the dominant condition for the perception of all objects, from the perceptual state of the eye up to the perceptual state of the entity.üîΩThe mental perceptual state is the dominant condition for the perception of all objects, from the perceptual state of the eye up to the perceptual state of the entity.üîΩThe mental perceptual state is the dominant condition for the perception of all objects, from the perceptual state of the eye up to the perceptual state of the entity.

original: bya bas ni de tsam nyid dang gnyis dang sna tshogs nyid du rtogs pas /
analyzed: bya bas ni de tsam nyid dang gnyis dang sna tshogs nyid du rtogs pas /
translated: By the activity, one realizes just that, duality, and diversity.

original: de tsam gnyis dang sna tshogs nyid //
analyzed: de tsam gnyis dang sna tshogs nyid //
translated: Just that, duality, and diversity

original: rnal 'byor pa rnams rtogs par 'dod //üîΩces bya ba ste /
analyzed: rnal 'byor pa rnams rtogs par 'dod // ces bya ba ste /
translated: are to be realized by the yogis.

original: rnal 'byor spyod pa rnams kyis yongs su shes par 'dod do //üîΩde dang bral na zhes bya ba la sogs pa la bral bar gyur pas bral ba ste /
analyzed: rnal 'byor spyod pa rnams kyis yongs su shes par 'dod do // de dang bral na zhes bya ba la sogs pa la bral bar gyur pas bral ba ste /
translated: The Yogacaras wish to fully understand that.üîΩWhen free from that, etc.

original: dmigs pa med pa'o //üîΩdmigs pa rnam par bshig pa de med na rnam par rig pa tsam nyid dang bral ba nye bar gnas te /
analyzed: dmigs pa med pa'o // dmigs pa rnam par bshig pa de med na rnam par rig pa tsam nyid dang bral ba nye bar gnas te /
translated: Free means free from the objective referent.

original: rnam par rig pa rnam par shes par byed pa nyid du med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par rig pa rnam par shes par byed pa nyid du med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: When that objective referent is destroyed, then the mere representation is also destroyed, because the representation is not a cognizer.

original: shes bya med na shes par byed pa mi rung ste ;
analyzed: shes bya med na shes par byed pa mi rung ste ;
translated: If the object of cognition does not exist, the cognizer is not possible,

original: rgyu yul med pa'i yul can du 'gyur du 'ong ngo //
analyzed: rgyu yul med pa'i yul can du 'gyur du 'ong ngo //
translated: because the subject would be without an object.

original: gzung ba dang 'dzin par rnam par brtag par bya ba ma yin pa'i dngos po 'phags pa'i so so rang gi ye shes kyis rig pa bems po ma yin pa'i dngos po 'di ni gnas so //
analyzed: gzung ba dang 'dzin par rnam par brtag par bya ba ma yin pa'i dngos po 'phags pa'i so so rang gi ye shes kyis rig pa bems po ma yin pa'i dngos po 'di ni gnas so //
translated: This is the case, because the object of the noble ones' individual self-cognizant wisdom is not something that can be conceptualized as subject and object. This is the case, because the object of the noble ones' individual self-cognizant wisdom is not something that can be conceptualized as subject and object.

original: yid kyi rnam par shes pa de nyid ces bya ba la sogs pas ni lta ba'i bye brag brjod de /
analyzed: yid kyi rnam par shes pa de nyid ces bya ba la sogs pas ni lta ba'i bye brag brjod de /
translated: The line That very mental consciousness... and so forth explains the different views.

original: yid kyi rnam par shes pa gcig kho na mig la sogs pa rten de dang de nas skye ba na mig gi rnam par shes pa nas yid kyi rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba'i bar de dang de'i ming 'thob ste /
analyzed: yid kyi rnam par shes pa gcig kho na mig la sogs pa rten de dang de nas skye ba na mig gi rnam par shes pa nas yid kyi rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba'i bar de dang de'i ming 'thob ste /
translated: Some bodhisattvas think that there is only one mental consciousness, and that when it arises in dependence on the eye and so forth, it is given the name of that particular consciousness, from eye consciousness to mental consciousness.

original: rigs gzhan du gyur pa'i rnam par shes pa gzhan ni med do snyam du byang chub sems dpa' kha cig sems so //
analyzed: rigs gzhan du gyur pa'i rnam par shes pa gzhan ni med do snyam du byang chub sems dpa' kha cig sems so //
translated: They think that there is no other consciousness that is of a different type.

original: ci dang 'dra zhe na sems pa dper brjod de /
analyzed: ci dang 'dra zhe na sems pa dper brjod de /
translated: What is it like? It is like intention.

original: dper na sems pa gcig lus la gnas te /
analyzed: dper na sems pa gcig lus la gnas te /
translated: For example, a single intention is present in the body.

original: lus 'jug par byed pa na lus kyi las zhes bya /
analyzed: lus 'jug par byed pa na lus kyi las zhes bya /
translated: When it moves the body, it is called bodily action.

original: ngag la gnas te ngag 'jug par byed pa na ngag gi las zhes bya /
analyzed: ngag la gnas te ngag 'jug par byed pa na ngag gi las zhes bya /
translated: When it is present in speech and engages in speech, it is called verbal action.

original: yid dang mtshungs par ldan pa na yid kyi las zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: yid dang mtshungs par ldan pa na yid kyi las zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
translated: When it is associated with the mind, it is called mental action.

original: gal te yid kyi rnam par shes pa de lta bu ni rnam par mi rtog par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gal te yid kyi rnam par shes pa de lta bu ni rnam par mi rtog par 'gyur te /
translated: If that mental consciousness is like that, it would be non-conceptual,

original: gnas kyi rigs kyis mig gi rnam par shes pa bzhin no //
analyzed: gnas kyi rigs kyis mig gi rnam par shes pa bzhin no //
translated: like visual consciousness, due to the type of basis.

original: gnas pa ni gnas kyi rjes su byed de /
analyzed: gnas pa ni gnas kyi rjes su byed de /
translated: The abiding is in accordance with the basis.

original: 'di ltar nyon mongs pa can gyi yid kun nas nyon mongs pa'i gnas kyis yid kyi rnam par shes pa 'byung ba na nyon mongs pa can nyid du 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: 'di ltar nyon mongs pa can gyi yid kun nas nyon mongs pa'i gnas kyis yid kyi rnam par shes pa 'byung ba na nyon mongs pa can nyid du 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: Thus, when mental consciousness arises due to the basis of afflicted mind, it would be afflicted.

original: rten thams cad du 'byung ba na zhes bya ba la sogs pas lan 'debs te /
analyzed: rten thams cad du 'byung ba na zhes bya ba la sogs pas lan 'debs te /
translated: The answer to that is given by arising in all bases and so on.

original: mig la sogs pa gnas thams cad du 'byung ba ni skye ba'o //
analyzed: mig la sogs pa gnas thams cad du 'byung ba ni skye ba'o //
translated: Arising in all bases such as the eyes is birth.

original: sna @224b tshogs kyi rnam pas gnyis su snang ba 'byung ste /
analyzed: sna @224b tshogs kyi rnam pas gnyis su snang ba 'byung ste /
translated: It arises with various aspects and dualistic appearances.

original: zhes bya ba ni 'dzin par rnam par rtog pa'i bdag nyid sna tshogs kyi rnam pas gnyis su snang ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni 'dzin par rnam par rtog pa'i bdag nyid sna tshogs kyi rnam pas gnyis su snang ste /
translated: Thus, the self-nature of the imagination of a self is twofold, appearing as the diversity of the subject and object.

original: rnam par shes pa gcig po las cha gcig ni don tsam du snang bar 'gyur /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa gcig po las cha gcig ni don tsam du snang bar 'gyur /
translated: From the single consciousness, one part appears as the mere object,

original: de'i cha gcig ni don la rnam par rtog pa'i rnam par 'byung ngo //
analyzed: de'i cha gcig ni don la rnam par rtog pa'i rnam par 'byung ngo //
translated: and the other part arises as the imagination of the object.

original: de lta bas na rnam par mi rtog pa nyid kyi skyon du mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta bas na rnam par mi rtog pa nyid kyi skyon du mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, there is no fault of the absence of imagination.

original: gzugs can gyi khams na zhes bya ba ni gzugs med pa'i khams na ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs can gyi khams na zhes bya ba ni gzugs med pa'i khams na ma yin pa'o //
translated: In the realm of form, not in the formless realm.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: yid kyi rnam par shes pa lus la gnas pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: yid kyi rnam par shes pa lus la gnas pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: Because the mental consciousness is based on the body, etc.

original: dper na mig la sogs pa'i dbang po lus la gnas pa bzhin du zhes bya ba ni des byas pa'i phan pa dang gnod pa lus kyi yang yin pa de bzhin du gzugs can gyi khams na yid kyi rnam par shes pa lus la gnas pa'i phyir des
analyzed: dper na mig la sogs pa'i dbang po lus la gnas pa bzhin du zhes bya ba ni des byas pa'i phan pa dang gnod pa lus kyi yang yin pa de bzhin du gzugs can gyi khams na yid kyi rnam par shes pa lus la gnas pa'i phyir des
translated: Just as the eye faculty, etc. are based on the body, the benefit and harm they produce also belongs to the body. In the same way, in the realm of form, the mental consciousness is based on the body. Therefore, the benefit and harm it produces also belongs to the body.

original: byas pa'i myong ba lus kyi yang yin no //
analyzed: byas pa'i myong ba lus kyi yang yin no //
translated: and also the experience of action is bodily.

original: gnas thams cad du yang reg bya la 'dzin par snang ba yang 'byung ngo zhes bya ba ni mnyam par gzhag pa khong lci ba dang / yang na myong ba yongs su gcod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnas thams cad du yang reg bya la 'dzin par snang ba yang 'byung ngo zhes bya ba ni mnyam par gzhag pa khong lci ba dang / yang na myong ba yongs su gcod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: And it appears as if it were grasping tactile objects in all the locations.

original: gcig bur smra ba'i byang chub sems dpa' lung smos pa /
analyzed: gcig bur smra ba'i byang chub sems dpa' lung smos pa /
translated: The Bodhisattva Ekavƒ´cika is mentioned.

original: gang zhig lus med ces bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: gang zhig lus med ces bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: ‚ÄúHe who is bodiless, etc.‚Äù

original: lus med ces bya ba ni khog pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lus med ces bya ba ni khog pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Bodiless means he has no torso.

original: phug gnas zhes bya ba ni nang na yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phug gnas zhes bya ba ni nang na yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: He dwells in a cave means he is within.

original: ring du 'gro zhes bya ba ni shes bya thams cad du 'gro ba'i phyir ro //üîΩgcig pu rgyu zhes bya ba de ni khungs te /
analyzed: ring du 'gro zhes bya ba ni shes bya thams cad du 'gro ba'i phyir ro // gcig pu rgyu zhes bya ba de ni khungs te /
translated: He goes far means he goes to all objects of knowledge.

original: gnyis pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnyis pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: He goes alone means he has no companion.

original: gdul dka' zhes bya ba ni dmu rgod do //
analyzed: gdul dka' zhes bya ba ni dmu rgod do //
translated: He is difficult to tame means he is wild.

original: 'dul byed ces bya ba ni dbang du byed pa'o //
analyzed: 'dul byed ces bya ba ni dbang du byed pa'o //
translated: He is the tamer means he is the controller.

original: lung gnyis pa yang dbang po lnga po 'di dag gi zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: lung gnyis pa yang dbang po lnga po 'di dag gi zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: The second scriptural passage begins with ‚ÄúThese five faculties . . . .‚Äù

original: spyod yul gyi yul ni yid kyis myong ste /
analyzed: spyod yul gyi yul ni yid kyis myong ste /
translated: The object of the domain of experience is experienced by the mental faculty.

original: zhes bya ba la yid kya rnam par shes pas zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la yid kya rnam par shes pas zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
