translated: The mental consciousness is what is meant by ‚Äúthe mental faculty.‚Äù

original: yid ni 'di dag gi rton pa'o //
analyzed: yid ni 'di dag gi rton pa'o //
translated: The mental faculty is the support of these.

original: zhes bya ba ni de'i dbang gis 'grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni de'i dbang gis 'grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because they are established by the power of the mental faculty.

original: yang khungs gsum pa smos so //
analyzed: yang khungs gsum pa smos so //
translated: The third scriptural passage states:üîΩThe six collections of consciousness are the mental faculty.

original: rnam par shes pa'i tshogs drug ni yid kyi skye mched do zhes bya ba ni yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i skye mched ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //üîΩgang du yang kun gzhi rnam par shes pa'i rnam par rig pa ni don gyi rnam par rig par rnam par 'jog pa zhes @225a * //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i tshogs drug ni yid kyi skye mched do zhes bya ba ni yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i skye mched ces bya ba'i tha tshig go // gang du yang kun gzhi rnam par shes pa'i rnam par rig pa ni don gyi rnam par rig par rnam par 'jog pa zhes @225a * //
translated: The consciousness of the storehouse consciousness is posited as the representation of objects.

original: bya ba ni don gyi rnam par shes pa'i rgyu yin pas de ltar rnam par 'jog ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: bya ba ni don gyi rnam par shes pa'i rgyu yin pas de ltar rnam par 'jog ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This means that it is posited in this way because it is the cause of the consciousness of objects.

original: de las gzhan ba zhes bya ba ni lus la sogs pa'i rnam par rig pa rnams so //
analyzed: de las gzhan ba zhes bya ba ni lus la sogs pa'i rnam par rig pa rnams so //
translated: The other means the representations of body, etc.

original: rgyu mtshan zhes bya ba ni dmigs pa yin te /
analyzed: rgyu mtshan zhes bya ba ni dmigs pa yin te /
translated: The objective mark means the objective support.

original: rnam par byang ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par byang ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is the cause of purification.

original: yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i rnam par rig pa rten dang bcas pa ni zhes bya ba ni 'das ma thag pa'i yid dang nyon mongs pa can dang bcas pa ste /
analyzed: yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i rnam par rig pa rten dang bcas pa ni zhes bya ba ni 'das ma thag pa'i yid dang nyon mongs pa can dang bcas pa ste /
translated: The representation of mental consciousness together with its support means the immediately past mind together with the afflicted mind.

original: de gnyis skyed pa dang kun nas nyon mongs pa'i gnas yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de gnyis skyed pa dang kun nas nyon mongs pa'i gnas yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because those two are the basis for the generation and affliction of the mental consciousness.

original: lta ba ni rnam par rtog pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lta ba ni rnam par rtog pa'i phyir ro //
translated: View means discrimination.

original: de'i lta ba 'byung ba'i rgyu mtshan yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni kun gzhi rnam par shes pa de'i lta ba rnam pa sna tshogs 'byung ba'i rgyu mtshan yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i lta ba 'byung ba'i rgyu mtshan yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni kun gzhi rnam par shes pa de'i lta ba rnam pa sna tshogs 'byung ba'i rgyu mtshan yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is the objective mark of the arising of that view means because the store consciousness is the objective mark of the arising of the various views.

original: mig la sogs pa'i rnam par rig pa dag don ltar snang ba ni yid kyi rnam par rig pa'i lta ba de dang / rtsa ba'i rnam par shes pa 'byung ba'i rten gyi bya ba byed do //
analyzed: mig la sogs pa'i rnam par rig pa dag don ltar snang ba ni yid kyi rnam par rig pa'i lta ba de dang / rtsa ba'i rnam par shes pa 'byung ba'i rten gyi bya ba byed do //
translated: The appearance of the eye consciousness, etc., as objects is the view of the mental consciousness, and it functions as the basis for the arising of the fundamental consciousness.

original: yang don med par bstan pa'i phyir lung gzhan dang rigs pa gzhan brjod de /
analyzed: yang don med par bstan pa'i phyir lung gzhan dang rigs pa gzhan brjod de /
translated: In order to demonstrate the nonexistence of objects by other scriptures and reasonings, he says,

original: byang chub sems dpa' chos bzhi dang ldan na zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' chos bzhi dang ldan na zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o /
translated: ‚ÄúThe bodhisattva who possesses four dharmas. . . .‚Äù

original: phan tshun mi mthun pa 'gal pa'i rnam par shes pa rnams kyi rgyu mtshan gyi dngos po ni rnam par shes pa 'byung ba'i rgyu mtshan nyid de /
analyzed: phan tshun mi mthun pa 'gal pa'i rnam par shes pa rnams kyi rgyu mtshan gyi dngos po ni rnam par shes pa 'byung ba'i rgyu mtshan nyid de /
translated: The object that is the causal-sign of mutually incompatible and contradictory consciousnesses is the causal-sign of the arising of consciousness.

original: phyi rol gyi don ni rgyu mtshan nyid du mi rung ba'i phyir de shes pas ni don med par khong du chud par bya'o //
analyzed: phyi rol gyi don ni rgyu mtshan nyid du mi rung ba'i phyir de shes pas ni don med par khong du chud par bya'o //
translated: Since an external object is not suitable as a causal-sign, one should understand that objects do not exist.

original: yi dags dang / dung 'gro dang mi zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni chu klung gang la yi dags rnams kyi rang gi las kyi rnam par smin pa'i dbang gis rnag la sogs pas gang bar mthong ba de nyid la dud 'gro nya la sogs pas btung ba dang gnas yinüîΩpa'i blos gnas par byed do //üîΩmi rnams ni dngar ba dang dad ba dang bsil ba'i chur rtog cing khrus byed do //
analyzed: yi dags dang / dung 'gro dang mi zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni chu klung gang la yi dags rnams kyi rang gi las kyi rnam par smin pa'i dbang gis rnag la sogs pas gang bar mthong ba de nyid la dud 'gro nya la sogs pas btung ba dang gnas yin pa'i blos gnas par byed do // mi rnams ni dngar ba dang dad ba dang bsil ba'i chur rtog cing khrus byed do //
translated: Animals such as fish see it as a place to live and drink.

original: 'thung ngo // 'jug go //
analyzed: 'thung ngo // 'jug go //
translated: Humans imagine it to be water that is drinkable, clean and cool, and they bathe in it, drink it and enter it.

original: nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched la snyoms par 'jug pa'i lha rnams kyis ni nam mkhar mthong ste /
analyzed: nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched la snyoms par 'jug pa'i lha rnams kyis ni nam mkhar mthong ste /
translated: Gods who are absorbed in the base of infinite space see it as space,

original: gzugs kyi 'du shes rnam par bshig pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzugs kyi 'du shes rnam par bshig pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they have destroyed the notion of form.

original: dngos po gcig la phan tshun mi mthun pa'i rnam par shes pa du ma 'byung ba de ni mi rung ba ste /
analyzed: dngos po gcig la phan tshun mi mthun pa'i rnam par shes pa du ma 'byung ba de ni mi rung ba ste /
translated: It is not possible for many consciousnesses of different natures to arise simultaneously in one thing.

original: chu klung de nyid rnag dang gcin dang phyi sa sa gang ba dang / dbyug pa dang ral gri thogs pa'i mis bsrungs pa yin pa dri zhim pa dang bsil ba'i chu dang / gnas dang / @225b btung ba la sogs pa'i bya ba'i 'os dang nam mkha'i bdag nyid du ji ltar 'gyur te /
analyzed: chu klung de nyid rnag dang gcin dang phyi sa sa gang ba dang / dbyug pa dang ral gri thogs pa'i mis bsrungs pa yin pa dri zhim pa dang bsil ba'i chu dang / gnas dang / @225b btung ba la sogs pa'i bya ba'i 'os dang nam mkha'i bdag nyid du ji ltar 'gyur te /
translated: How could that river be filled with pus, urine, and excrement, guarded by men holding sticks and swords, and at the same time be suitable as a place to stay, as drinking water, etc., and have the nature of space?

original: phyi rol gyi don med do //
analyzed: phyi rol gyi don med do //
translated: External objects do not exist.

original: brtags pas der snang bar ni rung ste /
analyzed: brtags pas der snang bar ni rung ste /
translated: It is possible that they appear as such through imputation.

original: ji skad du //
analyzed: ji skad du //
translated: As it is said:

original: bud med lus ni gcig pu la //üîΩro dang 'dod bya za ba zhes //
analyzed: bud med lus ni gcig pu la // ro dang 'dod bya za ba zhes //
translated: ‚ÄúOne and the same woman‚Äôs bodyüîΩis said to be a corpse by ascetics,üîΩa lover by lovers,

original: kun rgyu 'dod can khyi rnams kyi //
analyzed: kun rgyu 'dod can khyi rnams kyi //
translated: and a dwelling by rakshasas.

original: rnam par rtog pa rnam gsum mo //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa rnam gsum mo //
translated: The three conceptual thoughts

original: zhes bshad pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: zhes bshad pa lta bu'o //
translated: of the lustful dogs of the world.‚Äù

original: 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa la ni mdo sde pa'i ltar na rnam par shes pa dmigs pa med par grub po //
analyzed: 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa la ni mdo sde pa'i ltar na rnam par shes pa dmigs pa med par grub po //
translated: According to the Sautrantikas, consciousness is established as being without an object in regard to the past and future.

original: rmi lam yang grags so //
analyzed: rmi lam yang grags so //
translated: Dreams are also well known.

original: ting nge 'dzin gyi spyod yul gyi gzugs brnyan ni brjod zin te /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin gyi spyod yul gyi gzugs brnyan ni brjod zin te /
translated: The images that are the objects of concentration have already been discussed.

original: mdun na snang ba'i phyir de ni dran par mi rung ngo zhes bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: mdun na snang ba'i phyir de ni dran par mi rung ngo zhes bshad pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is not suitable to remember it.

original: me long la sogs pa'i nang du bzhin la sogs pa'i gzugs brnyan snang ba yang ji ltar ci yang ma yin pa de ltar sngar bshad zin te /
analyzed: me long la sogs pa'i nang du bzhin la sogs pa'i gzugs brnyan snang ba yang ji ltar ci yang ma yin pa de ltar sngar bshad zin te /
translated: The appearance of a reflection of a face, etc., in a mirror, etc., is just as it was explained before, as not being anything at all.

original: de dag la rnam par shes pa dmigs pa med pa nyid du grub bo //
analyzed: de dag la rnam par shes pa dmigs pa med pa nyid du grub bo //
translated: Therefore, it is established that consciousness has no object.

original: 'bad pa med par yang phyin ci log med par 'gyur ba ni gsal ba'i phyir rnam par dgrol bar kho bos 'bad pa ma byas so //üîΩgal te ji ltar dmigs pa bzhin //
analyzed: 'bad pa med par yang phyin ci log med par 'gyur ba ni gsal ba'i phyir rnam par dgrol bar kho bos 'bad pa ma byas so // gal te ji ltar dmigs pa bzhin //
translated: Since it is clear that one would be without error without effort, I have not made an effort to set forth this point.üîΩIf one understood the meaning

original: don rnams yang dag nyid rtogs na //
analyzed: don rnams yang dag nyid rtogs na //
translated: just as it is, as it is apprehended,

original: yang dag mthong bas lus can rnams //
analyzed: yang dag mthong bas lus can rnams //
translated: then, seeing reality, embodied beings

original: 'bad pa med par dgrol bar 'gyur //
analyzed: 'bad pa med par dgrol bar 'gyur //
translated: would be liberated without effort.

original: bsam gtan pa zhes bya ba ni nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas rnams te ;
analyzed: bsam gtan pa zhes bya ba ni nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas rnams te ;
translated: The ‚Äúmeditators‚Äù are the ≈õrƒÅvakas and pratyekabuddhas.

original: bsam gtan ni sems rtse gcig pa dge ba'o //
analyzed: bsam gtan ni sems rtse gcig pa dge ba'o //
translated: Meditative concentration is virtuous one-pointedness of mind.

original: 'di dag la bsam gtan byed pa'i ngang tshul yod pa ni bsam gtan pa'o //
analyzed: 'di dag la bsam gtan byed pa'i ngang tshul yod pa ni bsam gtan pa'o //
translated: The one who is in the state of contemplating these is the contemplator.

original: sems la dbang thob pas rnams la zhes bya ba ni sems las su rung ba nyid thob pa rnams so //
analyzed: sems la dbang thob pas rnams la zhes bya ba ni sems las su rung ba nyid thob pa rnams so //
translated: Those who have attained mastery over the mind are the ones who have attained mental flexibility.

original: mos pa ni mo par byed pa ste /
analyzed: mos pa ni mo par byed pa ste /
translated: Faith is the act of believing.

original: yid ches pa'o /
analyzed: yid ches pa'o /
translated: It is conviction.

original: de'i dbang gis zhes bya ba ni ji ltar mos pa bzhin dus la sogs pa chu la sogs pa'i dngos por snang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i dbang gis zhes bya ba ni ji ltar mos pa bzhin dus la sogs pa chu la sogs pa'i dngos por snang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: By the power of that, i.e., by the power of faith, water, etc., appear as earth, etc., at the appropriate time, in accordance with the faith.

original: zhi gnas thob pa zhes bya ba ni ting nge 'dzin thob pa rnams te /
analyzed: zhi gnas thob pa zhes bya ba ni ting nge 'dzin thob pa rnams te /
translated: Those who have attained serenity are those who have attained concentration.

original: zhi gnas dang ting nge 'dzin ni don gcig go //
analyzed: zhi gnas dang ting nge 'dzin ni don gcig go //
translated: Serenity and concentration have the same meaning.

original: 'dis sems g-yengs pa zhi bar byed pas zhi gnas so //üîΩrnal 'byor pa zhes bya ba ni stong pa nyid la dmigs pa'am /
analyzed: 'dis sems g-yengs pa zhi bar byed pas zhi gnas so // rnal 'byor pa zhes bya ba ni stong pa nyid la dmigs pa'am /
translated: It is serenity because it calms the agitated mind.

original: 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi la dmigs pa'i zhi gnas dang lhag mthong zung du 'brel par 'jug pa rang gi ngang gis 'jug pa dang ldan pa ni rnal 'byor pa ste /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi la dmigs pa'i zhi gnas dang lhag mthong zung du 'brel par 'jug pa rang gi ngang gis 'jug pa dang ldan pa ni rnal 'byor pa ste /
translated: The yogi is the one who is engaged in the union of serenity and insight that takes emptiness as its object or that takes the four noble truths as its object, and who possesses natural engagement.

original: de su dag la yod pa de dag ni rnal 'byor pa'o //üîΩde dag gi rjes la thob pa med pa @226a * //
analyzed: de su dag la yod pa de dag ni rnal 'byor pa'o // de dag gi rjes la thob pa med pa @226a * //
translated: Those who have that are yogis.

original: la sogs pa'i chos la lhag mthong zhes bya ba ni shes rab bo //
analyzed: la sogs pa'i chos la lhag mthong zhes bya ba ni shes rab bo //
translated: The insight of those who do not have the latter is called wisdom.

original: de la brtson pa rnams zhes bya ba ni mngon par brtson pa rnams so //üîΩmdo la sogs pa'i chos la lhag mthong byed pa na mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i don gcig pu la yang ji lta ji ltar skad cig mar 'jig pa la sogs pa'i dngos por yid la byed pa rnams kyi yul du 'gyur ba de lta de ltar rnam
analyzed: de la brtson pa rnams zhes bya ba ni mngon par brtson pa rnams so // mdo la sogs pa'i chos la lhag mthong byed pa na mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i don gcig pu la yang ji lta ji ltar skad cig mar 'jig pa la sogs pa'i dngos por yid la byed pa rnams kyi yul du 'gyur ba de lta de ltar rnam
translated: Those who are intent on that are those who are devoted to it.üîΩWhen one is engaged in insight with regard to the Dharma of the sutras, etc.,

original: pa du mar snang ngo //
analyzed: pa du mar snang ngo //
translated: the meaning of impermanence, etc., appears in many ways, as an object of those who attend to it as momentary destruction, etc.

original: rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes thob ste /
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes thob ste /
translated: One attains nonconceptual intuition.üîΩThose who abide in that do not perceive any objects.

original: de la gnas pa rnams la don thams cad mi snang ngo zhes bya ba la rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes ni 'og nas 'chad do //
analyzed: de la gnas pa rnams la don thams cad mi snang ngo zhes bya ba la rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes ni 'og nas 'chad do //
translated: Nonconceptual intuition will be explained later.

original: don de yod na rnam par mi rtog par mi rung ste /
analyzed: don de yod na rnam par mi rtog par mi rung ste /
translated: If that object exists, it is not suitable as nonconceptual.

original: rnam par brtag par bya ba yod na rnam par mi rtog pa nyid du mi 'thad do //
analyzed: rnam par brtag par bya ba yod na rnam par mi rtog pa nyid du mi 'thad do //
translated: If there were an object to be imagined, non-imagination would not be tenable.

original: gal te don yang dag pa yin du zin na rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes byung yang de mi snang bar mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: gal te don yang dag pa yin du zin na rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes byung yang de mi snang bar mi 'gyur te /
translated: If the object were real, then even if non-imaginative wisdom arose, it would not be non-appearance,

original: yang dag pa'i don la dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i don la dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it would have the real object as its objective support.

original: de ltar na zhes bya ba ni rigs pa smos ma thag pa dang rgyud sngar bshad pa rnams kyis kyang don med do zhes mjug sdud pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar na zhes bya ba ni rigs pa smos ma thag pa dang rgyud sngar bshad pa rnams kyis kyang don med do zhes mjug sdud pa'o //
translated: Thus, the word ‚Äúthus‚Äù refers to the previously explained reason and the previously explained continuity.

original: de ji ltar na gzhan gyi dbang yin zhes bya ba ni bdag rang gis shes par bya zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de ji ltar na gzhan gyi dbang yin zhes bya ba ni bdag rang gis shes par bya zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: How can it be other-dependent? means ‚ÄúI should know it myself.‚Äù

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is it so?

original: zhes bya ba ni gzhan la brjod ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //üîΩde bzhin du ngo bo nyid gnyis po la yang dri ba gnyis gnyis so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni gzhan la brjod ces bya ba'i tha tshig go // de bzhin du ngo bo nyid gnyis po la yang dri ba gnyis gnyis so //
translated: means ‚ÄúI should tell others.‚ÄùüîΩSimilarly, there are two questions about the two realities.

original: dri ba de dag gi lan kyang gnyis gnyis so //
analyzed: dri ba de dag gi lan kyang gnyis gnyis so //
translated: There are also two answers to those questions.

original: rang gi bag chags kyi sa bon zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni kun brtags par brjod pa'i bag chags su bstan te /
analyzed: rang gi bag chags kyi sa bon zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni kun brtags par brjod pa'i bag chags su bstan te /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúseeds of one‚Äôs own habitual tendencies‚Äù refers to the habitual tendencies that are described as the imagined pattern.

original: rang gi sa bon des dbang du byas pa'i phyir gzhan gyi dbang ste /
analyzed: rang gi sa bon des dbang du byas pa'i phyir gzhan gyi dbang ste /
translated: The dependent pattern is so called because it is controlled by those seeds.

original: bdag rang gis shes par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: bdag rang gis shes par bya ba yin no //
translated: It is to be known by oneself.

original: skad cig las lhag par mi gnas pa'i phyir gzhan la brjod do //
analyzed: skad cig las lhag par mi gnas pa'i phyir gzhan la brjod do //
translated: It is to be expressed to others because it does not endure beyond the moment.

original: sa bon gyi gzhan gyi dbang dang / skye ba dang 'jig pa gzhan gyi dbang gi phyir te go rims bzhin no //
analyzed: sa bon gyi gzhan gyi dbang dang / skye ba dang 'jig pa gzhan gyi dbang gi phyir te go rims bzhin no //
translated: This is so because of the dependence on seeds, the dependence on origination and destruction, and the dependence on another, respectively.

original: de la gnas pa'i zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi dbang la brten pa'o //
analyzed: de la gnas pa'i zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi dbang la brten pa'o //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúabiding in that‚Äù means that the perfected pattern is based on the dependent pattern.

original: don med pa zhes bya ba gal te med na don zhes ji skad bya zhe na /
analyzed: don med pa zhes bya ba gal te med na don zhes ji skad bya zhe na /
translated: If it does not exist, how can it be called an object?

original: len 'debs te /
analyzed: len 'debs te /
translated: The response is as follows.

original: snang ba zhes bya ba ni de mngon par brjod pa'i sa bon las yod pa ma yin yang don bzhin du snang ba ste /
analyzed: snang ba zhes bya ba ni de mngon par brjod pa'i sa bon las yod pa ma yin yang don bzhin du snang ba ste /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúappears as an object‚Äù means that, although it does not exist, it appears as an object because of the seeds that express it.

original: des na don zhes brjod do //
analyzed: des na don zhes brjod do //
translated: Therefore, it is called an object.

original: snang ba ni gsal ba dang mngon pa dang rab tu gsal ba zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: snang ba ni gsal ba dang mngon pa dang rab tu gsal ba zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Appearance means clarity, manifestation, and full clarity.

original: dpag tu med pa'i rnam @226b pa can gyi zhes bya ba ni bdag dang chos rnam pa sna tshogs mtha' yas pa yul du snang ba'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba kun du rtog pa'o //
analyzed: dpag tu med pa'i rnam @226b pa can gyi zhes bya ba ni bdag dang chos rnam pa sna tshogs mtha' yas pa yul du snang ba'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba kun du rtog pa'o //
translated: The imagination of what is unreal is the mental consciousness that appears as the object of limitless aspects of self and phenomena.

original: phyin ci log ces bya ba ni 'khrul pa ste /
analyzed: phyin ci log ces bya ba ni 'khrul pa ste /
translated: Erroneous means deluded.

original: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i don gyi rnam par 'byung ba'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir kun du brtags pa ste /
analyzed: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i don gyi rnam par 'byung ba'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir kun du brtags pa ste /
translated: It is the imagination because it is the cause of the appearance of the aspects of objects of the grasped and the grasper.

original: de la don du kun du rtog pa'i phyir ro //üîΩrang gi mtshan nyid med la kun du rtog pa tsam du dmigs pas zhes bya ba ni /üîΩbdag dang chos dag med pa la rtog pa'i de'i rnam par snang bas kun brtags pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de la don du kun du rtog pa'i phyir ro // rang gi mtshan nyid med la kun du rtog pa tsam du dmigs pas zhes bya ba ni / bdag dang chos dag med pa la rtog pa'i de'i rnam par snang bas kun brtags pa zhes bya'o //
translated: It is the imagination because it imagines objects that do not exist.üîΩThe imagination of what is unreal is the appearance of the aspects of objects of the grasped and the grasper, which are non existent, as if they were existent.üîΩThe imagination of what is unreal is the appearance of the aspects of objects of the grasped and the grasper, which are non existent, as if they were existent.üîΩThe imagination of what is unreal is the appearance of the aspects of objects of the grasped and the grasper, which are non existent, as if they were existent.üîΩThe imagination of what is unreal is the appearance of the aspects of objects of the grasped and the grasper, which are non existent, as if they were existent.üîΩThe imagination of what is unreal is the appearance of the aspects of objects of the grasped and the grasper, which are non existent, as if they were existent.üîΩThe imagination of what is unreal is the appearance of the aspects of objects of the grasped and the grasper, which are non existent, as if they were existent.üîΩThe imagination of what is unreal is the appearance of the aspects of objects of the grasped and the grasper, which are non existent, as if they were existent.üîΩThe imagination of what is unreal is the appearance of the aspects of objects of the grasped and the grasper, which are non existent, as if they were existent.üîΩThe imagination of what is unreal is the appearance of the aspects of objects of the grasped and the grasper, which are non existent, as if they were existent.üîΩThe imagination of what is unreal is the appearance of the aspects of objects of the grasped and the grasper, which are non existent, as if they were existent.üîΩThe imagination of what is unreal is the appearance of the aspects of objects of the grasped and the grasper, which are non existent, as if they were existent.

original: gzhan du mi 'gyur ba ni 'gyur ba med par yongs su grub pas yongs su grub par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: gzhan du mi 'gyur ba ni 'gyur ba med par yongs su grub pas yongs su grub par shes par bya'o //
translated: The imagination of what is unreal is the appearance of the aspects of objects of the grasped and the grasper, which are non existent, as if they were existent.üîΩThe imagination of what is unreal is the appearance of the aspects of objects of the grasped and the grasper,

original: rnam par dag pa'i dmigs pa yin pa dang / dge ba'i chos thams cad kyi mchog yin pa gnyis kyi yongs su grub pa zhes brjod do //
analyzed: rnam par dag pa'i dmigs pa yin pa dang / dge ba'i chos thams cad kyi mchog yin pa gnyis kyi yongs su grub pa zhes brjod do //
translated: The perfected is said to be the object of purification and the supreme of all virtuous things.

original: yang kun du rtog pa yod cing zhes bya ba la sogs pa kun brtags pa dpyod do //
analyzed: yang kun du rtog pa yod cing zhes bya ba la sogs pa kun brtags pa dpyod do //
translated: Again, the imagined is analyzed as beginning with the line, ‚ÄúWhen there is the imagination of what is unreal. ‚Äù

original: yid kyi rnam par shes pa ni kun du rtog pa ste /
analyzed: yid kyi rnam par shes pa ni kun du rtog pa ste /
translated: The mental consciousness is the imagination of what is unreal.

original: rnam par rtog pa can gyi phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa can gyi phyir ro //
translated: Because it is conceptual.

original: zhes bya ba ni nges par rtog pa dang rjes su dran pa'i rnam par rtog pa dang 'brel ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni nges par rtog pa dang rjes su dran pa'i rnam par rtog pa dang 'brel ba'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because it is associated with the conceptualization of determination and memory.

original: rang brjod pa'i bag chags kyi sa bon las byung ba zhes bya ba ni yid kyi rnam par shes pa yid kyi rnam par shes pa zhes thog ma med pa'i 'khor ba na tha snyad du brjod pa ste /
analyzed: rang brjod pa'i bag chags kyi sa bon las byung ba zhes bya ba ni yid kyi rnam par shes pa yid kyi rnam par shes pa zhes thog ma med pa'i 'khor ba na tha snyad du brjod pa ste /
translated: It arises from the seed of the latent impressions of self-expression. The mental consciousness is the mental consciousness because it is conventionally expressed as such in beginningless cyclic existence.

original: de'i bag chags ni 'di'i sa bon no //
analyzed: de'i bag chags ni 'di'i sa bon no //
translated: Its latent impressions are its seeds.

original: rnam par rig pa thams cad kyi brjod pa'i bag chags kyi sa bon las byung ba zhes bya ba ni 'di ltar gzugs la sogs pa mtha' yas par snang ba'i rnam par rig pa brjod pa'i bag chags kyi rgyu las byung ba ste /
analyzed: rnam par rig pa thams cad kyi brjod pa'i bag chags kyi sa bon las byung ba zhes bya ba ni 'di ltar gzugs la sogs pa mtha' yas par snang ba'i rnam par rig pa brjod pa'i bag chags kyi rgyu las byung ba ste /
translated: ‚ÄúArisen from the seeds of the predispositions for verbalization of all representations‚Äù means that it arises from the cause of the predispositions for verbalization of representations appearing as infinite forms, etc.

original: der snang bar 'byung ba'i tshul can yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: der snang bar 'byung ba'i tshul can yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is the mode of appearance there.

original: de'i phyir yid kyi rnam par shes pa ni rnam par mtha' yas pa'i rnam par rtog pa thams cad kyis 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir yid kyi rnam par shes pa ni rnam par mtha' yas pa'i rnam par rtog pa thams cad kyis 'byung ba'o //
translated: Therefore, the mental consciousness arises with all the infinite conceptualizations.

original: gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid ni kun du brtags par bya'o zhes bya ba ni de'i phyogs gcig mig la sogs pa yul du gyur pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid ni kun du brtags par bya'o zhes bya ba ni de'i phyogs gcig mig la sogs pa yul du gyur pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThe dependent entity should be imagined as the imagined,‚Äù means that one part of it, the eye, etc., is the object.

original: rnam pa gang du gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid la kun du brtags pa de ni de la kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid do zhes bya ba ni rnam par rgyur gyur pa kun brtags pa nyid du bstan to //
analyzed: rnam pa gang du gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid la kun du brtags pa de ni de la kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid do zhes bya ba ni rnam par rgyur gyur pa kun brtags pa nyid du bstan to //
translated: ‚ÄúThe dependent entity imagined in that way is the imagined entity,‚Äù means that the form that is the cause of the appearance is taught to be the imagined.

original: kun du rtog pas ji ltar kun du rtog ces bya ba ni rnam pa'i rab tu dbye ba dris nas /üîΩkun brtags pa'i rab @227a * //
analyzed: kun du rtog pas ji ltar kun du rtog ces bya ba ni rnam pa'i rab tu dbye ba dris nas / kun brtags pa'i rab @227a * //
translated: The reply is: It is imagined by name, sign, and discrimination.

original: tu dbye ba ston to //üîΩming gis dmigs pa zhes bya ba ni lha sbyin zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i ming thos nas don la kun du rtog par byed kyi ming ma thos par ni don la rnam par rtog par byed mi nus so //üîΩgzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid lus la sogs pa la der mtshan mar 'dzin pa zhes bya ba ni rang gi mtshan ma la mngon par zhen zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //üîΩmtshan mar 'dzin pa ni 'du shes te /
analyzed: tu dbye ba ston to // ming gis dmigs pa zhes bya ba ni lha sbyin zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i ming thos nas don la kun du rtog par byed kyi ming ma thos par ni don la rnam par rtog par byed mi nus so // gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid lus la sogs pa la der mtshan mar 'dzin pa zhes bya ba ni rang gi mtshan ma la mngon par zhen zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go // mtshan mar 'dzin pa ni 'du shes te /
translated: The reply concerning the differentiation of the imagined is given.üîΩThe phrase by name means that after hearing such names as Devadatta, one imagines the object, but without hearing the name one is not able to imagine the object.

original: ji ltar 'du shes su 'gyur ba de ltar rjes su tha snyad 'dogs so //üîΩyang na gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid mig la sogs pa la'o //üîΩlta ba rnam pa lnga nges par rtog pa'i rnam par 'jug pas so //
analyzed: ji ltar 'du shes su 'gyur ba de ltar rjes su tha snyad 'dogs so //üîΩyang na gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid mig la sogs pa la'o //üîΩlta ba rnam pa lnga nges par rtog pa'i rnam par 'jug pas so //
translated: The phrase by sign means that one grasps the dependent nature as a body, etc. , and the phrase by discrimination means that one grasps the dependent nature as a body, etc. , and the phrase by discrimination means that one grasps the dependent nature as a body, etc. , and the phrase by discrimination means that one grasps the dependent nature as a body, etc. , and the phrase by discrimination means that one grasps the dependent nature as a body, etc. , and the phrase by discrimination means that one grasps the dependent nature as a body, etc. , and the phrase by discrimination means that one grasps the dependent nature as a body, etc. , and the phrase by discrimination means that one grasps the dependent nature as a body, etc. , and the phrase by discrimination means that one grasps the dependent nature as a body, etc. , and the phrase by discrimination means that one grasps the dependent nature as a body, etc. , and the phrase by discrimination means that one grasps the dependent nature as a body, etc. , and the phrase by discrimination means that one grasps the dependent nature as a body, etc. , and the phrase by discrimination means that one grasps the dependent nature as a body, etc. , and the phrase by discrimination means that one grasps the dependent nature as a body, etc. , and the phrase by discrimination means that one grasps the dependent nature as a body, etc. , and the phrase by discrimination means that one grasps the dependent nature as a body, etc. , and the phrase by discrimination means that one grasps the dependent nature as a body, etc. , and the phrase by discrimination means that one grasps the dependent nature as a body, etc. , and the phrase by discrimination means that one grasps the dependent nature as a body, etc. , and the phrase by discrimination means that one grasp

original: de la mngon par zhen pa zhes bya ba ni mtshan mar byas pas mngon par zhen pa'i phyir te mtshan ma la mngon par zhen pa'i dbang gis zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de la mngon par zhen pa zhes bya ba ni mtshan mar byas pas mngon par zhen pa'i phyir te mtshan ma la mngon par zhen pa'i dbang gis zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The phrase one becomes attached to it means that one becomes attached to it by means of the signs, i.e., by means of the attachment to the signs.

original: lta bas nges par brtags pa'i don las 'di ni de bzhin no zhes mngon par zhen nas gzhan dag la ston par 'dod pa na rtog pa dang dpyod pa dag gis ngag kun nas slong ste /
analyzed: lta bas nges par brtags pa'i don las 'di ni de bzhin no zhes mngon par zhen nas gzhan dag la ston par 'dod pa na rtog pa dang dpyod pa dag gis ngag kun nas slong ste /
translated: Having become attached to the object that has been investigated by means of views, i.e., this is just as it is, one then wishes to teach it to others. One then instigates speech by means of conception and discernment.

original: ma brtags ma dpyad par tshig mi smra'o zhes ji skad gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: ma brtags ma dpyad par tshig mi smra'o zhes ji skad gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: One does not speak without having investigated and examined, as it is said.

original: mthong ba la sogs pa zhes bya ba ni mthong ba dang thos pa dang / bye brag phyed pa dang / rnam par shes pa tha snyad rnam par bzhi po dag gis te /
analyzed: mthong ba la sogs pa zhes bya ba ni mthong ba dang thos pa dang / bye brag phyed pa dang / rnam par shes pa tha snyad rnam par bzhi po dag gis te /
translated: The phrase by means of the four types of conventional cognition refers to the four types of conventional cognition: seeing, hearing, differentiating, and knowing.

original: ji ltar sprul gyi ming la dmigs pa na thag pa la sprul gyi mtshan ma kyag kyog la sogs pa mtshan mar byed cing de la mngon par zhen nas gzhan la bstan pa'i phyir sprul mthong ngo zhes tshig tu smra ba de dang mtshungs so //
analyzed: ji ltar sprul gyi ming la dmigs pa na thag pa la sprul gyi mtshan ma kyag kyog la sogs pa mtshan mar byed cing de la mngon par zhen nas gzhan la bstan pa'i phyir sprul mthong ngo zhes tshig tu smra ba de dang mtshungs so //
translated: Just as when one observes the name of a snake, one imagines the shape of a snake in the rope, such as its coils, and so on, and having become attached to that, one says to another, ‚ÄúI see a snake,‚Äù in order to show it to him.

original: tha dad pa yang ma yin zhes bya ba ni kun brtags pa dang gzhan gyi dbang gnyis yod pa dang med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tha dad pa yang ma yin zhes bya ba ni kun brtags pa dang gzhan gyi dbang gnyis yod pa dang med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not different. This is because the imagined and the dependent are both existent and nonexistent.

original: yod pa las yod pa nyid ni gzhan ma yin te /
analyzed: yod pa las yod pa nyid ni gzhan ma yin te /
translated: An existent is not different from an existent.

original: ri bong gi rva la sogs pa med pa ni yod pa las gzhan ma yin no //
analyzed: ri bong gi rva la sogs pa med pa ni yod pa las gzhan ma yin no //
translated: The nonexistence of the horns of a rabbit, etc., is not different from an existent.

original: tha dad pa ma yin pa yang ma yin zhes bya ba ni yod pa dang med pa gcig pa nyid du mi 'thad pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: tha dad pa ma yin pa yang ma yin zhes bya ba ni yod pa dang med pa gcig pa nyid du mi 'thad pa'i phyir te /
translated: It is not nondifferent. This is because it is not tenable that existence and nonexistence are identical.

original: de bzhin du gzhan gyi dbang dang yongs su grub pa gnyis kyang rang bzhin gyis dag pa dang ma dag pa'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du gzhan gyi dbang dang yongs su grub pa gnyis kyang rang bzhin gyis dag pa dang ma dag pa'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: In the same way, the dependent and the real are not different, because their natures are pure and impure, respectively.

original: 'dir dgongs pa'i rnam grangs la brten nas ni 'di dag gcig par yang 'gyur /
analyzed: 'dir dgongs pa'i rnam grangs la brten nas ni 'di dag gcig par yang 'gyur /
translated: But on the basis of the synonyms intended here, they are the same.

original: du mar yang 'gyur bas rnam grangs kyis gzhan gyi dbang nyid kun brtags par bstan te /
analyzed: du mar yang 'gyur bas rnam grangs kyis gzhan gyi dbang nyid kun brtags par bstan te /
translated: And since they are also different, the other-dependent is taught as the imagined on the basis of synonyms.

original: @227b kun du rtog pa'i rgyu mtshan yin pa dang des kun brtags pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: @227b kun du rtog pa'i rgyu mtshan yin pa dang des kun brtags pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is the objective source of imagination and because it is imagined by that.

original: zhes bya ba ni 'di ltar bdag dang gzugs la sogs pa kun brtags pa'i rten yin pa dang / kun du rtog pa zhes bya ba yid kyi rnam par shes pa bdag dang gzugs la sogs pa'i dngos por kun du rtog ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni 'di ltar bdag dang gzugs la sogs pa kun brtags pa'i rten yin pa dang / kun du rtog pa zhes bya ba yid kyi rnam par shes pa bdag dang gzugs la sogs pa'i dngos por kun du rtog ste /
translated: Thus, the imagined is the basis of the imagined self and form, etc. Imagination is the mental consciousness that imagines the self and the things form, etc.

original: dgongs pa des kun brtags pa zhes nye bar 'dogs par mdzad do //
analyzed: dgongs pa des kun brtags pa zhes nye bar 'dogs par mdzad do //
translated: Imagined is the designation made by that imagination.

original: rnam grangs kyis ni de nyid yongs su grub pa'o zhes bya ba ni ji ltar snang ba gtan du med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam grangs kyis ni de nyid yongs su grub pa'o zhes bya ba ni ji ltar snang ba gtan du med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The other-dependent is the perfected on the basis of synonyms, because it is utterly non-existent as it appears.

original: bag chags kyi sa bon gyi gzhan gyi dbang zhes bya ba ni rgyu la rag las pas gzhan gyi dbang ngo //
analyzed: bag chags kyi sa bon gyi gzhan gyi dbang zhes bya ba ni rgyu la rag las pas gzhan gyi dbang ngo //
translated: The other-dependent is the seed of the residual impressions, because it is dependent on causes.

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba'i ngo bo nyid yongs su ma grub pa gzhan gyi dbang zhes bya ba ni 'di ltar rnam par brtag par bya ba'i tshe ni kun nas nyon mongs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba'i ngo bo nyid yongs su ma grub pa gzhan gyi dbang zhes bya ba ni 'di ltar rnam par brtag par bya ba'i tshe ni kun nas nyon mongs par 'gyur ro //
translated: When it is imagined, it becomes the thoroughly afflicted;

original: rnam par brtag par bya ba ma yin pa'i tshe ni rnam par byang bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: rnam par brtag par bya ba ma yin pa'i tshe ni rnam par byang bar 'gyur te /
translated: when it is not imagined, it becomes the completely purified.

original: de ltar rnam pa gnyis la rag lus las gzhan gyi dbang ngo //
analyzed: de ltar rnam pa gnyis la rag lus las gzhan gyi dbang ngo //
translated: Thus, it is the other-dependent because it depends on the other two aspects.

original: de ltar na re zhig ngo bo nyid rnam pa gsum po de dag gi tshul ni ltos pa'i bye brag gis tha dad pa yang ma yin /
analyzed: de ltar na re zhig ngo bo nyid rnam pa gsum po de dag gi tshul ni ltos pa'i bye brag gis tha dad pa yang ma yin /
translated: Thus, the three natures are not different due to a difference in their mode of dependence,

original: tha dad pa ma yin pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: tha dad pa ma yin pa yang ma yin te /
translated: nor are they not different.

original: bag chags kyi sa bon las byung ba la sogs pa la ltos pa gang gis gzhan gyi dbang yin pa de nyid kyis gnyis po dag ni ma yin no /
analyzed: bag chags kyi sa bon las byung ba la sogs pa la ltos pa gang gis gzhan gyi dbang yin pa de nyid kyis gnyis po dag ni ma yin no /
translated: The other-dependent is the other-dependent due to its dependence on the seeds of habitual propensities and so on, but it is not the other two.

original: kun du rtog pa'i rgyu mtshan dang / des kun brtags pa nyid la /
analyzed: kun du rtog pa'i rgyu mtshan dang / des kun brtags pa nyid la /
translated: The imaginary is the imaginary due to its being imagined in the signs of the thoroughly imagined and by that imagination.

original: ltos pa gang gis kun brtags pa yin pa de nyid kyis gnyis po dag ni ma yin no //
analyzed: ltos pa gang gis kun brtags pa yin pa de nyid kyis gnyis po dag ni ma yin no //
translated: The imagined is not the duality, but is dependent on the relative.

original: kun brtags pa gtan med pa la ltos pa gang gis yongs su grub pa yin pa de nyid kyis gnyis po dag ni ma yin no //üîΩji ltar gzhan gyi dbang gi rnam par gnyis yin pa lta kun brtags pa yang de bzhin te /
analyzed: kun brtags pa gtan med pa la ltos pa gang gis yongs su grub pa yin pa de nyid kyis gnyis po dag ni ma yin no // ji ltar gzhan gyi dbang gi rnam par gnyis yin pa lta kun brtags pa yang de bzhin te /
translated: The perfected is not the duality, but is dependent on the imagined.üîΩJust as the relative is twofold, so is the imagined.

original: de la ngo bo nyid du kun du rtog pa ni mig la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: de la ngo bo nyid du kun du rtog pa ni mig la sogs pa ste /
translated: The imagination of what is unreal consists in the essential nature of the relative.

original: dngos po tsam nye bar 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: dngos po tsam nye bar 'dzin pa'o //
translated: The imagination of what is unreal consists in the apprehension of mere entities.

original: khyad par du kun du rtog pa ni mi rtag pa nyid la sogs pa'i chos la rtog pa'o //
analyzed: khyad par du kun du rtog pa ni mi rtag pa nyid la sogs pa'i chos la rtog pa'o //
translated: The imagination of what is unreal consists in the imagination of the special attributes of impermanence, etc.

original: rang bzhin gyis yongs su grub pa ni dri ma dang bcas pa'i de bzhin nyid du bstan to //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis yongs su grub pa ni dri ma dang bcas pa'i de bzhin nyid du bstan to //
translated: The perfected is taught as the perfected nature of the essential nature of the imagination of what is unreal.

original: rnam par dag par yongs su grub pa ni dri ma med pa'i de bzhin nyid do //
analyzed: rnam par dag par yongs su grub pa ni dri ma med pa'i de bzhin nyid do //
translated: The perfected is the perfected nature of the essential nature of the imagination of what is unreal.

original: bya ba ni tha snyad la mkhas pa rnams kyi zhes bya ba ni tshig sngon du btang nas rang gi bsam pa brjod pa dang 'brel pa'o //
analyzed: bya ba ni tha snyad la mkhas pa rnams kyi zhes bya ba ni tshig sngon du btang nas rang gi bsam pa brjod pa dang 'brel pa'o //
translated: The word activity is related to the phrase those skilled in conventionalities in the sense that it refers to the expression of one's own thought.

original: ma byang ba mi bzlog pa ste //
analyzed: ma byang ba mi bzlog pa ste //
translated: The phrase not reversing the unrefined means that the unrefined is not reversed.

original: ba lang la sogs pa @228a * //
analyzed: ba lang la sogs pa @228a * //
translated: The word unrefined refers to the cow, etc.

original: rnams kyi'o // ming la brten te ming gi ngo bo nyid la kun du rtog pa zhes bya ba ni dper na na li ke ra'i gling na gnas pas ba lang gi sgra thos nas de'i don ma rtogs nas ba lang gi sgra'i ming gis ming la kun du rtog pa'o
analyzed: rnams kyi'o // ming la brten te ming gi ngo bo nyid la kun du rtog pa zhes bya ba ni dper na na li ke ra'i gling na gnas pas ba lang gi sgra thos nas de'i don ma rtogs nas ba lang gi sgra'i ming gis ming la kun du rtog pa'o
translated: The phrase conceptualizing the name based on the name means, for example, that someone from the land of Nalikera hears the word cow, does not understand its meaning, and conceptualizes the name based on the name of the word cow.

original: // ming ma rtogs pa'i don zhes bya ba ni ming dang ming can 'brel bar ma byas pa de nyid kyis ba lang gi lus mthong nas phyir zhing don la rtog pa'o //
analyzed: // ming ma rtogs pa'i don zhes bya ba ni ming dang ming can 'brel bar ma byas pa de nyid kyis ba lang gi lus mthong nas phyir zhing don la rtog pa'o //
translated: The phrase conceptualizing the object without understanding the name means that, due to not having established the connection between the name and the named, one sees the body of a cow and again conceptualizes the object.

original: de gnyi ga la brten pa ni brda shes par bya ba brjod pa dang / brjod par bya ba gnyis la brten nas rtog pa'o //
analyzed: de gnyi ga la brten pa ni brda shes par bya ba brjod pa dang / brjod par bya ba gnyis la brten nas rtog pa'o //
translated: The phrase conceptualizing based on both means conceptualizing based on both the expression that conveys the conventional symbol and the object that is expressed.

original: rtsa ba'i rnam par rtog pa ni rnam par rtog pa de las gzhan pa dag gi rtsa ba yang yin la /
analyzed: rtsa ba'i rnam par rtog pa ni rnam par rtog pa de las gzhan pa dag gi rtsa ba yang yin la /
translated: The fundamental imagination is the root of the other imaginations,

original: rang yang rnam par rtog pas na rtsa ba'i rnam par rtog pa ste /
analyzed: rang yang rnam par rtog pas na rtsa ba'i rnam par rtog pa ste /
translated: and it is also imagination itself. Thus it is called the fundamental imagination.

original: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa'o //üîΩmtshan ma'i rnam par rtog pa ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa'o // mtshan ma'i rnam par rtog pa ni 'di lta ste /
translated: It is the store consciousness.

original: gzugs la sogs pa ste /üîΩ'di'o zhes mtshan mar byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa ste / 'di'o zhes mtshan mar byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The imagination of signs refers to form, etc.

original: mtshan mar snang ba'i rnam par rtog pa ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: mtshan mar snang ba'i rnam par rtog pa ni 'di lta ste /
translated: It is called the imagination of signs because it is the cause of the signs of form, etc.

original: rten dang bcas pa'i mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa'i rnam par rig pa'o zhes bya ba ni mtshan mar snang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rten dang bcas pa'i mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa'i rnam par rig pa'o zhes bya ba ni mtshan mar snang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The imagination of the appearance of signs refers to the representations of the visual consciousness, etc.,üîΩwhich are associated with the signs.

original: mtshan mar 'gyur ba'i rnam par rtog pa zhes bya ba ni gzugs la sogs par snang ba'i rnam par rig pa'i 'gyur ba ste /
analyzed: mtshan mar 'gyur ba'i rnam par rtog pa zhes bya ba ni gzugs la sogs par snang ba'i rnam par rig pa'i 'gyur ba ste /
translated: The imagination of the transformation of signs refers to the transformation of the representations that appear as form, etc.

original: de nyid rnam par rtog pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid rnam par rtog pa'o //
translated: That is imagination itself.

original: rga ba la sogs pa zhes bya ba ni rga ba la sogs pas gzugs la sogs par snang ba'i rnam par rig pa rnams 'gyur bar byed pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: rga ba la sogs pa zhes bya ba ni rga ba la sogs pas gzugs la sogs par snang ba'i rnam par rig pa rnams 'gyur bar byed pa'i phyir te /
translated: ‚ÄúAging, etc.‚Äù means that the cognitions appearing as form, etc. are changed by aging, etc.

original: 'di ltar rgas na phyi dang nang gi gzugs la sogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar rgas na phyi dang nang gi gzugs la sogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, when one ages, outer and inner forms, etc. change.

original: sogs pa sogs pas ni bde ba la sogs pa'i tshor ba bsdu ste /
analyzed: sogs pa sogs pas ni bde ba la sogs pa'i tshor ba bsdu ste /
translated: ‚ÄúEtc.‚Äù includes feelings such as pleasure, etc.

original: bde ba'i ming dang bzhin gsal ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: bde ba'i ming dang bzhin gsal ba'i phyir te /
translated: because pleasure, etc. are manifest in the face.

original: khros par gyur pa la sogs pa'i mdog mi sdug ces ji skad gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: khros par gyur pa la sogs pa'i mdog mi sdug ces ji skad gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: For example, it is said that the complexion of one who is angry, etc. is ugly.

original: gnod pa dang dus kyis yongs su 'gyur ba la sogs pa zhes bya ba ni gsad pa dang bcing ba la sogs pas lus la sogs pa'i 'gyur ba skyed pa'i phyir la /
analyzed: gnod pa dang dus kyis yongs su 'gyur ba la sogs pa zhes bya ba ni gsad pa dang bcing ba la sogs pas lus la sogs pa'i 'gyur ba skyed pa'i phyir la /
translated: ‚ÄúHarm, time, transformation, etc.‚Äù means that the body, etc. are changed by killing, binding, etc.

original: grang ba dang / tsha ba dang / char pa la sogs pas kyang phyi dang nang gi lus dang shing la sogs pa'i gzugs la sogs pa gzhan du 'gyur te /
analyzed: grang ba dang / tsha ba dang / char pa la sogs pas kyang phyi dang nang gi lus dang shing la sogs pa'i gzugs la sogs pa gzhan du 'gyur te /
translated: and by cold, heat, rain, etc. outer and inner forms, such as the body and trees, etc. are changed.

original: grang ba'i tshe grang bas nyen pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ji skad gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: grang ba'i tshe grang bas nyen pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ji skad gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: When it is cold, it is called the suffering of being afflicted by cold.

original: sems can dmyal ba'i 'gro ba la sogs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pas ni ngan 'gro thams @228b cad bsdus te /
analyzed: sems can dmyal ba'i 'gro ba la sogs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pas ni ngan 'gro thams @228b cad bsdus te /
translated: By mentioning the destiny of hell beings and so on, all the miserable destinies are included.

original: de dag tu gzugs la sogs pa 'gyur ba ni grags pa yin no //
analyzed: de dag tu gzugs la sogs pa 'gyur ba ni grags pa yin no //
translated: The transformation of form and so on in those destinies is well known.

original: 'dod pa'i khams la sogs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pas ni gzugs kyi khams bsdus te /
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams la sogs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pas ni gzugs kyi khams bsdus te /
translated: By mentioning the desire realm and so on, the form realm is included.

original: gzugs med pa'i khams na gzugs la sogs par snang ba'i rnam par rig pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzugs med pa'i khams na gzugs la sogs par snang ba'i rnam par rig pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because in the formless realm there is no appearance of form and so on.

original: bsam gtan bzhi po dag na sems can dang snod kyi gzugs la sogs pa nor bu'i 'od ltar dang ba yin du zin kyang 'gyur ba yod pa nyid de /
analyzed: bsam gtan bzhi po dag na sems can dang snod kyi gzugs la sogs pa nor bu'i 'od ltar dang ba yin du zin kyang 'gyur ba yod pa nyid de /
translated: Even though the form of sentient beings and the environment in the four meditative concentrations is clear like the light of a gem, there is still transformation.

original: gnas pa gzhan du 'gyur ba yang snang ngo zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnas pa gzhan du 'gyur ba yang snang ngo zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is said that the transformation of abiding is also seen.

original: mtshan mar snang ba 'gyur ba'i rnam par rtog pa zhes bya ba ni mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa'i rnam par rig pa gzugs la sogs pa'i mtshan mar snang ba rnams te /
analyzed: mtshan mar snang ba 'gyur ba'i rnam par rtog pa zhes bya ba ni mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa'i rnam par rig pa gzugs la sogs pa'i mtshan mar snang ba rnams te /
translated: The ‚Äúconceptualization that is a transformation of the appearance of signs‚Äù is the representations of eye consciousness, etc., that appear as the signs of form, etc.

original: rten mig la sogs pa dang bcas te 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: rten mig la sogs pa dang bcas te 'gyur ba'o //
translated: They are transformations along with their supports, the eyes, etc.

original: de nyid rnam par rtog pa ste //
analyzed: de nyid rnam par rtog pa ste //
translated: That itself is conceptualization.

original: ji skad smos pa rga ba la sogs pa 'di dag gis ji ltar mthun mthun du 'gyur bar byed pa'i phyir ro ;
analyzed: ji skad smos pa rga ba la sogs pa 'di dag gis ji ltar mthun mthun du 'gyur bar byed pa'i phyir ro ;
translated: Because it causes the changes that are mentioned, such as aging, etc., in whatever way is appropriate.

original: /'di ltar rgas na mig la sogs pa nyams pa nyid dang / rtul ba nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa 'byung ste /
analyzed: /'di ltar rgas na mig la sogs pa nyams pa nyid dang / rtul ba nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa 'byung ste /
translated: Thus, when one ages, the eyes, etc., are impaired and become weak, etc.

original: gnas gyur pa'i phyir de la gnas pa'i rnam par rig pa rnams kyang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gnas gyur pa'i phyir de la gnas pa'i rnam par rig pa rnams kyang 'gyur ro //
translated: Because of the transformation of the support, the representations that are supported on it also change.

original: de bzhin du bde ba la sogs pa'i tshor ba la sogs pas kyang gzhan du 'gyur te /
analyzed: de bzhin du bde ba la sogs pa'i tshor ba la sogs pas kyang gzhan du 'gyur te /
translated: Similarly, there are changes due to the feelings of pleasure, etc.

original: bde bar gyur ba'i sems mnyam par 'jog pa dang / sdug bsngal bar gyur ba'i sems rnam par 'khrug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bde bar gyur ba'i sems mnyam par 'jog pa dang / sdug bsngal bar gyur ba'i sems rnam par 'khrug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the mind becomes concentrated when it is happy and disturbed when it is unhappy.

original: de bzhin du gnod pa bsad pa la sogs pa dang / dus kyi yongs su 'gyur ba dang / 'dod pa la sogs pa'i khams rnams kyi gnas dang bcas pa'i rnam par rig par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de bzhin du gnod pa bsad pa la sogs pa dang / dus kyi yongs su 'gyur ba dang / 'dod pa la sogs pa'i khams rnams kyi gnas dang bcas pa'i rnam par rig par 'gyur te /
translated: Similarly, there is the idea of killing, etc., the idea of the change of seasons, and the idea of the realms of desire, etc., together with their bases.

original: ji ltar mthun mthun du sbyor ro //
analyzed: ji ltar mthun mthun du sbyor ro //
translated: They should be connected in the appropriate manner.

original: gzugs med pa'i khams na ni bde ba la sogs pa'i tshor bas byas pa'i rnam par rig par 'gyur ba'i rnam par rtog pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs med pa'i khams na ni bde ba la sogs pa'i tshor bas byas pa'i rnam par rig par 'gyur ba'i rnam par rtog pa'o //
translated: In the formless realms, there is the idea of the transformation of consciousness produced by the sensation of pleasure, etc.

original: gzhan gyis bstan pa'i rnam par rtog pa zhes bya ba ni dam pa dang / dam pa ma yin pa'i bshes gnyen dang phrad nas dam pa dang dam pa ma yin pa'i chos mnyan pa'i rgyu las byung ba'i rnam par rtog pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyis bstan pa'i rnam par rtog pa zhes bya ba ni dam pa dang / dam pa ma yin pa'i bshes gnyen dang phrad nas dam pa dang dam pa ma yin pa'i chos mnyan pa'i rgyu las byung ba'i rnam par rtog pa'o //
translated: The idea of instruction is the idea that arises from listening to the teachings of good and bad friends, whether they are good or bad.

original: 'di nyid phyir rol pa ser skya la sogs pa dang / chos 'di bas bde bar gshegs pa pa rnams kyi ni tshul bzhin ma yin pa zhes bya ba yin te /üîΩyang dag pa dang log pa'i @229a * //
analyzed: 'di nyid phyir rol pa ser skya la sogs pa dang / chos 'di bas bde bar gshegs pa pa rnams kyi ni tshul bzhin ma yin pa zhes bya ba yin te / yang dag pa dang log pa'i @229a * //
translated: Therefore, the non-Buddhists, such as the SƒÅ·πÉkhyas, and the Buddhists, who are more fortunate than they, are said to have ‚Äúincorrect views.

original: lta ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i phyir ci rigs su sbyar ro //
analyzed: lta ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i phyir ci rigs su sbyar ro //
translated: ‚Äù They are associated with correct and incorrect views, respectively.

original: tshul zhes bya ba ni rigs pa ste /
analyzed: tshul zhes bya ba ni rigs pa ste /
translated: The term ‚Äúview‚Äù is used in the sense of a mode of conduct.

original: de la de yod pas tshul bzhin no //
analyzed: de la de yod pas tshul bzhin no //
translated: The term ‚Äúcorrect‚Äù is used because it is associated with that.üîΩThe term ‚Äúconceptualization‚Äù refers to the sixty-two views that arise from the cause of the perishable aggregates.

original: 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i rgyu las byung ba lta bar song ba drug cu rtsa gnyis dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i rnam par rtog pa zhes bya ba ni sngon dang / phyi ma dang / dbus la rtog pa'i rnam pa ste //
analyzed: 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i rgyu las byung ba lta bar song ba drug cu rtsa gnyis dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i rnam par rtog pa zhes bya ba ni sngon dang / phyi ma dang / dbus la rtog pa'i rnam pa ste //
translated: It is a conceptualization of the past, future, and present,

original: tshangs pa'i dran ba'i mdo las 'byung ba'i tshul du ci bdag 'das pa'i dus na 'byung ba zhig gam zhes ba ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: tshangs pa'i dran ba'i mdo las 'byung ba'i tshul du ci bdag 'das pa'i dus na 'byung ba zhig gam zhes ba ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: as stated in the BrahmajƒÅlas≈´tra: ‚ÄúDid I exist in the past?

original: lta ba la mngon par zhen pa de nyid rnam par rtog pa'o //
analyzed: lta ba la mngon par zhen pa de nyid rnam par rtog pa'o //
translated: ‚Äù The term ‚Äúconceptualization‚Äù refers to the adherence to those views.

original: song ba zhes bya ba'i sgra ni rnam pa'i don to //
analyzed: song ba zhes bya ba'i sgra ni rnam pa'i don to //
translated: The word ‚Äúgone‚Äù has the sense of a mode.

original: rnam par g-yeng ba'i rnam par rtog pa zhes bya ni rnam par g-yeng bar byed par byed pas rnam par g-yeng ba ste /
analyzed: rnam par g-yeng ba'i rnam par rtog pa zhes bya ni rnam par g-yeng bar byed par byed pas rnam par g-yeng ba ste /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúconceptualization that is distraction‚Äù means that which distracts, because it causes distraction.

original: de nyid rnam par rtog pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid rnam par rtog pa'o //
translated: That itself is conceptualization.

original: gang las rnam par g-yeng bar byed ce na /
analyzed: gang las rnam par g-yeng bar byed ce na /
translated: From what does it distract?

original: rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes las so //
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes las so //
translated: From nonconceptual wisdom.

original: ci mngon zhe na /
analyzed: ci mngon zhe na /
translated: What is the evidence?

original: zhes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is the antithesis of the perfection of wisdom.

original: rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ste /
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ste /
translated: The perfection of wisdom is nonconceptual wisdom.

original: de nyis lhur na rnam par rtog pa rnam pa bcus sel ba yin no /üîΩdngos kyi ston nas de kho na rtogs pa'am /
analyzed: de nyis lhur na rnam par rtog pa rnam pa bcus sel ba yin no / dngos kyi ston nas de kho na rtogs pa'am /
translated: It is destroyed by the ten kinds of conceptualization.

original: brjod par mi nus pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: brjod par mi nus pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because it cannot be taught or realized in the ultimate sense.

original: de lta bas na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa thams cad du rnam par rtog pa rnam pa bcu'i gnyen po nyid bstan to //
analyzed: de lta bas na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa thams cad du rnam par rtog pa rnam pa bcu'i gnyen po nyid bstan to //
translated: Therefore, the antidote to the ten kinds of conceptualization is taught as the perfection of wisdom in all its aspects.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are as follows.

original: byang chub sems dpas ji ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyad par bya zhes na /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpas ji ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyad par bya zhes na /
translated: ‚ÄúHow should a bodhisattva practice the perfection of wisdom?‚Äù

original: sh'a ri'i bu 'di la byang chub sems dpa' ni byang chub sems dpa' nyid du yod bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu 'di la byang chub sems dpa' ni byang chub sems dpa' nyid du yod bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
translated: ≈öƒÅriputra, here a bodhisattva, while existing as a bodhisattva, does not see a bodhisattva.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i ming yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i ming yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
translated: He does not see the name of a bodhisattva.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yang dag par rjes su mi mthong /üîΩspyod ces bya bar yang dag par rjes su mi mthong /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yang dag par rjes su mi mthong / spyod ces bya bar yang dag par rjes su mi mthong /
translated: He does not see the perfection of wisdom.üîΩHe does not see ‚Äúpractices.‚Äù

original: mi spyod ces bya bar yang dag par rjes su mi mthong /
analyzed: mi spyod ces bya bar yang dag par rjes su mi mthong /
translated: He does not see ‚Äúdoes not practice.‚Äù

original: gzugs yang dag par rjes su mi mthong /
analyzed: gzugs yang dag par rjes su mi mthong /
translated: He does not see form.

original: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
analyzed: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
translated: He does not see feeling, perception, volitional factors, or consciousness.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'di ltar ming ni ming gi ngo bo nyid kyis stong /
analyzed: 'di ltar ming ni ming gi ngo bo nyid kyis stong /
translated: It is because a name is empty of the intrinsic nature of a name.

original: gzugs ni gzugs kyi ngo bo nyid kyis stong ste /
analyzed: gzugs ni gzugs kyi ngo bo nyid kyis stong ste /
translated: Form is empty of the intrinsic nature of form.

original: @229b stong pa nyid kyis ni ma yin no //
analyzed: @229b stong pa nyid kyis ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not that emptiness is form.

original: gzugs kyi stong ba nyid gang yin pa de gzugs ma yin no //
analyzed: gzugs kyi stong ba nyid gang yin pa de gzugs ma yin no //
translated: The emptiness of form is not form.

original: gzugs ni stong pa nyid las gzhan ma yin te /üîΩgzugs nyid stong pa nyid do //
analyzed: gzugs ni stong pa nyid las gzhan ma yin te / gzugs nyid stong pa nyid do //
translated: Form is not other than emptiness.üîΩForm itself is emptiness.

original: stong pa nyid gzugs so //
analyzed: stong pa nyid gzugs so //
translated: Emptiness itself is form.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is it so?

original: sh'a ri'i bu 'di lta ste /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu 'di lta ste /
translated: ≈öƒÅriputra, it is like this:

original: gzugs zhes bya ba 'di ni ming tsam ste /
analyzed: gzugs zhes bya ba 'di ni ming tsam ste /
translated: ‚ÄúForm‚Äù is merely a name.

original: ngo bo nyid kyis mi skye mi 'gag /üîΩkun nas nyon mongs pa ma yin /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid kyis mi skye mi 'gag / kun nas nyon mongs pa ma yin /
translated: By nature it is neither produced nor does it cease.

original: rnam par byang ba ma yin te /
analyzed: rnam par byang ba ma yin te /
translated: It is neither defiled nor purified.

original: ming bcos ma yin la chos de dag so sor brtags nas glo bur gyi ming gis rjes su tha snyad 'dogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ming bcos ma yin la chos de dag so sor brtags nas glo bur gyi ming gis rjes su tha snyad 'dogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is a fabricated name. When those phenomena are examined, they are designated with an adventitious name.

original: ji ltar ji ltar rjes su tha snyad 'dogs pa de lta de ltar mngon par zhen to //
analyzed: ji ltar ji ltar rjes su tha snyad 'dogs pa de lta de ltar mngon par zhen to //
translated: As much as there is designation, to that extent there is clinging.

original: byang chub sems dpa' ni de dag thams cad kyi thams cad du yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' ni de dag thams cad kyi thams cad du yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
translated: The bodhisattva does not see any of them at all.

original: yang dag par rjes su mi mthong bas mngon par zhen pa med do //
analyzed: yang dag par rjes su mi mthong bas mngon par zhen pa med do //
translated: Since he does not see them, he does not settle down on them.

original: gzugs la ji ltar bar rnam par shes pa'i bar du yang de bzhin du blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: gzugs la ji ltar bar rnam par shes pa'i bar du yang de bzhin du blta bar bya'o //
translated: As with form, so it is with feeling, etc., up to consciousness.

original: de la dngos po med pa'i mtshan ma'i rnam par g-yeng ba'i rnam par rtog pa'i gnyen por bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: de la dngos po med pa'i mtshan ma'i rnam par g-yeng ba'i rnam par rtog pa'i gnyen por bka' stsal pa /
translated: The antidote to the distraction of the sign of non-existence is stated:

original: byang chub sems dpa' nyid du yod bzhin du zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' nyid du yod bzhin du zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: ‚ÄúAlthough the bodhisattva exists, etc.

original: byang chub sems dpa' la stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' la stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the nature of emptiness exists in the bodhisattva.

original: dngos po'i mtshan mar rnam par rtog pa'i gnyen por bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: dngos po'i mtshan mar rnam par rtog pa'i gnyen por bka' stsal pa /
translated: The antidote to the distraction of the sign of existence is stated:

original: byang chub sems dpa' yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: ‚ÄúThe bodhisattva does not see the bodhisattva, etc.

original: kun brtags pa'i bdag nyid du med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: kun brtags pa'i bdag nyid du med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because of the non-existence of the imagined nature.

original: sgro 'dogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i gnyen por bka' stsal /üîΩ'di ltar ming ni ngo bo nyid kyis stong ngo zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i bar du ste /
analyzed: sgro 'dogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i gnyen por bka' stsal / 'di ltar ming ni ngo bo nyid kyis stong ngo zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i bar du ste /
translated: The antidote to the conceptualization of superimposition is stated:üîΩ‚ÄúThus, a name is empty of an intrinsic nature.‚Äù

original: brtags pas so zhes bya bar dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: brtags pas so zhes bya bar dgongs pa'o //
translated: The meaning is that it is empty of the object of conceptualization.

original: skur pa 'debs pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i gnyen por bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: skur pa 'debs pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i gnyen por bka' stsal pa /
translated: The antidote to the conceptualization of denial is stated:

original: stong pa nyid kyis ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: stong pa nyid kyis ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ste /
translated: ‚ÄúIt is not that emptiness is not form.‚Äù

original: chos nyid yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos nyid yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The meaning is that the reality of form exists.

original: gcig pa nyid du rnam par rtog pa dgag pa'i don du bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: gcig pa nyid du rnam par rtog pa dgag pa'i don du bka' stsal pa /
translated: In order to refute the conceptualization of identity, it is stated:

original: gzugs kyi stong pa nyid gang yin pa de gzugs ma yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: gzugs kyi stong pa nyid gang yin pa de gzugs ma yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: ‚ÄúThe emptiness of form is not form.‚Äù

original: dag pa dang ma dag pa la dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dag pa dang ma dag pa la dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The meaning is that it is not observed as pure or impure.

original: tha dad pa nyid du rnam par rtog pa dgag pa'i don du bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: tha dad pa nyid du rnam par rtog pa dgag pa'i don du bka' stsal pa /
translated: In order to refute the conceptualization of difference, it is stated:

original: gzugs ni stong pa nyid las gzhan pa yang @230a * //
analyzed: gzugs ni stong pa nyid las gzhan pa yang @230a * //
translated: ‚ÄúForm is not other than emptiness.‚Äù

original: ma yin zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: ma yin zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: The meaning is that it is not observed as different.

original: kun brtags pa'i gzugs kyi dngos po med pa nyid stong pa nyid ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: kun brtags pa'i gzugs kyi dngos po med pa nyid stong pa nyid ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The non-existence of the imagined form is the meaning of emptiness.

original: ngo bo nyid rnam par rtog pa dgag pa'i don du bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid rnam par rtog pa dgag pa'i don du bka' stsal pa /
translated: In order to stop the conceptualization of essence, he said:

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: Thus,

original: gzugs zhes bya ba 'di ni ming tsam mo zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs zhes bya ba 'di ni ming tsam mo zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: this so-called form is a mere name.

original: khyad par du rnam par rtog pa dgag pa'i don du bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: khyad par du rnam par rtog pa dgag pa'i don du bka' stsal pa /
translated: In order to stop the conceptualization of distinction, he said:

original: ngo bo nyid ni mi skye mi 'gag ces bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid ni mi skye mi 'gag ces bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: Essence is not produced and does not cease.

original: ming ji lta ba bzhin du yang dag pa'i don du rnam par rtog pa dgag pa'i don du bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: ming ji lta ba bzhin du yang dag pa'i don du rnam par rtog pa dgag pa'i don du bka' stsal pa /
translated: In order to stop the conceptualization of the real meaning as it is named, he said:

original: ming bcos ma la chos de dag so sor brtags nas ming glo bur gyis rjes su tha snyad 'dogs zhes bya'o //
analyzed: ming bcos ma la chos de dag so sor brtags nas ming glo bur gyis rjes su tha snyad 'dogs zhes bya'o //
translated: In the case of a fabricated name, those phenomena are to be examined and are said to be nominally designated by an adventitious name.

original: don ji lta ba bzhin du ming du rnam par rtog pa dgag ba'i don du bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: don ji lta ba bzhin du ming du rnam par rtog pa dgag ba'i don du bka' stsal pa /
translated: In order to stop the conceptualization of the name as it is the meaning, he said:

original: byang chub sems dpas ming de dag thams cad yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpas ming de dag thams cad yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
translated: The bodhisattva does not see any of those names as real.

original: yang dag par rjes su mi mthong bas mngon par zhen pa med do zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: yang dag par rjes su mi mthong bas mngon par zhen pa med do zhes bya ba ste /
translated: Since he does not see them as real, he does not settle down on them.

original: don ji lta ba bzhin du zhes bya bar dgongs pa'o zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: don ji lta ba bzhin du zhes bya bar dgongs pa'o zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The meaning is as stated.

original: rnam par g-yeng ba bcu po 'di dag gi zhes bya ba nas bzung ste /
analyzed: rnam par g-yeng ba bcu po 'di dag gi zhes bya ba nas bzung ste /
translated: The ten kinds of distraction, beginning with the distraction of the object of observation, are explained in the S≈´tra on the Ten Stages.

original: des kun brtags ma yin zhes bya ba'i bar ni tshig de nyid kyis bshad zin te /
analyzed: des kun brtags ma yin zhes bya ba'i bar ni tshig de nyid kyis bshad zin te /
translated: The passage beginning with ‚ÄúThey are not imagined‚Äù and ending with ‚Äúthey are merely conventional‚Äù has already been explained by the words of the verse.

original: brda phrad par zad do //üîΩji ltar gzhan gyi dbang kun brtags pa pa'i char snang yang de'i bdag nyid ma yin pa de bzhin du khong du chud par bya ba'i phyir ming gi sngo rol na blo med pas zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: brda phrad par zad do // ji ltar gzhan gyi dbang kun brtags pa pa'i char snang yang de'i bdag nyid ma yin pa de bzhin du khong du chud par bya ba'i phyir ming gi sngo rol na blo med pas zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: The meaning is as stated.üîΩIn order to understand that the imagined nature is not the dependent nature, even though it appears as a part of the dependent nature, the verse says, ‚ÄúSince there is no mind apart from the name.‚Äù

original: gal te gzhan gyi dbang nyid kun brtags pa yin du zin na ming smos pa med par yang kun brtags pa la blo 'byung ba'i rigs so //
analyzed: gal te gzhan gyi dbang nyid kun brtags pa yin du zin na ming smos pa med par yang kun brtags pa la blo 'byung ba'i rigs so //
translated: If the dependent nature were the imagined nature, then the mind would arise with regard to the imagined nature even without the utterance of a name.

original: gang ltar dmigs pa de yod pas gzhan gyi dbang la ming la mi ltos par blo 'byung ba zhi na de ni yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gang ltar dmigs pa de yod pas gzhan gyi dbang la ming la mi ltos par blo 'byung ba zhi na de ni yod pa ma yin te /
translated: In any case, since the dependent nature is not produced in dependence on the name, it is not tenable that it exists.

original: de'i phyir gzhan gyi dbang ni kun brtags pa'i bdag nyid du 'gal lo //
analyzed: de'i phyir gzhan gyi dbang ni kun brtags pa'i bdag nyid du 'gal lo //
translated: Therefore the dependent nature is contradictory to the imagined nature.

original: ming mang pos zhes bya ba ni ming gi dbang gis gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid don nyid du rtog ste /
analyzed: ming mang pos zhes bya ba ni ming gi dbang gis gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid don nyid du rtog ste /
translated: Many names means that the dependent nature is imagined to be the referent due to the power of the name.

original: don gcig la ming mang po yod pa ni sgra nges par sbyor ba las rnam grangs 'byung ba /
analyzed: don gcig la ming mang po yod pa ni sgra nges par sbyor ba las rnam grangs 'byung ba /
translated: Many names exist for a single referent, such as the synonyms that arise from the application of terms.

original: 'gro ba dang bzod pa dang sa dang sra bar gyur pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: 'gro ba dang bzod pa dang sa dang sra bar gyur pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: For example, ‚Äúgoing,‚Äù ‚Äúenduring,‚Äù ‚Äúearth,‚Äù and ‚Äúhard‚Äù are synonyms.

original: gcig la du ma'i ngo bo nyid med pas 'gal ba'i phyir gzhan gyi dbang dang kun brtags pa gnyis gcig tu mi rung @230b ngo ;
analyzed: gcig la du ma'i ngo bo nyid med pas 'gal ba'i phyir gzhan gyi dbang dang kun brtags pa gnyis gcig tu mi rung @230b ngo ;
translated: Since many natures do not exist for a single thing, it is contradictory for the dependent and the imagined to be the same.

original: / ming nges pa med pas zhes bya ba ni dper na 'gro lding ba rnams rna ba la ming ces zer ba dang / 'bras chan la tshom rkun zhes zer ba dang / mchu la tha dad pa zhes zer ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: / ming nges pa med pas zhes bya ba ni dper na 'gro lding ba rnams rna ba la ming ces zer ba dang / 'bras chan la tshom rkun zhes zer ba dang / mchu la tha dad pa zhes zer ba lta bu'o //
translated: The phrase because the name is not fixed means that, for example, the Dravidians call the ear name, and they call cooked rice bandit, and they call the lips different.

original: gal te ming dang don gnyis gcig par gyur du zin na /
analyzed: gal te ming dang don gnyis gcig par gyur du zin na /
translated: If the name and the object were identical,

original: de'i phyir rna ba la sogs pa'i don 'chol bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de'i phyir rna ba la sogs pa'i don 'chol bar 'gyur te /
translated: then the object, the ear, etc., would be mixed up.

original: de yang med pas ji ltar brjod pa bzhin du don med do //
analyzed: de yang med pas ji ltar brjod pa bzhin du don med do //
translated: But since that is not the case, the object does not exist as it is expressed.

original: don med pa de nyid tshig tu sbyar bas sdud de /
analyzed: don med pa de nyid tshig tu sbyar bas sdud de /
translated: That very non-existence of the object is expressed in words,

original: bde blag tu blang ba dang zin par bya ba'i phyir ro //üîΩji ltar chos rnams med pa'ang yin la dmigs par yang 'gyur ba dang / ji ltar kun nas nyon mongs pa yang mi 'gyur la /
analyzed: bde blag tu blang ba dang zin par bya ba'i phyir ro // ji ltar chos rnams med pa'ang yin la dmigs par yang 'gyur ba dang / ji ltar kun nas nyon mongs pa yang mi 'gyur la /
translated: in order to easily grasp and understand it.

original: rnam par byang bar yang 'gyur zhes gtan la dbab pa'i phyir tshigs su bcad pa smos te /
analyzed: rnam par byang bar yang 'gyur zhes gtan la dbab pa'i phyir tshigs su bcad pa smos te /
translated: In order to determine how things can be non-existent and yet be perceived, and how there can be neither affliction nor purification, a verse is stated:

original: chos rnams med la dmigs pa dang // zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o /
analyzed: chos rnams med la dmigs pa dang // zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o /
translated: and the objective referent of non-existent entities.üîΩLike an elephant, etc. in a magical creation, although it does not exist, it appears as an object.

original: sgyu ma la sogs pa'i glang po che la sogs pa bzhin du med kyang don du snang ba dang / ji ltar nam mkha' rnam par dag pas sprin la sogs pas nyon mongs par ma gyur kyang de dang bral na rnam par dag pa zhes bya ba bzhin no //
analyzed: sgyu ma la sogs pa'i glang po che la sogs pa bzhin du med kyang don du snang ba dang / ji ltar nam mkha' rnam par dag pas sprin la sogs pas nyon mongs par ma gyur kyang de dang bral na rnam par dag pa zhes bya ba bzhin no //
translated: And like space, although it is not afflicted by clouds, etc. because it is pure by nature, when it is free from them, it is said to be pure.üîΩWhy does it not become non-existent in every way?
