original: thams cad kyi thams cad du med par ci'i phyir mi 'gyur zhes bya ba la thams cad kyi zhes bya ba ni snang ba'i gnas dang / rtsa nas bton pas dmigs pa med pa'i phyir ro ;
analyzed: thams cad kyi thams cad du med par ci'i phyir mi 'gyur zhes bya ba la thams cad kyi zhes bya ba ni snang ba'i gnas dang / rtsa nas bton pas dmigs pa med pa'i phyir ro ;
translated: In every way means that it is not an objective referent because it is not extracted from the basis of appearance.

original: / thams cad du zhes bya ba ni dus thams cad du'o //
analyzed: / thams cad du zhes bya ba ni dus thams cad du'o //
translated: In every way means at all times.

original: yongs su grub pa med ces bya ba de gnyi med na yongs su grub pa shin tu 'grub pa ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: yongs su grub pa med ces bya ba de gnyi med na yongs su grub pa shin tu 'grub pa ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: If both of those do not exist, isn't the consummate nature completely non-existent?

original: rang bzhin gyis rnam par byang ba ni 'grub kyi /
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis rnam par byang ba ni 'grub kyi /
translated: The natural purity is established.

original: dri ma med pa'i rnam par byang b'a ni med do zhes lan 'debs so //
analyzed: dri ma med pa'i rnam par byang b'a ni med do zhes lan 'debs so //
translated: There is no stainless purification.

original: tshigs su bcad pa ni tshig de nyid kyis bshad zin to //
analyzed: tshigs su bcad pa ni tshig de nyid kyis bshad zin to //
translated: The verse is explained by the very words.

original: theg pa zhen po bstan pa la sbyor bas gzhan gyi dbang la sogs pa mtshon pa'i phyir dri ba sngon du btang ste /
analyzed: theg pa zhen po bstan pa la sbyor bas gzhan gyi dbang la sogs pa mtshon pa'i phyir dri ba sngon du btang ste /
translated: In order to show the dependent nature, etc., he asks a question in advance,

original: med pa la sogs pa'i rnam grangs ston to //
analyzed: med pa la sogs pa'i rnam grangs ston to //
translated: and then teaches the synonyms of non-existence, etc.

original: sgyu ma la sogs pa dpe rnams kyi don tha dang pa ni 'og nas 'chad do //
analyzed: sgyu ma la sogs pa dpe rnams kyi don tha dang pa ni 'og nas 'chad do //
translated: The meaning of the examples such as illusion will be explained below.

original: rang bzhin gyis rnam par byang ba ni so so'i skye bo rnams kyi ngo bo nyid yang dag pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis rnam par byang ba ni so so'i skye bo rnams kyi ngo bo nyid yang dag pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: Natural purification is the true nature of ordinary beings.

original: de bzhin nyid ni gzhan du mi 'gyur ba'i phyir chos thams cad kyi spyi'i mtshan nyid yin te /
analyzed: de bzhin nyid ni gzhan du mi 'gyur ba'i phyir chos thams cad kyi spyi'i mtshan nyid yin te /
translated: Suchness is the universal characteristic of all phenomena because it does not change into anything else.

original: de nyid la brten nas sems can thams cad ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying po'o zhes gsungs rab las @231a * //
analyzed: de nyid la brten nas sems can thams cad ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying po'o zhes gsungs rab las @231a * //
translated: Based on that, it is said in the scriptures that all sentient beings have the essence of the Tathagata.

original: 'byung ngo // stong pa nyid ces bya ba ni kun brtags pa med pa'o //
analyzed: 'byung ngo // stong pa nyid ces bya ba ni kun brtags pa med pa'o //
translated: It is the emptiness of the imagined.

original: yang dag pa'i mtha' zhes bya ba ni bden pa'i mur thug pa'o //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i mtha' zhes bya ba ni bden pa'i mur thug pa'o //
translated: The limit of reality is the limit of truth.

original: mtshan ma med pa ni gzugs la sogs pa'i mtshan ma thams cad dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mtshan ma med pa ni gzugs la sogs pa'i mtshan ma thams cad dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The signless is so called because it is free from all signs of form, etc.

original: don dam pa ni ye shes mchog gis thob par bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don dam pa ni ye shes mchog gis thob par bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The ultimate is so called because it is attained by the highest intuition.

original: chos kyi dbyings ni rnam par byang ba'i chos rnams kyi rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings ni rnam par byang ba'i chos rnams kyi rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The Dharma-element is so called because it is the cause of purified dharmas.

original: dbyings kyi sgra ni 'dir rgyu'i tshig ste /
analyzed: dbyings kyi sgra ni 'dir rgyu'i tshig ste /
translated: The term ‚Äúelement‚Äù here means a cause,

original: gser la sogs pa'i 'byung khungs bzhin no //
analyzed: gser la sogs pa'i 'byung khungs bzhin no //
translated: like the element of gold, etc.

original: dri ma med pas rnam par byang ba zhes bya ba ni tshig de nyid kyis bshad zin to //üîΩde 'thob pa'i lam rnam par byang ba zhes bya ba ni stong pa nyid thob par bya ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: dri ma med pas rnam par byang ba zhes bya ba ni tshig de nyid kyis bshad zin to // de 'thob pa'i lam rnam par byang ba zhes bya ba ni stong pa nyid thob par bya ba'i phyir te /
translated: Purification is so called because it is stainless, as has been explained.üîΩThe path to its attainment is so called because it leads to the attainment of emptiness.

original: lam nyid rnam par byang bar zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: lam nyid rnam par byang bar zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The path itself is purification.

original: byang chub ni nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa spangs pa dri ma med cing thogs pa med pa'i ye shes kyi rang bzhin no //
analyzed: byang chub ni nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa spangs pa dri ma med cing thogs pa med pa'i ye shes kyi rang bzhin no //
translated: Enlightenment is the nature of stainless, unobstructed intuition, which is the abandonment of the addictive and objective obscurations.

original: de'i rjes su mthun pa'i phyir dran pa nye bar gzhag pa la sogs pa'i ming du sum cu rtsa bdun la /
analyzed: de'i rjes su mthun pa'i phyir dran pa nye bar gzhag pa la sogs pa'i ming du sum cu rtsa bdun la /
translated: The thirty-seven accessories of enlightenment are so called because they are conducive to that.

original: rdzas su bcu dang / shes rab la sogs pa pha rol tu phyin pa 'og nas 'byung ba rnams so //üîΩde skyed pa'i phyir dmigs pa rnam par byang ba zhes bya ba la de zhes bya ba ni lam dang sbyar te /
analyzed: rdzas su bcu dang / shes rab la sogs pa pha rol tu phyin pa 'og nas 'byung ba rnams so // de skyed pa'i phyir dmigs pa rnam par byang ba zhes bya ba la de zhes bya ba ni lam dang sbyar te /
translated: In substance, they are ten, and the perfections such as wisdom, which will be mentioned below.üîΩThe object of observation for their production is called the purification of the object of observation.

original: byang chub kyi phyogs la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: byang chub kyi phyogs la sogs pa'o //
translated: The word ‚Äúthat‚Äù refers to the path, the accessories of enlightenment, etc.

original: lhag ma rnams ni tshigs su bcad pa gnyis dang bcas te /
analyzed: lhag ma rnams ni tshigs su bcad pa gnyis dang bcas te /
translated: The rest is explained by two verses.

original: tshig de nyid kyis bshad zin to //
analyzed: tshig de nyid kyis bshad zin to //
translated: The words themselves explain it.

original: nor ba nyid du som nyi za ba las bzlog pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni nor ba nyid du som nyi za ba ste /
analyzed: nor ba nyid du som nyi za ba las bzlog pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni nor ba nyid du som nyi za ba ste /
translated: In order to reverse the doubt that it is mistaken, etc.

original: ji ltar don med pa kun brtags pa spyod yul du 'gyur snyam du sems pa de dag gi som nyi de bzlog pa'i don du sgyu ma lta bu nyid de /
analyzed: ji ltar don med pa kun brtags pa spyod yul du 'gyur snyam du sems pa de dag gi som nyi de bzlog pa'i don du sgyu ma lta bu nyid de /
translated: How can the unreal imagination be the domain of the imagination of what is unreal? In order to remove the doubt of those who think in this way, he says:

original: ji ltar sgyu ma la glang po che med kyang dmigs pa de bzhin du gzugs la sogs pa med kyang gzhan gyi dbang la skye mched drug nyid du rnam par rtog pa ni yul du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ji ltar sgyu ma la glang po che med kyang dmigs pa de bzhin du gzugs la sogs pa med kyang gzhan gyi dbang la skye mched drug nyid du rnam par rtog pa ni yul du 'gyur ro //
translated: Just as an elephant does not exist in an illusion, but is perceived, in the same way, although form, etc. does not exist, the six sense-fields of the other-dependent do exist as the domain of the imagination of what is unreal.

original: smig rgyu lta bu nyid ni ji ltar nyi ma'i smig rgyu g-yo ba na chu med kyang de'i blo 'byung ba ltar phyi rol gyi snod kyi 'jig rten yang de bzhin no //
analyzed: smig rgyu lta bu nyid ni ji ltar nyi ma'i smig rgyu g-yo ba na chu med kyang de'i blo 'byung ba ltar phyi rol gyi snod kyi 'jig rten yang de bzhin no //
translated: The analogy of a mirage is like the appearance of water in a mirage, although there is no water. In the same way, the external world of the container is also like that.

original: rmi lam ni gnyid kyis sems dang sems las byung ba'i tshogs bsdus par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: rmi lam ni gnyid kyis sems dang sems las byung ba'i tshogs bsdus par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: A dream is the gathering of the mind and mental functions in sleep.

original: de dang 'dra ba ni ji ltar de ni gos la sogs pa'i don med par yang sdug pa dang mi sdug pa'i yul la nye bar spyod pa ltar gnyid kyis ma log pa'i spyod pa yang de @231b bzhin no //
analyzed: de dang 'dra ba ni ji ltar de ni gos la sogs pa'i don med par yang sdug pa dang mi sdug pa'i yul la nye bar spyod pa ltar gnyid kyis ma log pa'i spyod pa yang de @231b bzhin no //
translated: The analogy is that just as one enjoys pleasant or unpleasant objects without any purpose, such as clothing, in the same way, one enjoys objects while awake.

original: gzugs brnyan lta bu nyid ni ji ltar me long la sogs pa'i nang du gzugs kyi ngo bo nyid snang gi /
analyzed: gzugs brnyan lta bu nyid ni ji ltar me long la sogs pa'i nang du gzugs kyi ngo bo nyid snang gi /
translated: The analogy of a reflection is that just as the nature of a form appears in a mirror,

original: gzugs brnyan med kyang gzugs brnyan mthong ngo snyam du sems pa de bzhin du mnyam par ma bzhag pa'i dge ba dang mi dge ba'i sems pa las kyi ngo bo la brten nas med bzhin du yang 'bras bu 'grub pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs brnyan med kyang gzugs brnyan mthong ngo snyam du sems pa de bzhin du mnyam par ma bzhag pa'i dge ba dang mi dge ba'i sems pa las kyi ngo bo la brten nas med bzhin du yang 'bras bu 'grub pa'o //
translated: and one thinks one sees a reflection even though it does not exist, in the same way, the result is accomplished even though it does not exist, based on the nature of the action of virtuous and nonvirtuous minds that are not in equipoise.

original: mig yor ni bag 'dra ba'i rtsed mo ste /
analyzed: mig yor ni bag 'dra ba'i rtsed mo ste /
translated: A mirage is a game of children.

original: de dang 'dre ba nyid ni mnyam par ma bzhag pa'i rnam par shes pa sna tshogs rnams de ma yin pa'i bdag nyid don med pa rnams la 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dang 'dre ba nyid ni mnyam par ma bzhag pa'i rnam par shes pa sna tshogs rnams de ma yin pa'i bdag nyid don med pa rnams la 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The analogy is that just as a mirage appears as water in a place devoid of water, in the same way, the various consciousnesses of those not in equipoise arise with regard to objects that are not real.

original: brag ca lta bu nyid ni ji ltar brag ca med bzhin du rna ba'i yul mang por gnas pa de bzhin du ngag gi las med bzhin du yang tha snyad rnam par sna tshogs su gnas so //
analyzed: brag ca lta bu nyid ni ji ltar brag ca med bzhin du rna ba'i yul mang por gnas pa de bzhin du ngag gi las med bzhin du yang tha snyad rnam par sna tshogs su gnas so //
translated: Like an echo: just as an echo occurs in many places as an object of the ear, even though it does not exist, so verbal action occurs in various conventional expressions, even though it does not exist.

original: chu zla ni chu'i nang gi zla ba ste /
analyzed: chu zla ni chu'i nang gi zla ba ste /
translated: The moon in water is the moon in water.

original: ji ltar chu gsher ba dang / dang ba'i phyir zla ba med bzhin du yang de'i nang na yod par 'dzin pa de bzhin du yang dag pa'i don la dmigs pa nyid du yid ches pa'i rlan gyis bdag nyid kyi ting nge 'dzin dang ldan pa'i yid kyang dmigs pa'i don med bzhin du 'jug
analyzed: ji ltar chu gsher ba dang / dang ba'i phyir zla ba med bzhin du yang de'i nang na yod par 'dzin pa de bzhin du yang dag pa'i don la dmigs pa nyid du yid ches pa'i rlan gyis bdag nyid kyi ting nge 'dzin dang ldan pa'i yid kyang dmigs pa'i don med bzhin du 'jug
translated: Just as the moon does not exist in water, even though it is apprehended as existing there, because of the wetness and clarity of the water, in the same way, the mind endowed with concentration, which is moistened by the moisture of confidence in the object of true meaning, engages in the object of meditative concentration, even though it does not exist.

original: go // 'di gzugs brnyan dang bye brag ci yod ce na /
analyzed: go // 'di gzugs brnyan dang bye brag ci yod ce na /
translated: What is the difference between this and a reflection?

original: mnyam par bzhag pa dang / mnyam par ma bzhag pa nyid du brjod par 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: mnyam par bzhag pa dang / mnyam par ma bzhag pa nyid du brjod par 'dod pa'o //
translated: It is said to be in meditative equipoise and not in meditative equipoise.

original: gal te 'di snyam du bzhin la sogs pa rkyen tshogs pa'i che ba nyid kyis chu dang me long la sogs pa de ltar byung ba la 'dzin te /
analyzed: gal te 'di snyam du bzhin la sogs pa rkyen tshogs pa'i che ba nyid kyis chu dang me long la sogs pa de ltar byung ba la 'dzin te /
translated: But if you think that the greatness of the conditions, such as the face, etc.,üîΩcauses the water and mirror, etc., to appear in that way,

original: dper na nye bar gzhag pa la sogs pa'i dbang gis shel la sogs pa lta bu'o snyam du sems na /
analyzed: dper na nye bar gzhag pa la sogs pa'i dbang gis shel la sogs pa lta bu'o snyam du sems na /
translated: like a crystal, etc., through the power of what is placed near it,

original: de ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni ma yin te /
translated: that is not so,

original: tha dad du 'dzin pa'i phyir ro /
analyzed: tha dad du 'dzin pa'i phyir ro /
translated: because they are apprehended as different.

original: khron pa'i nang ltar bzhin dang zla ba la sogs pa'i gzugs brnyan me long dang chu dang tha dad par dmigs pa ltar shes la sogs pa ni de ltar ma yin te mi 'dra'o //
analyzed: khron pa'i nang ltar bzhin dang zla ba la sogs pa'i gzugs brnyan me long dang chu dang tha dad par dmigs pa ltar shes la sogs pa ni de ltar ma yin te mi 'dra'o //
translated: The reflection of a face, moon, etc., is perceived as different from the mirror and water, etc., like the interior of a well, but consciousness, etc., are not like that.

original: kho bo cag gi gzhung la ni chu la sogs pa'i don yod pa ma yin pas chos can mi 'grub bo //
analyzed: kho bo cag gi gzhung la ni chu la sogs pa'i don yod pa ma yin pas chos can mi 'grub bo //
translated: In our system, the object, such as water, does not exist, so the subject is not established.

original: sprul pa byas pa gang yin pa de ni sprul pa ste /
analyzed: sprul pa byas pa gang yin pa de ni sprul pa ste /
translated: That which is created is an emanation.

original: de dang 'dra ba ni ji ltar sprul pa med bzhin du yang sprul pa byed pa la nor ba med pa de'i phyir 'bad pa byed pa de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyang brtags pa'i don med bzhin du gzhan gyi dbang gis sems can rjes su
analyzed: de dang 'dra ba ni ji ltar sprul pa med bzhin du yang sprul pa byed pa la nor ba med pa de'i phyir 'bad pa byed pa de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyang brtags pa'i don med bzhin du gzhan gyi dbang gis sems can rjes su
translated: Just as a magical display can perform its function even though it is not real, in the same way, although the object of imputation does not exist, bodhisattvas, through the power of others' expectations, follow the conventions of the world and speak of the existence of form and so on.

original: bzung bar 'dod pas skye ba'i gnas de dang de dag tu lus yongs su 'dzin to //
analyzed: bzung bar 'dod pas skye ba'i gnas de dang de dag tu lus yongs su 'dzin to //
translated: Just as an emanation, although non-existent, is not in error in producing another emanation, so also the Bodhisattvas, although the imagined object does not exist, are not in error in taking up a body in this and that place of birth, because they desire to look after sentient beings by way of the other-dependent.

original: 'di ni de tsam du @232a * //
analyzed: 'di ni de tsam du @232a * //
translated: This is just the beginning,

original: zad de / 'di lta ste /
analyzed: zad de / 'di lta ste /
translated: for there are also

original: nang dang phyi'i'o //
analyzed: nang dang phyi'i'o //
translated: the internal and the external.

original: de'i dbye ba ni nye ba spyod pa lus kyi las dang ngag gi las dang / yid kyi las rnam pa gsum dang / mnyam par ma bzhag pa'i sa dang / mnyam par bzhag pa'i sa dang / nor ba med pa'o //
analyzed: de'i dbye ba ni nye ba spyod pa lus kyi las dang ngag gi las dang / yid kyi las rnam pa gsum dang / mnyam par ma bzhag pa'i sa dang / mnyam par bzhag pa'i sa dang / nor ba med pa'o //
translated: Its divisions are the three kinds of action: bodily action, verbal action, and mental action; the stage of non-concentration, the stage of concentration, and the non-erroneous.

original: don brgyad po 'di dag gi dpe brgyad de /
analyzed: don brgyad po 'di dag gi dpe brgyad de /
translated: There are eight examples for these eight topics.

original: ji skad du bcom ldan 'das kyis skyes du mkhas pa kha cig ni dpes bshad pa'i don shes par 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: ji skad du bcom ldan 'das kyis skyes du mkhas pa kha cig ni dpes bshad pa'i don shes par 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: As the Lord has said, ‚ÄúSome wise men understand the meaning through the parable.‚Äù

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis ci las dgongs te zhes bya ba nas bzung ste /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis ci las dgongs te zhes bya ba nas bzung ste /
translated: The two passages beginning ‚ÄúWhat was the Lord‚Äôs intention when he said . . . ?‚Äù

original: 'di las dgongs nas bka' stsal to zhes bya ba'i mdo gnyis ka'i tshig kyang tshig de nyid kyis bshad zin to //
analyzed: 'di las dgongs nas bka' stsal to zhes bya ba'i mdo gnyis ka'i tshig kyang tshig de nyid kyis bshad zin to //
translated: and ending ‚ÄúHe said this with this in mind‚Äù have been explained by the very words of the passage.

original: 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa gnyis bye brag med pa la dgongs nas zhes bya ba ni rnam par rtog pa ma lus par rnam par bshig pas 'khor ba mi dmigs so //
analyzed: 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa gnyis bye brag med pa la dgongs nas zhes bya ba ni rnam par rtog pa ma lus par rnam par bshig pas 'khor ba mi dmigs so //
translated: ‚ÄúWith the intention that the two, cyclic existence and nirvana, are not different‚Äù means that since all conceptual constructions are destroyed, cyclic existence is not perceived.

original: de mi dmigs na gang gi 'gog pa la mya ngan las 'das par lta ;
analyzed: de mi dmigs na gang gi 'gog pa la mya ngan las 'das par lta ;
translated: If it is not perceived, how can one see nirvana as its cessation?

original: gzhan nyid du yongs su grub pa med pa ni 'dir bye brag med pa nyid de /
analyzed: gzhan nyid du yongs su grub pa med pa ni 'dir bye brag med pa nyid de /
translated: ‚ÄúNot established as different‚Äù means not different here.

original: byis pas mngon par zhen pa'i khyad par las bzlog pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: byis pas mngon par zhen pa'i khyad par las bzlog pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because it is the opposite of the difference in which the foolish are attached.

original: ngo bo nyid gnyis kyi dbang du gyur pa nyid gang yin pa de nyid gnyis gzhan gyi dbang gi don gyi mchog go //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid gnyis kyi dbang du gyur pa nyid gang yin pa de nyid gnyis gzhan gyi dbang gi don gyi mchog go //
translated: The supreme meaning of the relative is the very fact that it is subject to the two realities.üîΩFor example, in the case of gold ore, three things are found: the earth element, the earth, and the gold.

original: dper na sa khong na gser yod pa la ni sa'i khams dang / sa dang gser dang gsum dmigs so zhes bya ba la sa'i khams ni sra ba nyid do //
analyzed: dper na sa khong na gser yod pa la ni sa'i khams dang / sa dang gser dang gsum dmigs so zhes bya ba la sa'i khams ni sra ba nyid do //
translated: The earth element is hardness.

original: sa ni kha dog dang dbyibs te /
analyzed: sa ni kha dog dang dbyibs te /
translated: The earth is the color and shape.

original: 'byung ba dang / 'byung ba las gyur pa dang go rims bzhin no //
analyzed: 'byung ba dang / 'byung ba las gyur pa dang go rims bzhin no //
translated: These correspond to the elements and the derivative form, respectively.

original: gser zhes bya ba ni gser gyi sa bon no //
analyzed: gser zhes bya ba ni gser gyi sa bon no //
translated: Gold is the seed of gold.

original: sar snang ba na log par snang ngo zhes bya ba ni de'i bdag nyid ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sar snang ba na log par snang ngo zhes bya ba ni de'i bdag nyid ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: When it appears as earth, it appears falsely, because it is not of that nature.
